Reviews.Title: “We love this hotel”
Reviews.Author: Barbara L
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights. Everything about this hotel is first rate. Each employee we encountered was friendly, professional and strived to please. The pool was comfortably warm and very clean with ample chairs and lounges. You can walk from the hotel to many very good restaurants and shopping. There is definately something for every age, from children to seniors. The fresh cookies in the evening were great and I must say, we had the best coffee of all at the hotel. We will definately be back.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful small friendly hotel”
Reviews.Author: SudburyJoh
Reviews.Content: Just spent at week at the Pacific Terrace hotel. It was wonderful-, great service, staff is the friendliest and most accommodating. Right on the boardwalk and beach which was nice for walks to local restaurants. Beautiful view of beach and surfers from our balcony. Enjoyed riding bikes down the boardwalk and poking around the beach shops. Enjoyed the morning breakfast buffet and the evening cocktail hour. Delicious smoothies for the children. Getting to local sites was easy. Special thanks to McGarrity Harney and Andres. unfortunately weather was too cool to enjoy the beach although the pool was heated.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Sunsets”
Reviews.Author: TravelinCari
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 2 nights and really had a great time. We had a room on the third floor with a full ocean view. The room had a kitchenette and a table to eat at. There was also a balcony overlooking the pool and beach. The hotel has a nice layout which made it seem as if there was no one next to you. In the evenings it was nice to watch the sunset from the balcony. The staff was very friendly and welcoming. They were very responsive and had lots of great advice for nearby eateries. The hotel was so close to the beach and was easy to walk to. They also have beach chairs and umbrellas that you can rent. They have an outdoor shower with warm water to rinse off after coming back from the beach. The hotel offers room service, but it’s not 24 hours and it’s from a nearby restaurant. They also have breakfast, but we didn’t try it. Location: The hotel seemed to be in a “young” part of town, but it wasn’t rowdy. My husband and I were traveling with our two kids and it felt safe. It isn’t close to downtown San Diego, but when you’re standing there looking at the ocean from your room it didn’t really matter. It was wonderful to open the patio door in the evening and just listen to the ocean. Would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Needmorefun
Reviews.Content: This is a very nice hotel. The staff is very friendly. The rooms are beautiful and clean. The breakfast is VERY good (we had the AAA rate which made it a really good deal). They loan out chairs and sand toys to take to the beach which is right out the back door. It's walking distance from many restauants and is close to the zoo. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Right on the ocean and close enough to everything else!”
Reviews.Author: mindfulday
Reviews.Content: We booked adjoining rooms on the non-ocean side of the hotel. While we only had a glimpse of the water, the rooms were plenty big and clean. The breakfast was better than most buffets. Getting to Sea World was an easy ten minute drive. Downtown was about 15 minutes (no traffic). The staff was really great. We were cheerfully greeted every time we walked in or out of the hotel. Only a walking path separates the pool from the cliff that the ocean is just beyond. Tall glass walls allow for a stunning view, but you still feel the breeze on a colder day. There is bar service at the pool. Order a smoothie for the kids to make them feel special. For dinner, think ahead as there aren't that many great options close by. All around great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful oceanfront property”
Reviews.Author: ejs192
Reviews.Content: We decided on this hotel because of the reviews on Trip Advisor and we were so happy that we trusted it. We had an oceanfront suite with jacuzzi tub and two balconies. Not only was the room beautiful and spacious, but the people there were absolutely wonderful! Joe Sutherland was one that really stood out as being very friendly and helpful. Diego too. The buffet breakfast every morning was really good. We wish it would've been included in our rate, but not a big deal. The location of the hotel is perfect. You can walk to any restaurant/bar right down the boardwalk in front of the ocean. We were able to walk to a CVS also to get necessities. We didn't have great weather, but it was one of our best trips ever. We were able to sit at the pool and hot tub one day and that area is beautiful too.

Reviews.Title: “Soooo beautiful!!”
Reviews.Author: kyla a
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed there for a weekend and enjoyed our stay so much. The hotel was beautiful inside and out. We had so much fun, and would recommend it to friends and family. The staff was really friendly. We met the front desk manger Enrico, and he was very helpful made us feel welcome. The hotel was so cute! We will be back :)

Reviews.Title: “Will go back”
Reviews.Author: StubbyJo
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from 5 days at PT hotel. Had room 318. Very nice and clean. Spacious enough with a great balcony over the pool/ocean view. Drawback was the weather did not cooperate to see a nice sunset or sit on the balcony and watch the ocean, but great trip anyway. We are big walkers and you can walk anywhere from here. Ocean walk is very busy with lots of activity and great people watching. Everyone and I REALLY MEAN EVERYONE is friendly and nice at this hotel. Not one person, from maintenance to front desk, hesitate to greet you when you walked by even if they were very busy doing their job. We ate at the Fishery nearby which was great. Did not use pool or hot tub since it was cool although plenty of people were there. DId not do the breakfast although it looked good. I asked the housekeeping woman if we could have extra regular coffee packets and she handed me 3 of them. Several other places I stayed at made it such a hassle to get more than one packet. Pacific Beach is a unique area and even though it appears to be more spring breakish, it is family oriented. Just walk the neighborhoods. The main part on Grand and Garnet can be a little challenging. Certainly saw some interesting characters. This hotel is at the north end of the beach and seems quieter than further south. Not sure who is running the place, but GREAT JOB!

Reviews.Title: “Beachfront comfort and convenience”
Reviews.Author: oneyedrosie
Reviews.Content: Pacific Terrace Hotel was such a great experience and the perfect choice for a quick birthday getaway. Right on the boardwalk our room had huge sliding glass doors out to a balcony that was so close to the water that the surf was the first thing I heard every morning. The service was absolutely excellent and the employees clearly love their jobs and sincerely want to provide a good experience. They even put bottles of water in our car as we were leaving in case we needed a drink on the way out of town! The hotel itself is lovely, the room was spacious (third floor suite), everything worked, very nice breakfast buffet option and absolutely the closest to the beach location on Pacific Beach. Everything PB has to offer is literally right outside the door. We will definitely stay here again next time we're in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous -- Loved it!!!”
Reviews.Author: mohmahmom
Reviews.Content: If there were an option to give this hotel 6 stars, I would. I have never felt so compelled to review a hotel, good or bad, as I feel to review this one. First and foremost the staff (everyone, without exception) is wonderful -- the best! They could not have been more friendly, helpful, polite, accommodating... I could go on and on. Our car was retrieved promptly (often several times a day) within minutes of calling down for it. Every time we came through the lobby the desk staff and concierge inquired as to where we were going today and if they could get us tickets, make us reservations or print us directions -- really helpful. The staff in the Carribean Room for breakfast in the morning and for drinks (and the delicious chocolate chip cookies at 4:00 every day) in the afternoon were great, as well. Breakfast was good (two different omelettes, sausage, bacon, breakfast potatos, make your own waffles, muffins, yogurt and delicious fresh fruit) and is 1/2 price if you are a guest at the hotel. Coffee is complimentary in the lobby and/or the Carribean Room in the morning, too. Drinks and light food can be ordered from the pool area in the afternoon, and the service was always prompt, polite and with a smile. The hotel itself is lovely, the rooms are lovely and the view from the ocean front balconies is amazing. A couple of times we saw whales swimming by in front of the hotel from our balcony. It was fun to people watch and watch the surfers every day, as well. The rooms were very clean and one of the days our room was actually cleaned twice. Chocolates left on our pillow every day were good, too. My one and only VERY MINOR complaint is that the pillows on the beds were a bit lumpy. This was our first time visiting San Diego, or the west coast for that matter; we were there to visit my nephew and his family. Though there are many hotels much closer to where he lives, I would never consider visiting the area again without staying at the Pacific Terrace. We miss the PT and staff already but we will definitely be back. Keep up the great work, it really does make a difference!

Reviews.Title: “This review to even out my earlier review”
Reviews.Author: Bryan J
Reviews.Content: Our first night, we were put in room 110, right by the lobby and so noisy. I was awakened and lost sleep. However, since then, we were moved to a quieter part of the hotel. The service is truly excellent here. The weather did not cooperate with our hopes to use all the amenities, such as pool and beach, but I would not hesitate to come back.

Reviews.Title: “More than expected!”
Reviews.Author: kimthebuilder
Reviews.Content: This was our first trip to San Diego, and the location for us and our 3 kids could not have been better! It is close to Sea World and the Zoo, but the surfing was the best! We rented boards and the hotel even has a free locker service to keep them for you when not using them. The breakfast was great every morning, as well. There were five of us in our two queen bed room (the beds were very comfortable) and when we checked in there was a very nice inflatable matress with linens already made-up for the extra kid. The extra mattress was so comfortable and fit perfectly between the beds that we did not mind the extra family closeness! The proximity to great beach activities and restaurants was great, we've already booked rooms again here in the summer!

Reviews.Title: “Very nice and modern.”
Reviews.Author: Logangp
Reviews.Content: We stayed here with our two kids. Lovely hotel and nice view. Price was good to for the oceanfront location.

Reviews.Title: “overall great stay”
Reviews.Author: crdwino
Reviews.Content: overall a great stay. the view from our room (306) was amazing, breathtaking view of the sunset most every night (except when the clouds obscured the view). great perch for people watching too. pretty central location to seaworld, the zoo, la jolla. staff was very friendly, especially Katherine (the weekend concierge), cameron, mcgarrity, and Kathy. not all advice was spot on but Perla's, a little Mexican restaurant about a block and a half away, was great - the wife and daughter sent me there 4 times during the week to get dinner. exercise facility was barely ok, but you can run or ride bikes on the beach or boardwalk, and there are yoga studios nearby. we all thought the breakfast was very good and reasonably priced. we liked the area, pacific beach, but i can see it not being for everyone. it is kind of a bohemian/surfer/spring break area, in stark contrast to the nearby and far more upscale la jolla. we did not experience the issues with panhandlers on the boardwalk that others have commented on but there is a public restroom RIGHT outside the hotel. overall this was a great visit and i can definitely recommend the pacific terrace!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!”
Reviews.Author: fredlovesbetty
Reviews.Content: We just returned from spring break and spent 5 nights at this wonderful hotel. We are a family of 4 (2 girls ages 9 and 12) who stated they would definitely want to return here. I have family here in the San Diego area and visit frequently...this was the first time here at this hotel. The location is perfect...right on the boardwalk with restaurants and shopping close by! They upgraded us to the Master Suite...wonderful room with lovely views from anywhere in the room! My husband had surprised us with a stay here and it was well worth the extra money we spent to stay on the beach! The rooms are spacious and surprisely quiet...never heard anything other than the ocean waves!!! My girls felt their sofa bed was the most comfortable they ever slept on...probably because they were aerobeds-nice touch! I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone regardless of age!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic getaway”
Reviews.Author: CRettCA
Reviews.Content: We have stayed here twice now and both times were wonderful experiences. The staff is incredibly friendly and helpful, the rooms are beautifully decorated, and the balcony view can't be beat. We were fortunate to get a room upgrade on our second night - wish we could always afford that oceanfront room as the sunset view was beautiful.

Reviews.Title: “A great little spot!”
Reviews.Author: 3kidmom
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the King Jr. Suite and had a great view of pool and ocean, the kitchenette was great and the room was fairly spacious. My family loved that Everything is right there..pool, boardwalk, beach. The property is lovely-clean, nicely decorated, quiet. A computer in the hallway on a nice antique piece of furniture for guests use. The greatest thing though was the staff. I have never been to a hotel where the staff were so helpful but also personable at the same time. When we mentioned at breakfast that we left some flip flops out by the pool the day before and needed to find the lost and found, our server went outside, found them and brought them to our table on a tray! Bikes (free rental) were promptly brought out when we asked for them. Warm freshly baked cookies are out every afternoon. Crystal Pier is nearby and we saw dolphins playing. The amusement park in Mission Beach was a fun thing to do for a couple of hours, and is just down the boardwalk. Anyway Pacific Terrace is a small sweet hotel that I highly recommend. They have a quaint buffet breakfast, but room service is called out to local restaurants. All of their recommendations were spot on. The one time we did not take their recommendation we went to Joe's Crab Shack and it was a disaster, but that is another story!

Reviews.Title: “great staff!! great location!!.... just great!!”
Reviews.Author: robashwootton
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay at the pacific terrance hotel, We had a side view junior suite on the second floor, very nice room, lots of space, great housekeeping. its on the side so its a little quiter and still a great sunset view of the ocean. I dont think you could get a bad room. The area is perfect right on the beach, lots of surf bars and restraunts very laaid back.. if you want more trendy places la jolla is 10 mins up the road.besides the location i have to give a big shout out to the staff at the hotel. Managment should be thanked (and thankfull) for having such great people there, ive been all over the world and have stayed in some really nice hotels but i have not seen service like this . first all everyone says good morning/evening/ hi / whatever!! i mean everyone!! front desk people, maintenance people and cleaners!!! its doesnt sound like much but you would be suprised how many people in diffrent places dont even acknoledge you!! Second we asked the front desk attendent for restraunt reviews and shopping places and even got him to book padres opening week tixs!! and he still wanted to do more for us!!! WOW!! (give him a raise ;) Thanks again for all the help, we really enjoyed our stay and would definetly recomend this hotel to anyone and would love to stay again someday!!! I never went to the Spa or the breakfast in the morning (kono's is just down the path a bit and it was awesome!!) but im sure it would be all good!!

Reviews.Title: “first floor small rooms.”
Reviews.Author: travelcafekim
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and I stayed here to see where I like to put my clients with they are booking a Disneyland/ San Diego package. I loved the location, pool was smaller than it looked in the pictures. I would stay again next time just on the 2nd or 3rd floor. The beds are in a "bed frame" that sticked out at least 5 inches. Everytime that we got into bed you would hit your knee! The bed was also about 6 inches from the glass sliding door! not much space! VERY friendly staff and very safe. One more thing, when the beds were made, it looked like a couple 2 yr olds were jumping on it for an hour! Both beds looked horrible when we would return after the housekeeping was done.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotels in this area of San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Susan O
Reviews.Content: I've been vacationing in Pacific Beach/Mission Beach for almost two decades - and I go several times a year. This is a great area for people of any age. Anything you could want is a close walk away - from local coffee shops to Starbucks, casual bars/grills to fine dining. Pacific Terrace Hotel is great. It's a smaller hotel and is pricey but all the hotels in this area are very pricey and at least with Pacific Terrace you get what you pay for. There are plenty of other places in the area that cost as much and are a disappointment. The rooms are clean and well appointed. The suites and jr suites are great if you have kids with you - more space to spread out. Ocean view rooms are worth the upgrade but book that room type before you show up. They are often fully booked so it may not be possible to upgrade upon arrival. The concierge is ready and willing to help you schedule outings and often has discounted tickets. We often rent houses but if we go the hotel route this is our favorite.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ocean view”
Reviews.Author: jackocalgary_AB
Reviews.Content: Great staff throughout hotel. Though the hotel is somewhat dated, still a great place to stay. Walking distance or public transportation to anything you'd like to see in surrounding areas! Had an ocean view room that overlooked the pool & was ideal for viewing the pool or the ocean. Many surfers in the ocean in front of hotel. Great restaurants & pubs near by but be careful of the costs; feel $ 95 for two for lunch is a little pricey!

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel, just don't get room 110”
Reviews.Author: Seattlebiz
Reviews.Content: The plus items for this hotel: great location, 25 minutes from airport (depending on traffic); 15 minutes to SeaWorld and easy route on regular streets; 35 minutes to LegoLand and Zoo is close also. It is right on the beach, well really 30 feet above but easy walk down steps. Nice pool and hot tub. The breakfast (on site) is good (cereal, scrambled eggs, omelet, bacon & link, potato, coffee, juice. The room is small but in the 3 hours open the tables turn over pretty fast and you can eat easily outside. If you have AAA card breakfast is half priced and no rental charge for bikes and other plus card benefits. Kono's (2 blocks down beach walk) serves good breakfast, long line that moves fast and for less than $7 each --good. Kono's also has outside espresso stand for morning walks. They have fitness room at garage level and bonus/play area (kids) above breakfast area. We bought our LegoLand tickets from Hotel Consigner and saved $7 each. Very secure, safe area. Rooms are nice (a little dark inside) with large screen TV. Underground parking is secured by metal roll-up gate at entrance and exit. About 5-6 blocks away is a Starbucks, CVS drugstore, Ralphs supermarket. We also ate at Nicks (next to Ralphs) which was good food with kids menu (large & busy bar upstairs and in part of main floor. We had the larger suite with a regular room adjoining. The difference is the suite had a bar/ counter with some bar chairs, sink, microwave and cabinets with dishes/flatware. I would do regular room next time since we only did popcorn in microwave. The negative:I would not recommend staying in room 110. The elevator is right across from the door and the breakfast area is just down the hall (after room 111 & 112 i think). From 7 am you are awakened to kids yelling as they get off elevator to run down the hall and at night 12-2am you are awakened by laughing and yelling from those waiting for the elevator. I must point out that this was during spring break, so it may only be a problem on friday/saturday nights at other times. We also had room 111 and people do sit right outside your patio area eating breakfast, so many times you wake to kids screaming. The mornings should be no problem if you're up before 7am. The TV in 110 was a dark screen. Really really dark. Engineering has the remote to adj brightness/contrast. It may be time to change this TV because even thought Engineering was prompt to come in and adj. it was still fairly dark after he finished. He said something about the TV may have a feature that automatically darkens the screen based on the amount of light in the room. Also, the beds are on a platform. They do provide a small 2-step stool (located in closet) to help get up and down. But if you have any mobility problem or are short this could be a problem. Oh, speaking of short...or the opposite, the shower head is high, you can be 6-3 or more and enjoy the shower. We will stay there again, mostly because of location, the beach, the safe walking along the sidewalk/boardwalk (?? not really a boardwalk but great for many people walking and bikes going by). One more thing that was nice was that when making the reservation, they assigned the room right then. I requested first floor and was given 110 & 111 at that time. Now in hindsight, 2nd and 3 floors are better, just remember or ask where they are in relation to breakfast area.

Reviews.Title: “The service was decent”
Reviews.Author: antonio b
Reviews.Content: there are only a few things that hampered our stay, but those are merrilly personal preferance, the rooms were very well kept, and the service was decent. The recomendations on part by the staff was a bit lousy, but if your looking for accomodations few choices would be better than the Pacific Terrace Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Great Place for a visit to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: sri s
Reviews.Content: Just got back from a 4 night stay there. Absolutely wonderful place! Great location on the beach and close to everything in San Diego and close to La Jolla. The staff is very attentive and will go out of their way to make your stay great. There are many restaurants within walking distance that are very good. Didn't matter that there is not a restaurant on site. They will get food and drinks for you while at the pool. Breakfast is served at the hotel is and excellent. Pick the pool chairs on the right hand side. Much less windy. Highly recommend staying here.

Reviews.Title: “Hotel ok ...”
Reviews.Author: chopin77
Reviews.Content: When we checked in we asked if we could upgrade. They said only for part of our five day stay. So we had two nights in a full ocean view which was beautiful. We then moved to a partial ocean view ( We paid for upgrades for both rooms) and unfortunately, the room was on the second floor with the valet parking outside the balcony, a view of the public restrooms plus the ice machine outside the room. We should have asked to see the room first. It was too noisey and not a room to pay extra for. We also had to ask for them to clean our room. The fresh fruit and cookies every eveningwas nice. It was also nice to have washing machines available. The beach area was nice and the pool area. We did manage to find parking on the street but only because it was off season. Another thing that was quite sad was the homeless people around the restrooms and the early round up by the policemen one early morning.

Reviews.Title: “Very enjoyable”
Reviews.Author: Lorenzodos
Reviews.Content: We stayed in room 114 with partial sea view. Walk directly to pool, dining room and nearby restaurants.We parked on the street and saved $20/night - lmited spaces but no problem in March. Very professional and helpful service. Bikes, movies, beach gear included at no extra charge. Rooms are handsomely decorated with the latesd high quality HDTV, DVD gear. Its worth every penny. We would return. Especially good for kids who like the pool.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly Staff, Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Callisto22
Reviews.Content: It gets a 5 rating, mainly for the staff. The hotel is clean and updated, but you could probably get a nicer hotel with better views in San Diego. The staff, however, makes this hotel a great experience! I took my husband here for his birthday, and the staff treated us like VIPs. They are so friendly and accomodating, but in a laid back way (not a creepy, overeager way). It's in a quiet location, but a short walk will take you to some cool restaurants & bars.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific visit”
Reviews.Author: mcavStCharles_Mo
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 4 night stay (Wed-Sun) at the PT Hotel and I highly recommend it. Everyone is extremely helpful and friendly. Since it is a small hotel, you feel very appreciated. Each night a piece of paper was left in our room with the names and pictures of the staff for that night and the following day...housekeeping did the same thing. I thought this was a very nice, personal touch. Valet service was included in the nightly parking rate and the valet was great at giving directions and tips for different places we were visiting...very helpful. We had breakfast there the first morning and it was very good and the price was extremely reasonable. Our room was #108, on the first floor near the pool with a view of the ocean. I was concerned about the noise at first since we were so close to the pool, but it was not a problem. My only regret was not getting a full ocean view on the 2nd or 3rd floor. The access to the beach was about a 30 second walk. We ate dinner at the Fat Fish and World Famous...walked to both and both were good. We also had breakfast at Kono, right down the street (also very good). If you are looking for a very clean, friendly, small hotel, right on the ocean you cannot go wrong here.

Reviews.Title: “Another wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: MicknMike
Reviews.Content: Location is perfect, on boardwalk, on a beautiful beach, within walking distance to good shopping, and good restaraunts. Not far from La Jolla, Sea World and Zoo. But what makes this location special is the fine maintenance of the hotel, and the hospitality of the staff, and great ammenities. This has been our hotel of choice both for family vacation with kids, and also a couples get away. Rooms with a view are on upper floors, and are wonderful, but the non-view rooms are still very nice, spacious, clean, well arranged and very comfortable. Pool is wonderful, with both a view of the beach, and of the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “You can't miss the sunset!”
Reviews.Author: Snydergal75707
Reviews.Content: One of the most beautiful hidden gems in the San Diego area, Pacific Terrace offers a quiet ambiance that is hard to find anywhere else in the country...combine the elegance of room furnishings with being right the on the beach, the warm and inviting pool and hot tub with gracious hotel staff, and you'd probably be quite satisfied...but the price of admission to this beautiful hotel can't cover the "show" you'll get as the sun dips into the far edge of the sea...it is spectacular!! Close to some of the best restaurants in the area, a vacation at Pacific Terrace is just perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Ideal Pacific Beach location in So Cal”
Reviews.Author: pikiniki93
Reviews.Content: Our family of 5 just returned from Pacific Beach and a stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. My husband booked this trip for our family and chose this hotel based on the positive reviews he read. The 3 story hotel is located right on Pacific Beach. It literally takes you less than 3 minutes to get from your hotel room to the ocean. It was very low key and uncrowded; a boutique-type gem. Upon our afternoon arrival, we were told our room preference was not available. We booked through Expedia and were told our room preference was not guaranteed because of that. The staff worked immediately to remedy the situation and placed us in a king jr suite with a full ocean view for the first night and then moved us to the room preference we had originally booked with an upgraded view. Every staff member we encountered, from the front desk to the person who brought us extra pillows, were friendly, competent and eager to help. Great staff! The rooms were upgraded and very clean. All amenities were provided that you would expect from a high end hotel including large beach towels for our use. The beds were very comfortable and the decor lovely. My only complaint would have been the use of bedspreads as opposed to duvets. The entire hotel was very well maintained, including the pool and lounge area. The pool was an ok size, no frills, but very clean with comfortable chaise loungers with cushions. And of course with a spectacular view of the Ocean! For a small fee the hotel provides beach chairs and beach cruisers. Children's beach toys are free to use. The beach in front of the hotel was never over crowed and we always had a front row seat to some great surfing. Parking was also convenient located in an underground garage beneath the hotel. We didnt eat breakfast at the hotel because we were off exploring the area each morning. Be sure to try Kono's Cafe just south of the hotel. We ate breakfast and lunch there a number of times during our stay. Great "made from scratch" food, big portions and cheap. We loved our stay and would definitely return to the Pacific Terrace Hotel again!

Reviews.Title: “Nice staff, convenient location!”
Reviews.Author: NYCDee29
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel when we went to San Diego in October 2011 (I'm a few months late in reviewing). The hotel is in an ideal location -- it's right on the beach and just a few seconds walk to Kono's Surf Club Cafe which has one of the most delicious breakfasts I've ever had (definitely worth the wait on line). We arrived at the Pacific Terrace before our room was ready but they were very accommodating in holding our baggage and letting us use the facilities and the pool. They also gave us a nice room upgrade and a bottle of wine as we were celebrating our anniversary, which was a nice touch. I can't say enough about how welcoming and helpful the staff is at the Pacific Terrace -- they all seemed genuine too, like they really wanted to help and were not just asking because they were getting a paycheck to do so. The room was incredibly clean and comfortable. We loved that the hotel offers bicycles that you can take along the boardwalk, it was so relaxing and fun. We didn't stay by the pool much, as we really wanted to enjoy the beach and boardwalk and check out the san diego bar scene and attractions (the Zoo is a must -- it's just incredible and not like any zoo you've ever been to!) , but the pool area looked nice. As for San Diego, I'm so in love with this city. The people are the friendliest and most happy people i've ever met in the U.S. I can definitely see my husband and I relocating to SD down the road. if you're comfortable using public transportation, don't be afraid to take the local bus to any attractions or anywhere for that matter -- it's MUCH cheaper than a taxi and it's very convenient. The bus stop is a few seconds walk from the Pacific Terrace and the transit system in san diego seemed very easy to use. Taking the bus gave us a chance to talk to the locals and see some parts of san diego that we prob would have missed if we took a taxi (downtown, little italy, etc.). I won't hesitate about staying at Pacific Terrace the next time we visit.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Location!”
Reviews.Author: lovetravelling77
Reviews.Content: We just returned after a week at Pacific Terrace! We did not want to leave! It is a great hotel and what a perfect location, right on the ocean ! We arrived at the hotel too early for check in,seeing our room was not ready yet,they offered us an upgrade to the Master Suite on the 3rd floor. WOW! We are so glad we did it! The room was awesome with King Room, jacuzzi tub,walk in shower,double vanities,seperate livingroom, kitchenette,dining table and 2 balconies! The views spectacular! The staff was very helpful and could not have been happier with their help. We used the hotels bikes every day for a lovely bike ride along the beach . We really enjoyed the pool area and also spend days on the beach across from the hotel. We never had breakfast at the hotel, just because we started our days with a long bike ride or walk and would end up having breakfast along the way. The Green Flash was our favourite - a 5min walk down from the hotel with glass patio overlooking the ocean,great for people watching while enjoying coffee and Blueberry Pancakes or Eggs Benni! The frontdesk staff organized a taxi for us every night to go for dinner in La Jolla, about a $13 drive. Do yourself a favour and try The Marine Room and Tapenade in La Jolla!amazing. We also had dinner at JRDN twice, a 2 minute walk down from the hotel! We had an unforgettable stay and already miss our room and views.Thank you Pacific Terrace for a perfect week!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing views! Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: kit-uk
Reviews.Content: I cannot recommend this hotel highly enough!! This is one of the nicest hotels I have ever had the pleasure of staying in. We stayed here for 3 nights whilst in San Diego and had an amazing stay here. The staff are all extremely friendly, helpful and efficient and the service they provided made such a difference to our stay. We booked the presidential suite and wow, it was wonderful!! The bed was huge (I actually had to climb up into it!), comfy and had a view looking right onto the ocean from it which was beautiful and very relaxing. We had a large balcony overlooking the ocean which is wonderful for having a drink and watching the sun go down. The balcony isn’t too private as it also overlooks the pool but with a view like that we didn’t mind at all. The room was spacious with a kitchen/dining area and a good size fridge, the wood and kitsch tropical floral design was very fitting to the beach location. The bathroom was wonderful, with a huge Jacuzzi bath – pure luxury! Separate walk in shower, WC and large marble top dressing table area with terry cloth robes. The hotel offer a turn down service in the evening with chocolates on the pillows and this was a really nice touch. The pool is nice, clean and a good size with views of the ocean. There is also a hot tub which stays open after the sun has gone down. There were lots of sun loungers and the pool area was really quite peaceful (we did stay out of season). The bar by the pool does happy hour from 4pm with 2 for 1 drinks and the friendly bartender made us some awesome frozen margaritas! Location is amazing, couldn’t be better! The hotel is right on the beach, with beautiful views and beach walks and walking distance to lots of nice restaurants and bars. Valet parking is available at approx $20 a day and we did use this service on the first night. It is pretty easy however to find free parking on the streets around the hotel if you didn’t want to pay. I loved this hotel and if we are ever lucky enough to visit San Diego again, we will definitely be returning and recommending to all our friends!

Reviews.Title: “Wow! What a view!”
Reviews.Author: VTMommy_8
Reviews.Content: We couldn't have been happier with this hotel (well maybe if they had free wifi, but small matter) and the folks that staff it. The location was perfect for our beach-loving, food seeking, and early morning latte- needing family. The building is not fancy, but is very, very nice. And their customer service is top notch.

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice”
Reviews.Author: Barbarak51
Reviews.Content: Our stay at this hotel was very enjoyable. We were greeted upon check-in and offered an upgrade which we graciously accepted. The rooms are well appointed and comfortable. We had an amazing view. The front desk staff were very professional, pleasant, helpful and knowledgable. There is no onsite restaurants, but many good restaurants within walking distance. There is room service to the hotel from two nearby restaurants vWe ordered twice and the food was delivered promptly and was good. Large portions so we saved by splitting an entre. We were well satisfied with our stay here and if in San Diego in the future will stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Views”
Reviews.Author: Dodgerduo
Reviews.Content: Great location overlooking the ocean. We saw dolphins passing by from our balcony. We have been staying here for the last 4 years, unfortunately others have identified this great place to stay. The prices have increased and availability is getting slightly tougher to obtain rooms based on the popularity. Beach front location is good for those wanting to take in all that San diego has to offer.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: TerryLou
Reviews.Content: I have stayed here many times starting back in the 80's to most recently last year 2011. Nice rooms, great location, great views, great staff!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: pinked_10_11
Reviews.Content: We spent four nights there and were very pleased with the hotel, ammenities and the staff. We stayed in a Junior King Suite which was very nice to have the larger space for more than a one night stay. Nicely furnished and clean. My husband had arranged in advance for us to return to the hotel the first evening to a path of rose petals and candles. The staff paid attention to when we left the room so that they could execute his surprise for me. It was beautiful and perfect. We did not try their breakfast buffet although it smelled good. Instead we opted to walk down the beach and try some of the closeby local places. The pool was kept very clean and we enjoyed the hot tub too. We did not appreciate the many homeless beggars but found that to be quite prevalent in the greater San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: LibbySei
Reviews.Content: We have been lucky enough to stay at Pacific Terrace Hotel multiple times. It is a great small hotel. Every room has a view of the beach. I enjoyed laying by the pool watching the waves on the beach, and the walkers on the boardwalk. We stayed three weeks on one stay. I was in Heaven! We enjoyed the cookie & wine hour also. We can hardly wair to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Most beautiful vacation spot EVER!!!”
Reviews.Author: MusikPoptart
Reviews.Content: This place spoiled me. Plain and simple. Beautiful view...wonderful staff...quiet neighborhood...close to EVERYTHING...family oriented, yet private and relaxing. The boardwalk is directly in front of the hotel which makes it convenient in so many ways. There's something for all ages here. I can't wait to go back :)

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel right on Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: brownieLuv2trvl
Reviews.Content: Pacific Terrace is a great little hotel right on Pacific Beach in San Diego. It is in a quiet neighborhood, and close to everything. It is within walking distance to restaurants and entertainment. The boardwalk right in front of the hotel makes it a convenient location. It is also close to the 5 freeway so you can get anywhere in San Diego within 10 minutes. Friendly staff and nice rooms.

Reviews.Title: “Great Property and Beach View”
Reviews.Author: Phillysteaks414
Reviews.Content: This place was above and beyond what we expected. Grounds: They had lush green plants all around the hotel. Inside the lobby they had fresh flowers daily. Once you step outside by the pool you can see the ocean and beach right in front of you. The Hotel is almost on the beach, if it was not for the walkway the beach would be right up front. Room: Our room was amazing. There was a full size bar in our room, the biggest bed we have ever seen, Flat screen plasma t.v., great patio and view of the beach. Granite counter tops and wood accents throughout the room. They even had a ceiling fan (tropical style). In the lobby there is a restaurant that serves free wine tastings, great feature. The beach is just 1 minute walk from hotel. The beach is very quite, not busy and was a great feature. Easily the best value in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Favorite hotel in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: Bethany415
Reviews.Content: I love love love this hotel. I lived in SD for 11 years and I would stay here every time my mom came to visit. I lied feeling like I was on vaca w her for a week. We stayed for one night last night. Great room, beautiful furnishings, beach view, it's on the boardwalk!! Amazing. I'm only giving it 4 stars for 2 reasons. 1) we never got our WAKE UP call!!!! Considering we had a flight to Costa Rica this morning that was a HUGE deal. I travel for work 50+ nights a year, and have NEVER had this happen. Luckily I had an alarm for something else that saved us from missing our flight. Either way, big problem! 2) Breakfast used to be included, and a wine happy hour too. Not anymore, this was also a disappointment. Anyway this place is awesome. Just keep those 2 things in mind when you book. Hopefully they will take care of us if we continue to stay there in the future! Have a blast!!

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: KAOSMUA
Reviews.Content: The room was great. We had originally rented a room with no view thinking that we were going to be in the room only at night, but upon arrival they offered us a better room with partial view and a balcony, for 15$ more a night, and we were really happy with that choice in the end. Sitting on the balcony having a glass of wine while looking at the ocean was awesome. We rented bikes from the hotel, which was great! Not far from La Jolla, the zoo, the bay, Gaslamp district. Great restaurant for breakfast near the hotel, since I don't eat much for breakfast, it wasn't worth for me to pay for the breakfast buffet. The room was big and bathroom as well. I would stay here again and would recommand the hotel to anyone: Families, couple, friends! The staff was so friendly!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Lighthouse21
Reviews.Content: Loved the location and the hotel. Beautiful property and views. Staff very friendly

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Surprise for my Husband”
Reviews.Author: Mary M
Reviews.Content: I used the previous reviews from Trip Advisor to choose the Pacific Terrace for a surprise mini vacation for my husband's 60th. The hotel lived up to all the reviews and more. Location is fantastic, hotel staff very friendly and accommodating, and service above and beyond. I booked the ocean front suite, but did not select any other options. Changed my mind at the last minute, and Angela, the concierge handled everything. We will definitely return. The sooner, the better.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: Palos
Reviews.Content: Beautiful room, great staff, fantastic beach location.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Hotel - Would definitely stay again!”
Reviews.Author: Joanne C
Reviews.Content: This hotel is steps away from Pacific Beach. Staff was very friendly and went out of their way to make sure you had a great experience. Rooms were nicely decorated, granite sink top, lighted makeup mirror for the ladies, frameless tub shower, large flat screen TV and DVR. Everything was very clean. Bed was comfy. Turn down service offered with Begian chocolates on the bed. We stayed off season and the rates were unbelievable for the location and amenities. One drawback is the parking -- $22 per night. We were able to park on the street since it was off season. Will definitely consider staying here again!

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff and 4 star hotel”
Reviews.Author: taft1958
Reviews.Content: My stay was very nice; however, the hotel had some technical issues that prevented pay movies from being available for up to 24 hours after purchase, room key being deactivated prior to check-out date, and a couple of small items went missing duringthe first day after the "turn down" staff visited the room. Overall the stay was nice and the hotel waived one day of the $22.00 parking fees as compensation for the missing items. The most notible points for this facility is the nice pool area, the view (magnificient), and the friendly staff. I would stay again when the opportunity presents.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful area, amazing hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mattmaccormick
Reviews.Content: We really lucked out on this hotel. We found it on trip advisor and it did not disappoint! Upon arriving we were upgraded by Diego for $30 a night (150 total) to a suite with two queen beds, a flat screen tv, a massive bathroom with jacuzzi tub, and a south facing balcony overlooking the beach. The breakfast buffet was delicious in the morning. The beach had great surfing and the boardwalk was perfect for running during the day or night. This area of San Diego is pacific beach and has lots of nice restaurants, shops and bars.

Reviews.Title: “They don't have scores high enough for this type service, best in Socal!”
Reviews.Author: ferralcat
Reviews.Content: From the reservation staff to maintaince workers in parking garage, to the desk staff and day manager Angela....everyone freindly and smiling! Rooms super clean with everything you need! (Dishes, micro,fridge,cozy robes) The best ! Not one thing I would change! The romance package...wow...did they ever do an awesome job! Brought tears to her eyes! Can't praise this place enough! We loved it so much we changed our flight and stayed. Another day!

Reviews.Title: “Beatiful hotel, view, awesome customer service”
Reviews.Author: AJ408
Reviews.Content: This is our second visit to the Pacific Terrace, we will be back again! The customer service is amazing. Enrico upgraded us to a beautiful suite upon arrival, totally unexpected. Andres provided great valet/bell service, even offering to go to a store down the street for my boyfriend's beverage! The location/view can't be beat either. Highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Paradise”
Reviews.Author: Jvvalo
Reviews.Content: Friendly staff, beautiful ocean views, clean rooms, close to restaurants. The list goes on and on. I definitely will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great location overlooking the ocean”
Reviews.Author: bevandmark2
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here in a second floor ocean view room which is definitely worth the extra money. The rooms have 2 double beds which are amazingly comfortable once you manage to clamber onto them - the heavy wooden frames around them are just at the right height for me to bang my shins every time I attempted to get on the bed. The view of the ocean from the balcony is fabulous - we left the door open to fall asleep to the roar of the waves crashing against the beach. Our room was almost right in the centre of the hotel - which meant that we were over the top of the entrance to the pool - the balconies are great but they aren't very private or quiet - indeed when there are people in the pool, especially kids playing, it can be very noisy. Service was reasonable - but not exceptional. When we booked we had a rate with a free glass of wine which didn't ever materialise - although to be honest we kept forgetting to mention it. There were a couple of other niggles which irritated - they ran out of the only decent beer they had in the bar - Sam Adams (they only did four different beers, one of which was a "lite") and 2 days later when we tried again for a beer they still hadn't got any (the bartender was a bit embarrassed and offered to pop down the shop!). The other niggle was that we asked about a late checkout - it was a quiet time so they agreed to an hour later than normal - 12noon, but if we wanted a 3pm checkout we would have to pay just under $100. We settled for 12noon. Overall we really liked this hotel - its small and right beside the beach with a great view and we would probably go back if we ever return to San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service Good Location”
Reviews.Author: whereissnot
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace in May 2011 and we are always comparing their service to other places we stay. The front desk staff were awesome in helping us to get around (we had to get to Petco Park for a Padres game and they were spot in with their public transport suggestions), making restaurant suggestions and just being really friendly overall. We work in customer service, so we know how easy it is to just smile and be pleasant, but we are constantly surprised at how many businesses get it wrong. It is great to feel confident in the advice you are given in a city you don't know. Room was spotless, loved the towel animals after each service. While the location is a fair way out of San Diego proper, there are some great restaurants near by and a supermarket is within walking distance.

Reviews.Title: “Long stay guest, and simply superb”
Reviews.Author: DJTravelBoy
Reviews.Content: The location is fantastic with the ocean at your doorstep and long, beautiful walks a daily must. Restaurants are close, ranging from the inexpensive to the chic. And the hotel staff at the Pacific Terrace is just the best. They are accommodating, friendly, genuine and customer focused. I have already booked a return stay for next year. This is a wonderful, intimate property.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel - beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: Mandy J
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here during our USA honeymoon. We had a great time in San Diego and the hotel was in a great location. So close to the beach. The junior suite was beautiful & spacious. They do also provide a hot breakfast in their dining room for an extra charge. Only complaints were there is no proper room service and our suite was opposite an elevator which got a bit noisy in the morning. If I were to stay again I would specifically ask to not be placed near the elevator or dining room. Apart from that it was a great stay and would definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome experience!”
Reviews.Author: asiangent
Reviews.Content: My first trip to southern California and this hotel had to be the best part! I want to specifically mention Enrico for his outstanding customer service and attentiveness, he made this stay that much more perfect!

Reviews.Title: “Great location!”
Reviews.Author: baybug
Reviews.Content: The front desk staff was exceptionally nice and accommodating to me and my family. We stayed in a room with a partial view of the ocean. Every night around 7:30 p.m. someone came to the room with a stack of chocolates asking if we needed turndown service. The room needed better air circulation, but if you opened the sliding door the ocean breeze came through. The hotel is just steps to the ocean and shops are within walking distance. I would definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Tommy Bahama Meets Beach Blanket Babylon”
Reviews.Author: blissfork
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace is my go-to hotel in San Diego...especially when they drop their rates at the last minute. Their full ocean view rooms have balconies that are basically on top of the ocean, and are AMAZING for people watching if you get a room on floor 2 or 3 on the right-hand side of the hotel. Try not to get a room right in the middle of the U shaped hotel, as those are farther back from the beach and you end up just spying on people in the pool when you should be enjoying the sunset. I never pay for parking, as I'm always able to find free parking within a few blocks. I also never eat the food at the hotel, as San Diego is chock-full of marvelous restaurants. My partner and I are honestly slightly embarrassed for liking this hotel so much. We're in our early 30s, which we think is far too early to be staying in a Tommy Bahama themed hotel. The upside of that is that there isn't a party scene at night. It's always quiet, we sleep with the balcony doors wide open, and when we venture down to the jacuzzi we always have it to ourselves. The one downside is the customer service. The hotel staff tends to be reluctant to allow early check-ins or late check-outs. They also won't let you book a specific room unless you pay a $50 fee -- so even if we book months in advance, we aren't guaranteed one of the right-hand side oceanfront rooms. Even though we are repeat customers! I also never get free upgrades, even when better rooms are available :-( My final gripe: my partner called today to find out about availability this coming Monday. He called at about 6pm and was given a special unadvertised rate by the person working the desk. He said he would call back in a bit to confirm. When he called back a different person answered the phone and refused to honor the rate he had been quoted just a few hours earlier, even though the room (a King Suite) was still available. We felt like we were being jerked around a bit, so we booked a "Surf Pad" room at a different beach-front hotel just a smidge down the boardwalk. We're bummed out, because that hotel is swankier, but also louder and douchier. That said, they are much more accommodating about early check-ins and they don't bait and switch on price.

Reviews.Title: “First Class All the Way!”
Reviews.Author: GoDog514
Reviews.Content: Every staff person we interacted with was very friendly and helpful. They always asked if everything was OK and if we were enjoying our stay. We had an ocean view room and I would highly recommend it. The patio is large and has 4 chairs and a table. A great place to have a cocktail, read or people watch. My Internet reservation included a complimentary glass of wine, free wierless internet, free use of bikes and half price breakfast buffet. We chose to walk to a local restaurant for breakfast instead. The consigiere was very helpful in recommending restaurants for dinner and made the reservations for us. You will pay $22 for parking and if you don't get the deal that includes free Internet, it will cost $10. The beds are comfy and sit up high in a large, impressive wood frame with a wood headboard. They do provide a wooden step if you need help reaching the bed. Located within walking distance to shops and restaurants and steps from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: jalabrake
Reviews.Content: Love stay here! The staff is friendly and made me feel welcome. The rooms are very nice. The beds are so comfortable! I love falling asleep and waking up to the sounds of the waves from the beach.

Reviews.Title: “California beach at it's best. Stay here!!”
Reviews.Author: fabiab1
Reviews.Content: We stayed for a business/ vacation a couple of yrs ago. I found the staff to be from a cross section of countries. It was interesting to hear where they were all from. The staff was exceptional. fresh baked cookies daily in the lobby. Wonderful breakfast served daily included in the room price. I relaxed here. Our room had a partial ocean view, we had breakfast watching the surfers at 6AM..The balcony was large enought o sit with nice chairs. restaurants are close. Nice place to see "old California, loved the surfer feel. The hotel was very well endowed in luxury. The bed was soft enough to be soothing. I slept so well. Bathroom well equipped. I would stay here again and again!! Nice parking and pool is great,, one of the nicest!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel & Area”
Reviews.Author: Maureen M
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very well appointed, comfortable beds, very comfortable, quiet rooms. Our room was a third floor, ocean view with a balcony. A very delicious, hot breakfast is served every mornining. The staff is excellent, very helpful and informative. The concierge helped with reservations, discount tickets and information. The hotel is affiliated with a wonderful car service that picked us up and drove us to various attractions and then was back at the appointed time to take us to the hotel. The pool and hot tub are very nice and we met some wonderful people there. There are lots of lounge chairs and cabanas and free cool drinks, near the pool area. The beach and walking path are accessible from the pool area.

Reviews.Title: “Highly Recommend”
Reviews.Author: travelgal30Seattle
Reviews.Content: Beautiful location. Excellent customer service. Thoroughly enjoyed our stay. Room service menu incredibly reasonable, beautiful views, water pressure and temperature excelllent, good insulation between rooms, we had a wonderful time. Definitely recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic location & hotel”
Reviews.Author: FrequentTravelerNC
Reviews.Content: I was in San Diego for a conference and my company booked at Pacific Terrace. I was greeted by friendly and welcoming front desk staff and found out I was upgraded to a junior suite with partial view of the ocean. Check in was quick and the person that checked me in was informative and resourceful about the hotel amenities and where to eat nearby, etc. My room was large, clean and stocked. That partial view was amazing, not sure why they call it a partial view! The front desk called me to make sure all was well in my room. The room is nicely appointed with free and reliable wireless (important item for me when traveling for business). They do not have a restaurant at the hotel, but have a few options: (1) they have participating restaurants that deliver food, and (2) they provide a food card and if you eat at the participating restaurants of that plan they just bill your room. Also, they do have a breakfast buffet in the morning which is nice and pretty reasonable in cost. Location, it is walking distance to lots of dining options and a Starbucks. The hotel is very close to Interstate 5, literally 6-7 minutes straight shot to La Jolla, and many other areas. Downside, public parking is hard to get, but there is valet option of $20/per day. Not an issue for me, but those on a budget, this is a good thing to know. Otherwise, the stay was amazing and I will certainly return to stay at Pacific.

Reviews.Title: “Killer views for the price”
Reviews.Author: jjjjohn777
Reviews.Content: Overall solid value. My partial ocean view room was essentially all the ocean I could handle. My only complaint is the heating/cooling system works on a motion detector system so I woke up cold each morning (I stayed in December) because the heat didnt automatically kick in. This would be a non issue in summer but it made me long for a simple window/wall mounted unit to crank up the fan/heat as i saw fit. staff was nice , welcome glass of vino, secure underground garage parking. there are computers in the hall so not sure if a business center is necessary.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Place to stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: glen c
Reviews.Content: We had a very nice stay here. The staff are super friendly and helpful. The rooms are clean, spacious and comfortable. Nice location, close to shops, restaurants and beach. Close to Sea World ($20 taxi) Seaworld ($40.00) - Legoland is a fair hike ($85.00 each way in Taxi). Awesome view. Great pool and spa. Very reasonably priced. Would highly recommend!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful sunsets!”
Reviews.Author: Tinsman5
Reviews.Content: The hotel was located on a fun boardwalk in San Diego, Ca. The views from the hotel were awesome! My favorite time of the day was at sunset. We would sit on the chairs by the pool and have a perfect view of the sunset. The service at the hotel was excellent. Everyone was friendly from the janitorial staff up to management. I thought that was very impressive. Even before we traveled to San Diego, I was contacted by the hotel concierge to find out if we had any needs for reservations at local restaurants or any local attractions. In advance, the hotel made us dinner reservations for some near-by places, and got us our San Diego Zoo tickets. This made things so convenient and easy for us. Our room was very nice and a good size. We stayed in on of the family suites. The pull-out couch was very comfortable. The view from our room was of the pool and the ocean. I think this was a perfect room for our family of 5. As far as food, the hotel only serves breakfast. We ate breakfast there 3 out of the 5 days. The food was pretty good, but the menu did not change daily while we were there. It was a buffet with things like eggs, omelettes, bacon, sausage, potatoes, toast, pancakes, french toast, yogurt, bananas, a few rolls, and a couple of choices of cereal. We enjoyed it on the days we ate there. The coffee was Starbucks and was very good. The hotel concierge gave us 4 excellent recommendations for places to eat dinner. We enjoyed all the places they sent us to. Most of the places were within walking distance and we would walk there along the boardwalk each night to get there. The pool was nice and enjoyable for the kids, and they had a nice hot tub. The chairs were comfortable lounge chairs and they even set up tiki torch lights once the sun went down. The hotel really was a great choice for us and I would highly recommend it. The only drawback at all had nothing to do with the hotel itself, it was more the area where it is located. We found it was very interesting, but we had no problems with it. The boardwalk had some homeless people further down the road from the hotel and there were certaintly some very interesting characters we saw as we walked on the boardwalk. The hotel itself is very secure and we never felt unsafe. The area around the hotel is pretty casual with a lot of surfers around. It was fun to watch them surfing at high tide! We did not spend much time at the actual beach. The beach area is okay, but certaintly not like the white pristine beaches in the Carribean :). It is just a public beach in California. I knew that this was the case, but playing on the beach was not one of our priorities this vacation. I did see other families with their kids down on the beach playing. My kids seemed to prefer the beautiful pool at the hotel. Anyway, overall I would say the hotel exceeded our expectations. We were very happy with them and would recommend this hotel. I think the two biggest and most important reasons why you would want to stay at this hotel are: 1. the excellent staff/service and 2. the beautiful view of the oceans and the sunset!

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return to this amazing place!”
Reviews.Author: Bsquared1962
Reviews.Content: I scheduled us for a weekend trip to PT to include a renewal of our wedding vows on 11-11-11. Our fabulous weekend started with the assistance of Angela from PT. She was a great help in getting the "ceremony" put together. The entire staff went above and beyond make this a most memorable trip. Then you add the quality of the hotel and the location right on the beach, perfect! I have never had the level of service and attention to detail from any hotel, ever!! We can't wait to come back!! If possible, do get a 2 or 3 floor room as the views are amazing. I also found the new expanded breakfast very enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “Wedding Anniversary ♥”
Reviews.Author: Tawnee G
Reviews.Content: My husband and i recently celebrated our 1 year wedding anniversary at Pacific Terrace. The place was beautiful. The website pictures do not do justice. It was way bigger and nicer in person. Our favorite part was the Jacuzzi Tub!!! we stayed in that thing for most of our visit. The breakfast buffet was also a nice add in. Food was great and the beach view made it even better. Close to shops and great nightlife. It is very kid friendly as well. I plan to go back for a family vacation next.

Reviews.Title: “Good Hotel, Great Location”
Reviews.Author: db210
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed 3 nights in this hotel with my wife and our child. We got the family suite so that we could have our own space and it was well worth it. The rooms were comfortable and well appointed. We also had an ocean view which was very nice. I would say the location was the best thing about this hotel. The walk up and down Ocean Blvd is awesome, the beach is right there, and there are tons of restaurants. We walked to dinner every night. You have to do some minor driving to get to the sights, but we made it down to the Zoo and Balboa Park in about 15 minutes, La Jolla and some of the stuff up that way was about the same drive. 15 minutes to the airport as well. It was easy enough to navigate The only negative, which has been pointed out by other reviewers, is the charge for breakfast. This is a minor issue, but breakfast is complimentary just about everywhere you go. Overall, though, I would stay at this hotel again.

Reviews.Title: “Love the Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: swf1107
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel October 29 & 30 and again on November 5th. The stay was very relaxing, as usual, the views from the oceanfront rooms is spectacular, especially at sunset!! The first leg of our trip we stayed in Room 319 which has the best afternoon sun!! The only thing that bothers me about this hotel at all is the charge for parking but even at that, it is convenient. Also, the elevators are a little flaky sometimes but it is only 3 floors so the steps are very easy to use.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing getaway”
Reviews.Author: coolcots
Reviews.Content: The hotel is in a beautiful setting with a convenient location. The staff are extremely friendly and helpful. The room had a great view and was very tidy. However the hotel charges an extra $20 per night for parking so we parked on the street. The 24hr gym was quiet - I enjoyed this aspect.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing welcome to San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Kathleen H
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pacific Terrace on my first night alone after moving to San Diego. I could not have asked for a warmer welcome. Having booked the room on a whim that day after passing in while scoping out apartments with my sister, we called and happened to get a great Internet deal. When I arrived, as a scared New Yorker, I was made to feel a part of my new world in an instant. Apparently the fates clearly knew how nervous I was, because this wonderful staff opened the doors to an ocean front room, where my 2nd floor balcony was just high enough off the pool that I felt like I could touch the Pacific Ocean. The staff provided me with everything I needed or couldn't find amidst my road trip mess. The room was enormous with spectacular beds and every amenity you could desire. And as soon as I unpacked, I was encouraged to join the party at 2 for 1 cocktail hour on the pool deck. As I sat, sipping my pomegranate mojito and calling my friends back in New York, I knew I would be OK. Thank you Pacific Terrace, for helping me to fall in love with a new city!

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking...”
Reviews.Author: LeviTrop
Reviews.Content: As soon as I walked into our ocean-view suite, I was glad my fiancée chose this place! Large spacious accommodation with windows all across the suite viewing out to the ocean. You can watch almost 180 degrees of waves crashing onto the shore from your bed!. A small but adequate breakfast buffet is offered in the hotel for around $11. The boardwalk is literally steps from the hotel and lots of great things to do around the vicinity. The only con was a bit of noise coming into our unit from other guests and maintenance staff in the hallways every morning, but not enough that it affected my sleep. I would definitely come back if I am ever in San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Views and Staff!”
Reviews.Author: icedkachang
Reviews.Content: What a great hotel! Thank you Tripadvisor for helping us find it. Absolutely amazing view of the ocean... worth paying extra for the full ocean view. Love the palm trees and sea breezes. Bed was amazing, soo comfy. Nice decor and I really loved the shampoo/ soap (Tommy Bahama, smells like coconut! really nice touch). Staff were extremely helpful and enthusastic. Honestly, everyone was so great. Really nothing to complain about at all! Neighborhood is full of resturants, bars, coffee places, great mexican food, lots of interesting characters. Enjoyed the stroll down the beach and proximity to La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Ambiance of Mauii without the Jetlag.”
Reviews.Author: Douglas B
Reviews.Content: We spent three nights here in early November, 2011. The ambiance is Mauii-esque with the indoor/outdoor feeling of the open hallways on each floor, and the ocean-views from the rooms. The service is stellar. The staff go out of their way to make you feel comfortable and relaxed. By the second day, they were addressing us by our names. Special kudos to Cameron Curran and Maria Ratto; they didn't miss a detail or an opportunity to make us feel at home. Our room was fantastic! The bathroom, with the jacuzzi tub and shower, was bigger than some hotel rooms I've stayed in. The two-king suite was very spacious, comfortable, and clean. The beds are like sleeping on a cloud. The giftshop was very nice. The proximity to the boardwalk/promenade along the beach. The many restaurants within walking distance made our stay very easy.

Reviews.Title: “Can't beat walking right out the back door onto the boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: Owen J
Reviews.Content: Its right on the beach, so location is amazing, the rooms are huge and the staff is great..

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: kelly155032
Reviews.Content: Just recently visited this hotel in October 2011. Beautiful property with great views of Pacific Beach. Get a room on the 2nd or 3rd floor oceanfront....you won't be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Our beach getaway - and we live in San Diego!”
Reviews.Author: relaxationseeker0
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a secret treasure. Perfectly clean, lovely rooms with decks (some with hot tubs). One of the only hotels in SD that actually sits on the sand. Great for families. You can imagine you are in Hawaii here.

Reviews.Title: “One of the best hotel & service in our California trip”
Reviews.Author: Midouille
Reviews.Content: The location of the hotel is great, right in front of the beach, with only a pathway in the middle. The pool and jacuzzi were a pure delight for our two kids and ourselves. The personnel is extremely attentive to all your needs, all without exception are smiling and greeting you with a positive energy. The room was nice (we got uograded to family suite), very roomy and equipped with all that's needed to enjoy lunches or breakfasts in the privacy of your room. We can only recommend that hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Nice Room - Until the AC Came On”
Reviews.Author: MD_to_SC
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace is a nice looking hotel, on the beach (across the walkway, anyway) with a very nice staff. Our room, the Presidentail Suite was large and well-furnished and everything seemed great. Then the air conditioning came on and it felt like we were on the taxiway at San Diego airport. There is one large AC vent just above the headboard of the bed and the noise from it was deafening. Our solution was to cool the room as much as possible before going to bed and then turn off the HVAC system. Unfortunately the room became hotter than the outside temp and we needed to switch on the AC at 2 AM. No sleeping in this room! While the hotel is nice, the surrounding neighborhood is a bit run down. Expect to see frequent homeless folks on benches just next to the hotel (and do not use the public restroom nearby - it is the dirtiest one we've ever encountered). In the future, for $400 a night plus $20 for parking, I'll go elsewhere. PS - They did refund the parking fee when we complained about the AC noise - woo woo!

Reviews.Title: “A perfect place”
Reviews.Author: Markus1003
Reviews.Content: we have made reservation for two nights in an ocean view room and had a very relaxed time there. check-in was quick and very friendly, they offer complementary parking in the garage of the hotel. everyone of the staff was very friendly and always greated with a smile. our room offered a beautiful view of the beach directly in front of the hotel which is located at front row. the area features a lot of hotels and condos but only small ones and it doesn't get really crowdy. the historic crystal pier and many restaurants are within walking distance. the pacific terrace itself only offers breakfast which was about $ 13 during our stay and of good quality.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in area - just make sure you are happy with Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: ChiswickTurnhamGreen
Reviews.Content: So this hotel is exactly as good as most of the other reviews say. It's by far the best hotel in the area - Pacific Beach. The view onto the beach and the Pacific and the surfers is fantastic; as are the sunsets. Just as good is the level of service here - the quality,warmth, friendliness of every single team member is as good as i have ever know it in any hotel. The best room: The best rooms are on the second and third floors - avoid the first (ground) floor as it's onto the pool and not much of a view of the sea. The best rooms are on the edges of the hotel but they are the suites and I'm not sure they are worth the extra. You get a great sunset from all the ocean front rooms - it does not matter which one you are in. We were slightly to the side of the pool (on the second floor) which was good. Breakfast is really average and I would not bother with it - as one guest said: 'in other hotels this kind of breakfast is normally complimentary.' Go out. There is no restaurant in the hotel but that's fine as there are so many choices in walking distance - ask for the restaurant recommendation sheet they have in reception to find the better places. The hotel is not a trendy hotel - it's very functional but it won't win design awards! It's ideal for families. The secure garage parking, under the hotel, is $20 per day for residents, which is steep. There is free wifi which is of a good quality. I Which brings me to my main problem - the area - Pacific Beach itself. It's a surfer beach, popular with students, and the younger folks. It's NOT a top end resort at all. I guess, for California, it's a little bit of a dive. Trendy dive. So, for example, eating out is cheap and cheerful. There are loads of rowdy sports bars close by. Next time, i think I won't come back to this area (I'll go to La Jolla, see below) which is a shame because i liked the hotel. My advice is to research the area you stay in San Diego very carefully. Here's my very simple guide..... Most important to you is restaurants, busy and good bars and lots of choices. You don't mind not being by the sea.....GAS LAMP QUARTER DOWNTOWN You like being by the sea and like really loud and lively budget places with the trendy vibe....PACIFIC BEACH You want to be by the sea, will pay really premium prices and like it older and more conservative....LA JOLLA (you get the bonus of seeing seals every day on the rocks around La Jolla) In all 3, you'll need a car to get around and inland, into the forests, mountains and desert - all of which are 1.5 hrs drive from San Diego. Bye the way, San Diego is totally cool place - so definitely go. ps top tip - we went in late October and the 'coastal eddy' had started = fog, mist, cold (mid 60s). Simple... 3 days it was miserable on the coast, we drove 1.5 hrs into the mountains and then onto the desert and it was beautiful - totally cloudless blue skies and hot, hot, hot. Within 1.5 hours we went from 65 on the coast to 96 in the desert. I love the fact that that is always and option if you have fog/bad weather in San Diego. If you like my review pls click the 'useful' button - thanks!

Reviews.Title: “Location, location, location -- and a great staff!”
Reviews.Author: CathyHV
Reviews.Content: We have stayed in three different rooms at this hotel and they were all different but great in their own ways. All had full ocean views. We enjoyed an end room which was directly above the sidewalk. This was perfect for people- and surfer-watching. The other two rooms were more interior and afforded more privacy and a view of the pool and hot tub as well as the beach. Everyone we encountered on the staff was exceptionally friendly and helpful. This last visit was on my birthday and there was a bottle of wine in the room for me from the hotel. We got dinner recommendations for JRDN (right down the beach) and Piatti (in La Jolla) which were both excellent. The fitness facility is located in the garage. It is small but has enough machines to get a workout. Free wi-fi works great. Parking is valet and is $20 per night but we got such great room rates it was still a bargain.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location... on one of the most popular beaches!”
Reviews.Author: PatCross
Reviews.Content: Small-ish boutique style hotel, with lots of personal attention! Have stayed here several times and will continue to do so!! All of the rooms are beautiful and the private verandas on the upper floors offer great views no matter where you are located. Go to bed with the sound of the ocean lulling you to sleep. However if it was me, I would specifically ask for a first floor room …just a personal preference…The private patios are huge on the first floor and you are steps away from relaxing by the pool, and moments away from the gate out to the waves and the oceanfront sidewalk. Kudos to the excellence in choosing their staff, starting at Ted at the front desk and going on up to Gerard who will respond to your every need! All employees appear to love their jobs at the Pacific Terrace and go out of their way to make sure you have a first-rate time there as well. This hotel is on one of the most popular beach areas in the entire San Diego area; young and old alike on their beach cruisers or roller-blading by. The location is perfect if you want to stay around the pool there or hang out on the beach below for your entire visit, or it is wonderfully well-situated for lots of action or just convenient things to do within walking distance. Near Garnet’s shops, taverns and eateries, and just a short drive to all San Diego’s attractions. Especially close by the hotel is beautiful LaJolla. All and all wonderful experience time and time again!! P.S. Their sofa sleepers (found in a few of their rooms) are also superior! Super comfortable!

Reviews.Title: “Strange bathroom set-up”
Reviews.Author: UtOpia210
Reviews.Content: This hotel is located at the northern end of Pacific Beach and we were not disturbed by noise at any time during our three night stay. Our room was one which had an ocean view and had a large balcony. I did not like the fact that the wash basin was located outwith the bathroom and next to the coffee making facility. The coffee from this machine was inferior to that provided free in the foyer each morning.
