Reviews.Title: “look no further!”
Reviews.Author: bmxm0m
Reviews.Content: The staff is unsurpassed. It's hard to beat 100% smiling faces, warm welcomes and a sincere desire to make your stay the best. EVERYONE went above & beyond here. We reserved a 'partial ocean view' room thinking we would have to crank our necks around a wall to catch a glimpse but to our surprise, it was a fantastic view of the ocean. The 'partial' part I guess was because it was on the 1st floor and the gate around the premises blocked an unhibited view? Loved the individual patio (w/ every room), we thought the breakfast was good (was advertised as "new", possibly changed since a previous review stated it was poor?). Our room wasn't really big but it was clean, had comfortable beds, and you can't beat the proximitiy to the beach. This was a family vacation and our kids loved the pool and the hot tub was very nice too. The hotel had beach toys and chairs for us to borrow as well as bikes for us to ride along the oceanside pathway. This is a very 'happening' area; a young/surfers demographic. We felt very comfortable and enjoyed walking to nearby restaurants that are popular w/ the locals. 'Joe' at the front desk was especially kind and out of his way helpful to us. The concierge was great to. We look forward to going back.

Reviews.Title: “Good view but otherwise unexceptional”
Reviews.Author: SteveM114
Reviews.Content: If you place great value on an ocean side room and good view then it will be worth you paying the extra to stay here. However, in my view it otherwise fairly ordinary. Rooms are ok, a little dated but comfortable, but the hotel has no bar and is dead in the evenings. Breakfast is very poor quality. Pool is nice and staff generally helpful.the area around the hotel lacks any sophistication with many noisy bars more suited to the yound surfer crowd. Nearby La Jola is 20 mins by bus, much more upmarket with lovely shops and restaurants. It s well worth visiting for an afternoon or evening out

Reviews.Title: “The pacific terrace pretty much sums it up,love to open all the doors , take in the tremendous view and fall asleep to the sound”
Reviews.Author: ltinpb
Reviews.Content: We love to stay here when ever we have the chance and we live right down the street. We have stayed in many of the rooms and the are all great. The Kingston suite is my favorite,the best part of the stay is the incredible staff!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff and Location”
Reviews.Author: legalmanager
Reviews.Content: This is about our 5th stay at this great hotel, which has a excellent location on the beach on the south end of Pacific Beach. Angela, the Chief Concierge, provided above and behind the norm for outstanding service when a minor issue came up about our room. The hotel is very clean, has great views of the beach and amazing sunsets and a very friendly staff. There are also numerous places to eat within a few blocks from the hotel. A have attached a few on my photos of the area, as well as my web site of my photography. http://photomanva.zenfolio.com/p145278967

Reviews.Title: “Amazing people, amazing stay”
Reviews.Author: Park3r51
Reviews.Content: I've ben to this hotel twice and they've over booked my room both times, but with that said they were very gracious and helpful they upgraded my steady both times. The location could not get any better right in the center of pacific beach and inches off the ocean. The staff is wonderful and the rooms are comfortable and modern. I would recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the PB area.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanside Gem”
Reviews.Author: Donna0004
Reviews.Content: This is a diamond with a clear-cut mission:to deliver the friendliest customer service around. Rooms with a view of sunrise early morning surfers provide instant relaxation. Bath products are top shelf. There is a great massage room ground level and dinner delivery from close restaurants. This is the best place to stay in the San Diego area.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT HOTEL ON THE BEACH”
Reviews.Author: chanel49
Reviews.Content: Wonderful hotel...great service..friendly staff...beautiful rooms and views..chocolate chip cookies every day..YUM........have been here 12 times and love it more each trip......boardwalk is great for walking.......location is perfect.....pool and spa are fabulous.......3rd floor is the best for ocean views....if in PACIFIC BEACH stay at this hotel!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: Carter1234
Reviews.Content: Our 4 night stay at Pacific Terrace Hotel has been great. The rooms are updated, clean and very nice. Hotel staff is courteous and goes above & beyond. Soft drinks/water is available at the pool all day & they are literally right on the ocean (within a few steps to the sand!) Their breakfast is wonderful & priced well for what you get. We visited the zoo & Angela (consierge) was very helpful with discount tickets and directions. We would definitely recommend staying here. It's a great place!!

Reviews.Title: “Blackout Fabulous!”
Reviews.Author: runaway_with_me
Reviews.Content: Not only the nicest hotel on the beach, but incredibly prepared when the power went out Sept. 8th for almost 12 hours. Every room was given a lantern, (thank goodness!), and staff in the dining area set out cheese, crackers, trail and chex mix packages galore, evian water bottles, and best of all, free wine! Rooms were lovely, beds cozy, and all very clean. Staff members were always pleasant. Pricey, but worth it.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace - best place on the beach in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: mcrosson
Reviews.Content: Here is the wonderful hotel I stayed at in San Diego - the www.PacificTerrace.com ... right on the beach, small boutique style with impeccable service and fantastic rooms. A combination of Tommy Bahama and Ralph Lauren styling, very spacious and inviting. It gets my highest recommendation and I'm pretty darn picky.

Reviews.Title: “Nice Place”
Reviews.Author: MrsPAlbany
Reviews.Content: We really enjoyed our 3 nights. The hotel was in excellent condition, clean and the ocean views are great. Very attractive rooms and I really liked the wood louvered sliding doors. The bed was really comfortable. The hotel buffet breakfast was convenient and good, It was not included and was 11.50 per person, but we were told we would get half off. I guess this is a guest price? Nice pool and hot tub. This was our first visit to San Diego and we did enjoy Pacific Beach but the main street was not extremely attractive to shop or walk. The beach walk was very nice along the beach. As mentioned by a few others, the parking fees seem a bit much. Why some of these hotels charge high fees for their rooms and then add on parking fees is hard to understand. I can't see many people coming to Pacific Beach without a car. We did have to pay hotel parking in San Francisco,but public transportation seems more realistic there and so a lot of guests might not have a car and I am guessing they don't want to raise overall hotel rates and penalize non drivers? The hotel rates are on the high side considering that the area is not real ritzy, but I guess the ocean location is the reason for the rates. We really liked the pool area. The pool temperature was perfect and the view of the ocean from the pool area is great!

Reviews.Title: “The best place to stay in Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: Katherine_Albany_CA
Reviews.Content: For years, while staying at a "modest" hotel nearby, we would walk by the Pacific Terrace Hotel and envy the folks basking by the gorgeous pool overlooking the ocean. At our old hotel, we had to walk down a crummy alley, past the dumpsters and pools of some kind of liquid to get to the bluffs. Pacific Terrace was our Shangri-La! For our anniversary, we decided to splurge and we booked a room at the Pacific Terrace. We were delighted that the price wasn't *that much* more than what we had been paying. The people were friendly and were there when we needed them. Having easy access to bicycles and boogie boards made the whole experience even more of a treat. To get to the ocean, all we had to do is step outside the front door or through the pool gate and we were on the bluffs...with a short jaunt to the waves and beautiful beach below. We love the casual, uncrowded atmosphere of Pacific Beach. And, this is the best place to stay in Pacific Beach!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, even better staff.”
Reviews.Author: Justin B
Reviews.Content: I stayed here during the 2011 San Diego blackout. The staff really went above and beyond to make me and all guests as comfortable and safe as possible. Everything in the city was closed, but we had a pretty good time in the hotel! The pictures of this place don't lie - it's amazing. The pool is great, the rooms are amazing. They're not just the cookie-cutter rooms you would get in a Hilton or Marriott - some thought actually went into laying them out. But in my humble opinion, the staff really makes this place stand out among all the places I stayed on my trip.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Boutique Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Fawn07
Reviews.Content: We reserved a third floor room with a balcony and ocean view. The room was very clean. The furnishings were in good condition. The view was great -- ocean view and pool view. It was a bit noisy in the morning when the crew was preparing the pool for the day, but if the door was closed and the AC on, we heard nothing. Lounging at the pool is pleasant. Isaac is attentive to all of his guests. The location is excellent. Only a few minutes from Mission Beach and a few more in the other direction to La Jolla. We rented a car so that made it very easy to get around. (Elsewhere in San Diego be prepared to have quarters handy for the meters.) I did not encounter the rowdies from down the walk as mentioned in other reviews. No one bothered us at night. Seriously, the location is great and you don't need a car if you just want to stay in the area. Restaurants and shopping are all in walking distance. The turn-down service chocolates were very good! We departed at the crack of dawn and our tab was ready to go. The staff at the front desk were always on duty and very friendly. I will surely make it back for another visit.

Reviews.Title: “Our Favorite Place to Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Love2Go100
Reviews.Content: We've been traveling to the San Diego area for years and this ultimately is our favorite hotel and location. The staff is more than accommodating, the rooms are beautiful and the location is great. Don't miss the 2 for 1 happy hour!

Reviews.Title: “A nice hotel”
Reviews.Author: brainman
Reviews.Content: We booked a double queen ocean view room. We got room 114, on the first floor, middle of the hotel, right next to the breakfast room. We got a decent prepaid rate. We could see the ocean waves across the pool and through the wind break. The pool area entrance was steps from our back door. The room was very nice and well thought out. It had a small refrigerator, and we used the microwave in the breakfast room when needed. The staff were very helpful. One downside was that we could hear them making breakfast through the walls starting a little after 6am each morning. Also $20/night for parking, while safe and convenient, is a bit excessive.

Reviews.Title: “Paper thin walls, ceiling, and floor, we will not be returning”
Reviews.Author: christmaszorro
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful location at a compromise. We stayed in the Executive suite room. The neighbors on all three sides were audible. It was disturbing to hear the upstairs occupants walk the length of their room at night. When we stay in a hotel quiet only comes second to the bed comfort and luxury. Unfortunately, this hotel left much to be desired. The bed was too firm and pillows too large and hard. The bed sheets were very scratchy and stiff. The brunch/breakfast was completely inedible. The pre-made "omelet" was a salty nightmare, the waffles were rubbery under the heat lamp, and the fruit was fermented and soggy. For a hotel with only 4 levels (including the garage) the elevator was excruciatingly slow, at least the stairs were somewhat accessible. The hotel does not even come close to having the right number of bike for it's occupants to rent. The only redeeming quality of such an over priced hotel was the friendly staff. Needless to say we will not be returning.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location, excellent staff!”
Reviews.Author: Chris M
Reviews.Content: I stayed here for business for two days but loved it so much I ended up not wanting to leave so I took vacation to stay an extra day. This hotel probably has the friendliest and genuinely most helpful staff of any hotel I've stayed at (and I generally spend two to three weeks in hotels around the US every year).

Reviews.Title: “Amazing hotel, we'll definitely return!”
Reviews.Author: Lotus5683
Reviews.Content: This was my first trip to San Diego, and the hotel came highly recommended. Needless to say, it did not disappoint! The staff was friendly and always helpful when we needed directions or dinner suggestions. Getting to San Diego's main attractions like the Zoo and Balboa Park was very easy from this hotel so it worked great for us. We had a full ocean view room which was spacious, clean, comfortable, and of course had an amazing view of the Pacific. The bed was super comfortable, and the room had a mini fridge in it too which was convenient.The balcony off the room was huge! The hotel is located right on the boardwalk and is within walking distance of tons of great bars, restaurants and even a grocery store. The area is great and the beach is just steps outside of the hotel. The pool area is beautiful as well. Some people might not be too thrilled that the hotel only offers breakfast, but all you have to do is walk a short distance and there are so many great options that you really can't complain. I loved our stay here and look forward to coming back when I return to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Great view and location-High Price-very average rooms at best”
Reviews.Author: mlsLincoln_MA
Reviews.Content: The hotel is nicely situated on Pacific Beach. We had a third floor ocean room and the view is spectacular. I felt the neighborhood was safe and offers a wide variety of good dining options in the neighborhood, provided you are willing to drive to some. The public areas are well kept and the staff is extremely friendly, always going out of their way to cordially greet you every time you pass by them. Although the pool is not huge, we enjoyed it. The hot tub was also nice. We were disappointed in our room. At $500 a night and all the glowing reviews (#2 in San Diego!), our expectations were high. The rooms are dark, cramped and cluttered with a lot of large clunky furniture that is not functional. There were no regular size drawers to put our clothes in, so we kept them in our suitcase – but there was barely a place to set our open suitcase (that was out of the way). The bathroom vanity was so cluttered with stuff that there was no room for our stuff. The caulk and tile in the bath and shower area was dirty and installed poorly. I recall seeing a previous review that said something like: “think Best Western with wood trim.” I think that pretty much sums up the quality and style of the rooms. Which would be fine, if we weren’t paying $500 a night…… It was nice to have breakfast available in the hotel, and they have an adequate selection. However, the precooked breakfast is of mediocre quality (e.g., dry toast, hard waffles). They have the staff on hand and the facility to cook eggs made to order, which would be a great addition. If the breakfast were fully included, it would be harder to complain. But it goes back to the value issue: since we were paying extra for it, we were expecting a bit more. Oh, and the chocolate chip cookies that everyone’s talking about? We heard about them, we even smelled them, but we never saw one. Apparently, there’s about a 30 minute window in which you might be fortunate enough to get one….

Reviews.Title: “Ups and downs”
Reviews.Author: Umberto B
Reviews.Content: My wife and I booked a family suite with our 7-year and twin, 2-year old girls. Prior to our arrival we requested two cribs for the twins and were promptly assured that two pack-n-play would be waiting for us in our room upon check-in. The cribs weren't there when we arrived, but a visit to the front desk fixed that. The 2-room suite is not terribly large, calling it a "family" suite is a bit of a stretch. The living / dining room has a pullout sofa bed with a comfortable but somewhat complicated air inflatable mattress (electric pump is in the closet), and no direct access to either patio or bathroom, remember that if you like to watch TV late at night while other family members are sleeping next door. The \bedroom has two very comfortable queen beds and a small work desk, but not enough room for the cribs, so we ended up leaving those in the living room and our older daughter slept with us on the second queen bed since the cribs took all the room in front of the sofa bed, no big deal but we were hoping for some extra room in a family suite, honestly. Some nice touches in the room: a power strip with plenty of available outlets for phones and laptops by the desk, an iHome radio on the nightstand, an available refrigerator in addition to the minibar fridge for the babies' milk and stuff, two big, high quality flat screen TVs and DVD players, Tommy Bahamas toiletries, four big pool towels - but make sure you bring them back with you to the room or they will charge you for the missing ones. Not so nice: somewhat dated furniture and carpets, a bathtub with an anemic shower head (in a suite at this price we expected separate shower stall and tub), poor wi-fi coverage. We were on the first floor (suite 105) and could barely get a signal, or none at all, depending of where we sat. I hate that. Service was spotty: Very friendly staff, but we left the room at 10 am the second day and when we came back at 2 pm for our girlls' afternoon nap, the room had not been done yet. We called and scheduled it for 6 pm, housekeeping did come while we were out for dinner but must have been in a rush as they forgot a bunch of cleaning supplies and dirty rags in our bathroom. My wife and daughters had no complaints about the pool, service staff was attentive and friendly everywhere else. We ate breakfast in the room, much easier with little kids... The $20 daily "valet park" fee should be eliminated, though. First of all, the valet attendant is almost never there and it is really way faster to self park, it's a small hotel. Also, 500 bucks for a room and you want and extra $20 to park my car, seriously? Finally, a couple of hours after checking out someone called my cell and left a message saying that housekeeping could "smell some strong smoke odor" in my room and I would be assessed a $250 fee, bye bye. WHAT? We don't smoke and, if we did with 3 small kids in our room, we should probably be in jail, lol! I called them and, after putting me on hold for a while, a manager came back on the phone to tell me the fee would be waived... She never explained why I was assessed the fee to begin with, a mistake perhaps? I don't care either way, but I can't help but thinking that, had I not called right away to complain, that fee would have stuck. Everyone makes mistakes, but before you accuse someone of smoking in a $500/night non-smoking room you better make 100% sure you know what you are talking about. Finally, the location: It's great as long as you concentrate on the ocean in front of you: Unbeatable views, breezes and walks on the beach just steps away, really gorgeous. The area around the hotel, on the other hand, is definitely forgettable. It's fine to hang out during the day but I would not feel safe walking around at night with small kids. We didn't, we took the car to go eat since the hotel has no restaurant. Lots of beach dives, taco stands and fairly seedy pubs, rowdy kids in a party mood (it's the end of summer, maybe that had something to do with it) and the occasional homeless sleeping on a bench, Pacific Beach is not very family friendly in my opinion. There are a few good restaurants on Garnett, but you have to really look for them between the junk. San Diego is better than that, but you'll need to drive a while to figure it out.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous hotel in a great spot”
Reviews.Author: mike c
Reviews.Content: The staff at this hotel really made a difference, and it didn't matter whether it was the front desk attendant, a maid or bellhop. Everyone had a smile on their face and was very willing to help. The rooms and pool/spa were kept clean, the beds were very comfy, and the ceiling fan as a nice touch. Breakfast at the resort was very convenient and well worth it. Parking in the underground garage was extremely convenient considering the parking situation in PB. You really couldn't ask for a better location either, right on the beach! A short walk down the "boardwalk" led to many restaurants and shops. I took my daughters to experience the laid-back Southern California lifestyle and they haven't stopped talking about it. I usually do not return to the same place twice, but I can't wait to schedule a return trip!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location and the rooms are lovely!”
Reviews.Author: Lislcat
Reviews.Content: We spent one night at this hotel and wish we could of had a couple more nights. The location is wonderful and the views are splendid. Right on the ocean, what more could you ask for. The room was nicely decorated in a tropical theme and it was very clean. The staff is the main plus at this hotel. They are all very nice and helpful. At the front desk, we received info on places to eat along the boardwalk and they gave us directions to the Old Town Trolley, so we could tour San Diego. Our only negative, was that at our breakfast there, our daughter's omelet had hair in it, so then of course, she wouldn't eat anything more and we had to find her something to eat elsewhere. Hopefully, that was just a fluke and we do hope to return again.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Vacation, awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: Jason F
Reviews.Content: My new bride and I stayed here for our honey moon and the hotel certainly helped make it a special and memorable occasion. From the ocean front room, the friendly staff, and the comfortable rooms—our stay was amazing and truly helped make our honeymoon special. The location is also great as there are plenty of restaurants and outlet stores within walking distance. The staff went above and beyond to make us feel welcome and appreciated.

Reviews.Title: “Can't wait to return!!”
Reviews.Author: Mjv5
Reviews.Content: We were here for a girls' weekend trip - and LOVED our stay. Friendly staff, unbeatable location, flexible check-out times, absolutely stellar facility. Mellow vibe on site, but lots to do just steps away from the hotel. We can't wait to come back for another weekend!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent staff and loved the room and location”
Reviews.Author: getupandgonow
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took his handicapped brother to San Diego for a 5-day vacation and stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. I was underwhelmed with the hotel lobby, but our rooms/suites with a patio overlooking the beach made up for any misgivings upon our arrival. The accommodations were very nice and offered everything we needed, including plenty of seating, a mini-kitchen area, table and chairs, desk and chair, comfortable beds, and a mini-fridge for leftovers from the wonderful restaurants not far away. When we wanted to relax, we were entertained by a non-stop parade of beach lovers -- riding, and running on the beach path -- yet we never suffered from lack of privacy, or noise. June, we discovered, is very cool on the beach in San Diego, and had we done our homework, we would have visited in July or August. I cannot say enough about the kindness of this staff toward my brother-in-law. He was treated wonderfully, as were we, always with gracious attitudes and warm smiles. I highly recommend this lovely hotel, and I send an earnest "thank you" to every member of this hotel staff.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: jeff-from-hamilton
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel with great amenities and a fantastic location right on the beach. The pictures on the hotel website are very accurate - no photoshop pics here. Our room was great (other than a bit of a leaky shower, which maintenance fixed very quickly). The pool / hot tub was clean and very relaxing - great lounge chairs and covers. The location right on the beach and right along the "boardwalk" were perfect. Certainly not the cheapest hotel in the world, but based on the rest of the prices in SD, the price wasn't horrible. Unfortunately, we were a bit disappointed with the beach in SD but that's not the hotels fault. Overall, very nice.

Reviews.Title: “Highly recommend - Big is not always better”
Reviews.Author: nancyp45
Reviews.Content: This gem of a hotel (73 rooms I believe)in in the Pacific Beach area of San Diego and right on the ocean. We had a partial ocean view room (304) and it was perfect. Bath had sink, toilet and great shower/tub. Outside the room was a separate sink area. Hotel was very well maintained - no sign of any wear and tear. If you are in to biking, hotel offers bikes to ride the beautiful paths along the shoreline All staff very very friendly and attentive from desk managers to room staff and valets. Genuinely seemed to care about the comfort of their clients. Although there was a parking charge, you were free to pick up your own car and have all day in and out privileges. One interesting point I have never seen in an hotel was the air conditioning system. If the patio doors were open, the air conditioning system cut out. When closed, the automatically cut in at the temperature you chose. Very green! If you are here for R and R this is the perfect little gem. If you want to see the sights of San Diego, you will definitely need a car.. There is an adequate breakfast buffet to satisfy all tastes. No other meal service available but many restaurants within walking distance. Side note: on this trip we also stayed at the JW Marriott in Santa Monica and the Disney California Resort Hotel. This one wins hands down. Big is not always better.

Reviews.Title: “Love this place”
Reviews.Author: LobsterBrew
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last November, and really enjoyed our stay. Everything about this place was above average. Great rooms, great location, professional staff, etc. We can't say enough good things about this place. We are planning on coming back again, this November.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous resort at great location on Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: rev5
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace Hotel is definitely worthy of its high ranking. The hotel staff provided us excellent service beginning with the reservation process and continuing throughout our stay. Danielle was extremely helpful in working with me to get the best possible rate for our partial ocean view room. Cameron (bellman/valet) and Joe (guest services) offered several great suggestions for dinner and made us feel welcome each time we returned to the hotel. The hotel itself is very attractive, clean, and well located on Pacific Beach. Our room had a balcony with a great view of the ocean and nearby pier. The room was decorated with Tommy Bahama furnishings which were attractive and functional. The beds were very comfortable and the room and bathroom were extremely clean and spacious. The breakfast buffet was average and our preferred rate enabled us to get it for half price at $5.75 per day, per person. When staying in the Pacific Beach area, you should realize how congested the area is. We walked down the beach for miles and it is just one building after another. The beach is wide and nice (the water is cold). It's easy to find restaurants, clubs, and shopping within walking distance. Walking is the best way to get around because there is no other place to park your car other than the hotel. It costs $20 per day to park and the parking garage was well lit and convenient - definitely worth it, considering the lack of parking in the area. There were a lot of people partying at clubs/condos/restaurants along the boardwalk; so if that offends you, you might want to pick another beach. We saw plenty of families along the boardwalk too. The Pacific Terrace Hotel is on the north end of the boardwalk, so it doesn't get the same foot traffic and noise as its neighbors to the south. The hotel loaned us boogie boards, beach chairs, and beach towels at no charge which was a nice benefit. This location was convenient to our trip to Torrey Pines State Park and La Jolla. Though we didn't go there, Sea World was nearby. For our week-long trip to San Diego we stayed in three different places - a B&B in Coronado, the Pacific Terrace, and a B&B in Hillcrest. Each place offered different scenery and activities. There's so much to do in San Diego and this was a great way to see more of the city. I would highly recommend the Pacific Terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Just a wonderful time”
Reviews.Author: Andree F
Reviews.Content: Let me tell you. If you really want to treat yourself or the family. Stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. Truly the best place on the beach. I was looking for weeks for not just a nice place or a good place that was small and cheap. I was looking for a Best!! This place is it. I wanted a place that I could take my love of 20 years and treat her to wonderful time and spoil her But, not break me. Hey.. I work for a living. Well I found it here. You will meet a great and helpful staff. From the front desk to house keeping. Very warm and friendly people. The room was the best that I had ever stayed in (Presidential Suite). This is the first place that looked just like the pictures you see on the site and not were they did some photo magic and you end up in a cracker box. Worth every penny. You get what you pay for. Not so!!. Here we got more then we could do in a weekend! The view was priceless.. Full view is the way to go. King size bed slept like a baby. All we could hear was the sounds of the pacific with the door open. Beach was right down the stairs Everything is within walking . We put 30 miles on the car that weekend most was to and from the airport the rest... I got lost and we call the hotel and they reel us right in. Good place to eat is Nicks!!! Great food. have the SeaBass. Tip'em good. Nick's is Just pass the Denny's same side of the street and there is a food store also water chips ect. everything. I look foreward to staying there again and bring the family from the east coast to enjoy San Diego. The Pacific Terrace Hotel is the ONLY place we will stay Thank you guys You hit it out of the park. Andree Las Vegas NV and WE KNOW HOTELS

Reviews.Title: “Overpriced in a dump of a town”
Reviews.Author: 5StarVillanearDisney
Reviews.Content: I can't believe the great ratings people are giving this hotel! Yes the staff are friendly but very young. We were asked at breakfast 'do you have a last name?' doesn't everyone? The rooms are ok but certainly not 4 star rated. We visited the Coronado on our way back to the Pacific Terrace & it is a true luxury hotel with rates about $100 less a night. We could have cried. The website really misleads guests - there is no spa as such, it is a door which is locked and you have to call a number. The pool is small and unheated with scruffy dated lounger cushions. The breakfast was lukewarm with no fresh toast or hot tea. The so called room service is from local restaurants not inhouse. We walked to see what they were like, they were jam packed with drunks, music thumping - 8pm. Then there were the vagrants, stinking on the benches we walked past along the beach which was badly lit - also people just staggering about, drugged up, smoking weed. We had our kids with us who were scared so did a quick walk round the block and came back without dinner. The hotel is in an area of small streets leading to the beach, some of the homes have furniture dumped in the gardens and it's generally a run down scruffy area with no fine dining. Fine for spring breakers, not families. Our dinner on our 2nd night was snacks from the CVS - great! Realistically the price per night should be $150. $20 for valet parking is also a joke - we got our own car out every time. It is more like an inn or motel that has been refurbished to look good with selective photography and wording. They should watch out for trading standards.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding. Customer service is clearly their highest priority.”
Reviews.Author: Deeter256
Reviews.Content: Every single person I enteracted with, from the front desk to the maintainance guys to the maids, everyone was absloutly delightful. Everyone said hello to you with a willing and genuine smile. They were there to answer questions when you had them and make arrangments for you. The hotel is beautiful. Excellent location. It was a delight to stay there. A+

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful, wonderful, wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: dddenise51
Reviews.Content: Excellent service, the staff was friendly, pleasant, and helpful. The room was very nice, comfortable beds, good shower, plenty of linens. The carpet was the worst part of the hotel, it was stained and funky looking. Loved the balconey. Location was tops. Breakfast at Kono's almost everyday. Enjoyed the Starbucks coffee in the lobby every morning.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect in every way!”
Reviews.Author: noshame
Reviews.Content: The staff was top notch. Customer service was above and beyond. The location was great. It's just outside of the craziness but close enough to walk to it if/when you feel you need to get a little wild. The rooms were great. They had a boutique feel and not a hotel feel. The pool could have used more lounge chairs. However, you are right on the beach so go get a little sandy. The hotel has complimentary boogie boards and bikes which was huge for us. It's also directly on the boardwalk. Perfect for a jog or bike ride or people watching. It's on the pricey side but would recommend it over all the other properties we saw, including La Jolla. Do yourself a favor and stay here and visit the other wonderful areas of San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: pamr48
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at this hotel, which was the last stop on our 10-day California vacation, in October 2010. We traveled the opposite way most people do, I guess, and started up north in Sacramento and made our way down the coast. Loved the entire trip, but what a beautiful way to end it! The hotel doesn't look like much from the outside, but the staff could not have been more helpful during check in and our room was spectacular! Nice big room, gorgeous HUGE furniture - 2 beds, big closet and sink/vanity area with an enormous bathroom (oddly laid out with a giant empty space where there should have been another vanity and sink) a large shower and toilet. The balcony overlooked the pool and hot tub and the view of the Pacific was perfect! The hotel is right on the path that runs along the cliffs and is close to the Crystal Pier and lots of restaurants and bars. The hotel had a concierge who was very helpful with directions, maps and advice. The free breakfast was OK - nothing fancy. We loved this hotel and would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding Service: Awesome Place”
Reviews.Author: laurlee
Reviews.Content: I just got back from a one night stay. I have NEVER been so impressed by the service and staff at any hotel, ever. (Not even the Hotel Del Coronado in SD, which has NOTHING on this hotel except being famous and overpriced). Everyone was so extremely helpful without being insincere. They seem as if they enjoy their jobs:) (Must have a great management team). We found parking when we arrived, unloaded with help and later valet parked. Andrew (staff) delivered our bags to our room and even unloaded a box of capri suns into the fridge. Over and beyond expectations. We requested bed rails and they were delivered within 5 minutes. We loved the room #218. Beautiful furnishings, crown moulding, widescreen tv, ipod dock, etc. We borrowed their bikes and the staff helped us by attaching my trailer to one of the bikes and when we returned he collapsed it and stowed it in my parked car for me. The spa and pool were heated nicely. The only improvement suggestion would be to have a restroom outside or nearer the pool. It was inconvenient to have to go outside of the pool area with my room key, to go inside near the reception desk to the unisex restroom using my key. We were with toddlers so we frequented the restroom a bit. You also need keys to leave property. The outside shower was nice too, nice and as warm or hot as you like. The "Tommy Bahama" toiletries could have been some no frills brand but I brought my own so no big deal (but I did try them). Overall, I would recommend to anyone. Great place. I am so glad I got to experience it and hope to return one day when my budget allows, since it was $400.00 plus a night.

Reviews.Title: “Listen to the Pacific Ocean whilst lying luxury”
Reviews.Author: spinach_eater
Reviews.Content: Having never been to San Diego before we wanted to experience the Pacific Beach atmosphere but having spent the first part of our travels in basic accommodation we also wanted some luxury. We chose the Pacific Terrace Hotel for both its luxury and its position and it didn't let us down. When we arrived the check-in was handled swiftly and perfectly and after a long drive south to SD it was so pleasant to be able to walk in and check in so quickly. I needed parking and I used the onsite basement parking, You can unload and put your luggage strait in the lift up to your room. We had requested a room overlooking the sea and that is exactly what we got with a balcony and seating to enjoy the view. The reception staff were excellent and extremely helpful we used the beach chairs and umbrellas, which you can borrow from reception, a couple of times and nothing was any trouble. The staff all seem to enjoy what they do and are very helpful. We even had animals created from the towels placed on top of the TV unit or on the bed when the room had been cleaned which really was a nice surprise. It was particularly nice to be able to open the doors of the balcony and hear the waves of the Pacific crashing on the shore while lying in bed. The position of the hotel is perfect, its right on the board walk to Pacific Beach but not in the centre of activity so you are not disturbed in any way as you might be if you were based more directly in the middle of things. Our room was quite small for a family of 4 but we managed fine. The room had a coffee maker and fridge which is great. There was also a 42 inch HD TV which was also great. There are no restaurants in this hotel but having said that, the breakfast is well done and ample. This means that you have to consider that you have go out and find somewhere to eat every time. This is perhaps the only negative, all the restaurants we sampled in the near vicinity are mediocre at best. You have to go at least three blocks back into SD to find somewhere to have a good meal. Granted there are quite a few restaurants along the Pacific Beach boardwalk but they are not great as it seems that they are quite happy with the passing trade they have and seem to cater for the drinking customer more. The best we found was the Green Flash and they got our order wrong but what we had was OK. The pool is nice, clean and gets sun pretty well all day. We had a great few days here and would recommend this establishment but its quite expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful ocean front hotel”
Reviews.Author: Kayenne
Reviews.Content: We stayed for three nights, and our family had an excellent and comfortable stay in a full ocean view room (318, I think). Check in was efficient and extremely friendly; we seemed to be greeted with genuine warmth. We loved the room with its wonderful view (no sunset view from our room as it faced the pier - not an issue for us, but check which room you're getting if that's what you want). The facilities in the room were excellent. The hotel's location is superb. You can easily walk to a number of eateries which was useful as the hotel does not have a restaurant. There are beach chairs for guests to use, and even buckets and spades for the kids. We attempted to go for breakfast once but were put off by the air of chaos in the dining area, so we left and went to Denny's instead (a diner type place). The kids (9 and 7) loved the pool area. If we are lucky enough to return to San Diego this hotel would be high on our list of places to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Relaxing and comfortable with family of 4”
Reviews.Author: fire860
Reviews.Content: I been reading searching which hotel to stay at. It was between Del or pacific. We are so glad we choose the pacific. The first step you wall in their hotel you are treated so kindly from hotel front to bell man to the guy ay the pool. The rooms are beautiful and large enough room for two kiddos. The view is breath taking I would suggest if you already going stay and not sure if you want to pay extra for the view. I would say do it. It's worth it. We stay in pool until 945 at night, our kids where hungry went down stairs to see where we can walk to get them bite to eat they gave us a packet and said these people delivery. This is wonderful hotel we will be back. The night before we stay at their sister hotel The Dana that was a waste pacific terrance all the way

Reviews.Title: “It was the right place for our family”
Reviews.Author: txfamily4
Reviews.Content: We stayed at Pacific Terrace 2 years ago and it was a great memory so we went back this July and stayed 5 nights. We were so thankful that we even got the same exact room we had 2 years ago,,,a King Jr Suite. We are a family of 4 that includes twin 9 year olds. I felt that the room was clean and well maintained. We loved that we had access to beach toys, chairs and an umbrella. The umbrella was a huge benefit to me as we are all extremely fair skinned and burn easily as a result. The room had a breakfast bar area with refrigerator and microwave (plus a mini bar which we never used). There was a sofa sleeper that was a little larger than twin bed size which was great for the kids. The room was a great size and arrangement for us where we could have access to our own snacks and make a lunch or dinner for the times we wanted to save a little money,,,or too tired to go out. The "kitchen" area was stocked with plates, glasses and utensils. It was on the first floor with a patio that opened out to the pool area. It is the only room I've stayed in that had enough trash cans! I thought the hotel was fairly quiet. We are not picky about things like that. My kids are usually the ones making the noise. There was a workout room that I meant to visit but never did and also a computer available. There are even books available to read which was great for me because I forgot to bring one. The hotel is right off the beach. It is exactly what my daughters loved,,,,alternating between the pool and the beach. It was so easy for us with it being on the first floor. Access to the hotel and pool is secure. We always felt safe and it was not over-run with people at the pool or the breakfast buffet. Surf lessons are offered up and down the beach. The boardwalk was great for exercise. We meant to rent bikes but never got around to it. It was a great and lazy vacation,,,,just what we were looking for. We didn't need the big resorts with the fancy pools. My daughters (age 9) were perfectly happy with the pool and beach. We met another family that had been coming there for 25 years and staying in the same room. Everyone we met was really nice. I feel like they kept up the clientele so we were never concerned with the other guests. Everyone was quiet and respectful of privacy. The breakfast buffet was simple but just what we wanted. There was a great breakfast place down the beach a short walk,,,,Konos,,,the portions were huge. Yes, hotel parking is $20 per day,,,as it is for most nice hotels on the beach. There was a lot of kelp on the beach and I did read up on that situation about the kelp washing ashore and that it is best for the environment for it to be left there. It was interesting and I recommend reading up on the subject. It certainly didn't slow us down or impact us one way or the other. The staff was friendly and helpful. We all pledged that we want to repeat it again next year,,,exactly the same as this trip.

Reviews.Title: “Slipping just a tiny bit but still a great place to stay”
Reviews.Author: wallywanna
Reviews.Content: We stayed for our second time at this very nice hotel in July. While we will come back again, I found the staff to be just a bit more rushed and a bit more over worked in all areas, leading to some confusion. The rooms were not quite as spotless as they had been, and a couple of items in the room required maintenance. A little dissapointing given the high summer rates. The views remain priceless, and the opportunity to walk and run the boardwalk and eat at some quaint local restaurants offset this however.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel at a fair price”
Reviews.Author: jdeerhake
Reviews.Content: I stayed here with my girlfriend during mid-June 2011. We stayed in an ocean view room and had a really great time. I saw on their website that you can come early and use the pool, so we did. The guy at the front desk was so nice and helpful that he actually found us a room and let us check in to our room 3 hours early. The room itself was very nice, large, and had a fantastic view of Pacific Beach over the hotel's pool. The pool was nice and the service was great - drinks delivered right to your chair. The hotel's location is also very good, quick access to all of the Pacific Beach restaurants and shops. The only thing I could say wasn't perfect about this place was the price. I think it was fair though, just not cheap or anything. (I found the best rates on the hotel's own website under 'Web specials'). Also parking is $20/night at the hotel - something to factor into your budget.

Reviews.Title: “Friendly staff, very clean”
Reviews.Author: Phillytravels
Reviews.Content: A clean hotel is the number one thing I look for, so I was happy here. Housekeeping did a great job. A few times, we left in the morning and stopped back at the room fairly early, like 12:30, and the room would already have been cleaned. I stayed in a partial ocean view room for 6 nights at $420 a night. I didn't know it came with a kitchenette, so that was a nice surprise. It had a small frig, microwave, coffeemaker, sink, and plates, bowls, and utensils. It came in handy. The balcony overlooked the ocean on the left and directly underneath and to the right was grass and a view of another building. The Pacific Beach area can be noisy at night. I left the patio door open to hear the ocean overnight. Drunken carousers screaming below at like 3 am woke me up the first night. I came to San Diego for comic con, and the hotel was close to everything I wanted to see. I don't think it took longer than 10 minutes to drive to the convention center, the zoo, Sea World, La Jolla, etc. There are also a lot of restaurants you can walk to from the hotel within a few blocks. There's a Trader Joe's a couple blocks away as well, so you can buy drinks, etc. to bring to the zoo or the other attractions that want to charge you an insane amount for a snack or bottle of water. Parking isn't too bad if you don't mind sometimes having to walk a block or two. There is a garage at the hotel that is $20 a night, but we just parked on the street, and it was fine. It's well marked where you can park and can't, mostly only signs for street cleaning (no parking first Wed. of the month sort of thing). The staff was really nice about answering questions about getting around and parking and didn't push us to pay for the garage, which is what I expected. They provide a lot of nice little touches which I appreciated: free iced tea and cookies, 4 beach towels in your room, HBO, everyone on staff makes a point of saying hello. The only thing I can come up with negative is that they were doing construction on the pool area, so I didn't get a chance to use it. But it wasn't a big deal, since the beach is right there. Also it would have been nice if there was another entrace other than the lobby. It was quite a hike to get to my room each time on the other side of the building. Usually they have a back door you can stick your keycard in, but I never saw one. Overall, I'd highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “5 star resort on the beach.”
Reviews.Author: dizeeblnd
Reviews.Content: Excellent service. Staff was wonderful. Beautiful property in the perfect location. Very high class.

Reviews.Title: “definately will stay here again”
Reviews.Author: westcoast25
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel and a fantastic location. All of the employees provided great service. But especially an employee named Cameron. This guy went above and beyond and made me feel like i was staying at my friends house. This employee is trully an asset to your hotel. In addition, the only complaint i have was on the fourth we wanted to park ourselves and they made us valet not to big of a deal.

Reviews.Title: “Great location right on the beach”
Reviews.Author: TOWestonCT
Reviews.Content: The hotel is about as close to the beach as you can get without being directly on the sand. You have to like the active crowds and boardwalk scene to stay here since there is near constant activity surrounding the hotel. We had a family suite that accommodated 5 people pretty well. The buffet breakfast was good and very affordable. The hotel also supplies free drinks and snacks throughout the day. A washer and dryer are on site for laundry. Parking is self parking in a safe, gated garage for just $20 per day. All in all a good experience and would go back.

Reviews.Title: “way too expensive”
Reviews.Author: aarcher888
Reviews.Content: this hotel is ok but way too expensive. you have to pay for parking. The room was huge but the bathroom tiny! paid over $400 for one night....there is not even a jacuzzi in the room....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: ScottgNJ
Reviews.Content: Pacific Terrace is an excellent hotel, highly recommended. The rooms are immaculate, the staff amazingly friendly, and the beachfront location cannot be topped. Breakfast in the Carribean Lounge is well worth the cost and very covenient. Pacific Beach itself is a surfer area with many bars, clubs, and tattoo parlors, and a younger crowd that my family was not comfortable around at night. It was a bit difficult to find family oriented restaurants without driving so plan accordingly. The Firehouse and Tony Roma's were very good however. My 13 year old loved Fatburger, 2 blocks away. The beach is very nice and right in front of the hotel. Our oceanfront room view was just off the front corner of the building, we did have a lot of street view, a bit disappointing, but still a spectacular view. All the major SD attractions are only about 15 minutes away, and this was very convenient. The on site pool is very small and we did not use it. $20/night parking seems unnecessary with the room rates but it is very secure. Overall, highly recommended for families, would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Lived up to expectations”
Reviews.Author: FightOnAAA
Reviews.Content: We read lots of great things about the Pacific Terrace before staying there for two nights the last week of June. The good news is that it lived up to its promise. The staff was more than friendly, the room was very comfortable and the location was ideal. A small reason behind our choosing this hotel was because they rented bikes on the property. We were briefly disappointed when we learned they were out of bikes when we checked at the front desk around noon. However, we were pleased when Rachel at the front desk directed us to a rental company just a couple blocks down the beach where we were able to rent for an even lower price than the hotel offered, thanks to a coupon she gave us. We didn't mind the walk to the rental location since we were already planning a long ride and a little warm-up walk wouldn't hurt. At the bike rental place, we were on our way in under 5 minutes. We also got a recommendation from Paul for a Mexican restaurant in Old Town, plus a coupon for a free appetizer. The food was great! On the downside, just minor points. There were lipstick marks on one of the glasses in our room, but otherwise the room was impeccable. Don't expect much from the excercise room. We checked it out, but decided against it. Choose a long bike ride if you want to get in some exercise. The pool was nice and but most lounge chairs were taken when we chose to visit around happy hour. However, we had a room on the first floor that was just steps from the pool and were happy when they brought our drink order to our patio where we were taking in the view. The pool water was bath water warm. Overall, we'd definitely return. Next time we'll choose an ocean view room (there were none avaiable when we booked) and that will only improve the experience.

Reviews.Title: “excellent location”
Reviews.Author: barbaraPasoRobles_CA
Reviews.Content: tons of things to do for the family, beach is beautiful, pool is nice. recommend.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: mamanana25
Reviews.Content: We've been going to this hotel for at least 6 nears now and plan on staying there for future get-a-ways. Location is great! Right on the boardwalk, beautiful views of the ocean. Excellent pool. Staff is awesome, very clean and breakfast is good, wish they offered more pastries, though, as they did in the past. Hot cooked oatmeal would be really good, too, instead of instant oatmeal. Also, more rooms offered with kitchenettes would be awesome, as we love taking the grandkids there. The master suites are the only rooms with full kitchens and they are really nice rooms, but they are a little too pricey for our budget.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: KLMHOUSE
Reviews.Content: We had an full ocean view jr suite (worth the extra $). Stayed 3 nights. Area is close to many nice restaurants. Didn't care too much for breakfast at the hotel, but my favorite meal is breakfast and Konos is right down the street. Wonderful breakfast. Staff is awesome. Bike, buggie board rentals right at hotel. We are already planning our next trip. Decide no further, book this one, you won't regret it.

Reviews.Title: “best vacation ever!”
Reviews.Author: 31190AmyL
Reviews.Content: the Pacific Terrace is a wonderful place to stay for a san diego vacation. The staff is nothing short of steller. Gerard is the famous one, and deservedly (sp?) so, but let's not over look Paul, the front desk supervisor. Look up customer service in the dictionary and there you will see his picture. Cameron and Andreas on the bell desk are amazing...the rooms are beautiful, the service amazing and the price is right. Love it! Can't wait to see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “felt like a queen”
Reviews.Author: heartsandrocks26
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel we went in the off season every one was wearing coats but we are from a cold climate so it was perfect weather for us. We were given a suite with a view of the ocean for half the price. It was the most wonderful room i have ever stayed in. T.V. in the bathroom with a jacuzzi tub. music system dvd player and big screen T.V. we went to breakfast at this cute little mexican place on the corner by the pier. We also found it a great place to stay close to the pier for fishing. Very wonderful. We would like to stay again some day.

Reviews.Title: “Very friendly staff - Great”
Reviews.Author: alexandrosg
Reviews.Content: Great Art-Deco hotel right on the beach... For those who don't like the pacific tides, there is always the swimming pool where you can splish splash. Its major advantage though compared to other hotels in the area is its extremely friendly staff. Thanks guys for the hospitality!

Reviews.Title: “A tropical escape divulging guests in superior quality, personal attention and the most eloguent guestrooms including grounds an”
Reviews.Author: pinnipeds1
Reviews.Content: i have returned to Pacific Terrace five times in a year. I have never been treated so well, had solice and my needs personally met.

Reviews.Title: “BEST SERVICE WE EVER HAD , A CLASS ACT , SAN DIEGO'S BEST HOTEL”
Reviews.Author: Becerra28
Reviews.Content: This Hotel has the best staff I have ever seen , they make you feel like you're part of their Family , you will love to stay in this place and I bet you won't want to leave !!!!!! We can't hardly wait to go back , congratulations to all the Hotel Staff , you are the best . The location could not be any better , close to everything .

Reviews.Title: “Best get-away vacation!”
Reviews.Author: clinkey
Reviews.Content: We had an anniversary celebration that exceeded them all at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. From the moment we arrived, we were greeted with over-the-top staff - especially Eric, who served our every need, everyday during our stay! Front desk staff helped out when we had a slight mishap with a car service and redirected us to the best dinner on the boardwalk at JRDN's. Every member of the staff is polite, courteous and accomodating to your every wish. We will be back - soon!!!

Reviews.Title: “Our 14th Year!”
Reviews.Author: mysterywriterdiva
Reviews.Content: This hotel has stood on their heads to make us happy during all of our 14 stays. We had 45 family members last week at our family reunion and there is only one word to describe our stay--Paradise! The wait staff, concierge, manager and everyone in between always did their best to accommodate our every need and we felt very much at home and pampered. Drinks and room service from outstanding nearby restaurants, chocolate chip cookies and fruit in the afternoon, complimentary glass of wine in your room one afternoon, Starbucks coffee, lemonade and ice water throughout the day, walk to restaurants and shops and lots to do in San Diego during the day. The pool is heated and the sunsets spectacular. We loved everything about this hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Quite possibly the best service I have ever received!”
Reviews.Author: jayham22
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stopped over in San Diego for only one night and were basically looking for a place to crash after a long trip along the coast, we got so much more than that. Beautiful, huge room (they upgraded us without us asking) great view of the ocean, nice pool and jacuzzi with poolside service, free wifi and a good location right on the beach. ALL of the staff were amazing and more than willing to help with all of our requests. If I am ever in this area again there is no doubt I will stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great Place”
Reviews.Author: anthempc
Reviews.Content: Location was great, as advertised. The rooms were very comfortable with a wonderful ocean view. Nice flat screen television ( not that it was needed ). The breakfast buffet was a great value !!! Much better quality than you would receive at a continental breakfast. Staff was very friendly without being overwhelming. Beach front was best in area. Will definitely return !!

Reviews.Title: “Super Duper Staff”
Reviews.Author: Namano
Reviews.Content: I had a business trip that my family tagged along for so I wanted to be sure they had a good home base/place to stay. Read the reviews on Tripadvisor and decided to take a chance on the Pacific Terrace Hotel. When we rolled into town late on our arrival night, I was a little apprehensive of the location/area. BUT, the rooms and service and staff at this hotel are nothing short of fantastic. Beds were super comfy, the guest services team consistently went above and beyond to make sure that our stay at the hotel was great. But what was really impressive was their help and concern about our experiences outside of the hotel. We asked for a restaurant recommendation and said we were going to walk down the beach. At the last minute we changed our mind and my husband went to get the car. The staff behind the counter saw us getting in our car and practically hurdled the counter to be sure to give us a pass for free valet parking at the restaurant. Another time they helped us to find a tagalong bike for my youngest son. We were pleasantly greeted by housecleaning and other staff even walking in from the garage - one even waited for us to get our bikes so he could hold the gate open for us. We also witnessed the hotel staff pleasantly talking to each other and helping each other out! Really a great pleasant place to be and what a wonderful example you set for our children. Thanks Pacific Terrace for going above and beyond and just being so darn nice! The Z Family

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel and location”
Reviews.Author: trvl2learn
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace at the recommendation of our travel agent for the San Diego portion of our vacation. She picked a great location for us. The hotel was a few steps from the beach and a great walking path. The kids had a great time swimming in the pool which has a nice view of the ocean. The hot tub seemed very popular in the evenings as well. It was relatively convenient to get to the I-5 to be able to drive to area attractions. We had a "partial ocean view" room which ended up being on the first floor looking out towards the pool-we could sorta see the ocean--but from my perspective I wouldn't consider it to have been a true "partial ocean view." That being said..I would say to spend a few extra dollars to get a ocean view room on the 2nd or 3rd floors--that way you won't be disappointed. The room was nicely furnished, spacious, and clean. Our wireless internet was inconsistent--sometimes we could connect and stay connected without issue and other times we would lose the connection sporadically. We were not aware of the fees to park our car at the hotel prior to arriving-so that was a big surprise to us. $20 per day to park in the parking area under the hotel seemed a bit high to me--so be sure to plan on budgeting that into your travel costs. Also, when we booked our room the hotel was doing continental breakfast with the room--they stopped doing that just before we arrived. They are now charging a separate charge for a breakfast buffet ($11.50 for adults and $6 for children). We tried it one morning- there was cereal, muffins, yogurts, oatmeal, eggs, bacon, sausage, juice, milk, and coffee. It was nice to sit by the pool hearing the ocean, but for the price we felt you could do better by going a short drive to the IHOP.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect spot in Sand Diego”
Reviews.Author: HitTheRoaders
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a family suite with lots of room and a great little patio. Staff was friendly and helpful. The hotel gives you great views of the beach while allowing security and privacy. A few steps away, your toes will be in the sand or you can cool off in the pool. Perfect for kids and adults.

Reviews.Title: “We absolutely loved our stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel.”
Reviews.Author: hello61
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 days at the Pacific Beach hotel and we enjoyed our stay so much. The hotel is located right on the ocean with a fantastic view. Our accomodations were sooo nice. The employees were wonderful. Ted Tillman, guest services supervisor, was so helpful to us when we booked our stay. Very nice and very professional. The impression we had was that if there was anything we needed from housekeeping to the front desk, etc., all we had to do was ask. Honestly, this was one of the very nicest hotels we've stayed in. There was lots to do nearby, walking on the beach, great restaurants, relaxing by the pool and spa, our trip was so very nice. Because of the beautiful setting and the top notch quality of the hotel, you kind of feel like you're in paradise. We will definitely be back. Doug and Stephanie Mansfield

Reviews.Title: “Breath taking location!”
Reviews.Author: Lillieben
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel in September for 4 nights. The staff was very friendly and helpful. The room was clean, beautiful view of the ocean and conformable beds. The location is also great, good restaurants, shopping areas, and at walking distance. I will definitely be staying here when I return.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic experience, would easily go again!”
Reviews.Author: TuckerQ
Reviews.Content: I have written long reviews of hotels on this and other sites but the Pacific Terrace appears to have numerous reviews already so I'll keep this short. I just want to validate what everyone says. My experience was nearly perfect. My room was immaculate and well appointed. The staff was delightful. The maid service was excellent. The ocean view room had just that - a beautiful ocean view. Being right on the boardwalk made it very convenient to beach restaurants of many types. I said nearly perfect because if I had to pick out a negative, I can only think of one. They charge $20/night for parking. It's underground, secure and very convenient. Given the excellence of the hotel, it didn't end up bothering me much. I would stay here again without thinking twice.

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous”
Reviews.Author: studenttraveller42
Reviews.Content: Gorgeous hotel. Great service, worth every penny. Free lemonade, iced tea, water, cookies, fruit... Right on the beach! They had turn down service at night, so free chocolates too! We had a 'partial oceanview' which included a little parking lot... but a surprisingly great view of the ocean all the same! The water there had big waves, but the beach was great. The only downside is that you are pretty secluded, not a ton to do aside from the pool/beach in the area (but there is happy hour at the pool everyday!). The pier nearby is just a hotel, and a lot of shops in the surrounding area are closed. But overall a great stay & I would make a point of staying there next time!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pacific Terrace!”
Reviews.Author: JJK97
Reviews.Content: This was my first time at the Pacific Terrace, and I will definitely be back The staff was absolutely fantastic and the location was terrific. The room was clean, very nice and the beds were comfortable. I was in a partial ocean view room and the view was amazing! There are great restaurants and shops within blocks. Highly recommend!.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel--fabulous staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Gingerville
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel based on the recommendation of friends and was not disappointed. The location is terrific, providing gorgeous ocean views and close access to the beach (note, the hotel sits above the beach, so you must use the nearby wooden staircase to get there). The room decor is plush with a tropical flair--comfortable beds, wooden louvered rolling shutters, and premium dark wood furniture. We enjoyed the huge flat screen TV and DVD player. The bath area included a large marble-topped counter and sink with large mirror, separate from the toilet and tub. The countertop housed a small fridge and also a mini-bar. Everything was sparkling clean. The balcony was oversized and included 4 wrought iron chairs and table. Our particular room faced a more southern direction, but the balcony was semi-circular in shape which allowed for a broad view. We did partially overlook the side street and a few buildings, but still had full ocean views, including some spectacular sunsets. (There are also ocean front rooms that overlook the pool area.) The pool was small, but more than adequate; the lounge chairs were comfortable and I really enjoyed being able to see the ocean waves while lounging by the pool. The hotel does not have a restaurant on-site, but there are many places to eat within walking distance. They also have a unique system with a couple of the local restaurants where you can actually charge your meal to your hotel room. There is also the option to have room service provided by nearby restaurants. There do serve breakfast, at an additional cost ($9). We enjoyed it--choice of ham and cheese omelets with breakfast potatoes, bacon or sausage and toast or waffle and bacon or sausage. Plus coffee, juice, milk, and hot chocolate. I can't say enough about the staff. Everyone at the front desk was extremely helpful and accommodating. Check-in and check-out was smooth and efficient. I was welcomed back every time I returned through the lobby. Every single staff member I encountered greeted me. I also noted that members of the staff were constantly cleaning and polishing the public areas. All in all, really top-notch. The room rates are in line with first class status, but I really felt like they went out of their way to earn it. While this is a smaller property, they provide personal touches, accommodations, and service that is equal to or better than the larger resorts. I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “The sun is always shining at Pacific Terrace Hotel........”
Reviews.Author: WezT
Reviews.Content: From the moment you step into the place it feels like home. Gerrard the main man in charge on the front desk offered us a service the likes of which we hadn't seen during our Californian trip. PTH is warm and charming and the rooms are decorated in a way that wouldn't be out of place in a more expenisve hotel. We didn't eat there but were offered advice on where to go, which turned out to be spot on. It's 10 foot from the beach and you get to see a beautiful sunset as well. This was paradise and as Gerrard said when he answered the phone "the sun is always shining at pacific terrace hotel....." This is the way it should be. No wonder they've scored so highly. Another trip advisor gem.

Reviews.Title: “Right up my Alley”
Reviews.Author: Utravelwithme
Reviews.Content: Close to the beach if you wanted - but for me was not too far from my business meeting and restaurants close by - everything was in its place - quiet and peaceful after a hard days work - this will be my resting stop each trip to the area.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent location, free cookies mmmm”
Reviews.Author: Australianberry
Reviews.Content: Not the cheapest but Right on the beach. Room ready upon arrival. Room had two queen beds with gorgeous wooden bed frames and furniture but tad squishy due to size of furniture. Shutters on windows didnt block all the light and light on outside of balcony did not turn off. The rooms as others mentioned were a bit stuffy- The fan was quite noisy but couldnt leave the aircon on it was really noisy and didnt work all that well. Bathroom adequate, could use a bit of bleach and lock on bathroom door didnt work. tiny safe, good sized tv, free bikes and dvds for the kids, pool nice fabulous pool service. Hotel quiet not much noise from other rooms although every panel in roof of your room does lift which concerned us re our items being secure Clock in room had mind of its own kept going off all night even after we pulled the plug we could laugh about it in end but....Free warm choc chip cookies in entrance and fruit basket, staff friendly and helpful.

Reviews.Title: “Not a review - but a recomendation”
Reviews.Author: bollidear
Reviews.Content: We were booked into the Diamond Head Inn across the road, but left after seeing the badly stained carpets and general filth in the rooms. On the off chance we called in to see if the Pacific had any rooms. Only one was available and Gerard did his best to screw down the price a long way to a point that we could afford. But alas, it was still out of our reach for a 6 day stay. But after offering us some snacks and a drink (all free), Gerard then phoned around and got u an excellent rate at the Dana Missionary Bay. Now compare this with the Diamond Head who offered no explanation or apology for their disgusting accommodation and no help with finding anywhere else. Once again a very special thank you to Gerrard McNearney for the time, patience and help he offered us, even in view of the fact that we were unable to afford the lovely room he had reduced for us.

Reviews.Title: “Wow”
Reviews.Author: bh_liberty
Reviews.Content: An exceptional hotel with great views. My only complaint is that there is not a bar in the hotel. I guess I got by on the mini bar in the room. I would definitely stay here again but I promise you I'll have my own bottle next time

Reviews.Title: “Absolutley fabulous”
Reviews.Author: GavMom
Reviews.Content: Sun, sleep, sand/surf -- you never have to leave the hotel room. right on the edge of the beach, running biking trail with free beachcruisers, breakfast in bed -- altogether unbelievable. very nice staff and great service. could not have had a better time!

Reviews.Title: “Great Ocean Front Hotel”
Reviews.Author: europhilestl
Reviews.Content: My family and I just stayed at the Pacific Terrace Inn in early May. We rented a family suite for just under $400 per night. We had 3 adults and 2 children (11 and 7) . We were in the Dominica Suite. The room was nicely furnished and had a refrigerator, microwave, table and chairs, and small enclosed patio facing the beach. The room was very clean and the staff is very pleasant and helpful. It's located right on the boardwalk and has a nice pool terrace with deck chairs and cabanas. We enjoyed our stay, just wish the weather would have been nicer.

Reviews.Title: “First rate experience - the best service we've ever had”
Reviews.Author: HKF84
Reviews.Content: When traveling, we've learning that boutique hotels tend to offer more personlized service. We had the option of staying downtown San Diego, but we wanted to find someplace away from the hustle and bustle. Pacific Beach is an area full of character, and very laid back. We found the Pacific Terrace Hotel through TripAdvisor. This is our 2nd stay at the hotel. When we arrived, we weren't placed in the room we thought we had reserved. It was simply a difference in what we remembered when talking to the reservation agent vs. what the reservation agent had noted. Our understanding was contrary to what their room classes were. They could have easily argued their point (which technically was correct). After talking with the staff, and out of sheer goodwill and interest in pleasing us, the shifted some rooms around and were able to put us in the room we had expected. The next day we received a personally written (not a form letter) note apologizing for the mix-up and wanting to ensure we were satisfied. We needed to stay in our existing room for a couple of nights until the current guess departed our room. The thought of moving rooms wasn't appealing to us because we'd have to pack our stuff and move it. They sent us another note on the day we were to transfer rooms indicating it would be done between 11am and 1pm, and we didn't need to be present - they'd send a guest services agent to move all of our luggage. They told us to hang our clothes (which we would have done anyway) and they'd move them directly from the old closet to the new one. We basically threw our toiletries in our suitcases. All the moving was done by the guest services agent. Let me reiterate - they way their room classes were set up, they didn't need to let us transfer rooms, but they did it anyway. They also discounted the rate for a few nights, gave us a free bottle of wine and free garage parking. The staff is unbelievably friendly. We've traveled extensively for business and pleasure and have never had such wonderful service. The amenities in the room were fabulous. The bed was so comfortable, the provided a DVD player, beach towels ... everything I could think of. My wife had a sinus headache one evening and someone at the front desk offered to go to the drugstore and purchase medicine. The hotel is right on the boardwalk, which is perfect for walks or using the free bikes provided by the hotel. We're looking forward to our next visit to San Diego and staying at the Pacific Terrace Hotel.

Reviews.Title: “great location, room & public areas extremely clean & service oriented staff”
Reviews.Author: k215
Reviews.Content: ocean view room with roomy balcony staff very helpful and always greeted you and asked if there was anything you needed steps from boardwalk & beach (easier access short walk from hotel down boardwalk) convienant to cvs & ralphs plus many dining options easy walk to free shuttel for trolley tours must try konos for brkf/lunch-huge portions & low cost first time visitors and would stay again

Reviews.Title: “Wow, ugh.”
Reviews.Author: sunshine467897
Reviews.Content: Positive: Location, rooms, decor, service. Negative: No breakfast variety, parking fee, no designated outdoor smoking area.

Reviews.Title: “Incredibly friendly staff from hotel manager to groundskeepers made us feel welcome and well treated.”
Reviews.Author: Ken70Plus
Reviews.Content: From our initial greeting by the valet when we arrived from Colorado in our personal vehicle to an unanticipated opportunity to meet the hotel manager (strictly by chance) during breakfast on our final morning, we felt truly appreciated as guests of this recently refurbished facility. The first glimpse of our room and the view overlooking the pool and the ocean definitely brought forth a positive "WOW" from both my wife and me. Without exception, every member of the staff, including housekeeping, groundskeepers, and front desk folks, consistently gave eye contact and friendly greetings (far more sincere sounding than the typical retail sales clerk's "Have a nice day" type comments.) An earlier review we had seen online regarding this facility mentioned the friendliness of the staff, and that was the deciding factor in our staying there over a couple of other places we had considered. We were not disappointed. While I do not know how many more such trips we will be making, this hotel has set a high standard against which to make comparisons.

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: lovetotravelma
Reviews.Content: We just stayed at Pacific Terrace and had a wonderful time. You cannot beat the location, right on Pacific Beach with the pool overlooking the ocean - the views are amazing! There is wait service at the pool, you can get drinks and snacks. Water, iced tea and lemonaid is provided for free. There is even free coffee in the morning (the breakfast is $9). The staff was very friendly and helpful - I truly felt pampered. There was maid service in the morning and turndown in the evening (they replaced towels and refreshed my room every evening). I have stayed in a lot of hotels in San Diego and Pacific Terrace is by far the BEST! The room rate was reasonable and I never felt that they were trying to get more money from me. They do charge for parking but there is some on street parking. Go to Kronos for breakfast - at Crystal Pier, great breakfast burritos (they are huge)

Reviews.Title: “Magnificent Views”
Reviews.Author: slucky5
Reviews.Content: This hotel was fabulous! We ran across the hotel by accident as we were lost at 3:00am from driving in from Phoenix. The customer service was superb and the front desk manager was nothing more than accommodating.
