They actually upgraded us to a different room since the room we were originally booked in was taken the second night of our stay. We had a lovely time staying at the hotel. We will definitely be back. Ocean and pool views, and steps away from the beach...what else can you ask for.

Reviews.Title: “Won't be staying here again.”
Reviews.Author: RosieMadison
Reviews.Content: We chose this hotel for a family vacation largely as a result of favorable Trip Advisor reviews, but won't be returning. It seemed promising at first. The room was ample but I question the "newly redecorated" part. Everything felt (and looked) very late-90s to me. The staff were friendly and responsive, but we had a bunch of minor problems that sort of added up. Our thermostat didn't work, the pbs station on the tv didn't work (and that's all our kids watch!), the dvd player didn't work, and our room was missing a trash can. Very responsive fixes to most of these problems but the pbs never got fixed---we were told it was a LodgeNet issue). The location is a little odd....there appeared to be a mobile soup kitchen a couple of evenings right outside our window which drew a colorful crowd. I never felt my safety was threatened, but it was not exactly a neighborhood feel. Skip the breakfast...many local places were very good but the whole "Carribean Room/pool" scene was pretty unpleasant. The pool is very small, not particularly clean, and not somewhere we felt comfortable lingering. The worst part of our experience was the cigarette smoke. We did have a non-smoking room, but even with the patio door shut, smoke from the neighbors must have been seeping through the walls. Our poor little asthmatic three-year-old ended up on oral sterroids she flared so badly (handy CVS pharmacy a few blocks away). If we hadn't brought a portable nebulizer with us "just in case," we likely would have ended up in the ER. Most good hotels are entirely non-smoking these days, and I no longer even think to ask about cigarette smoke. Big mistake! I would not give this hotel four stars. Maybe three without all the other issues. At best, 2 1/2. The bill for six nights, with parking and only 1 breakfast, was $2,800. I think we would have been much happier at a Westin or similar business-class hotel. The beach location doesn't add THAT much. We still had a nice vacation, but it was more in spite of the hotel than because of it.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay again”
Reviews.Author: 37209Sandy
Reviews.Content: Nice rooms, great location right on then beach, and walking distance to lots of good restaurants, easy parking, and very friendly and helpful staff. Definitely on the "stay there again" list.

Reviews.Title: “Great amenities, excellent location!”
Reviews.Author: onaroll91360
Reviews.Content: We reserved an oceanfront room for our 30th anniversary. When we arrived there was a celebratory bottle of wine from the management. The room was amazing, with all the comforts of home and a panoramic view. There was 2 for 1 drinks in the evening and a 2 for 1 full breakfast in the morning. We parked the car and didn't need to drive for the whole weekend. There are plenty of great restaurants, bars and shops around. Raplhs grocery store is just a couple of blocks away. The staff were all personable, friendly and helpful.The pool, jacuzzi area is very nice. We rode bikes along the 3.5 mile boardwalk, walked the beach and had a great time. Room 221 is one of the best, thank you for a great setting!

Reviews.Title: “Great staff and location!”
Reviews.Author: 11thchild
Reviews.Content: We stayed for 5 nights. The free bike usage, the half price breakfasts, the promptness of staff and service and the location as well as a nice, large room, including large private patio made it worth it's price. Pool and hot tub are nice! They have pool service for drinks, etc but also have free ice tea, lemonade. Free warm cookies in the evening, turn down service in the evening with chocolates on pillow. Nice robes. All the little touches added up to a very nice stay. We rode bikes everyday, keeping the bikes all day one day. Very prompt valet with both the car and the bikes! Our room was very quiet as I requested and even though they said we had a non- view room, we actually had a peek of the ocean! We didn't have to look at a parking lot or wall!

Reviews.Title: “Best Partner/Family Retreat Yet”
Reviews.Author: jcrew7
Reviews.Content: Our partnership/group has been traveling with our families for almost 10 years. We have stayed up and down the coast of southern CA and by far Pacific Terrace offered us such amazing comfort and service as well as beautiful views and convience to the beach. I believe two best features of this hotel, ok, maybe three, are the location which is at the end of Pacific Beach where it is quiet but still withing walking distance to many restaurants. Second, it is a smaller boutique hotel so we saw much more of each other than we had at some of the larger hotels we had stayed at. This was a plus for our group. Finally, Pacific Terrace has a staff that is amazing! Julie G. handled our group reservation and everything was exactly as promised and exceeded our expectations. They have a wonderful breakfast that is very kid friendly, a great fitness facility although you can't beat the views running or biking the boardwalk and they even gave our group the reins to their meeting room where we played games, watched movies and had hot cocoa and cookies each night. Keep in mind that although the price is higher than chain hotels, most families who would normally need two rooms elswhere can comfortably fit in their family or executive suites. This hotel is so charming that my husband sent me and a few girlfriends there for a surprise 40th. They all loved it too and many of the partners have returned with their families since our visit last summer. You will love it!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Hotel Right on the Ocean”
Reviews.Author: Lovetotravel099
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 6 night stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel in Pacific Beach, North of San Diego. We loved the hotel and the best part (in addition to the very spacious, beautifully decorated and comfortable rooms) was the customer service. Although some of the facilities were less than we expected (e.g., very small fitness room in the garage) and small pool, it was a wonderful stay and we look forward to returning. When we inquired about being transferred to another room because we were woken up our first two days by noisy neighbors, the staff could not have been more accomodating. Kyla was amazing and offered to move us to another room while we spent our day at Legoland. All they asked was that we pack our stuff, not to include items in the closet and refrigerator. They upgraded us to a junior suite for the inconvenience. When we returned from Legoland, all of our stuff had been moved to the new room. We really appreciated their thoughtfulness. This was by far the best service we've received at a hotel and we travel quite a bit. The location is fabulous. Although not a budget hotel, it is well worth the expense.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent hotel”
Reviews.Author: eihsan
Reviews.Content: I love it! Great location, service, quality excede my expectations. Breakfast service also excellent

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay in PB”
Reviews.Author: Stargazn
Reviews.Content: My husband and I have been back to Pacific Terrace twice. We wouldn't stay anywhere else...steps from the boardwalk, rooms are great because you have a frig, some kitchen stuff, furnishings are upscale but still with a beachy feel and the accommodations are quite roomy...plus, you can't beat the balconies and the view of PB/MB/OB to the South and Old Man's to the north. The staff is so receptive and helpful. A very restful experience!!"

Reviews.Title: “Could be more constant in services”
Reviews.Author: Sponi
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there in March 2011 for 14 days. The view from the "ocean view rooms" was great and the rooms for nice and comfortable. The airconditioning / heating system was loud and noisy! Generally the services were good but they varied on a daily basis. Sometimes the rroms were done quickly other days in the afternoon when we came back the had not been done. In the evening after dinner sometimes both bed were prepared on other days only one and on yet others they forgot the room! Wake up calls were forgotten. The view is woth the stay. For breakfast the better places then this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else in SD”
Reviews.Author: PepperMD
Reviews.Content: This place defines excellent service! I have honestly never stayed at a hotel with more accommodating staff. Everyone was very pleasant and asked what more could be done to improve my stay. Heated pool and hot tub were clean. Great location on beach. Breakfast was tasty but a little expensive.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: HammerDE
Reviews.Content: My wife and I were fortunate to have booked our hotel stay in San Diego at the Pacific Terrace Hotel in Pacific Beach from Feb 25 through March 2. This was our first time in San Diego and we happened to arrive at the same time the area was in the middle of an atypical cold snap. We originally reserved and were placed in a partial ocean view junior suite on the top (3rd) floor. This view was great for both looking out with a direct view of the boardwalk to the south and the ocean at just a slight right angle. We also faced the pier which extends hundreds of feet over the ocean and was lighted at night. The room was spacious and well appointed and includes a small kitchenette area, sitting area with couch and a small desk area for laptop use. Free Wi-Fi and parking was included in our package. The stocked kitchenette is convenient for those that may want to purchase food and prepare some meals to reduce restaurant dining expenses should you desire to do so. It’s a nice option but we did not take advantage of that aspect.. Visit Kono's a few blocks walk south on the boardwalk for a big breakfast at reasonable prices. Do take advantage of the very knowledgeable and helpful staff of the hotel. Both Angela the concierge, and Kyla at the front desk are fantastic to work with and exceptional at their jobs. Upon arrival we spent a fair amount of time with Angela getting assistance and recommendations for the “must-do things” in the area that she would recommend as a person with provincial knowledge. Angela took time with us to provide us helpful information, directions, restaurant recommendations and even ways to save money by acquiring discounted event/tour coupons available at that time of our stay. During the remainder of our stay whenever we saw each other we would casually chat about what we have done and are planning to do next, as easily as if talking with a friend. The next point I cover is not a complaint. It's an example of how the hotel staff works to please their customers. Although the assigned room was almost perfect in every way, there was a slight issue with our shower. No matter how we positioned the shower head, water still leaked out onto the floor. The swinging glass doors have a slight open space where they meet the side walls, and the joint where the glass doors are suppose to seal must not be tight enough. This was not so much of an issue other than it required us to use the towels to sop up the spillage which took more than just one towel to absorb. I was more concerned about long term damage to bathroom floor and to the ceiling of the room directly below us than any minor inconvenience to us. After our second morning when we were leaving to sightsee for the day, I reported my concerns about the shower to Kyla at the front desk. She said she would send someone right up to look at it. Out of curiosity, I inquired if there were any full ocean view rooms available for upgrade. Kyla checked for availability and found a corner room with a full ocean view that was displaying as available for the next 2 out of our remaining 3 nights and she offered it to us at a VERY reasonable upgrade fee. She could then move us our final night to another full ocean view junior suite room free of any additional charge. All we had to do was throw our clothes back into our suitcases and the staff would move them while we were out for the day. Anything hung in the closets could stay there and the staff would take care of moving them. During the 15 minutes it took for us to go back to pack our bags and return to the front desk with the old room keys, Kyla informed us of some good news. She was able to move some things around in the system so we could stay in the corner room for the duration of our stay. Not only were we excited to hear this news but Kyla looked genuinely excited for us that she was able to work this out while we had packed. She really went above and beyond anything we had expected and I can’t stress enough how she sincerely took pleasure in making us happy. The room was a great bargain in my eyes. This corner room turned out to be one of the large honeymoon suites with two separate balconies overlooking both pool and ocean, two separate rooms dividing the living room, kitchen, dining room area from the bedroom, bathroom area (with larger sink area and separate large Jacuzzi). We awoke each day looking directly from our bed straight out to the ocean, with the waves lapping onto the shore and no more water lapping onto the bathroom floor after showering. The hotel has a nice pool area but as mentioned the weather was a little cool and windy. You need your room key to gain entrance though the gated areas. This is probably due to keep small children and non-guests from access. The pool was heated and the children had no problems jumping right in. There is also a large separate hot tub to one side of the pool with temperatures high enough to ward off any cold weather. We found this hotel’s location ideal for our plans which included spending our time at different places in the surrounding area. During our stay we visited the typical spots such as Old Town, Coronado Island, Balboa Park, Gaslamp quarters, Seaport Village, etc., via the Old Town trolley tours (highly recommended for first time visitors). We drove the rental car back to some of the same to spend time in the evening hours. We also briefly visited La Jolla, Laguna Beach, Balboa Island and Newport Beach. The hotel’s location was perfect for both these North and South directional excursions. All the staff at the Pacific Terrace hotel should be commended for their customer service and friendliness from the bellboys, valet parking, maid service, front desk and concierge. Each person always had a ready smile and courteous greeting during the length of our stay. We would highly recommend this hotel to be one of the top on your list for consideration if you are staying in the area. Thank you Pacific Terrace for a memorable stay.

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous getaway with my daughter”
Reviews.Author: annemconnor
Reviews.Content: Winters are long and cold in Wisconsin, so when my daughter needed a mid-winter getaway, we Googled "Sunniest places in the US" and up popped San Diego. We booked our stay at the Pacific Terrace .... a bit of a gamble since we hadn't stayed on Pacific Beach in the past. Arriving late, we received a gracious welcome and were led to the most fabulous room. My pre-teen daughter stood at the doorway for a moment just to get her bearings. We were only in town for a few days and wanted to maximize our time in the sun, but after a day and a half of sightseeing, she said, "Mom, I'd really just like to stay near the hotel!" We had everything we needed ... a warm, clean pool, easy access to the beach, and shops on the boardwalk of Pacific Beach. Who could ask for more? It was a five-star weekend.

Reviews.Title: “Best place to stay San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Meg7335
Reviews.Content: Don't let the word Hotel fool you, this resort was the nicest all around, I have ever stayed in. I never walked past a staff member without them saying "Hi how are you today"? Most even remembered your name. They had pool side service, you could order drinks or food. They also provided excellent advise of local attractions and activities. I have never had staff at any resort i have stayed at be so accomidating and nice. I can't wait to go back next year!

Reviews.Title: “Great Weekend Getaway”
Reviews.Author: 91NSX
Reviews.Content: My wife I have stayed here quite a few times. We generally stay during the off season as we live relatively close by and the room rates are more favorable. The staff is very friendly. The local restaurants are great and within walking distance. We really like the Green Flash for dinner ( on the outside patio) but there are many other options. There are other hotels overlooking Pacific Beach, but this one is the most upscale in our opinion. We book the full ocean view room as we enjoy sitting on the balcony with a glass of wine watching and listening to the ocean waves. If you like to leave the balcony access door open (to hear the waves at night) be advised that at 7:00 AM the pool area is open and it becomes a bit noisy. This is a family friendly hotel and there are kids along with the noise they create. So we remember when we brought our kids (now in college) to Pacific Terrace and how excited they were and how much noise they made. A little patience goes a long ways. In conclusion, if you want a great ocean view, a nicely furnished room, many restaurant choices nearby this is a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel , awesome location resort like atmosphere friendly staff!”
Reviews.Author: ilovepacific
Reviews.Content: Once we got to pacific beach we were expecting average cheap hotels once we checked this one out there was no denying it, beautiful location gorgeous hotel and the staff was so friendly .. couldn't have asked for a better hotel in pacific beach, was within walking distance of the popular night life spots and even dinner and lunch places .. the rooms were so clean great patio and the bathrooms were unreal ! The pool and jot tub area was wonderful too , right over looking the pacific ocean and beach. Could not have stayed in a better hotel. Would absolutely recommend it to anyone , families ,couples, friends.

Reviews.Title: “Top notch service, value and property”
Reviews.Author: MsteachNYC
Reviews.Content: Super well-kept property, probably the best in Pacific Beach area of San Diego. Walking distance to everything even super market and starbucks. Located right on the beach with a beautiful pool/lounge area that is serene, clean and very well maintained. I was very impressed with the maintenance of this property and watched the maintenance man clean the pool religiously every morning. Even though I was traveling with my mother, we quickly realized that this hotel caters to families, offering children's DVDs to watch at night in the room, and having a heated pool, so regardless of the weather the children could swim. It was quiet enough though for us to be very relaxed even with kids around. The staff was super cheerful and professional and went out of their way to accommodate us as much as possible, even when my mom wanted to purchase 15 sunblock and the gift shop didn't have it, I think a staff member ran out to the store to buy it for us! I wish breakfast was included in the room cost, but at least complimentary coffee and tea was available to all guests in the breakfast restaurant. I have no complaints other than the fact that the room keys were very hard to get to work. Especially on the outside doors heading out to the board walk. The key card locks would not read my cards and I ended up getting around 5 replaced during my 4 day stay, but the staff is more than willing to issue fresh ones as needed. I highly recommend this place.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location! Incredible Views from our room!”
Reviews.Author: jackiebabol
Reviews.Content: I was deliberating between getting a private condo or staying in this hotel by the ocean. I'm glad we chose to stay in this hotel. staying in the hotel is an activity in itself, It was nice to hang around just by our porch and watch the surfers right in front of our room! Thank you for making our trip incredible! The staff was friendly and efficient. Surprisingly nice to see as many men cleaning the rooms as well as women (I like that!) I'm the little girl scout that brought all her comfort food with her and was surprised to find out we do have a refrigerator but no microwave for my teas and soups. They promptly delivered one when I asked the chambermaid (but not the front desk). THe chambermaid crew was more helpful than the front desk in several good ways for us. Kudos to them! More power to you all!

Reviews.Title: “Odd Combination of spectacular views and homeless neighbors”
Reviews.Author: MaineCascoBay
Reviews.Content: Just finished five night stay in the Master Suite. The hotel is very nice and the facilities provide spectacular views, good service, with rooms that are large and clean if not a bit dated. The location is very convenient for all of San Diego.. I must say, though, that the surrounding area, surprisingly, seems a bit "downmarket". Our view looked out,. partially, on a public washroom that was refuge (in bad weather) for at least four unfortunate, homeless individuals. In good weather, they spent nights on the wooden walkway to the beach. While I sympathize with their plight - it set up a strange combination of resort versus homeless neighbors. Just what were we trying to accomplish - relaxation? or dealing with reality? In looking back on Trip Advisor comments (on return home), I noted that this situation was pointed out a couple of times back in 2009 - so its been going on for a while. So, it seems, it is a long-term issue there. I suppose the kicker for me was the nightly, late-night "singing" by our "neighbors on the beach deck". My young son joined us in bed having "nightmares". He said they were singing "help me". What do you say to that ? Other sounds along the walkway late at night were heard most nights.. So..... what should I say.? I'm not overly negative, just realistic. The hotel is great, the neighborhood is different - the posted signs against sleeping along the oceanfront don't seem to be enforced. It's not the hotel's fault., but ................

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Hotel and staff, peaceful location.”
Reviews.Author: golfer09Sask
Reviews.Content: Who could imagine sitting on the balcony and watching dolphins swim in the ocean. Staff looked after every request, even the person who was smoking on the balcony. Thank you to guest services.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Service!”
Reviews.Author: poppies77
Reviews.Content: My family and I recently stayed here for the fourth time in two years, it's our favorite hotel. Service has always been great, but this time was particularly notable. Our young son has autism, and has trouble being quiet, which troubled the guests below us. We felt terrible, and the staff did all they could to fix the situation. Paul, Andrew, Niki and Gerard took a tough situation and handled it with grace and kindness. We'll certainly be back!

Reviews.Title: “Angela Menna and Pacific Terrace San Diego ROCK!”
Reviews.Author: prayne987
Reviews.Content: I took my wife to San Diego for Valentine's Day and when we first booked the trip, we had another hotel in mind until at the last minute we booked our stay at Pacific Terrace San Diego on Pacific Beach. THAT WAS THE BEST DECISION EVER!! My wife and I checked in with Angela Menna and she was fantastic!!! Our hotel room was not ready because we arrived at 9am so she took our number and called us when our hotel was ready. She told us the best places to go while we waited and she followed through and called us 2 hours before she said our room would be ready. To our surprise, we got the best room in my opinion which was the St. Lucia suite. My wife and I were blown away! We had hoped for an ocean view and boy did she deliver. The staff service called us both by name our whole stay and went over and above to ensure we had the best stay possible. The hotel is centrally located and we are going to book it again in March becasue we had so much fun. The room was decorated super nice, indoor jacuzi tub and just an overall warm feel to the room. With San Diego so beautiful you would wonder why I even cared about the room but it truly was wonderful to wake up to the waves and the view with my wife. We didn't book this room specifically and it was Angela who got it for us. Talk to Angela Menna when you go to this hotel because she will make your stay as enjoyable as possible and the rest of the staff will exceed all expecations. FYI- I signed up for this just to write a review as I am not a big review guy but they deserve it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel with Awesome service”
Reviews.Author: amberandmike
Reviews.Content: We stayed there last night and loved it! The staff was beyond accommodating and the views were amazing! Worth every dollar we spend and then some. We cannot wait to go back, pretty much the nicest hotel in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing service”
Reviews.Author: Zilly_8
Reviews.Content: Stayed here with extended family, including an 80th birthday. I've never stayed in a hotel where the staff went so far out of their way to satisfy whatever the request was. Champagne glasses for 13? Done. Tray? Done. Stroller? Done. The bedsteads are a bit over the top, but who's complaining...............

Reviews.Title: “Amazing location”
Reviews.Author: gardengatebnb
Reviews.Content: We spent 4 nights here for our honeymoon. We are not in the $380/night hotel crowd but this was worth it for the once-in-a-lifetime experience of hearing and seeing the surf outside our open balcony. The Capri condos next door is a much taller building and has huge search lights on its roof. It lights the white waves of the surf during the night so after dark, you can still see the waves rolling in. It was pretty incredible to fall asleep to the sounds and sights of the ocean. The room was sumptuous and we enjoyed it very much. This hotel is one of those places where you don't ever really see work being done but you know there must be many workers to keep it all so perfect all the time. This was our first exposure to extra fees for everything. Our "extras" bill was over $200, above our pre-paid room/taxes. That was just parking, internet and breakfasts, not even the mini bar or room service. Breakfast was posted as $9 but it had 2 kinds of fees/taxes added to that which made it $13. I'm sure those things don't matter to the money-is-no-object crowd. This location is second to none. The boardwalk is about 5 yards past the edge of our pool/breakfast area, and then the sand and water are just below that. We soaked up the ambiance of rollerbladers, yoga'ists, surfers and California culture. Things I found odd about our room: the shower had beautiful luxury glass doors, but were placed on a standard hotel tub, which meant you had to shower with your arms up to not bump into the (marble) walls or glass doors. It was very very clean, but I still think it's gross to rub against a shower wall.The water pressure was also nothing great. The bed frames were outrageously beautiful handcarved wood. The wierd part was that the rim part of the frame running around the mattresses was about 8 inches wide. Just swinging my legs down off the tall bed without thinking about it resulted in a number of good bruises. This was a bed where you had to calculate your strategy for reaching the floor. And they don't have any King beds, just queens. I'm sure this is every hotel's battle near salt water, but there were several bits where the drywall was crumbling or rusting metal showed through. Our balcony railings seemed painted not too long ago, but you could tell it was bubbly and rough from rust underneath. Overall, I hope to be so lucky to stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel, great staff”
Reviews.Author: buffaloaded
Reviews.Content: We stayed here at the end of the January to celebrate an anniversary. We opted for a partial oceanview jr suite, but the initial room we had was a partial ocean view by only a few degrees and had some noise issues. While most hotels would have said that is what we get, these folks found us a room on the quieter side of the hotel with a little more view. We also made it known we would love to have a full ocean view if any opened up during the 3 days we were their. Again, most hotels wouldn't have bothered to help us, but this is not an ordinary staff. We did get our "middle" night of 3 in a full view. So on the second and third nights they moved us (we were sightseeing) back and forth. The rooms we had were amazing. Both had large bedrooms, and the partial view had a huge bathroom. Great bedding. Here are more examples of the great service. When they heard it was our anniversary, they sent up a bottle of wine. Because we had reserved a king bed, which they could not provide, the second night we got another bottle of wine and a free breakfast. On the last move the bellman forgot to move our refrigerated items ( we were going to make an early breakfast out of leftovers from the GREAT Thai place a few blocks away) and the maid discarded them-- they gave us another free breakfast the morning we left. Everybody on the staff gave us a hello and smile each time we entered and exited. The front desk folks alway asked what we did and how we liked it. Being right against the ocean, hearing the waves at night, makes this a 6* for location. When

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding rooms with service to match!!!”
Reviews.Author: jalhome
Reviews.Content: Traveled to San Diego in Feb 2011 for business from Richmond, VA and was lucky enough to discover the Pacific Terrace Hotel. Beautiful and clean room with outstanding ocean view and good location. Service was the best I've experienced with the hotel staff extremely helpful and their everyday attention to detail was outstanding! Gerrard at the front desk was very helpful in making our reservation. You will love this hotel !!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wish we could have stayed longer!”
Reviews.Author: MizzSpider
Reviews.Content: My husband and I returned from our stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel vowing to return after a wonderful stay. From the moment we arrived, we felt comfortable and at home. At the reception desk, Rachelle checked us in and gave us an upgrade to a Partial View room, which was a lovely surprise and which we absolutely loved! The hotel also has secure parking underneath the hotel, so you don't have to park on the street, and with an elevator leading directly up to all floors of the hotel. We were only in town for one night, but promised ourselves we'd return again, book a full ocean-view room next time, and stay for longer! Thank you P.T. Hotel for a truly enjoyable nights' stay at your lovely hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Superb service with the rolling Pacific at your door step”
Reviews.Author: brubecksmum
Reviews.Content: Just spent four days at the Pacific Terrace and would reccommend it to couples and families. Out the door and you are ready for miles of boardwalk along the beautiful Pacific beaches - perfect for strolling, jogging or biking. Tell the concierge you are hungry and she has recommendations and reservations in any one of a number of places - suitable for lots of different tastes and budgets. The rooms are lovely and almost all provide some view of the sea. The beds are divine! The pool is warm enough to avoid temperature shock but comfortable for swimming and the hot tub is great and open until 10pm under the stars. San Diego is a great vacation spot and this hotel reminds you constantly where you are and how lucky you are to be there. And even though they charge you for parking we took our car in and out several times a day and never once waited more than three minutes for our car. The staff were wonderful. We will be back and encourage others to go too.

Reviews.Title: “The Right Choice”
Reviews.Author: redheadfamily
Reviews.Content: Great Location and very friendly staff made our visit to San Diego fantastic. We loved the complimentary cookies and fruit waiting for us after our busy day on the town. The rooms are spacious and nicely decorated. We loved the pool and jacuzzi overlooking the ocean. Computers available on each floor as well as free wireless available in room. We will definitely come back for another stay.

Reviews.Title: “This was an excellent holiday getaway!”
Reviews.Author: adsouthall
Reviews.Content: This hotel was the perfect choice for relaxing after a long day of sightseeing! I am a neat freak and was pleasantly surprised at the cleanliness of the hotel and the space for luggage in our room. There were 4 of us, and that can get a bit crazy if there is not enough space. If I could change one thing, I would add some type shelving at the vanity for toiletry bag storage. We used the fitness room as well as the pool / hot tub and were happy with both. The hotel is located near many good local restaurants within walking distance which we enjoyed and very close to Sea World and other areas to discover. The service was extremely friendly and accomodating, from the front desk, to the maid service (we needed extra laundry bags), to the breakfast room crew...all treated us like family in their own home! If I had to choose one thing I liked the best it would have to be the cleanliness because if a place isn't clean I cannot relax, no matter what. If I had to choose one thing I liked least it would have to be the fingerprints on the coffee caraffes in the breakfast room. Like I said, I'm a neat FREAK, and I notice things like that. However, if that is the worst thing I can say about this hotel, they are doing a pretty doggone great job of pleasing their guests!

Reviews.Title: “Didn't want to leave!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: welltraveled2008
Reviews.Content: WOW!!!! What a wonderful place to stay! My husband and I were absolutely thrilled with our accomodations! The staff couldn't have been more helpful. We loved everything about it. Our only regret was having to leave! We could have stayed forever. The property is immaculate from top to bottom. Our room (Jr. Suite..full ocean view) was top of the line. Parking garage well worth the daily fee. Location fantastic. We highly recommend this fabulous place! Dined at The Green Flash...very good dinner. And we had breakfast at Kono's...it was great!

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay at the 'pacific terrace hotel'”
Reviews.Author: SanDiegoBarbra
Reviews.Content: already living in san diego- we picked this hotel to have our anniversary-mini vacation -by the sea we both loved- the hotel and our full ocean view balcony room and how everyone working there treated us. we were blessed with warm san diego winter weather and full southwest view of the ocean and its -large waves we plan to stay again at this top notch hotel.. our thanks -to all the staff at the pacific terrace hotel the rhodas.

Reviews.Title: “Beyond What We Hoped For”
Reviews.Author: TheNieuwTravelers
Reviews.Content: What a fantastic place! Easily a new favorite for our family. The location is remarkable with access to the beach and the boardwalk and an amazing view. The palm trees and layout of the pool area add a ton to the atmosphere. The staff is friendly, responsive and personable - from the front desk to the maintenance guys diligently keeping the pool and spa clean. We have kids and took the advice of the hotel staff and booked a first floor partial view. While most "partial views" may be a sliver, this one (room 117) had a great view. It was very convenient on the first floor as we could easily get to the pool with our kids through the patio off the sliding door. Even though it was January it felt like Summer as we enjoyed a long day enjoying the sun, the scenery, the pool and a nice bike ride. Make sure you ask the hotel for the coupon to rent bikes as they have negotiated a great deal with a local bike rental company. It's about a 20 minute bike ride from the hotel to the end of the boardwalk - and a blast on cruisers. While we didn't get a chance, try the local Kono's for breakfast. Thanks to all at the Pacific Terrace for an amazing time! We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely wonderful!”
Reviews.Author: c.krzanowski
Reviews.Content: Me, my husband, our two brothers and their wives just spent an amazing 6 days in three seperate rooms at the Pacific Terrace Hotel and we can't say enough about how wonderful our entire stay was. Absolutely everyone working there went out of their way to make sure everything was perfect and that we had everything we needed or wanted. The rooms were very very clean and stylish, the grounds well cared for, and the location was incredible. We all plan on going back!

Reviews.Title: “Will be my first choice accomodations in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: MickandMik
Reviews.Content: We traveled as a family with a teen and a young child. Who would think that one hotel could provide a romanitic atmosphere for parents, a fun environment for a child, and chic and desireable location for a teen? But they have accomplished all of this in the Pacific Terrace. The ammenities in this hotel leave nothing to be desired. Game and video available to entertain our kids, nice restaurants to satisfy all our tastes were within walking distance. Pool area lovely for swimming, laying out, and people watching. Rooms plush and roomy, as well as clean and very well maintained. Family friendly, yet not childish. Chic and classy without pretention. Couldn't have asked for more. Staff was accomodating to the highest standard. This hotel made a nice vacation wonderful.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic View”
Reviews.Author: LaliBird
Reviews.Content: We had a wonderful weekend at the hotel. Our room was very spacious with a beautiful view of the ocean. We sat on the balcony and watched the gorgeous sunset. We could see surfers and dolphins playing. Breakfast was limited and there is not a restaurant but many in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: megabbylily3
Reviews.Content: My 3yr old daughter and I stayed here for 5 nights. Great location right on the beach. Housekeeping was wonderful, the room was sparkling clean and they always left a towel animal for my daughter! Entire staff was very helpful and friendly. We will be back!

Reviews.Title: “If a great hotel with ocean views is what you're looking for - this is it.”
Reviews.Author: Bridesmom_8
Reviews.Content: We're from Nebraska and rarely get to be on either coast so when we planned to go to San Diego the first thing I looked for was a great hotel on the Pacific Ocean. Bay views are nice but if you want to watch the surfers, the seagulls, people walking on the beach and the sun setting over the ocean then this is the place to be. Pay more to get a room with a balcony on an upper floor if you're like us and just want to soak up all the memories of a view that can't be found on the prairie. Rooms are great- so is the staff.

Reviews.Title: “Above and beyond is a perfect fit for this hotel staff and hotel”
Reviews.Author: Libby27_11
Reviews.Content: My mom and I recently stayed at this hotel for 2 days and 3 nights. Immediately we were more than pleased. The staff at the front desk at any given moment during this stay were beyond helpful, pleasant, and eager to assist. In fact, the entire staff down to the maintenance workers and housekeeping staff were always quick to give a smile and say hello. We stayed in a junior suite so likely more spacious than the average room. Loved the oceanside view...you could hear the waves crashing all night if you wanted. We found the hotel to be extremely clean and really couldn't complain. The only time you would hear the other guests was when they were talking as they got off the elevator (which was close to the room we were in). The location of this hotel is very convenient to being able to walk on the boardwalk/beach within a close distance of local restaurants, beach shops, etc. The concierge service was knowledgeable and able to give good recommendations of places to see and places to dine. You can tell that the management of this hotel has gone out of their way to think of all the little things you might need and have them available in the room (towels for the beach, toiletries, wine opener, etc). For those who like having an on-site restaurant this would not be the fit for you; however they do offer breakfast each morning in a downstairs lounge area at a reasonable price. We did not ever take advantage of it so unable to review the worth of the price. It may be a little pricier overall than I would've liked; however, they didn't disappoint which makes paying a little more much easier to bear!

Reviews.Title: “Amazing!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: DisneyNutWI
Reviews.Content: What more needs to be said, then AMAZING. The location, right on the ocean, can not be beat. All of the staff are extremely friendly and helpful; and treat you as if you are the only customer. The pool and hot tub area is very nice, and overlooks the ocean. Rooms are large, nicely decorated, and very clean. Location is within walking distance of dining and nightlife. Easy drive to Sea World and San Diego Zoo. This is by far the nicest hotel we have ever stayed at. I would recomment this hotel to everyone, for any trip type.

Reviews.Title: “Super friendly service”
Reviews.Author: Janetm53
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for our first trip ever to the San Diego area. I picked it after a lot of research ( I love the research part!) and when I looked it up on Tripadvisors list of hotels for this area it was in the top ten yet much less expensive than the other hotels it was rated with. Granted it is outside the city but Mission Beach is such a fun and funky neighbourhood that it was a perfect choice. The hotel is small and right on the beach. We were on ground level with a patio close to the pool and hot tub so we would go for a late night swim in the dark with just the tiki lights blazing. At night we would leave the patio doors open so we could hear the pounding surf - it was right there! The room was very clean and comfortable and the beds were massive. No lie, they put steps out for you to use to climb up onto the beds! Every person we encountered that worked in the hotel from the front desk staff to the gardeners were the nicest and friendliest we have ever met. The smiles and good mornings were genuine and sincere. We will stay there again for sure.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect for our Wedding night!”
Reviews.Author: JennyOutram
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed in the Presidential Suite for our wedding night and it was nothing short of amazing. The wonderful staff left us a complementary bottle of Chardonnay with a card congratulating us and thanking us for our patronage. Not to mention giving my mom and I a short tour of the room the week before, when we stopped by to make sure it was a decent choice for the big day (Having only read reviews online about it). The front desk staff is young, cheerful and very accomodating. When my husband and I arrived after our wedding, we were greeted and given fresh baked cookies and some fruit to snack on. After a quick check-in we headed to our room. It's a smaller hotel than we've stayed in before, but it had a nice "private" feeling to it, perhaps due to the size and more upscale decor. We had a perfect view of the pool area and the ocean from our top floor, centre room suite. It was incredible falling asleep and waking up to the gentle sound of the Pacific Ocean right outside our large balcony window. In fact, the way the room and bed are positioned, we could actually watch the ocean as we lie in bed. It was far enough into the room, however, that there was no worry of anyone outside looking in. The spa tub in suite was huge and extremely comfortable, easily fitting my 6'2" husband and my 5'2" self with room to spare. The toiletries were nice and they provided toothbrushes and toothpaste in addition to the usual upscale soaps, hair products and lotions. Our toilet did stop working after one use, but after a quick call to the front desk, an "Engineer" came and fixed it within minutes. We were very impressed. For all the bigger name hotels we could've picked for our wedding night in San Diego, we're both in agreement that we made the best choice going with a smaller, but perhaps more detail-oriented hotel such as the Pacific Terrace. We'll certainly be back next November to celebrate our anniversary.

Reviews.Title: “Perfection on the Pacific”
Reviews.Author: Musiclover9
Reviews.Content: My daughter and I stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel for 5 nights. We chose this hotel based upon the reviews in Tripadviser. It was a superb experience. The room was spotless; the service was incredible. We stayed in an oceanfront room and enjoyed sitting out on the balcony watching the sunrise and sunsets. We like to take public transportation; the bus stops one short block from the hotel. Also, for those of you who like to swim, the pool is extremely well kept and warm; the jacuzzi is fantastic. If you like to walk, there is a long boardwalk adjacent to the hotel. I will always cherish my memories of this hotel and the beauties of San Diego and environs.

Reviews.Title: “Location, Location, Location!!!”
Reviews.Author: AZ_Crisman
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace has THE BEST staff of ANY place we've EVER stayed. They are sincerely warm, friendly, helpful, knowledgeable, and they remember you -- not only from the day before, but from years previous! And that's just the icing on the cake -- you can't beat the location -- literally a stone's throw from the beach, easy access to freeways and San Diego tourist sites -- and the town of Pacific Beach itself is a very friendly, laid-back, AFFORDABLE place to vacation. Will we be back?? You betcha!!!

Reviews.Title: “Worthwhile Stay”
Reviews.Author: ExperiencedTravelers
Reviews.Content: When you drive up to the hotel you can't miss it, since it is at the beach. The room was very, very tastefully decorated and did not seem like a hotel room, more like a room you might have in your house. Our room had a balcony facing the beach and, except for occasionally when people walked by, was quiet. The staff was exceptional. They were very friendly throughout our visit and reminded me of the sort of service you get at the highest end hotels. Pacific Beach is not exactly close to much, but if you want a couple of nights away from it all this is an excellent choice. We go to San Diego quite often and definitely would stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Not a Bad Place At All”
Reviews.Author: UPRR_engineer
Reviews.Content: Pretty good place, not the best place ive ever stayed, but its pretty good. The staff there was some of the best ive saw in a long time as far as American hotels go. Everyone that works there did a great job taking care of us. Service goes a long way there! We picked this place because we wanted to be on the ocean with the waves, vs staying in some bay. Location is great as far as that goes, its a bit of a hike to any store that sells beer, smokes, soda, and snacks, or place to sit down and eat. Pool is a bit smaller then the pictures make it out to be, big enough i guess. Breakfast there was great, good food and great coffee. Great place to come back to after going to Seaworld and the Zoo. Our two year old daughter had a good time while we were here. Good place for family with young kids.

Reviews.Title: “For the perfect vacation in San Diego, stay at The Pacific Terrace Hotel”
Reviews.Author: CoastalGal11954
Reviews.Content: This is the third time I have stayed at The Pacific Terrace Hotel. It has been consistently pleasurable. The location is convenient to shopping, restaurants, of course the ocean, all the happenings on the boardwalk, yet peaceful enough to return to for rest and relaxation. A car is not needed for the immediate area. The hotel is more than helpful in regard to any aspect of a person's stay. What I found most amazing and impressive, was that the staff, regardless of the shift or position of a staff member, each one was genuinely honest, friendly, caring and always ready to make your stay even better! They know you on a first and last name basis within a day! I have visited other establishments, but returned to the Pacific Terrace and will continue to do so. Thanks to everyone at the hotel for an enjoyable visit each and every time! Keep up the great work!

Reviews.Title: “Should have been advised about garage!”
Reviews.Author: bartgo
Reviews.Content: OK, fabulous location, friendly, courteous, and helpful staff; but.....why wasn't I told at check-in that the room we were assigned was directly over the garage door??? Who needs an alarm when the garage door opens at 4:58 AM the morning following our first night???, and each morning thereafter it opened NLT 7:00 AM. In addition, room layout was awkward--just one sink for two people is inadequate; who gets to shave while she uses the hair dryer??? There is clearly enough room in the bathing area to install a second sink. No doubt there are gorgeous rooms with great views. While I knew going in that we wouldn't have a room with a view, I am disappointed that the room we were assigned seemed below par for a hotel with this high a rating. Suggestion: pay a little more and get one of those elegant rooms others are raving about. Not all rooms at PTH are equal!

Reviews.Title: “Very relaxing stay.”
Reviews.Author: and_dream
Reviews.Content: This was one of the best hotels we have ever stayed in. The room we stayed in was on the third floor with a partial ocean view. Even being "partial" it was still a great view. Very clean room and very comfortable beds. Staff is amazing. From check-in, room service & cleaning staff everyone was so nice and helpful. If I had to pick something as a downfall it would be the price of parking in the garage. $20 a day. Loved the HEATED pool and hot tub. We will definitely be staying again.

Reviews.Title: “excellent hotel, service and jewell of a location by the beach”
Reviews.Author: Mario155019
Reviews.Content: We were at the Pacific Terrace for four nights and enjoyed every minute of it. From the time we checked in, the staff was courteous, polite and very helpful. The hotel is very well run and attentive to details. When we checked in, they offered a list of restaurants that you may consider for breakfast, lunch and dinner in their area acknowledging their dining room facility was somewhat limited. Our room was very comfortable, very clean and quiet. Good comfortable beds. The hotel is by the beach with a courtyard swimming pool overlooking the ocean. Our room had a fabulous view of the ocean and there is nothing in between the hotel and the ocean. Their cleaning staff and the director of guest services, Angela, were just extraordinary. I have never dealt with more honest people in my life. Four days after I had checked out of the hotel, I realized that I had dropped my wallet, $275 worth of Canadian dollars, somewhere in the closet below the safe and the wallet was probably out of sight from the cleaning staff. The cleaning staff retrieved it for me and the service manager sent it back to me by Fed Ex, following my delivery instruction. I have never dealt with more honest people in my life. Mario

Reviews.Title: “Dreams Come True Here! Romance and Beauty AMAZING HOTEL&STAFF!!”
Reviews.Author: Bubblyme23
Reviews.Content: All I can say about this beautiful hotel is I would recommend this to anyone who wants to feel as if they are in a place where they truly matter to the hotel staff. I love feeling like I am not just another person staying at there hotel. The staff greet you with real friendly smile and make sure you have every thing you could possibly need and want! Oh and yes the hotel is RIGHT IN FRONT OF THE BEACH!!! We walked out of our balcony and could see the pier, amazing sunset, boardwalk OMG it was my dream come true! I always wanted to fall asleep listening to the waves crash upon the sand. We stayed 3nights in the Executive Suite woowwwooww huge room with two queen very comfy beds,a lil kitchen with microwave,fridge,sink,plates,utensils,coffee maker and the bathroom holy cow! huge bathroom with a JACCUZZIIIIIII TUB yes it was enjoyed alot :) and a separate standup shower. Oh and a plasma flat screen tv as welll in the bathroom! The parking is a lil pricey but well its hard to find parking anywhere in PB. Restuarants were within walking distances as well. All i can say is trust the reviews and really this hotel and the people who work here will make you feel so special and really it is worth it!!!

Reviews.Title: “Most Relaxing Hotel Stay - Ever!”
Reviews.Author: Pattylynn49
Reviews.Content: My husband and I traveld from Florida to San Diego to visit our daughter for Thanksgiving. We chose this hotel to be on the Ocean. We were very happy with our choice. The location was perfect - many places to eat within walking distance. Every staff member was friendly and helpful. Although the Hotel itself may be older - the inside was beautifully updated. Our room was clean and spacious. We could also see the Pacific Ocean from our room! We did get a wonderful off-season rate. This was the first time my husband actually relaxed on a vacation in thirty years. I love this Hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: philbur
Reviews.Content: We were there for a week. Perfect location, staff couldn't be more helpful. They even have a sheet with all nearby eateries, what they offer & distance in blocks from the hotel. We travel all over the world & this was one of the best weeks we have had, anywhere.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely view of the ocean and boardwalk”
Reviews.Author: NCarter58
Reviews.Content: We were treated with warm smiles and gracious hello's from very polite and helpful staff. Our room had a lovely view of the ocean and boardwalk, had a large patio and free wifi. Oh, and was very comfy! This has to be one of the best hotels we have been to in a long time. This is also close to shops and restaurants. We will be back for sure!

Reviews.Title: “Trust the Positive Reviews”
Reviews.Author: SeaShellyPlay
Reviews.Content: My family and I are so glad we read the reviews and decided on this place. It was the absolute perfect place to stay. My only regret is that we didn't stay longer. The views are awesome! We would open the doors to our big porch (We stayed in the Jr Suite) and listen to the sound of the waves crashing as we enjoyed the view. It is actually on a bluff and not directly on the ocean, but there are stairs nearby with easy access to the beach. We walked to the beach in just 5 minutes and fed the seagulls from our hand. The hot tub was a nice way to relax every night after a long day at Legoland - an easy drive just 30 minutes away. We loved it and you will too! Thanks to all the others who reviewed this place for us!

Reviews.Title: “Gorgeous, clean, friendly. Top notch. Highly recommend”
Reviews.Author: alohawoman39
Reviews.Content: We stayed there for 3 days. Couldn't have been better. Right on the beach, unobstructed view of the ocean. Very clean, extremely friendly staff, convenient location. The only inconvenience was rather late check-in - 4:00 p.m. When we got there our room was not ready and we were offered to upgrade to a suite, which was available. We noticed another couple the next day was in the same situation. I found that a bit awkward, seemed like we were being pushed to pay a bit extra. In any case, it was still a good experience. We were in a suite on the ground level - walk right into the pool and jaccuzzi right from our patio, right next to the little gate onto the boardwalk. So, all was great. But I would almost recommend that you stay on the 2nd floor, that way, you see the ocean front and center, probably more breathtaking. All and all, highly recommend!

Reviews.Title: “Great place!!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: katiekatie
Reviews.Content: All the reviews are true, this place is great. The location is right on Pacific Beach, the views from our balcony were so beautiful, people thought that my photos of the trip were post cards!! The customer service was spectacular, people were always smiling and friendly and ready to help. The rooms were large enough for 5 (4 adults and an 8 year old child), we had a junior suite. The only draw back was that the beach was full of kelp, which did not really bother us surfing but it was everywhere (not the hotel's fault, just an observation). I would HIGHLY recommend this hotel to anyone, and we are already planning our trip back to the Pacific Terrace!!

Reviews.Title: “Wowee, it was fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Burgbabes
Reviews.Content: Arrived October 29 to a great room and a free arrival glass of wine. Stayed at the hotel 6 nights and seven days. Staff was fabulous and always went out of their way to offer special litle things to enhance your stay. The room, view and staff and location all added up to one fabulous stay for total relaxation.

Reviews.Title: “Best Romantic ocean hotel!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: Gingerfranklin
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at the coziness AND first class service. The decor was superb and the 'turn down' service was beautifully done. Even though the weather was foggy and cloudy the ocean was perfectly viewed from our room! We also liked the friendliness of the staff and their willingness to go 'above and beyond'.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect place to unwind”
Reviews.Author: Bolen
Reviews.Content: Just spent a week here with my wife. Unbelievably relaxing place to hang out. Hotel service friendly and efficient. Location on the beach is perfect. Beautiful rooms. Highly recommend the ocean view king suite The pool great. Could not find one thing to complain about except $20 a night for secure parking. Make sure you rent a cruiser bike around the corner with a discount coupon from the front desk. Lots of free parking on the street.

Reviews.Title: “The Best In SanDiego”
Reviews.Author: peske1116
Reviews.Content: From check in to check out we had great service. The staff always had a smile-all of the staff. Front desk answered all questions, got us where we wanted to go without one problem. By mistake we left expensive jewelry out in the bathroom one day, not touched, trusted the maid like no other we have experienced. Beautiful room, Great view. Only problem was the weather, but we're not willing to blame the hotel. This is the only place we'll ever stay in SanDiego! Exceptional! Thank You Pacific Terrace.....

Reviews.Title: “What a lovely place to stay!”
Reviews.Author: home4056
Reviews.Content: We were able to stay for 2 nights and received the 3rd night free. When we arrived, it was raining, so we upgraded to the jacuzzi suite for an extra $30/night...great value! The rooms were huge and even the partial ocean view rooms had a great view. We spent quite a lot of time on our covered balcony...such an awesome view. The bathrooms are huge with a beautiful tile shower and huge vanity area. The pool was warm and had a great view from its location - unfortunately it was too cold to use it. We did splurge on a couples massage. They felt wonderful, but the location of the "spa" area was right off of the workout room and right inside of the parking area...so it was incredibly noisy, which did take away from the relaxation. We did have to close our sliders in the morning as well as there were lots of garbage trucks, sirens, car horns, etc. so, way too noisy to sleep with the door open. However, we would definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Great location with solid two star accomodations and staff”
Reviews.Author: mattnjennie
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace defines itself by its four star rating, however, the condition of the hotel, lack of fitness facilities and mediocre front desk staff might be found in a Best Western and not a property defined by four star luxury. The views are quite nice and the pool facilities are not as nice as the Marriott in San Diego but nicely maintained. The rooms are what you might expect in a Best Western but have disguised the inside with plank boards on the ceiling and furniture so large that as a six foot guy I literally have to jump down from the bed onto a carpet that has seen better days or a few homicides...not really sure what that pattern is or if it is a collection of brown stains on what was a golden carpet with palm trees or something... Point is, the rooms are barely adequate and could use a significant updating and please would somebody take-out the stinky 1970's carpet! All gratuitous, however, rightly deserved comments aside the assistant manager has been very accommodating and the service staff has been very kind and clearly takes a lot of pride in their work. I was hesitantly recommend this Hotel for the views, sounds of the ocean at night and generally fun place for a family to hang-out for a few days. Business travelers will not find this Hotel akin to the Omni, Marriott or Hard Rock in town with its slow internet access and lack of a (real) fitness facility....and no a 12 by 12 foot room in the parking garage is not a gym just because the placard on the wall states, "fitness facility!"

Reviews.Title: “The hotel of my dreams!”
Reviews.Author: Quaker82
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay at the Pacific Terrace based on the numerous accolades I read on TripAdvisor. It is everything we hoped for and more! It's difficult to say what the best part of the hotel is - the staff, the location, the amenities, room comfort, the service, housekeeping, secure parking, concierge, grounds/landscaping, pool/hot tub are all fabulous. We had only one suggestion upon checkout - they really could use more hooks in the room to hang towels. We would definitely return to the Pacific Terrace and are happy to recommend it to others.

Reviews.Title: “Nothing but great things to say .....”
Reviews.Author: saay555
Reviews.Content: I found this hotel via Trip Advisor and LOVED it!!! Right on the water and away from downtown. Great restaurants, beach and things to do within walking distiance. Staff was SUPER friendly. Continental breakfast and wifi were included with my buy 2 get 1 night free!!!! I will be back!!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful view Perfect Location”
Reviews.Author: Iamirish
Reviews.Content: We stayed three nights at the Pacific Terrace. It is in a perfect location. The view from our room was wonderful. We really enjoyed the pool, especially the cabanas which are no charge. The staff were very pleasant and helpful. I was however a disappointed in our suite, an upgrade which we did not pay for. I thought it was little tired especially after reading all the rave reviews about the rooms. Perhaps I was expecting too much. We enjoyed our stay and we would return.

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: skylinewest
Reviews.Content: The best thing about this hotel is it's location. If you want to be close to the beach, this is a great place to stay. You will have to deal with the homeless people and watch out on the boardwalk for the speed demons on bikes and skate boards. If you dont move out of their way they will run you over. The hotel is comfortable and clean, the staff is pleasant and helpful. For the price, I think they should have included complimentary wi fi and continental breakfast but they do not. Parking is $20 a day and you really dont have a choice bc there's basically no parking spots on the street. You're right by public beach access so free parking is scarce. There are several choices for eating within walking distance but not all of them are good. Dennys, Ihop, Taco Bell, Fatburger to name a few. Overall its a nice place to stay but next time we look for a place on the beach Im looking for one with free wi fi and comp. breakfast and hopefully free parking.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful San Diego Getaway”
Reviews.Author: TravelingTeacher00
Reviews.Content: My boyfriend and I recently spent 3 nights at the Pacific Terrace Hotel and couldn't have been more pleased. We originally booked the most basic nonview room to save a little bit of money (we booked the fabulous stay 2 nights get one free promotional offer), however, the staff upgraded us to a junior suite with a partial view when learning we were celebrating our 10 year anniversary. The room was perfect and had everything we needed, the kitchen was a great bonus. Every staff member we encountered were incredibly helpful and accommodating, especially Gerard. The location was perfect and the view from the pool was absolutely beautiful. I did quite a bit of research before booking this trip and all of my expectations were met or exceeded. We will definitely be returning!

Reviews.Title: “The best hotel I have been in for awhile.”
Reviews.Author: Lorenajuarez
Reviews.Content: Amazing rooms,nice view from the ocean and the most wonderful people.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful”
Reviews.Author: maci0202
Reviews.Content: Great service, great rooms, great location. Worth the money. We thought all deserved a big 'WOW'. Indeed, not the average basic hotel furniture. The rooms were really nicely set up, and the view that we paid for, was well worth it: right on the beach, looking at the palms and the ocean and listening to the gentle waves....absolutely, beautiful and romantic.. The hotel is some half hour drive from the San Diego City, in the famous La Jolla area. While the area has few main streets, it is big enough for interesting walks and even better shopping. Believe me you don't have to go to the city for that, plenty around in the proximity of the hotel. Staff were really nice and eager to assist with any enquires that we had (it's just that our postcards that we gave them to post on our behalf, arrived 3 weeks later...). We had continental breakfast included in our price, but it was very, very basic. You really had to pay to get decent breakfast. Plenty of restaurants around though, including iHop! The hotel has their own underground secure parking (for a fee of course), but we parked on the street as there was plenty of room and it was for free. The area seemed trouble free and safe enough, so no problems encountered. Overall, good hotel, well maintained, great service and nice location. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: hawaiigal59
Reviews.Content: I traveled with my mom, daughter, and 2 year old grandson. We had a family suite. Bedroom with two queen beds. Livingroom with a pull out sofabed. Decor very nice. We had a corner room on the first floor, with a view of the ocean. Room 120. Slept with the windows and sliding door open. Had a little noise around 1:45 am. People coming back from the bars? Pool area small but nice. Our room came with breakfast with muffins, juice, bagels. For $9.00 you can have a hot cooked to order breakfast. Parking is $20 a day extra. Everyone who works at the hotel went out of their way to help. Great hotel. Will come back again with husband.

Reviews.Title: “Would absolutely stay here again!”
Reviews.Author: TDAKansas
Reviews.Content: The rooms are spacious and clean and lovely. The service is amazing- we were always treated well, all staff was friendly and they went out of their way to make sure things were going well for us. The view was beautfiul and this may be the only quality hotel that is actually on the ocean. My 4 year old daughter loved the complimentary beach toys and heading down to the waves to be splashed and play in the sand. We left San Diego for Disneyland after a 4 day stay at the Pacific Terrace and my husband and I were missing the Pacific Terrace immediately upon walking into our rooms at Disneyland! You cannot beat the quality of the rooms, the beautiful scenery...and the complimentary breakfast you can eat poolside with the view of the ocean!

Reviews.Title: “Extremely beautiful, clean and friendly place to stay.”
Reviews.Author: TRPLLL
Reviews.Content: Everything at this hotel was very clean and tastefully decorated. The staff were all very friendly and eager to be helpful. I would stay there again for sure. Had a great time!!!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel stay ever!!! Didn't want to leave...”
Reviews.Author: brownie070
Reviews.Content: Just recently stayed there for four nights and we loved every minute. We had planned to stay in a partial ocean view room, but received a call from the hotel before the trip with an offer to upgrade to the Executive Suite. It was a little extra per night, but SOOO worth it. The room was incredibly spacious with 2 very comfortable queen beds, huge flat screen tv, dvd player, sound system, sofa, dining table and small kitchen area with a mini bar and fridge. We even commented that the suite was probably bigger than our small townhouse at home. There was also a spacious private balcony with a partial view of the ocean which was close enough to hear the waves crashing and watch the surfers. I highly recommend the 3rd floor rooms for best view and least street noise. The bathroom was beyond belief with a HUGE jacuzzi tub, walk-in shower, spacious closet, dressing and makeup area AND a TV!!! Watch a movie from the tub or while you're getting ready. An array of toiletries were provided including shampoo, conditioner, lotion, bath salts, shower gel, mouth wash, toothpaste and tooth brushes. The maid service was amazing; they respected our privacy and as soon as we left just for a short time, we came back to a made up room without ever seeing the staff responsible. The front desk and all other staff were all very helpful and accommodating. The heated pool and jacuzzi were very nice and the hotel location cannot be beat. It's just off the ocean and a very short walk to many restaurants, bars, nightlife, and shopping. As for the rates, they were pricey and parking is extra, but sometimes you get what you pay for and we left feeling like this stay was worth every penny. Could not ask for more and wouldn't stay anywhere else the next time we're in San Diego. Thank you Pacific Terrace Hotel!!!

Reviews.Title: “BEST KEPT SECRET”
Reviews.Author: bestkeptsecret31187
Reviews.Content: We wanted to spend my birthday in San Diego again, but wanted to stay on the water this time.Well we found the Pacific Terrace Hotel.It was just like the pictures but with sound,the waves were crashing on the beach.It was great.The staff was very helpful and friendly. I can't wait to go back. Carol

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Staff- Best Hotel on the Beach!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: GLemond
Reviews.Content: Wow- after reading all of the amazing reviews I don't think we can come up with anything more flattering than what has already been written! There must just be something "magical" about Pacific Terrace. In our times, with everyones busy lives, for all of these happy guests to sit down and take the time to write multiple paragraphs praising this hotel must say something great about this jewel of a hotel. We are rate shoppers! Never once in negotiating our room rates, comparing with other hotels, etc., did the staff ever make us feel "cheap" or badly for trying to get the most room for the money- quite the opposite in fact. Paul, Danielle and Carli were all wonderful to deal with as we changed rooms (different views and sizes) three times before deciding on one! When we arrrived at 7:00 am (after a 6 hour drive from Phoenix) they took our number and promised to get the room ready early for us...they also recommended a restaurant up the street called Hennesseys. The concierge Katherine overheard us looking for a place to eat breakfast, called the restaurant and arranged for us to get a two for one breakfast:) Hennesseys also is a wonderful, casual place to eat- equally friendly and accomodating staff... low key though, so if you are looking for "fancy" this is not your place! Great food, great drinks- and a very lively football watching group was their clientele! So, true to their word, we got our room early... having booked a full ocean view and coming out to see palm trees blocking our view- we asked to switch rooms.... again- NO PROBLEM:) They rushed a bellman up to us- he helped us pack up the room we had just unpacked and they moved us down the hall- the whole time assuring us that the room we had was the only one with the palm tree "blockage" and not to feel badly about wanting to switch. We did this and got the most AMAZING view!!! After a long day of sun, drinking and eating, we decided to rent a movie on the PPV they offer at the hotel- being technologically challenged, we had to call down a few times to figure out how to get it to work- again- no problem... every request, small or large was met with a smile, and NO PROBLEM- that should be the theme for this hotel- WE HAVE NEVER HAD SUCH AMAZING SERVICE AS IN THIS HOTEL! We have stayed in resorts in many cities- many of them more expensive and "high end" with less amenities, and certainly worse service. Its as though the entire staff goes to customer service seminars on a nightly basis to keep it so consistent:) One last thing we would like to point out, and yes we are going to mildy bash a couple of the other beachfront hotels here- Ocean Park Inn, Tower 23, Beach Cottages, Best Western Blue Sea Lodge..... We have stayed at these places. We have occasionally made reserverations and then called the cancel them... well, before staying this time at Pacific Terrace, we had also booked a room for $30 less at Ocean Park Inn. When we booked the room at Ocean Park I called Pacific Terrace to cancel- they didnt just say "ok, heres your cancellation number"- they asked why? And they asked if there was anything they could do so we didnt have to break the reservation....it worked! Even though Pac Terrace was higher by $30 a night, we stayed with them- number 1- because they made us feel that our visit mattered- number 2- they offered us a nice bottle of wine! So, I then called Ocean Park Inn to cancel and got "heres your cancellation number"- not even a why.... that kind of service with our kind of take on it could mean thousands of extra dollars a month for one hotel over the other! Our special thank yous to Katherine, Paul, Kyla, Carli, Danielle, Angela, Ted and the bellman- sorry guys we do not remember your names! Even the housekeeping staff who were always smiling and friendly- who also left animal shaped towels on our bed!! Little things are everything at this hotel!!! Everyone should experience it at least once!

Reviews.Title: “I had high expectations and they were all met”
Reviews.Author: wallywanna
Reviews.Content: Rest assured, this place is as good as all the reviews lead me to believe. From the moment we checked in, the service was superb. Having the "wide eyed" look of a first timer, even an employee leaving for the day stopped us and asked if this was our "first stay" ... and when we said yes, she told us "you are in for a real treat" ... and was she right. I can't add much to what others have to say. While the facility is great, it is the people that make it special. Everyone welcomes you and asks what they can do to make the visit more pleasurable. The only thing I'd nitpick -- and this is a function of staffing, not the individuals ... we found the pool beverage service to be a bit uneven, having to track down the person to order a drink once in a while. There is plenty of seating outside now for breakfast, and the food is excellent. I did the "cook to order" each morning and it was well prepared and fast. No restaurant on site is not an issue, as there are lots of places to eat very close, and room service is available. One comment on parking ... some have said to pass on the underground parking ($20 per day) and find a spot on the street. At least during the busy season forget it --- there is really no street parking close by. Try the first night in the garage, and then look yourself ... but the $20 is worth it. Great mix of the beach, the pool, and people watching on the boardwalk. I have already made reservations to return the same time next year.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect beach getaway hotel. Combination of ambiance, service, location and quality.”
Reviews.Author: travelerSP54
Reviews.Content: Every day was a perfect day. Easy to get to anywhere, from the beach to the Midway aircraft carieer and Seaport Village. Next time we want to stay longer.

Reviews.Title: “Great customer service”
Reviews.Author: michael602
Reviews.Content: The customer service was great this year and what a great improvement I may say. Although I don't want to go into specifics about my experience last year, this year was fabulous.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Grinanbear
Reviews.Content: We (family of 5 with sons agaed from 14 to 20) stayed here on a family holiday. The location is perfect, right on the front at Pacific Beach. Even the partial view rooms have an excellent sea view. The room sizes are very good and if you have selected a room with two "queen size" beds, these are a genuine equivalent to a UK double bed size. Service is very professional and efficient but not in your face. Whilst staff are obviously looking to maximise their tips, they would never be so rude as to mention or suggest it. Facilities are a little limited (fitness room is small and no restaurant), but you have a plethora of eating and drinking establishments nearby. The "boardwalk" at Pacific beach is lively during the day, but not noisy at evening. There are one or two homeless around, but the area is very safe for walking around even late at night. It doesn't really have a spa, but the treatments/massages are as good as any we have encountered in many luxury spas in the UK and elsewhere. The place has personality rather than corporate blandness. It is not 5 star as it doesn't have the full facilities you would expect in a 5 star, but the quality of the hotel and the friendliness of service put many of these to shame. Highly recommended

Reviews.Title: “So nice we were there 3 times in July”
Reviews.Author: beezee168
Reviews.Content: Relax and enjoy all that this place has to offer. Great staff great place wonderful sunset views. You will return again I promise you.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic hotel in fantastic location!”
Reviews.Author: nifty16
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights at the end of our 10-day trip that began in LA, and it was amazing: Location: Right on the boardwalk on Pacific Beach. The view of the surfers riding the waves is great, from your balcony or from the pool area. Plenty of restaurants and shops within an easy walk. Drive north a few miles to La Jolla to see the seals or snorkel with the leopard sharks, or just take in the gorgeous scenery. Only 10-15 minutes from downtown, the zoo and the aiport. The hotel: The rooms have an elegant touch to them, yet are very comfortable. The beds were great, the bathroom had plenty of space (separate vanity area), and there is a large hi-def TV. The balconies were roomy enough for the four of us to have our pizza while taking in the view. The pool is not huge, but it's fine because the hotel is small. Everything is lit up at night, giving it a very warm, romantic feel even with the kids there. Amenities: Large towels are provided in your room when you arrive to use at the pool and/or beach. They are yours for the duration, but they are happy to provide fresh ones. There is free lemonade, iced tea and water in the Caribbean room by the pool, and cookies during happy hour.
