Yes I did see a few homeless people, but I don't know of any beaches in southern California that don't have a homeless population. Pacific Beach is a fun beach community.

Reviews.Title: “This place is BEAUTIFUL!!!”
Reviews.Author: Lestersmommy
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed here for the final 2 days of our "great California adventure" We booked the 3rd floor presidential suite and it was AMAZING. I was lucky enough to use my entertainment book and got the suite for 1/2 price. We had a huge balcony overlooking the pool and ocean. It had a great table and chairs and we sat for hours enjoying the view and the wine! The staff was kind and left us some champagne for our anniversary This was easily the NICEST hotel I have ever slept in!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: thehowedogs
Reviews.Content: My wife and I just got back from a short holiday in the San Diego area. We wanted a room with a view of the ocean and this hotel definitely has that. It is adjacent to the boardwalk which has a steady stream of joggers, cyclists, etc. The view of the ocean is great, the rooms are very nice, and house keeping does an excellent job. There are lots of restaurants nearby.

Reviews.Title: “relaxing weekend getaway”
Reviews.Author: kircc
Reviews.Content: The hotel was wonderful. We were looking for a relaxing getaway that overlooked the ocean and that is exactly what we got with the Pacific Terrace hotel. The rooms were spotless and had everything we needed, including a small fridge. We stayed in a partial ocean view which was perfect. It overlooked the beach and looked down the coast to La Jolla. We thought our room was much better than those overlooking the pool as the pool area tended to get noisy. We never ate breakfast at the hotel but did try the drinks one night. They definitely were not worth the price. With the fridge in the room, we then made our own on the balcony.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Great Beach”
Reviews.Author: KSP-GR
Reviews.Content: Beautiful hotel right on the beach. The pool and hot tub are also great. Hotel staff are very friendly and service oriented. The rooms are a good size and very nicely decorated. We had a fridge, microwave and extra sink in our room, which was a standard room with no view (but there actually was a nice partial view). Many restaurants are within walking distance, try Sweet and Savory Gourmet for breakfast or lunch. We did not rent a car, used a car service for the Zoo and Sea World. Prices were about the same as a taxi. Would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay”
Reviews.Author: txfamily4
Reviews.Content: PT looks great from the outside,,,just like the pictures. Check in was pleasant. I was disappointed because we paid the rate for a partial view and got a 1st floor room. If we stood just right we could see the ocean through the pool area, sidewalk and trees. Not what I had in mind. Our room was outside the reception area, elevator and next to the common computer. Normally I would be very unhappy about that. However, I was traveling with my family that included young children so the location was helpful plus they could run out our sliding doors to the pool. They loved that. We had a king suite that included a small refrigerator and microwave. The room was nice and large. The sofa bed had a nice air mattress that was very comfortable. It was a very quiet hotel and we never heard any noises. My kids want to go back. The location on the beach was great. They provided beach toys for the kids. We shopped at the grocery store and mostly ate in the room because the kids were so tired each night plus we had a hard time finding family places to eat. The pool was nice but the water was cloudy which made me concerned that perhaps chlorine levels were not maintained. We were disappointed that they charged us for beach chair and umbrella given the price of the room. The internet connection on the common computer was extremely slow,,,,dialup level.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace was the right choice!”
Reviews.Author: jkbanta
Reviews.Content: It's the best hotel on Pacific Beach! The room was so comfortable with a fantastic view, and the staff was extremely friendly and helpful. I would definitely stay there again. Ask for 2nd or 3rd floor rooms - the views are much better.

Reviews.Title: “What an awesome hotel!!”
Reviews.Author: Ready4MoreBeach
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace from July 2 to July 7. We chose this hotel based on Tripadvisor reviews and its proximity to the ocean. The hotel is wonderful. All of the staff, from check-in, to the maid service, the bellhops, even the maintenance guys in the elevator were awesome and made us feel like special guests. Pros -Hotel is super clean, very nice overall -Rooms are awesome and decorated with real furniture not the normal cheap hotel stuff! -Nice pool with great bar service from very helpful staff -The view of the ocean is awesome. We had an Oceanfront King on the 2nd floor. I would try to get one of the end rooms that face the ocean when I return. All have awesome views but the hotel is sort of C shaped facing the ocean. The end rooms have the awesome view but don't have to overlook the pool. Either way, the view is awesome and will not disappoint. -Location is within walking distance to all sorts of original restaurants. Ask the front desk, they will guide you. Make sure you eat at Taco Surf, just 1 block away on the main road. Its a wonderful little dive Mexican restaurant. Very clean and delicious. The kids (ages 3 & 5) liked the pizza next door and I was able to bring it in to Taco Surf. Cons - these are nit picky but you cannot review all positives! -A little pricey. I booked on their website and chose the Internet prepay deal. The price ended up going down a bit, so I called and was upgraded. But, I would say the price is justified given the service, location, and cleanliness of this hotel. -Self parking is $20 per day. With the price of the rooms, this should be included. Good luck parking the car if you refuse to use their parking. -I called to ask if they were on the beach. I was told they are 15 steps from the beach. Not true, they are 15 feet from the beach, but if you took 15 steps towards the beach, you would fall down a 30 foot cliff. Now, however, they are on an awesome boardwalk and located between 2 sets of stairs to get to the beach. The stairs are probably 45 feet in either direction. We explored the area quite a bit, and we believe this is the nicest beachfront hotel in the area. There are so many nice touches, from the furniture, to the turn down service, to the printed information delivered to your room telling you what staff is available overnight even with their pictures, and just the overall great, secure feeling you have while staying here. Overall this is an awesome hotel and please do not hesitate to stay here. You will not regret it.

Reviews.Title: “Superior Location, Room and Staff!!”
Reviews.Author: Carpediem75
Reviews.Content: It always starts with reception, and I must say I was so pleased with the pleasant greeting we received. The on duty Manager was warm and professional. We got our keys and got to our room, only to find it was under construction (whoops), but this minor inconvenience was quickly corrected and he 'upgraded' us to a junior suite oceanview - so....Sweet!!! We were in so much need of some R&R and having a vacation start off on that positive note was absolutely what we needed. The room was great, the view spectacular, and I really liked the location. This being our first trip ever to San Diego, I had no idea but would definitely stay in this location again, super easy to get around and love the beach lifestyle. We got a great rate, and would have loved to stay longer but the rates went up significantly on the weekend so I had booked the remainder of our trip at another hotel (Island Palms BW on Shelter Island) - I don't recommend it and NOT even comparable! The Pacific Terrace truly understands what customer service is all about, and they deliver. Well done :)

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place to Relax and Unwind”
Reviews.Author: RogerMKE
Reviews.Content: We enjoyed our stay at the Pacific Terrace hotel. It is a great place to go if you want to relax and unwind. We rented a family suite, which was fairly expensive, but reasonably roomy and allows someone to hang out in the living room and watch TV while others are sleeping in the bedroom. I highly recommend an ocean view. Architecturally, the hotel is a very nice building. Our room was considerably nicer than our room at the Ritz-Carlton in Marina Del Ray. The staff was very friendly and attended to all our needs. There is not really a restaurant in the hotel (except for breakfast) but there are a number of casual places to eat within walking distance. The neighborhood around the hotel isn't anything to write home about -- it's a slightly run down beach community. When you are not hanging out at the beach or pool, you will probably want to drive somewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great place to stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: Globetrotter789
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace is a great hotel! The check in staff was very pleasant, even offering suggestions for places to park free in the area. Being a popular part of town we didn't have any luck findind a spot, but the underground garage was secure and easy! A few reviews rip this hotel for not having a place to eat which is totally lame. If you are visiting a new city do you really want to eat at a hotel restaurant? Why not try one of the countless places within walking distance? We tried several, all good to great! Overall, this is a great place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “You get what you pay for but I would ask for a floor plan first.......”
Reviews.Author: swa7381
Reviews.Content: Unbelievable place! Yes it is pricey but it has everything you expect. The staff was extremely helpful and very nice. 5 star resort setting on a small scale. 3 Floors of varying size rooms from small one bed to two room suites. It does make a big difference where your room is and if you pay the same 400/nite as the next guy you want as much bang for your buck. Room placement and size can vary and that's why if you do your homework wether google maps or call for a floor plan first it would be a huge benefit. The only complaint was when my family stayed in a 1st floor room with a partial ocean veiw(plenty of ocean veiw) the noise from upstairs esp when the guy above moves his patio chairs all nite long. It's so loud it comes thru the ceiling! I asked to be moved and was taken care of immediately, still if the family above has a kid or for some reason has to keep moving it will keep you up all nite, even with ear plugs! My new room was smaller and still the room above kept us up. There a certain rooms that are smaller and thats why a floor plan with room #s can help, find the room of YOUR choice and when you get that big hotel bill you will know it was worth it! ps 20 bucks a day to park underground with roll up gates only accessable with hotel card.

Reviews.Title: “What a Great Place”
Reviews.Author: msshellnlb2
Reviews.Content: I went on line to help my nephew plan a surprise get a way for him and his wife on her birthday. I stumbled on this place by accident and fell in love with it. They spent the day at sea world and arrived at the Terrace to a great staff that was very welcoming, professional and accomidating. They were in the executive suite that had the perfect ocean view. Even from the huge jacuzzi tub in the bathroom. The sound of the waves rocked them to sleep and greeted them in the morning! She had a wonderful time and could not praise them enough. The terrace took care of everything...all the way down to the bottle of wine for her birthday.

Reviews.Title: “WOW! Never again. The economy has kicked this hotel's [--]!”
Reviews.Author: vendorcloud
Reviews.Content: I loved this hotel the first time we went early in 2008. What a difference a year and 4 months makes. The PT was #1 ranked back then. Now, it's dropped to a 5 or so. I still went hoping all was well. When we arrived check-in was fine and fluid. No qualms. We had a so-so rate for the weekend and an ocean view suite. We anticipated the whole pool experience in the car going down from LA. When we got down there we were met by a half dozen youngish thugs with stretched ear lobe rings, full body tats and a few had that glazed look of "where am I?" on their faces. There were all guys except one girl who was in a bathing suit that was 3 sizes too small for her body. Not pretty for the family scene. They began to smoke and carry on. It's all good, believe me. I was a punk once too. But not for $400 thanks. The concierge and my wife had a mis communication about dinner reservations but it was finally worked out. We went to the trendy JRDN at the Tower 23 hotel a few blocks away. The babysitter that the hotel arranged was great btw. JRDN started off with a thud. There's lots to write here but I will leave it to Urbanspoon. Look for my review there. Just prepare yourself for lots of trendy but no substance. We inquired about the change in guest profile and were told they would "ask them to calm down" if need be. Ya.... no thanks. I don't need to be shot in the garage. These guys were about 5 or 6 to a room btw. I know that was not on the rules list. The free hot breakfast has been changed to a $7.50 hot breakfast with lots of $2.00 add ons. We opted for the free continental. It was fine. The supposed Starbucks coffee was weak. Go down the beach a bit and have a better coffee (and probably breakfast) at Konos. The beach here is not fluffy white but that is ok. If you are looking for Hawaii, San Diego ain't it. But all in all the hotel's location is prime. In fact, if they didn't have the location, they'd probably be out of business at this point. Upon check out the concierge (Katherine?) was very helpful and offered to do anything to make all the woes go away. She gave me free parking ($20) which I didn't ask for. It's funny. They always think it's about the money. It's not. Get rid of the party at the pool and I would have paid $500. The sad part was that she was so earnest in her effort to help, the other "customer service" agents at the desk (Matt and another gal) were making fun of her while I was being helped. Get a plan for a new job guys. You won't be here much longer but I'm sure the concierge will find a great job.

Reviews.Title: “Blew our minds away”
Reviews.Author: Skooter430
Reviews.Content: We were originally supposed to stay at the Hilton on Mission Bay for our honeymoon, until i read the reviews of the Pacific Terrace. Everything I read I wanted to experience. Being right on the water with nice rooms. So I cancelled our reservations for the Hilton and Booked with the Pacific Terrace. We were not dissapointed. The view was spectacular and the grounds were beautiful and the employees were very nice. We had booked a Junior Suite w/king bed. The room was very well laid out. We were also able to see the ocean from our bed every morning and listen to the waves during the night. We also went there knowing that they didnt have an onsite restaraunt but were shocked to find that they did have a small breakfast available. The food was better than we had thought it would be for the price we had paid for it. The restaraunts around the hotel were also great. We went to Gringos for lunch and Fat Burger. We tried everything at least once. We deff. plan on staying here again, it was an unbelievable honeymoon, thank you for the memories.

Reviews.Title: “Will be back”
Reviews.Author: Wstrnboots
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just got back from a California vacation during which we spent 3 nights at this hotel which was the highlight of the trip. We had a partial ocean view room on the third floor (which is the top floor) and it was beautiful. We stayed one whole day just watching the surfers and the people walking up and down the beach. The room was pretty big and had a fridge, microwave, sitting area and jacuzzi tub. The balcony overlooking the pool and beach was big enough to accommodate a round table and four chairs with room to spare. The weather was a little cool so we did not use the pool but it was very nice and there were quite a few people in it. We ordered breakfast one morning which was good and the staff was very helpful in providing information on area restaurants that delivered. There were quite a few restaurants in the area and we were able to get downtown in about 15 minutes. Overall I would recommend this hotel and we will definitely be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Best View of all our travels”
Reviews.Author: turtle040
Reviews.Content: WE booked into the Pacific terrace with a travel zoo special reserving a non view room. When we arrived they let us check in early, and asked if we wanted to upgrade our room for 30 more dollars for a full ocean view. I am so glad we did, as it was one of the highlights of our trip. WE sat on our balcony for a couple of hours enjoying a glass of wine, and watching the surfers, the dolphins, and the sun go down. What a view!!! It was spectacular. And in the morning when I woke up, I could watch the ocean from my bed. Amazing. The staff asked us when we checked out if anything could have made our stay better, and we could not think of one thing.

Reviews.Title: “What a View!”
Reviews.Author: Macciatto
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a presidential suite, the room was well laid out with a large oceanfront balcony, king bed facing the ocean, and 52" TV. The bed was very comfortable, nice chocolate at turndown service and reletively quite. The pool stayed active even though it was it was in the lower 60's. Jacuzzi tub in bath was nice, but would not drain and was not oprable for the last 2 days, they comped our parking for 2 days to offset. I was happy with this. The staff was friendly and engaging but not polished or slick. If you want a view this is the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “2star pretending to be 4 star”
Reviews.Author: MaryDollandRab
Reviews.Content: The view of the ocean and pleasant staff are the 2 top things going for this hotel.The rest of my comments are to make other travellers aware of the full picture.We read the all reviews before booking this hotel and have to say at no that time was it mentioned that there was no restaurant or bar on site. I have never been in a hotel (priced at this level) where there is no restaurant and no shop to buy basic requirements ie,bottled water, sun cream etc.The hotel itself is in need of a fresh coat of paint and quite shabby. The room service is provided by a couple of local restaurants and is expensive and there is a basic cable television service, any other channels eg Disney costs extra .There brochure mentions all day pool service but that is very rare (provided by a little bar which is rarely open)and again no food available. The fridge in the room is stocked with drinks (watch the dates on the beer) and snacks which are at their sell by date or just short of it! Also beware the bottle of Evian on the table beside the glasses, this costs a hefty $5.We were fortunate as the air conditioning was not required as I doubt you could have slept through the noise.There is little parking outside the hotel which forces you to stump up $20 per nite to park in the hotel's underground car park. No fault of the hotel however,the beach could have been better cared for as it didnt appear to have been cleaned in a long time and was covered in seaweed.A pleasant stroll along the boardwalk was marred by dodging numerous cyclists and joggers and lastly the whole area attracted homeless vagrants-a lot of whom appeared to sleep beside the restrooms located directly outside the hotel and on the benches on the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect location, amazing staff!”
Reviews.Author: marcosie
Reviews.Content: My husband and I would come back to this spot any time! The location was perfect, we did not have to use our car at all once we were there, you can walk to restaurants, bars, beach, and shopping. The staff was so friendly and helpful, they really made us feel at home and welcome. The new breakfast was very nice and cheap!

Reviews.Title: “This hotel was better than the one on our honeymoon!”
Reviews.Author: tallmom25
Reviews.Content: My husband and I recently stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel in San Diego for two nights over our Spring Break. We had a wonderful experience! We stayed in a beautiful ocean front hotel for our honeymoon that we thought could not be beat. The Pacific Terrace Hotel has now taken the top spot for our favorite hotel! We would like to make a family tradition of it and come each year to the hotel. Next time we will take our two children. It is family friendly and great for a quiet get a way for just a couple. We stayed in an ocean view Jr Suite with a king bed. It was very spacious and nicely decorated. The bed was soft and cozy (I am very pregnant, and it was the best night's rest I had had in a while!). The customer service was amazing. The hotel is very close to many attractions. Sea World and Old Town and the Gas Lamp district are very close. I am a very picky person when it comes to hotels. I am not easily impressed- The Pacific Terrace Hotel exceeded all of my high expectations. Thank you for my relaxing vacation! We will see you next year!

Reviews.Title: “Nice View, Excellent service but HSIA was not as I expected.”
Reviews.Author: silverjay57
Reviews.Content: I was on a buisness trip with a group from my work (30 of us each in our own room). Some of us got Jr Suites with nice views, I got a regular first floor room with a view of the ocean through the pool area. Which was blocked by the plants they have. They waived the parking fee for us in the garage because we stayed for 11 days. Granted I would have been reimbursed if they charged us anyways. The staff was very accomodating. I wanted a microwave in my room, and they brought one up to me. However the way they plugged it in, I kept killing the power strip it was plugged into. Which didn't help at 4 am when I was getting up. (Jet lag from East Coast) The staff would always recommend a good place to eat for me. both nearby and further away. They gave me directions to both Target and Walmart (I forgot to pack a swim suit). The TV was nice and big. Being able to listen to the ocean at night was a plus, expect on the weekends with kids who were there to party checked in, then I couldn't sleep well. The pool was very warm, which helped with the very cool breeze coming off the ocean. Ok now the negatives. I contacted the hotel before my trip to inquire about HSIA. They said it was wireless in the hotel, and there are no wired connections in the rooms. Ok fine, I took a wireless laptop with me. I decided not to bring DVD's with me (since I was traveling for such a long period of time), relying on my Netflix streaming account to watch movies online. BIG mistake!!! The conneciton signal in the room was a 3 bar, 4 if I was lucky. There are no Desk level electrical outlets, so you have to search for one for your computer. In this age of Internet access, I would expect a wireless signal of at least 4 to 5 anywhere in the hotel. Oh well. I meant to ask for turn down service at a different time, because when I got back from work, I would turn my own bed down. But the little chocolates they provided are nice. Thier breakfast was a JOKE. It was easier to make my own in my room (after I got the microwave). Of course we headed into work at 6am. so breakfast wasn't even being served yet. I didn't see any dinner offered, as other people have written. I highly recommend this hotel for a little get away. Being on the beach is nice. I walked to dinner most nights, when I was eating close.

Reviews.Title: “Our family thoroughly enjoyed our stay at the Pacific Terrace hotel with its wonderful location & terrific staff”
Reviews.Author: cincyoh04
Reviews.Content: Upon arrival, we were pleasantly surprised with a good sized room and a terrific beach view. Katherine, the concierge, was very helpful to us in finding the best activities to do with our two girls ages 7 and 4. We never left the hotel without directions or discounted tickets to our activities courtesy of a great staff. On site breakfast in the mornings was also terrific. Overall, great experience.

Reviews.Title: “Great Location”
Reviews.Author: newtravelors
Reviews.Content: This is a really nice hotel in a great location. The front desk staff are awesome. We stayed one night and got the internet special of $115/ night for a partial ocean view. Otherwise, it is way more. It is definately worth this price, but not sure about 300-400 dollars. There are many places within walking distance. Overall, we loved it.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Hotel Staff!!!!!!!!!”
Reviews.Author: exotik
Reviews.Content: Our stay here was above and beyond our expectations. The staff treated our stay like we booked a 5 star hotel. They were friendly, helpful, accommodating, and polite. We did not want to checkout. The property is beachfront so even lounging at pool you see the sunset and ocean. Nice 42" plasma tv, I think 42". Rooms were cozy and since we were on the first floor we could walk right out to pool. The beach was nice. Many places to eat nearby and hotel provides dinner info for surrounding areas. The walls are kind of thin, so be prepared to get up at 8am. I prefer to sleep late when I have no agenda. Valet parking is $20.00. I recommend this hotel if you are searching for nice hotel and do not want to pay for 4 or 5 star prices.

Reviews.Title: “Simply Amazing”
Reviews.Author: ejdennis
Reviews.Content: This hotel was amazing - the appearance, the cleanliness, the rooms, the staff, the location - the list goes on. The staff went out of their way to make you feel comfortable and welcome. My family and I thoroughly enjoyed our stay and look forward to the next visit!

Reviews.Title: “definitely would return!”
Reviews.Author: gerronimo
Reviews.Content: This place was recommended by close friends. To summarize: great rooms and views; exceptional guest room interiors; very helpful/pleasant staff. Negatives: DON'T STAY HERE AT SPRING BREAK IF YOU CAME TO RELAX. They charge $20/night to park which is gouging. Overall: 9 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Very good stay.”
Reviews.Author: duskglow
Reviews.Content: This was a very good hotel. The price was right (even though it was the off-season discount), everyone was friendly, room was clean, balcony led right out to the ocean, beach was nearby, lots of places to eat were very close, and there was very little about it that I think could have been improved. They even came up with a free glass of wine on my first night. That said, there were a few things. The bathroom was just a little tacky and badly maintained (though clean and not bad enough to affect my enjoyment any), they charge $20 parking - which if you're paying full price would seem almost like an insult, but I paid half so it didn't bother me too much... there is no onsite restaurant. All of the extra charges (parking, etc) made me feel like I was being nickel and dimed, and if I'd had to pay full price it wouldn't have been worth it. They did have a "continental breakfast" one morning - which was a danish and an orange juice - and $9 for an omelet and some sausage. While I can understand them charging for the hot stuff, you can get a better continental breakfast at a place half the price. Go on the off season and you'll have a great time for a decent price... go when it's full price and you'll probably feel a little cheated. Not because it's not a great stay - it is - it's just not worth $500 a night plus parking. Oh, and watch out for the birds.

Reviews.Title: “beautiful sunset on very private balcony!”
Reviews.Author: thriving88
Reviews.Content: We had an unforgettable time here! We are locals and came here for a mid-week post-Valentine's/husband's birthday getaway. When the amazing staff noticed it was my husband's bday, we were upgraded to the Presidential Suite and it was fabulous!! It really created a special memory for us and what a bummer we didn't stay an extra night. The first thing we did was enjoy the sunset from the balcony which immediately relaxed us. We then walked to Gringo's and had a delicious dinner. There are a zillion restaurants to choose from in a 1 block radius, FYI. Upon return, enjoyed the jacuzzi tub while watching the awesome bathroom TV (we don't have an LCD at home). The room was beautifully decorated and you can leave your balcony door open to hear the ocean waves as you lie in the ginormous bed. The TV from the bed was great too. Just being that close to the ocean was soooooo spirit-changing. Even staying just one night was renewing. The cool thing is most of the rooms face out to the ocean. We will definitely be back, and for longer next time!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel with Wonderful Staff!”
Reviews.Author: ParticularAnne
Reviews.Content: We decided to pop into this hotel for one Saturday night prior to checking into our so-called "5 star resort." When we arrived the next day at said fancy resort, we were so disappointed at how it compared to Pacific Terrace. We stayed one night and then checked back into Pacific Terrace for the remaining 10 days of our trip. The hotel itself is perfectly situated on Mission Beach with most rooms offering terrific views of the ocean as well as the hotel's beautiful, warm and lighted pool surrounded by comfy lounge chairs (some under a shaded canopy that I certainly needed for my red head!) The grounds are beautiful and well kept up with maintenance people all over collecting towels and any litter that (rarely) seemed to find its way to the pool area. What I loved about the pool is that there was no smoking, no food and beverages (since the eating area patio was just steps away) and no music....Just peace and quiet. Even the very few children in the pool were quiet and well behaved. The tone was just automatically set to be this tranquil. We swam everyday despite SD having a record cold spell during our trip. When I asked the hotel desk to turn up the heat in the pool even more than the 80 degrees it was set at, they immediately complied and the next day, and for the rest of our trip, the pool was a haven away from the cold winds off the Pacific. Each room has a fantastic balcony where we had our breakfast delivered daily. To look at the beautiful ocean and that pristine beach over coffee every morning was the best way to start our day. There is also a walkway along the ocean path for bikes, rollerblades and the like, but we loved walking on this amazing beach best with its hard packed damp sand making it super easy to traverse. The rooms are newly renovated with very comfortable beds, lovely furnishings and lighting, new, clean carpeting, and plenty of space to stretch out. The staff, though, is what made this a special trip for us. We were treated with such cheerful smiles and genuine offers of help in every way by every staff member there. Lynette, Ted, and Cassie were especially helpful. Lynette brought us complimentary wine one evening for us to enjoy on our balcony and even remembered a treat for our 3 year-old son, Leo. The housekeeping staff, too, was exceptional, going out of their was to accommodate our changing needs daily. We loved them all! My partner didn't want me to even write this review for fear that the hotel will become too popular, but they really deserve kudos for their fine service and wonderful facilities. Even with the "incident" of a broken water main on our first night, leaving all of us with no showers for 36 hours, the staff went out of their way to make us comfortable and were profusely apologetic about the accident (which wasn't in any way their fault to begin with.) It was impossible to be angry about it with the entire staff scrambling to help us all out. I wouldn't necessarily go to San Diego again just for Sea World and the Zoo (the main reason we took our son) but knowing that we could stay at the Pacific Terrace again ensures that we will, in fact, be back. I have already planned a trip with my sister and her family for next year and we will be staying at the Pacific Terrace. THANK YOU, PACIFIC TERRACE, FOR A WONDERFUL TRIP!

Reviews.Title: “Perfect hotel for a week stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: MaureenM18
Reviews.Content: We had the most wonderful time at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. We have two children ages 2.5 and 5 years so we stayed in a Family Suite (two rooms) the first two nights. The prices went way up for Valentines Day weekend so we switched to a Junior Suite to be more economical. This room actually worked much better for us and we downgraded the rest of the trip to the Junior Suite from the Family Suite. We found we didn't need the bedroom closed off...the kids fell asleep easily after days at Legoland, Seaworld, Zoo etc. and then coming home and playing in the pool. The suite was well equipted and had a refrig, kitchen table, plates and utensils so we were able to eat fruit and cereal most days before heading out. This saved money and felt like we were having a healthy meal. We loved being pool side so it was easy getting back and forth to the pool with the kids and for cocktail hour supplies. We were thrilled with the location. You are right on Pacific Beach and it is beautiful. The boardwalk runs for 3.5 miles or so and it is just gorgeous. I could not recommend this hotel more. Rooms are very clean. Staff is very friendly and care deeply about your enjoyment and satisfaction. Plush robes are a nice touch and great for traveling out to the pool when the weather is only 60'f but the kids want to go in. Pool and hot tub were great and beautiful view from the pool. We can't wait to go back. Some recommendations...Taco Surf across the street had great authentic Mexican food which we took back to our room for dinner on two nights. Walk down the boardwalk and there is a breakfast place Kono's. Not a healthy breakfast but delicious and people line up. The line moves very quickly. Joe's Crabshack also a nice walk down the boardwalk was delicious and the beers reasonable (3.99 for a microbrewed draft pint). We had the Dungeness crab and it was excellent. Great kids menu which was important to us. Ralph's grocery store was convenient and good prices if you get a store card. Longs Drugs of all places had good prices on wine and alcohol.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful experience at Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: saabco
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took a long needed vacation to California and spent four nights at the Pacific Terrace. The room, the view, the location and the service was great. While there I had a biking accident. The employees couldn't have been more helpful, offering ice and wrap, a wheel chair and even a glass of wine to ease the pain. We enjoyed coming back to the room after our siteseeing, relaxing on the patio while watching the sunset. Lots of activity outside the window. Then a short walk to dinner down the boardwalk(concrete). It would be better if they had a restaurant and bar at the location.

Reviews.Title: “worst experience imaginable.”
Reviews.Author: duckincali
Reviews.Content: We checked in for a weekend getaway by booking our reservation through a 3rd part website. Once we arrived, they stated our booking had been lost and we would need to check in to another hotel 3 miles from the existing location. This was all done with a big smile with absolutely no concern for inconvenience we would have to endure. After speaking with 2 different managers, we were able to get a "wait one minute while I check with our General Manger" response. After waiting 30 minutes in the lobby, she came back and stated we were lucky and we would get a room even though they weren't obligated to honor our reservation since it was made through a 3rd party website. Never in my life have I ever met a hotel manager that was so rude, callous, and void of managerial competance. The view was spectacular and the rooms were sufficient but the service received by the woman front office manager with blonde hair and glasses will never be forgotten. I would never stay here ever again even if it was free.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanfront Location + Great Service = Highly Recommended”
Reviews.Author: Carrie R
Reviews.Content: Pacific Terrace was outstanding. My mother and I sadly only stayed for one night in January 09. We paid $119 on hotels.com and were upgraded to an oceanfront room upon arrival for an additional $50. The room normally is about $250 in the off season. Our room was lovely - 'princess and the pea' beds, very high and cozy. Full mini bar with sink, but also with an empty fridge to stock your own goodies. We were happy that they had actual glassware - coffee mugs, wine glasses, and cocktail glasses. The room was clean and modern with a HUGE television. A nice layout with a more private bathroom / changing area - especially useful with the oceanfront boardwalk right outside your window. The surrounding area included quite a number of restaurant choices - mostly pub / grill type places, which looked casual. We were only there one night and ordered room service, which was fast and yummy. The hotel offers a number of room service options from surrounding restaurants. The only downside is that they charged $20 per day parking fee, but included 'free valet', which was efficient and friendly. I suppose they get away with charging this in the summer months, but in the winter, it seems a bit high - and I'm from Chicago. Overall though, worth every penny and would highly recommend this lovely oceanfront hotel!

Reviews.Title: “Relaxed Elegance At The Awesome Pacific Terrace Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: jcjintegrity
Reviews.Content: All of the wonderful things written by other Trip Advisor reviewers are echoed by us. The BEST things, of course, are the location and the incredible view and sound of the Pacific Ocean. The facility is fabulous, and the staff bends over backwards to please their guests. They sincerely seemed to want to do whatever they could to make us happy. When we checked in on Sunday, 1/18, the consierge, Katherine, made us feel like we were the most important people in the hotel with her attention to detail, patience, and efficiency in meeting our requests. On the last day of our stay, the front desk gave me enough post cards so that I could give one to each of my students back home. Everything inbetween was exceptional, too. We were fortunate to stay off-season, when the room prices were discounted by 50%. So the price wasn't extremely expensive, just very expensive. Still, we felt that we got our money's worth and then some! We stayed in a 600-square-foot junior suite on the thrid floor with a full ocean view, a King bed, and a breakfast bar. Here are some tips that I don't recall reading in the other reviews: **We discovered that the view was even better when we took the tall breakfast stools out onto the balcony. Then we didn't have to look through the bars to see the ocean. **There is a silent but very effective ceiling fan in the bedroom area that helped to keep the air circulating. The temperature was perfect so we left the patio door open all day long. **The sliding shutter doors can be closed to give you absolute darkness & privacy, or can be moved completely out of the way to provide a totally unobstructed view out the patio door and windows. The shutters can be moved to allow just the amount of light or darkness desired. **Separate from the toilet & shower area, there is a large vanity area by the sink, with a giant mirror and a large plug-in makeup mirror. Lots of room to spread out. **The bed is extremely elevated, probably so you can still see the ocean while you're lying down. There are stairs provided in the closet that can be placed by the bed if you need help getting in and out of the bed! It is unbelievable comfortable, and we slept extremely well. **We slept best with the patio door shut tightly at night. It was very quiet, but you could still faintly hear the beating of the waves. **The $9 breakfast was actually about $27 for two people, when you add in the required gratuity, tax, and a tip for the server delivering it to our room. But it was large, hearty, and very tasty. Great to eat breakfast on the patio as we watched the ocean & the people passing by on the boardwalk! **We observed daily testing and/or cleaning of the pool and hot tub by pool professionals. My husband felt that the chemical balance and temperatures were perfect. **Even during the off season, the $20 per night for parking was well worth it. Easy in, easy out, safe, secure, and convenient. **The best part of the trip was our time at the hotel or on the beach. Why go anywhere else when you're in the perfect location with comfort and luxury all around you? During the day, the ocean, beach, boardwalk, and nearby shops and restaurants were all we needed. Watching the sun go down as we sat on our balcony was breathtaking every evening. After dark, the in-room movies were nice entertainment, for a fee of course. **We purchased pop & snacks at a nearby store to stock our refrigerator so we weren't tempted by the goodies in the mini-bar. In the Carribean Room, coffee & tea were always available, there was iced tea and lemonade in the afternoon, and freshly-baked cookies are at the front desk at 4:00 p.m. Yum! **Twice we ate at the Crab Catcher in La Jolla, about 20 minutes away by car, but you'll need good directions to get there. The hotel concierge can make the reservation and will get you great seating. Delicious food, beautifully presented. See if you can get Michelle to be your waitress -- she was delightful! The worst thing about being at the Pacific Terrace Hotel is when you have to leave. I was actually seriously depressed for about a day after we left! We're already starting to save for our next trip. Comfort and elegance combine to make this place a haven for the weary soul. We can't wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “The Best Place to Stay in Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: DPJChicago
Reviews.Content: Not only tastefully decorated, but very comfortable as well. Of course, you can't beat the location and the view. The hotel staff was friendly, professional and very accommodating. Don't fuse with taxi service, contact the hotel and hire Carlos. He is a great driver, reliable and knows the city well.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel! Great Location!”
Reviews.Author: apodko
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at this hotel for 4 nights in January and we both loved it. We are both 24 I am not picky but my friend is and she loved the Pacific Terrace Hotel. There are no restaurants on site but there are diners, bars, and many other restaurants within easy walking distance. They do provide Starbucks coffee in the morning and throughout the day, an actual Starbucks is less than a 10 min walk away. The staff was always extremely nice, the rooms are excellent, we used our robes a lot especially to walk to the hot tub at night. The rain shower heads could use more pressure but an extra minute or two in the shower really shouldn't be something to whine about. Weekend rates are expensive but if you travel during the week search rates often because you can find a great deal. The only legitimate complaint that I think anyone could have is the parking fee but if your not lazy and don't mind a short walk you can find a place to park.

Reviews.Title: “Nice hotel in scenic location”
Reviews.Author: syee99
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Pacific Terrace during a recent road trip out to San Diego. The location is nice, right on the beach front, and far enough away from the bars so you don't get too much of the traffic and noise associated with it. Rooms were very clean and spacious - I got the economy room with no view (although there is a slight view from the balcony). The mini fridge and microwave was a bonus. Beds were comfy, and the plasma TV's are a nice touch, especially with the large number of high def channels they had available. It's one of the few times I've actually wanted to stay in my hotel room instead of going out. As another reviewer had mentioned, I was expecting a continental breakfast since I had read somewhere that it was provided. Unfortunately, it's not offered anymore, and breakfast is now a $12 option. Dennys and iHop was close by so I didn't bother with the in house stuff, and just went to one of the many local restaurants nearby for breakfast. The $20 parking was a bit steep too, but with the limited on street parking, you'll probably want to pony up the $20 for it if you're going to be there during peak season. I was there during the winter, and parking was still a little scarce at times. The front desk staff was very friendly and accommodating. They greeted me by name when they saw me which was actually quite surprising and a nice personal touch. They also offered to help with my bags which was also nice. Turndown service every evening is a nice touch that you only find in higher end hotels. Overall, a nice hotel. Very modern, comfortable, and nice location. Stay there if you get a chance.

Reviews.Title: “Renovations disappointing”
Reviews.Author: numero2wo
Reviews.Content: We have been coming to the Pacific Terrace for medical reasons every other month since 2000. In the past couple of years, "renovations" have occurred which "justify" rate increases. What are those renovations? Huge, bulky, dark sleigh beds which make the large rooms small and make it difficult to get into and out of bed; terrible pea green paint on walls which also make room appear smaller; They replaced the regular shower heads with Rain shower heads which hit you on the top of your head and make it impossible to shower without drenching your head; the final straw is they used to have a wide variety for a super continental breakfast available in a main floor room. That is done now. No more. Finito. Now you have to order the night before for delivery at a specific time and choose from basic boring options. The hotel manager seems to have made every effort to take a great hotel and ruin it with "renovations" to justify rate increases. We are moving to the Embassy suites.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace never disappoints”
Reviews.Author: sunseeker073
Reviews.Content: We have stayed at the Pacific Terrace many times. We recently stayed at the Pacific Terrace with our children The property has been renovated beautifully. The staff couldnot have been more helpful. It is a rare find when you can get the boutique hotel feeling while traveling with your family. When we were there with out our children it felt like an exclusive hideaway . When we returned with the kids they fell in love with the Pacific Terrace. Just as we had 5 years earlier. We are looking forward to staying with you all again. We have traveled around the world. Stayed in five star accomadations,Pacific Terrace by far is one of our favorites. Thank you for another wonderful stay. The Burrell Family

Reviews.Title: “Not what we were expecting!”
Reviews.Author: Kimi_Smith
Reviews.Content: We were extremely disappointed in the hotel. The employees were very nice but beyond that we could not wait to leave. The carpet was dirty and the bed was very incomfortable. When we initially entered the room it was stuffy and smelly! Our "partial view" did in fact have an ocean view but it was directly over the street and parking lot. There were car all night and all morning who were coming and going with music blasting and car alarms sounding. This noise was finally drowned out once the bars closed at 2am and the drunk students proceeded to light fireworks, scream and party within an earshot of our room. It was the least peaceful place ever and by far the least romantic! We paid about 30% less than the quoted rate and were angry about paying that amoun for the expierence we had. I can't imagine how livid people are that pay full price! Definately NOT worth the money!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Accommodations !!”
Reviews.Author: KapOhio
Reviews.Content: We made arrangements at the last minute to stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel to celebrate our 25th wedding anniversary, and to watch our son play football at a local university. We had reservations elsewhere, but changed them to be near the ocean for a few days. The moment we walked into the hotel we were greeted by kind and helpful staff, and even offered wine upon our arrival to our room. The staff made sure our room was comfortable ( it was AMAZING!!! ) and that we had all we needed. Everything was wonderful! The grounds were beautiful, the staff in all the areas were friendly and helpful. It was Halloween and they dressed up to celebrate, making it even more relaxed. Our view of the ocean was incredible ( thanks Matt !), and the price was great for the treatment we received ! We weren't sure if the hotel was older because of the picture in the AAA book, or just a retro looking hotel, but it was beautiful, very clean and updated. We plan on returning in two years for another football matchup, and we do plan on staying here again. Thank you Pacific Terrace Hotel for such a warm and welcoming experience !!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Home for Weekend”
Reviews.Author: deredye
Reviews.Content: Awesome hotel! A phenomenal value for the Pacific Beach area, amazing hospitality and no-nonsense luxury hotel. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “Luxury and superb service at the beach”
Reviews.Author: TravelLuvr45
Reviews.Content: We spent a week at the Pacific Terrace and it is truly one of the best hotels we have ever stayed at. We have stayed at luxury hotels in Europe, Hawaii, the Caribbean and throughout the US and I can truly say this one is in our top three - and I'm vert picky. The service is unbelievable and special thanks to Danielle in reservations and the front desk. Danielle and the rest of the staff really make you feel at home. The room was exceptionally clean and was decorated in beautiful tropical decor. The bathroom is marble and there are granite counter tops by the sink which is separated from the toilet/tub area. The pool and hot tub area is landscaped very nicely. Remember that this is a small hotel so there is no restaurant onsite but there are many little restaurants nearby or within a short driving distance. There was a basic breakfast with cereal, breads, fruit, yogurt, juices and coffee included with the room. The service though is unreal and that's what sets this property apart. Thanks everyone!

Reviews.Title: “The word "Awesome" comes to mind....”
Reviews.Author: Gceres
Reviews.Content: Needed a break from life for a night so decided to book a hotel room here after searching endlessly online. Got an amazing deal at $99.00 a night (normal price is $389.00). Was leery as I'd never heard of the hotel before despite living in Pacific Beach before. VERY satisfied! Check-in was seemless....got there at 2:40 and was told room wasn't ready until 4:00 despite being told on the phone it would be ready. After informing the concierge of this, she promptly got us a room. They bring a complementary glass of wine directly to your room shortly after you get there, have an amazing pool area with an ocean view, and offer free coffee and juice all day and night. The room itself is elegant with AWESOME beds (the mattresses were PERFECT!). The 42 inch flat screen television was an added bonus. They have a fully stocked refreshment bar which we didn't utilize but is a plus. The tub was adequate with a great hand-held shower. Phone in the marble tiled bathroom. Wooden shuttered doors to a balcony with chairs and a table....VERY CLEAN! To our surprise, there was even a maid that knocks on the door offering chocolates and turn down service. Oh, and they have the coolest complementary bath robes! Overall, QUITE relaxing and one of the best hotels I've stayed in for a while. Next time I think we'll upgrade and try the jacuzzi suite which was on discount for $299.00 (just out of my price range this time). HIGHLY RECOMMENDED!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous Stay”
Reviews.Author: sassychigal
Reviews.Content: After reading a review on Orbitz - I called the Hotel directly and they honored the online rate. I received the best service from everyone. My room was HUGE - non ocean view with a big HG TV. The b-fast was good as was the happy hour from 4 - 5pm. The location was amazing and the pool was great.

Reviews.Title: “Nice rooms, good beach location”
Reviews.Author: dctrips
Reviews.Content: We had a good stay at Pacific Terrace Hotel. We got a good deal on a non-ocean view, but ended up getting a room with patio views to the ocean. The ocean is literally in front of the hotel with easy access (and easy to rent a wetsuit and surfboard to go surfing here too). Good continental breakfast in the morning and free iced tea, lemonade and water throughout the day. Friendly and accommodating staff that helped us out even hours before check-in time. Getting into downtown San Diego involves a bit of freeway driving, which can be a bit tedious and longer of a drive than we expected.

Reviews.Title: “Will stay there any time I'm in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: TJBSEA
Reviews.Content: This hotel lived up to the pictures and reviews on Orbitz.com. The staff was always very friendly, gave great restaurant recommendations. The rooms were very clean, new, large plasma HD tvs, porches with shutters, clean and modern bathrooms, all fixtures in great shape and more tasteful than your average "tropical" designs. There is a free wine reception from the patio just outside the pool from 4pm to 5pm. The gated porch and pool area opens right out onto the boardwalk. Great views of Crystal Pier and overall just an awesome laid-back feeling in Pacific Beach. Close to great restaurants and 15 minutes from La Jolla.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Location, little overpriced”
Reviews.Author: TicTacToeFamily
Reviews.Content: We stayed in an ocean view suite ie king bed and sleeper sofa. Sleeper sofa was supposed to be queen but one 7 year old barely fit. The accommodations themselves were above average but not excellent, though they were very clean. The staff here are definitely their best asset. Friendly, approachable and just very hospitable all round. Also very family friendly. The breakfast on offer was cheap and unappetizing, considering the price of a $550 a night suite - yogurt, dry muffins, bagels and pretty bad coffee. Had to pay for parking each night - it should be included in the price of the pricey rooms! The view from our room was spectacular. To be able to open the doors and have an unobstructed ocean and sunrise/ sunset view was unbelievable. But right outside of the hotel ie in front of all the rooms is a very busy boardwalk, which kept going pretty much all of the time so patio privacy was a little limited. But the beach itself was also very close and accessible so it was a fair trade off. Local area is pretty run down but seemed safe enough. We found several very good family run type restaurants within 10 minutes walking distance which were reasonable and good.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Place To Stay”
Reviews.Author: Bo C
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed there for three nights in October 2008 and we loved it. The hotel is about 30 years old but the owner has done a great job renovating it. We paid an extra $50 (for a total of $200) per night to upgrade our hotel to a junior suite that has a perfect view of the Pacific Ocean. Our room was clean, roomy and well appointed. The pool and hot tubs were great. We loved the large comfortable bed and the 52” plasma hi-def TV. The hotel has free wi-fi Internet, serves great breakfasts and even provides free wine samples in the afternoons. We loved having our breakfasts in the garden patio. The location is also great as it is about 15-20 minutes from La Jolla and downtown San Diego. The only minor annoyances I have are the hotel charges you $20 per day for parking and the beach in front of the hotel has a lot of seaweeds. Other than that, we’re extremely pleased and would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it and would absolutely go back!”
Reviews.Author: cammi2001
Reviews.Content: We stayed there from 9/29/08-10/3/08 and it was awesome! There was four of us in the non-ocean view room on the 1st floor. It was me, my husband, 3 yr old son, and 1 yr old son. The staff was friendly and very helpful. Even though, it was a non-ocean view room....we were able to go out to our patio and see it from there. It was quiet and just perfect for us. Our room didn't come with a microwave, but they found one for us and moved it in. It was fast service.....within 15 minutes! Then our fridge stopped working. I called the front desk....they apologized right away and immediately a replacement fridge came. (within 15 minutes again) I am just amazed at how fast the staff react to guest requests cause most hotels take forever to get you anything ( in my experience, anyways). The staff were kid-friendly. My kids loved it here. This was our 1st time in San Diego and a trip that will always be remembered. We were able to stay on the beach, go to the Zoo, SeaWorld, and Legoland. And after a fun-filled and exhausting day, come back to a quiet relaxing atmosphere. There is nothing bad I can say about this place at all.

Reviews.Title: “It was okay”
Reviews.Author: smtsmith
Reviews.Content: After looking for hotels in the SD area, we decided on Pacific Terrace, eventhough it was over priced, we wanted to enjoy the the beach instead of staying in downtown. The overall stay was "okay." The staff was very friendly, and the continental breakfast was alright, not great. What really bothered us, was the AC. My husband likes it very cool in our room, and the AC was not working properly, and it would get up to 82 degrees in the room. We called an had this worked on 3 times within 2 days. I would have appriceated if they offered to change the room, but they did not. The AC was still not working properly, upon our check out. We told the front desk upon check out what had happened during our stay, and she just smiled and said "sorry." Which leads me to beleive that this might be a common problem. I would expect staying at a pricey hotel, prolems like this would be handled better.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed stay”
Reviews.Author: equestrianesse
Reviews.Content: I will preface this review by explaining that we found a great rate on Orbits ($200 a night for ocean front) and then were upgraded to a Presidential Suite (which is usually $580 a night). I really enjoyed how friendly and helpful the staff were- it is quite common to deal with quite rude people, so I liked how nice everyone was. The room was beautiful, clean and spacious. I liked the jacuzzi tub very much, and the toiletries were amply replenished every day. No on-site restaurant, but we had a car and didn't want to stay at the hotel anyway. If you do not have a car, there are many restaurants in easy walking distance. The beach is right there. For those who complain that this isn't "beach front" as you have to walk down a couple steps, that seems a silly complaint to me. They can't help it that the beach is naturally lower than the land. It's nature, people. I am not sure what the previous reviewer meant about self-parking as we only saw a valet. It was $20, but we discovered that many hotels make you pay for parking when we stayed at a hotel that charged $30 the next weekend in LA. A very nice place, but I would not pay full price as it was not worth that much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice enough but way overpriced”
Reviews.Author: sawbo2
Reviews.Content: Hotel is indeed on the beach and we had a lovely view from our room. However lots of the rooms faced a really rough site - shed -like buildings and concrete. The room itself was clean and well laid out with a small balcony. The whole hotel (inside and out) is painted in a dreary khaki/olive paint which makes it look dull and hostel like. The pool is very small but looks out onto the ocean. The staff were all pleasant (bit put off when I saw Bell boy spitting!) and helpful. Our total stay cost $2559 for 4 nights which included $80 for parking (self parking!!) Parking at the Bellagio in Vegas was free so felt this was a bit steep! The area is ok but no nice restaurants nearby. More surfer type locale really. Breakfast is ok (not great) and no restaurant on site. Definitely way over priced.

Reviews.Title: “Great Spot”
Reviews.Author: Mctcfitz
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace for the 5 or 6th time this summer. This was our first trip without the kids. This is a great place with or without our 4 small kids. The hotel sets on Diamond Street right on the beach. It is elevated from the beach so you have to walk down stairs or a ramp. One nice thing about this is there isn't nearly as much traffic and people hanging around as down south in Mission Beach. The beach used to be overrun with homeless but they've obviously made an effort to clean this up. There are still some but the area much nicer than it used to be. The hotel has continental breakfast and afternoon wine hour. There aren't any onsite restaurants but you can get room service from the many restaurants nearby. Very easy to walk down the beach and find pretty good dining as well as fast food up on Mission Boulevard. The hotel has been refurbished in the last few years and is very nice, marble bathrooms, kitchenettes, just great. We stayed in one of the premiere suites in the middle of the hotel, which was very nice. Overall, this is the most relaxing and nice hotel. The staff is very friendly but it has a very casual atmosphere so very comfortable. The views are the best, the beach is nice (Not as nice as Coronado), the pool is warm, and the hot tub good enough. The windbreak around the pool is great. La Jolla is only a 5-10 minute drive. Overall one of our favorite places

Reviews.Title: “Even better than I remember”
Reviews.Author: ebowen
Reviews.Content: Stayed the first week of August with my Mother and 5 year old nephew for a family vacation. Had stayed here many time in the past but it had been years. The last time I stayed it was in need of remodeling and boy did they. The room are completely remodeled...freshly painted, new furniture, large flat screen tv, etc. The grounds and location are beautiful as always. The exterior of the property has been painted and cleaned and looks modern. They also updated their patio furniture and added a beach bed. Can't beat this location on Pacific Beach...still love watching the surfers in the morning. Continental breakfast by the pool is complimentary and we very much enjoyed it every day. Cereal, fruit, breads, bagels, juices, hard-boiled eggs, etc. Room service is provided by a couple of local restaurants and was great. Concierge also did a great job of recommending some nice kid friendly restaurants. There is valet parking and underground parking for a daily fee. Overall, still a wonderful property. Can't wait to come back!

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel in Pacific Beach!”
Reviews.Author: ryanwhite17
Reviews.Content: This was my newly wife and I's (we stayed at Pacific Terrace for our honeymoon) first time staying in San Diego and I couldn't have asked for better. Before we even got to the hotel the concierge went above and beyond my needs to make us happy and set everything for as soon as we got there. Once we got there we were met, as we were every other time during our stay, promptly and respectfully by the valet boy and the front desk personnel. Once we got to our room we were astonished by the effort they out into our room (I asked for a heart shaped rose on the bed and a cookie bouquet) and they threw in a free bottle of wine. They then called two times right away once we got to our room to check to see if we needed anything. They checked our room twice everyday, once in the morning and once for turn-down service. Every person there had a great attitude, smile on there face, and worked to ensure our gratification. The view and location couldn't have been better. Walking distance to anything and everything and the beach is right in front of you. When we left the hotel the car was already pulled in front, the valet came up to get our luggage and even placed water bottles in the car for us for the ride home. Definitely and HOME AWAY FROM HOME!

Reviews.Title: “Nice place, but worth it?”
Reviews.Author: Moirende
Reviews.Content: My wife, almost four year old daughter and I just got back from a week at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. We stayed in one of the "Family Suites" because we wanted a bit of a kitchen available so we didn't always have to feed our little girl restaurant food all the time. Here's what I liked about it: - If you want a "beach" holiday in San Diego, the hotel is perfectly located for that; its right there on a very nice one - The local area is great for walking around. Not a lot of high end restaurants, but quite a few mid-range / family friendly ones to choose from, all walking distance - Reasonable drive to Sea World, the Zoo, Old Town, downtown, etc. - Excellent front desk staff; always extremely helpful - Excellent room staff - Prepare to be surprised by how nice the furniture is. - LOVED the two 40" flat screen hi-def TVs with DVD's. Here's what was not so much: - Bell service... hmm... called for assistance with the inflatable sofa bed. No one ever came. My wife eventually figured it out. - Gave up on the valet parking by the end of the first day. There was NEVER anyone out front when we were coming and going, so we just got used to parking ourselves. - Last day wake up call... asked for 8:00am, got it at 8:18am. How hard is it to get that, of all things, right? Good thing we weren't in a hurry to catch our plane... this alone would make it impossible for me to ever consider staying here on a business trip - Standard collection of all the usual hotel annoyances... cracked wine glasses, sinks that don't drain properly (and the SMELL when they don't...), only tolerably clean carpet, one of the phones didn't work, yada yada yada. - The pool is definitely on the small side, and some days it was a challenge getting a lounger. In the end, while we enjoyed our stay there, we wouldn't go back. Or at least if we did, we wouldn't stay in the family suite, which cost us over $600 per night. At $100 - $200 per night sure, I'll put up with the little stuff, its kind of expected. But for $600 a night the whole experience should be top notch from start to finish, not just parts of it. Frankly, take away the super nice furniture and TVs and basically the average Marriott Suites is going to give you virtually the exact same experience... at a third the price.

Reviews.Title: “A lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: welshbelle
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel for one night last month before moving on to a rented house in La Jolla. The hotel receptionist was delightful and exceptionally helpful. On arriving we were told that we had been upgraded to an executive suite which naturally made us feel well disposed to the hotel. Our room was lovely and was probably almost as large as our room in the Venetian in Las Vegas had been. It had a good size kitchen and dining area and two sofas. The bathroom was enormous and had a spa bath and TV. Although the furniture was not brand new, the room was exceptionally clean and the beds were very very comfortable. We had a partial ocean room which looked down the boardwalk. The hotel is right on the beach and there is plenty going on around it. The pool was quite small which could be a problem if you didn't like the beach. The hotel gym was very small. Although we really liked the hotel I don't think that I would want to stay here for more than a few nights. Personally we preferred La Jolla Shores as an area even though it was not as busy at night.

Reviews.Title: “Superb location, a bit over-priced”
Reviews.Author: DamLou
Reviews.Content: Booked here because of tripadvisor reviews. Not disappointed, but overall it is pricey for what you get. Pacific Beach area of San Diego is a laid-back and scenic extent of beach that doesn't suffer the pretentiousness of La Jolla, or the city feel of the San Diego centre. This is a small hotel with some great features, including: good breakfast included, great complimentary wines at 4pm daily, twice daily room service with turn-down service, sumptuous bath-robes provided in room, in-room fridge, huge TV, heated pool and plastic wind-barriers round the pool so even when a chill sea-breeze blows, it is hot sitting round the pool. Above all, it is located above a really attractive beach, and there is a great view of the sunset from the beach. However, parking is extra, a rollaway air-bed is extra, and the total cost is similar to a 5 star hotel, which is I think hard to justify. It is a compact hotel, and when busy, it can feel squashed with insufficient space around the pool..Hotel is in a "V" shape, with a south and a north wing. The South wing rooms get best views of ocean and sunset, and they get sun on the balcony, the north wing rooms don't, apart from the top floor. So ask to be in South wing if you like sun and sunsets, and north wing if you don't! Oh - really good Thai just around the corner, 5 mins away, cheap but really authentic taste. Glad I stayed there?- yes - But would I choose it again? - no.

Reviews.Title: “Great Honeymoon Choice”
Reviews.Author: MarcandCiara
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace as part of our Highway 1 Honeymoon Road Trip. We booked online a few days before arriving on the strength of the reviews on this website and we weren't disappointed. The hotel is in a great location, right on the beach and on a quiet street but close enough to bars and restaurants to make going out for the evening without the car very easy - not always a given in the US. (Take your passport though, bars on Garner will only accept a passport as proof of age, drivers licence is not enough) The hotel staff we very pleasant and friendly and the rooms huge. Rooms were cleaned to perfection and the turndown service was a real treat - even got chocolates on our pillows! The afternoon wine reception was a welcome treat after a day's sightseeing and a day at Seaworld - nothing quite beats a glass of rose wine while soaking in a hot tub on the coast of the Pacific! I would absolutely recommend this hotel - look no further, stay here!

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful hotel with excellent customer service”
Reviews.Author: dar362
Reviews.Content: This hotel is a beautiful hotel in awesome location right on the beach. We were on the 2nd floor with an ocean view room, the view was spectacular espeacially at sunset. What really makes this hotel special is the customer service. The staff goes above and beyond to make your stay here a special and memorable one. The nightly turndown service with the chocolates was something we looked forward to nightly. The daily wine and cheese sampling should not be missed. The staff here is superb and I will definately return.

Reviews.Title: “Quality hotel perfectly on the beach...”
Reviews.Author: BobMcGS
Reviews.Content: This is a high class hotel beside the Ocean on San Diego's Pacific Beach. My wife, two teenagers and I stayed for four nights sharing an Ocean view room. Everything was of a very high standard with first-rate cleanliness (key to any hotel) not only in the lobby but all corridors, the bedroom and pool area. The HD flatscreen room tv was an unexpected bonus. The room and bathroom were a good size. Staff were always friendly and professional. They were keen that everything was excellent. The location was excellent too with a variety of restaurants in walking distance. The hotel allowed us to take some towels down to the beach for an exhilarating swim in the waves. Parking was in a reassuringly secure underground garage. Highly recommended.

Reviews.Title: “nice hotel but over-priced”
Reviews.Author: a visitor from ireland
Reviews.Content: This is everything that the other reviewers have written. Lovely sea views, nice beach, good staff, great rooms but a bit over-priced for what you get. For 550 dollars a night you would normaly get a hotel with more facilities and a bit of soundproofing (very thin walls made for disturbed sleep). Also the additional 20 dollars for parking and 55 dollars tax meant a whopping 625 dollars per night. However, the room was clean, comfortable with a fantastic view of the ocean. The wine at 4pm was a nice touch. Breakfast was basic, the pool area is nice. There are a lack of up-market restaurants nearby. Tower 23 is quite good but the rest seem to be very casual/family orientated.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful location”
Reviews.Author: gjob
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace hotel was very good but expensive. I stayed in a suite which was brilliant apart from the fact that you can hear everything in the room next door. The decor was very good as was the room appointment with a beautiful balcony/view along the beach. It cost approx €1200 for our 3 nights stay which compared to every other hotel suites we stayed in California during our visit was excessive. There is no restaurant within the hotel so the continental breakfast was just ok, I would have expected more for the price.The staff however were very attentive & I could not fault them.

Reviews.Title: “The best”
Reviews.Author: Simon14
Reviews.Content: The PTH is everything that they say. Upon check in we were offered an upgrade to a ocean front room on the 2nd floor, which we took. I highly recommend taking the upgrade, if offered, it was worth it. We had a HUGE room with kitchen and lovely bathroom. Balcony faced the ocean, about 40 yards away. wonderful. The last couple of nights there, a large party booked the suite above us and at about 2 am. tramped around like a herd of elephants. The following night, the same issue, just starting at 9pm or so. I would recommend asking for a 3rd floor room to eliminate being effected by this sort of rudeness from other people who believe they are the only hotel guests that exist. The hotel was not at fault, but I mentioned it to the front desk upon check out and the upgrade fee was waived! Very nice! The front desk staff was very nice and do everything they can to make your stay pleasant. They go above and beyond at every opportunity. The neighborhood was not bad, no different then any other beach side community. Some homeless, but by far outnumbered by tourists and surfers. I would have felt safe staying there by myself. The garage is expensive, but worth it. I also would suggest getting tickets to the attractions at the front desk and saving the time in line at Seaworld, SD Zoo etc. . . . Go to La Jolla and check out the seals! It's a short 10 minute bike ride and really cool!!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay!”
Reviews.Author: kelb
Reviews.Content: We picked Pacific Terrace because it was on the beach, it had rooms remaining when we booked at the last minute, and also because it is #1 rated on tripadvisor.com of all hotels in San Diego - that is an amazing feat! If you want a real California beach experience, great people watching, and an easy walk to some good restaurants, stay here. It is also very easy to access any place you might be going in San Diego - downtown is only a 10-15 minute drive. The hotel is everything that the reviews claim. You will smile a lot,. and you will be surprised. For us the surprises included an enormous room with full kitchen, even though we apparently had the lowest priced room on the property - #126. The comfort level of our room brought to mind the luxury of the Hotel at Mandalay Bay in Las Vegas. The huge LG flat screen TV is worth the cost of admission! The free breakfast is so ample that we had little interest in lunch. The wine party at 4 PM is a riot - they serve decent wines, and the servers come by and refill your glass if they catch you not returning to the bar! It's a great way to start a fun evening, though it would probably work better at 5 rather than 4. The gated underground parking is well worth $20 a day since it takes one more worry off your mind. There were always open spaces. The staff at the hotel has a huge bias for yes...it seems as though they have figured out that if they just give guests whatever they ask for, life will be smooth. We have to withhold one star for the lack of any restaurants on site. Other than that, it is hard to find fault with the Pacific Terrace and its beautiful surroundings. For an authentic California surfer experience, have a burger and beer at the Bare Back Lounge, just a couple of blocks from the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!!!! Above and beyond my expectations......”
Reviews.Author: IceCream30
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at Pacific Terrace Hotel on 6/6/08 in celebration of our anniversary. When researching hotels in the area, I came across a couple of travel sites with old outdated pictures, when I went directly to the hotels site, I was surprised at how lovely the rooms were. I called the hotel to confirm, that the pictures on their site were current, and I was told that all the rooms have been completely remodeled. I booked a partial view double bed room for 159.00 plus tax (what a bargain) since the price for that class room is normally 440.00 The only downfall was no king bed. I requested for for a room on the 3rd floor, I was told that they couldn't guarantee it, but that he would note that I am requested a room on the 3rd floor. After reading several reviews, I had mixed feelings, but it was really the only beachfront hotel I could find in the 200.00 price range, that looked maintained. The staff was super friendly, attentive and professional. I have never been to a hotel that every class (bellboy, front desk, house keeping, cafe, security) of employee was kind, courteous and willing to bend over backward to accommodate your needs. This hotel is VERY customer service orientated. Upon check in, I asked if they could accommodate us with a king bed, mentioned we were celebrating our anniversary (really tried). Unfortunately they were unable to do so, since they were completely booked. They were able to accommodate my request for the 3rd floor, as the view is so much nicer. Some reviewers complaining about the 20.00 underground parking, but the peace of mind is worth it, very safe, key access only, and direct access from hotel elevator. The room decor was very inviting and up to date. Nice dark solid wood beds, granite counter tops, marble bathroom, huge plasma TV, ipod player clock radio, snack bar, coffee maker, iron, blow dryer, safe. The room was immaculate, and well stocked with towels, comfy bathrobes, bath goods even q-tips & cotton balls. The beds were very comfortable, pillows were fluffy, the sheets were high thread count and super soft. The balcony was spacious, with 4 chairs and a table. Our room was facing South toward the pier, and it was an amazing view. I could have sat on that balcony our whole visit just listening to the waves crash and people watched. There was a little parking lot below our balcony, that was normally occupied by surfers. I had a blast watching the surfers change in and out of wetsuits in the parking lot, lol. It was a little noisy at times (car alarms, beeping delivery trucks, ice cream truck) but I didn't mind, I liked all the action. I do have to say that there were quiet allot of homeless people in this area (most beach areas are this way), but I never felt unsafe or threatened in anyway as they just mind thier own business.
