Lots of restaurants, clubs and shopping on Garnet which is about a 3 block walk. This area is populated by allot of young college students, majority is 25 and under. There were a few nicer restaurants like Jordan at Tower 23 hotel which is 2-3 hotels down from PTH that had a more mature crowd 30 and over. It's definatley a lively happening area, which my husband and I enjoy. We live in Los Angeles so we are used to this type of atmosphere, it might be a little shocking to people who are not accustomed to this. Beach access is super close and easily accessed through the pool area which is accessed with your room key. We didn't use the pool/spa, but it looked really nice, heated, ton of towels and lounge chairs. I did notice allot of families on the lower level and pool are which is were the family suites are located. Which might be a little odd if you are there for a romantic getaway or honeymoon. Some little perks that make ALL the difference in feeling pampered........... Free iced tea, lemonade, Starbucks coffee (self serve) Basket of apples and fresh baked cookies in the lobby Free wine from 4-5PM in the cafe (self serve) Turn-down service, with Belgium chocolates on your pillow Basket of towels in front of every room in the morning Continental breakfast included I was expecting danishes, cereal and fruit, but the variety was impressive. 5-6 different types of pastries and muffins Bagels, croissants, english muffins (variety of cream cheeses, jams, peanut butter) Fresh fruit, variety of melons, oranges, apples, bananas Variety of hot and cold cereals Boiled eggs Yogurt Starbucks coffee, Tazo teas, Juices, milk The dining area seats about 15, but there are several tables right outside the cafe around the pool or you can get a tray and take your food to your room. If you really want to be pampered, for 12.00 you can put in a request the night before to have breakfast delivered to your room. I myself, got a tray and took it up to my room and enjoyed breakfast on the balcony watching the sun come up. This hotel went above and beyond my expectations, I will definatley be visiting PTH on a regular basis when I need to getaway with my hubby. Hopefully I can get a budget friendly rate again in the future, because $440 is a little steep. The only thing I disliked was the early check out time of 11:00am. I have stayed at allot of hotels and resorts, and I can confidently say that this was one of my best experiences. So go ahead and BOOK IT!!!! ENJOY!!!!

Reviews.Title: “Great Friendly Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZN8TIV
Reviews.Content: This was a last minute book but so glad we did it. The hotel is in a perfect spot away from most of the crowded beachstrand of Pacific Beach. It literally is on a bluff overlooking the ocean and within 30 yards of the stairs to take you down below to the sand. The check in process what very easy and best of all the hotel has underground parking for a stressfree nightsleep. They have a nice little wine hour and free continental breakfast. There's no shortage of towels and the landscaping for a small property is lush and inviting. Hopefully some of my pictures will convey the boutique atmosphere and the closeness to the coast. We'll be back.

Reviews.Title: “Great value, nice extras”
Reviews.Author: Familiafour
Reviews.Content: We booked a room at this hotel, at the last minute, based on Tripadvisor reviews. We were very happy with our stay. The hotel had great staff, from the bellhop/valet to front desk staff, to the buffet helpers. Their advice on what to do in San Diego was right on. We stayed in an ocean view room on the top floor. The rooms were clean, comfortable and spacious with a great flat screen TV and turn down service available. Bathroom was clean and modern. Outside the door in the morning was a basket of extra towels if we wanted it! The staff printed out our boarding passes for our flight the next day and printed out mapquest directions to a restuarant of our choice. By the way "The Fishery" was close by, casual, moderately priced and a great choice for seafood. Wish we could have stayed longer. We had the breakfast buffet, that is included in the room price, which was adequate with a lot of fresh fruit, baked goods, cereals and Starbucks and staffed by two ladies. It is a small, well run hotel. Good view of the beach. Short walk down some stairs to get to the beach. We loved the personal attention we got from the staff. Thank you to Laura, Kevin, Chris and Cindy!

Reviews.Title: “Hmmm.....trusted Tripadvisor and badly let down”
Reviews.Author: Danash
Reviews.Content: We had booked a 4 day stay to finish off a tour of the California Coast and selected this hotel primarily on the basis of the reviews here. I am at a loss as to how this can be the number one hotel in the lively San Diego area. On check in the Receptionists asked us if we wanted to upgrade to a King junior suite for an extra $30 a night - which we did but were shown to a North facing ground floor room with a view of the street and if you looked really hard the ocean on the horizon. We went back down and switched to a room facing the pool. The rooms were Ok and the staff were nice. Our real surprise came when we went out to look for dinner - the neighbourhood is terrible. You pass hoboes and bag ladies on your way to the main strip. Having been in San Francisco, Carmel and Napa ont his trip so far this was the first time we felt nervous for our safety. After a hurried burger in a very low quality bar - complete with warring spouses we returned to our room watched a movie and checked out as early as possible the next morning. ( The breakfast is appalling by the way ) I am writing this from the 19th floor of the Marriot Downtown having spent two lovely days by the pool and experiencing the atmosphere of this lively city. If you want to see San Diego - the Pacific Terrace is not the place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Great spot for seeing San Diego with 2 kids”
Reviews.Author: Mayadog
Reviews.Content: Our family of four (two boys age 7 and 9) recently stayed at this hotel and loved it! We loved the location and found it easy to get to all of our destinations---Legoland, Seaworld, Zoo etc. Staff was very helpful. Rooms were very nice, breakfast was more than adequate but the locations made it for us. We watched dolphins and surfers from our room and were able to walk to a variety of good restaurants. I was also very impressed with how quiet the hotel was each night. Despite a full-house, including a packed room of Bachelorette party girls across the hall, we had a good night sleep every night. We kept the sliding door open and could hear waves crashing. The concierge service was nice and helpful but we were usually able to get better rates at the attraction (particularly Legoland) with our AAA card. Don't miss the Scripts Aquarium! Our kids loved it and it was an easy drive through cool La Jolla to get there.

Reviews.Title: “Best hotel ever”
Reviews.Author: rachaar
Reviews.Content: This is an absolutely beautiful hotel with an incredibly helpful and friendly staff. Other than two people in a major fistfight in the apartment complex across the street while we were checking in (which of course was not the hotel's fault) everything was absolutely perfect. My husband was able to upgrade our room from a 2-queen room to a king bed ocean-view junior suite for only $25 more a night four days before we arrived for our honeymoon. My parents (unbeknownst to us) called a few days before our arrival to order a gift basket to be placed in the rooms for us newlyweds and said that the people they chatted with were wonderful. We couldn't have been happier, and when we got to our next hotel in Anaheim for the second leg of our trip, although it was theoretically a fancier hotel we really longed for the Pacific Terrace. We will definitely come back here when we return to San Diego. I will say one little thing - we were really surprised by how many families with young kids were staying in the hotel and swarming around the pool. The pool does have very limited adults-only hours but other than that, tons of kids. This isn't really a complaint, we were just a little surprised that a place like this was such a family destination. It was a little jarring on our honeymoon :)

Reviews.Title: “The Pacific Terrace has it all!”
Reviews.Author: kyroby
Reviews.Content: My fiance and I recently stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel and truly LOVED it! The staff was TOP notch and went above and beyond for us. You really feel like more than a room number at this hotel and that is a compliment to every member of the staff. The hotel itself was gorgeous too and the location was terrific-right on the beach. We loved it and should we ever travel to the San Diego area again we will most certainly be staying at the Pacific Terrace!!

Reviews.Title: “Not even Wildfires could stop us from staying.”
Reviews.Author: RBKnoxville
Reviews.Content: We were on a family fall break trip with Disney and Legoland and Sea World all on our agenda. I saw the fabulous ratings on this and other sites and decided to plunge for three nights. When we arrived we found ourselves in the California Wildfire event. We did disney the first two days, but the smoke from the fires did burn our eyes the second day. I was very worried that San Diego was going to be a bigger problem, but my calls to Pacific Terrace were reassuring, so we kept with the plan. I am glad we did. First off, the room was heavenly. Hardwood furniture, big flatscreen tv's in both rooms of the suite, a view of the Pacific, heck we were right on the boardwalk. We were thrilled with the overall hotel and the room. Breakfast was a selection of bakery shop type rolls and danishes and granola with fresh fruit etc. No eggs or waffles, but It was high quality and was probably healthier too. We walked the beach each morning, but the water was too cold for a real swim, but my boy and I did jump in for the thrill. There were great eateries and shops within walking distance which we did use on two nights. Sea world was closed "due to air quality" but the hotel which was close by was fine, so I guess it was more due to the fact that nobody would have shown up. The zoo was awesome and more than made up for it. San Diego was such a great city to visit. The Service was superb. Little details abound which let you know that they care about service to the guests. They give real voice calls for morning wake ups, and one morning the guy told me that he recalled that we were heading back to LA for our flight and he informed me that the interstate was closed. If he hadn't done that we would have missed our plane, fortunately they helped me plan a trip through the mountains east of the fires. Driving was a trip, like going through a cauldron of orange smoke when we neared the fire areas. So glad we braved the wildfires, because San Diego was fun and that hotel was outstanding.

Reviews.Title: “How is this the #1 hotel on TripAdvisor ??”
Reviews.Author: stevewynnerival
Reviews.Content: I honestly cannot understand how this is the #1 rated hotel in San Diego on TripAdvisor. It's incredibly over-rated and very expensive for what is a 3* motel with a great looking pool and sea view. The rooms are floral-themed circa 1978 and are in drastic need of updating. The wash basin is in the room itself which isn't great. The toilet and shower over the bath (which again is like a motel bathroom) are off the room separately. The "free" breakfast is served in pokey, dark room just off the pool - and you have to walk through it to get the pool. Breakfast is cereals, some bagels, bananas, apples and juice so don't get too excited. The pool is nice enough though smoking is allowed and with kids around, not brilliant. There is no pool service for drinks or food. There is some free wine for an hour in the afternoon but no great shakes. There is no restaurant - but there are restaurants locally who will deliver. There is free parking within walking distance of the hotel but it is limited - it's there though. Noise-wise, you can hear other balconies and because the area overlooking the pool is half-moon shaped, can be quite loud, although my 3-year old slept through soundly. For the price, this hotel (motel) is hilariously expensive. It hasn't had much competition in the past, but with hotels like Tower 23 springing up (2 minutes walk from the Pacific Terrace and better in almost every way) I hope they will have to reconsider their proposition. If you think you're going to get a great hotel because of the rate, you won't. But if you're happy with a good motel that has a pool and view and you think it's worth $350+ then book away !

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: tikisuz
Reviews.Content: This was the most romantic place I've been in a long time. The hotel is right off the water, the staff treat you like royalty and overall the experience is just amazing. It's almost too good to be real. Free internet? Free breakfast? What's the catch, right? The answer is no catch, this is just a good quality hotel that might be "rated" 3-4 stars but treats you more like a 5 star. It's like the Ritz Carlton on a budget (even if it's not that cheap). Will try to stay here every time I can on future trips to San Diego. I travel here at least 4 times a year and this is by far the best place I've found with the Southern California vibe and access to restaurants, beaches and bars.

Reviews.Title: “has gone dowhill”
Reviews.Author: shannpann
Reviews.Content: I have stayed at this hotel a few times over the past two years and I am sad to say that it has gone downhill. Two years ago I thought that I had found a gem and was nervous to even tell friends as I wanted to keep the secret to myself. My last stay was a week ago and I booked a partial ocean view for two nights. I knew that the rooms are rarely ready before 4pm so did not bother checking in until my conference was over for the day. Upon check in I was shown where my room assignment was and asked if there were any other rooms (I knew this one was not optimal). The gentleman at the desk told me that they were entirely sold out - he assured me that I would like the room. Needless to say, the room was not acceptable. It was directly over the lobby of the hotel and essentially faced the street with a street light shining in to the room and cars parked behind it. When I called and said that this was not what I had expected - he asked in a snippy voice "can you see the ocean?" to which I replied " not really, there is a light glaring into the room". I told him that I would prefer to check out than stay in this room and then magically there was another room. Both days that I went to the pool there were no towels for the beach or for the pool (only a pile of used towels). In fact, I stood next to a soaking wet man in the lobby the second morning as there were no towels at the pool so he was going back to his room to dry off. The "breakfast buffett" is in a small room that feels rather dirty - you can get a tray and bring items to your room which I recommend. The rooms are still nice although do not feel quite as pristine and new as they did 1-1/2 years ago. I agree with the reviewer who stated that if you have a car, you are roped in to the $20 parking fee as there is sparse overnight parking around the hotel. I am not sure that I will stay here again - would probable consider renting a beachhouse if I needed to be by the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: HJSDenver
Reviews.Content: We loved the Pacific Terrace. It's a nice beach hotel with a great location. We could see the ocean from our room and patio. The hotel has easy access to the sand -- you go out through their keyed entry gate onto the boardwalk, and down a flight of stairs to Pacific Beach. The pool is small but fine. The hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. They sell tickets to area attractions at a small discount, and it was very helpful to have our SeaWorld tickets in advance so we didn't have to wait in lines. The complimentary breakfast was very good, with lots of healthy choices. There is a complimentary wine bar by the pool in the afternoons. We had a big group for a family reunion, including 3 kids under age 12, and everyone was happy. The hotel is expensive, but given the location, we did not feel it was overpriced. However, we would not recommend the "Family Suite". It has 2 queen beds and a sofa bed but only one bathroom, and the room layout felt cramped. We had planned to have Grandma stay with our family of five, but she decided to get her own room because the family suite wasn't quite large enough for 6 people (even though it could sleep 6).

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace Hotel is Over Rated”
Reviews.Author: reagpCalifornia
Reviews.Content: I booked this hotel based on the Trip Advisor's ratings and I found this hotel to be extremely over-rated. We were celebrating our wedding anniversary after several years of marriage and were looking for something different and romantic as my wife would say. I am an appraiser by profession, so I may be a little more critical in my observations. If you like a noisy beach location then this is your place. The hotel is on the beach boardwalk and lies between two feeder streets that lead to the beach. It has underground parking which is another $20 for each night. Considering the amount of beach traffic you really have no other alternative, but to pay the extra $20 for parking so factor that into your costs. We asked for a partial ocean view to take advantage of the beach location and yet to be a little more economical then the very expensive beach front location, but one had to be on the balcony to see the partial view. What was really annoying is that you were directly facing one of the streets I refer to. If you don't mind being bothered at 6 AM by people arriving at the beach then your OK, but like us, we like the slider or window ajar to get fresh air during the night when sleeping. There is late and early traffic on the streets and since the hotel is only 3 stories high you are going to be relatively close to the noisy streets regardless of which floor you are on. We were on the 2nd floor. One noise that could have been avoided is the hotel Help early in the morning. I didn't understand a word they said, but all I know is that there was one hotel worker that appeared to be in charge of the others and she was doing a lot of yelling to her subordinates in the hallway. The doors were not well insulated and we did complain to the hotel about their Help being too loud in the early mornings. The rooms were appointed rather comfortably, however, the large frame beds did make it more difficult to enter the beds, especially if you have small children or older adults who will find it difficult to climb into and out of the beds. Even exiting the beds we were hitting our shins, because the frames came up so high from the floor. Like many hotels, these beds had colorful tropical bed spreads that I would never sit on or lay on and it is obvious these bed spreads are not washed on a daily basis like the sheets are changed. The floors seemed clean and they did provide new slippers, but the slippers were one size fits all and if you wear an 11 shoe like I do then forget it. The bathroom was OK. Only one sink and the water pressure was normal. The bath tub is enclosed with a double glass doors with seals at the bottom of the doors that did not seal and if you took a shower there was more than just a pool of standing water when you exited. We had to use several towels to soak up the water and we also reported this to the hotel, because we thought it would create mold and moisture problems in the walls. The room had other features, like a small refrigerator, microwave, a small wet bar and a big screen TV. There was a hair dryer, a lighted magnifying mirror and ironing equipment. They did provide terrycloth robes that were available for purchase. One feature they did have that was upscale and that my wife enjoyed was the Gilchrist and Soames body bath soaps and cremes. On the other hand, however, what may be a little embarrassing if you are sharing a room with non-intimate guest is using the bathroom. The bath fan was too small and inadequate to ventilate the bathroom odors that penetrated to the entire room immediately. This is a design flaw in the original construction. There is no restaurant in the building, but they do provide a continental breakfast from 6:30 to 10:00 AM. in the exit room to the pool area. There is also Starbucks coffee provided all day that were in dispensors near the pool area. One evening they did have some complimentary inexpensive wines available for tasting in the late afternoon near the pool/patio area. There is a considerable amount of local shopping stores and small fast food local-owned and chain restaurants , but if you want any real fine dining you will need a vehicle to travel up to La Jolla, which is the adjacent city, which is approximately 5 miles north. Our partial ocean view room was $330 and tax was $41.25, parking $20 for a total of $391.25 per night. This price in my opinion is far too much for the accommodations that we had and for that reason and the others mentioned above this hotel is over-rated with Trip Advisor.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: Happymomma
Reviews.Content: Our family of five, including three kids ages 10, 8, and 6, just returned from four nights' stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. What a gem. The pool is warm (good since we had cooler weather), beach is lovely, view from room (we had a jr. suite with premium ocean view on 3rd floor) is beautiful, breakfasts balanced with something for everyone, plus friendly staff, convenient location... no complaints except that it is indeed expensive. That said, we would recommend this hotel highly.

Reviews.Title: “Lives up to the rating of #1”
Reviews.Author: mcclungp
Reviews.Content: Pacific Terrace lives up to the hype with fantastic service, personal attention, great rooms, and beautiful setting. At checkin, even though I was there late they brought a glass of wine to the room. You can hear the waves outside of the room. I had a "partial view" room, which opened onto the terrace with a huge area terrace for my room that then went into the pool. Beautiful walking all around the hotel, and the restaurants around and recommended were superb.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect”
Reviews.Author: eej76
Reviews.Content: Small very nice hotel. Location is great. Right on the water. Bed and room very comfortable. Private and romantic perfect weekend getaway for 2. I would always stay here when in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “awesome boutique hotel”
Reviews.Author: kansasbird
Reviews.Content: Just returned from San Diego area where my family had a reunion at the Pacific Terrace Hotel in Pacific Beach. From the initial reservation to check out, it was overall a terrific experience. The staff is friendly, responsive and competent. The rooms are all a little unique, but each one was very nice- elegant furniture, excellent LG flat screen, great views of the ocean. The concierge was extremely helpful with local restaurants, caterers, attractions, etc. Our entire family of 27 guests in 12 rooms all agreed it was absolutely perfect for our group. The teenagers were able to walk around and have freedom and it felt very safe. There is no on-site restaurant, but plenty in walking distance, and the staff will go get food from area restaurants if you wish. Enjoyed the free breakfast bar of a variety of pastries, fruit, yogurt, juices, coffee, etc. A complimentary wine bar was set up by the pool daily, cookies and fruit at the front desk. Just a very relaxing, beautiful, unpretentious place to chill. We'll definately be back!

Reviews.Title: “Outstanding!!!”
Reviews.Author: zman-nh
Reviews.Content: The view, the room, the location, the comfortable bed-----all perfect! This is absolutely a great place to stay.

Reviews.Title: “You SHOULD stay here”
Reviews.Author: hcrMassachusetts
Reviews.Content: We stayed in a suite and had friends who stayed in a room with 2 queen beds. Both rooms were superb, clean, and equipped with fridges. The front desk staff, anyone with whom we interacted, was pleasant and helpful. The pool was clean and WARM! The hot tub was clean and HOT! Enjoy the wine tastings, advice for local restaurants and places to go. I am happy to be more specific for you via email.

Reviews.Title: “Great Staff, good hotel, odd area”
Reviews.Author: Nrock
Reviews.Content: The hotel is very nice in every respect and the staff was wonderful. It helps that the staff is very small so that by day two or three everyone is familiar. They were very quick to address our needs and always very pleasant. The beach was nice and the heated pool and hot tub were a huge hit with the older two (2,6) of our three boys. The room was very nice and spacious and the balcony was a big bonus. On the negative side, although the walk along the shore/cliffs is very nice the area generally is not very good. Its not dangerous it just not a match for the hotel, lots of bed sheets as curtains and kegs on the front stoops. Its hard to find a bank. We had three little kids and it was a challenge to find somewhere to go for dinner that was interesting to the adults. Overall it was a very good experience. They could really use a restaurant on site though.

Reviews.Title: “Brief stay, but loved every second!”
Reviews.Author: FlipperGirl
Reviews.Content: While we only stayed here for just one night, my boyfriend and I really enjoyed staying at this lovely hotel in Pacific Beach and would stay here again in a heartbeat. It is one of the nicest rooms I've had in a hotel. I don't know what he paid for the room, but he's a great guy. He reserved us one of the King-suite ocean front rooms. It was pretty much in the center of the hotel (kind of shaped like a horseshoe a bit) and I think we had room 316. The balcony was nice sized and felt fairly private even though it overlooked the pool and deck, which is just off the main beach path running throughout PB. We slept with the door wide open at night to the sound of the crashing waves of the ocean. But, it also came with a price. Staff moving deck chairs around in the morning (6 am?) by the pool dragging the metal legs along the concrete as well as a bunch of Marines on their early morning and loud cadence jog. But, did i mention the waves? ;-) The room had gorgeous furniture (a REAL entertainment unit) a huge wide screen LG HD TV, a comfortable bed, enough tables and sitting areas to be comfortable, and lovely decor. The room is decorated throughout with dark wood working such as the crown molding and plantation shutters covering the slider door (no cheesy curtains!). It's very warm, relaxing, and tropical feeling and was reminiscent of a model home in a new housing community. The bathroom consisted of a large wide area near the door with the closet and a nice sink and countertop. One of my few complaints was the screw for the hot water knob was stripped and kept falling off it's base knob. The toliet and tub/shower are in a closed room. The main room had a huge granite counter/bar near the small kitchen area (honor bar, small fridge, microwave). We didn't need any of that (except for the $6 Amstels). Everything was clean, new, and seemed recently painted. My only major complaints are with the towels, they were not that plush or high-end comparing it to the rest of the room's offerings. Robes were provided, though. Also, the pillows on the bed were not that nice (we grabbed two more from the closet). They could use some plusher, down or feather nicer pillows. -The staff are super friendly. -You have to pay for parking in their private garage underneath the building. -We ordered room service which comes from one of two off-site local restaurants (Hennesey's was one). The food was just ok and not that worthy at all of being 5 star (like typical bar food). Too bad they don't have a better restaurant/room service on site. -Location is great, near lots of restaurants, the beach, convenience stores, etc. Though I've never stayed in PB during the high season, it was nice there mid-week in March. Read my other reviews; i'm stingy with the "5 stars". I think this place is really 4.5 on my typical scale, but I'll bump it up to 5. It was the decor and the ocean front....plus I stay in a lot of hotels and this one is just very unique and nice for not being a national high-end hotel chain.

Reviews.Title: “Wow, what a hotel”
Reviews.Author: TXScott
Reviews.Content: I have to have strong feelings one way or another about something - good or bad- to take the time to write a review. This was possibly the best hotel experience I've ever had! I've stayed in fancier hotels, but the overall experience (value for the money, service, comfort, etc) was fantastic. The staff couldn't have been more pleasant or helpful. We were always greeted with a smile and a hello, and they took care of everything we needed promptly. The wine reception was a nice touch, and the continental breakfast is convenient (nothing spectacular). As for the room - beds were VERY comfortable. I'm a light sleeper and can usually only sleep well in my own bed. The only thing I found less than stellar with the room was the smallish size of the tub / shower. Also, we stayed in a premium ocean view room, and I highly recommend spending the extra $$ for one. Fantastic view. Also, it gives you some distance from the pool. There were a couple of kids that were in the pool all day and were pretty loud. We left our balcony door open so we could hear the ocean, which was great, but we could still hear the kids too as a result. I'm glad we weren't on the pool level! We didn't rent a car, but probably should have. The only cab company that didn't rob us blind getting around town was Silver Cab, so they get a free plug from me. Be sure to stop by Hennessey's up the street for lunch. The bleu cheese & bacon burger was the best one I'd had in a while.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel. Amazing Experience.”
Reviews.Author: OttawaDevine
Reviews.Content: I also had a wonderful stay at this hotel. I did base my choice on the tripadvisor reviews and was not dissapointed. The hotel staff all very friendly and accomodating. The hotel itself is very clean, which is my number 1 concern in staying at any hotel. The rooms also very clean and our suite was beautifully decorated and spacious. Comfortable beds in the room. Adequate air conditioning and heating as well. The views of the ocean are amazing and equally beautiful are the sunsets. Free Wireless Internet Access. They also have dimmers on the lights in the vanity area which serves as a nice nightlight. The suites include a microwave and fridge and cuttlery, plates, wine glasses. Just enough if you have a quick snack in your room. They also provide a wine list and a mini bar is available. It was a very nice touch to have a happy hour pool side.The pool was also heated and a Jacuzzi is also onsite. It was cleaned daily and they did a great job. The hotel is on the beach, a mere 5 minute walk ( slow walk). There are a number of restaurants in the area. We only had 2 days and therefore tried only a small sample. There is a great Thai place about 5 minutes down the main street on the right hand side that is amazing! There is also a Dennys for all of you with children who want a family restaurant that is close by. Filippi's Pizza Grotto is disgusting and I would recommend staying away from this place. The food has no flavour and the service matches the food, simply terrible. The firehouse and eggery are also two other good choices. You can walk to many of the restaurants in the area. There is a preffered car available at the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Couldn't have been better”
Reviews.Author: RAGBRAI_rocks
Reviews.Content: I was pleased to find out that the positive reviews for this hotel were valid. I traveled with my husband and 6 year old, we've stayed in plenty of nice and not-so-nice hotels and we were so thankful that we chose the Pacific Terrace. With the numerous online searches available I had originally scoped out a different hotel in SanDiego that we thought would meet our needs, but after reading trip advisor decided that there were too many reviews regarding uncleanliness of rooms and uncomfortable beds, which I will add are my #1 and #2 requirements when choosing a hotel for family travel, (when traveling for relaxation with family it's just not worth it to be uncomfortable). This hotel was very clean, very comfortable (including the beds), and quite peaceful. The friendly staff always greeted us with a smile and a friendly comment when we exited and entered, I think they really like their jobs. One surprise was the exercise room. When hotel staff mentioned that I had to go through the underground parking lot to get to the exercise facility I was haunted by thoughts of a dingy old room with rusty equipment...to my sincere pleasure it was the exact opposite and absolutely perfect. It has new, clean, well maintained equipment, 3 TV's, free weights and machines - it is a small room but has everything you need for a vacation work out, even a scale & restroom with shower. The breakfast (with plenty of healthy choices) and wine reception are a great way to start and end a relaxing day. Don't worry about no shuttle and don't bother with the "hotel' driver. [I was concerned about whether to rent a car or choose a hotel with the optional shuttles available (hotel shuttle was originally was my # 3 hotel requirement for this family vacation) - but I am happy we chose to rent a car and I recommend it merely because SanDiego is pretty easy to get around and most importantly for the freedom to explore what you want when you want... also renting the booster for our child with the car rental avoided putting him in taxis or vans with inappropriate or no seatbelt. We did the usual SanDiego stuff - the Zoos, SeaWorld, the beach,... but we passionately enjoyed our family vacation when we ventured off the beaten path, for example we visited the beautiful Torrey Pines area and toured a few of the nearby vineyards, which included a fun educational opportunity and often wine tasting's for the adults.] The hotel is surrounded by many types of food and restaurant choices, the room service is a nice option, but we had a great time going for walks (or driving around in our rental car) to explore the area while choosing our next meal. - Konos, Gringos, many Thai, and Japanese options to name a few of our favorites. It was assuring to find that the photos shown on the hotel website are true representations of the rooms and the hotel. Because we vacationed during the off-season we were able to experience this hotel at a reasonable rate, which was much appreciated! In my opinion Pacific Beach area, in general, has a rough-around-the-edges reputation, but what we found is that it's a genuine area with real people - we loved the area and the Pacific Terrace Hotel!! My only fear is that our Pacific Terrace Hotel experience was too good to be true and when we go back we'll discover it was all a dream. However, we will go back!

Reviews.Title: “Beware of ocean view family rooms”
Reviews.Author: gwants
Reviews.Content: The family ocean view rooms are very dissapointing ,no view of the ocean .The rooms are situated on the corners of the hotel building on the ground floor,So the view is of shrubs and a public footpath.

Reviews.Title: “will recommend to everyone”
Reviews.Author: coacheswifeOregon
Reviews.Content: We just returned from seven nights at this hotel. We traveled with our three children and all of us loved our time there. We have told everyone they have to stay here when in San Diego! The hotel is small, yet very nice, and close to everything.; Seaworld, La Jolla, and convenient to get to I-5. The beach is great-and easy to get to. Breakfast was great, wine between 4-5 pm, extra towels and chocolate every evening, and the pool was almost as warm as the hot tub! Our view was great of the beach and boardwalk, I believe every room has a view of either the beach, the pool, or both. Staff was extra friendly and accomodating!! We will stay here again everytime we are in the area.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Ocean Front Hotel”
Reviews.Author: bruiserjohnson
Reviews.Content: This was a wonderful hotel in San Diego right on the beach! I have a 2 year old and it was perfect to walk down to the beach or swim in the heated pool in January. I am not a cold person and even though it was only in the 60's you could definately swim! We were upgraded to a junior suite with a partial ocean view for a small fee (I think like $20). We stayed in room 302 and it had a beautiful view of the coastline. The balcony doors you could leave open and listen to the waves. The hotel has several restaurants that deliver to the hotel. Gringo's is a really good! Hotel staff were very friendly and helpful. Great stay and we would definately stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent but pricey”
Reviews.Author: Toofaraway
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel from January 15 to 19, 2008. We chose it because of the glowing reviews and because it enjoyed a Tripadvisor #1 rating. I agree with the reviews citing all the good points. The hotel is very well located with an excellent view of the ocean and beach area. It is convenient to all areas north and south. The services, accommodations and personnel are top-notch. The downside is that it is pricey and on top of the room rate, if you use the parking garage on site, it will cost another $20.00 per day. Room tax and a "San Diego Marketing and Tourism Assessment" will add another $45 or $50 dollars per day onto the bill. also, in colder weather, the breakfast area can get quite crowded; in warmer weather this would not be a problem, as there are a number of nice tables outside near the pool. All in all, it is a super-nice place if you can handle the cost.

Reviews.Title: “Loved The Pacific Terrace Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: sanddunegirl
Reviews.Content: We just got back from this hotel and had a great time! We stayed in a Partial ocean view room with 2 queen beds. They had a 42" plasma tv with HD channels and an ipod adaptable stereo. There were a few things missing though. There was no mirror in the bathroom (there was on with a sink outside the bathroom) and there was no hair dryer. I do agree with other reviews that you can hear people out in the hall. We could also hear the people above us get up at 3 am to feed their baby. Otherwise we had a great expeirence. The view was wonderful (ask for the South side of the hotel) and the breakfast was pretty good as long as you take it back to your room and watch the ocean while eating. The staff treated us well and even recommended we use thier preffered driver to get to the airport. It was 10 dollars cheaper than a cab and we were driven in a black mercedes. I would and have already recommed this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: ATravelerMidwest
Reviews.Content: Having read previously posted reviews on Trip Advisor and other travel websites I booked this hotel. The reviews were factual and I loved my stay at this hotel. It was perfect for all of my/our needs. The location is great as it is situated on the Pacific Beach boardwalk. The hotel pool overlooks the Pacific Ocean and you can listen to the sounds of the ocean as you drift to sleep at night and at sunrise you can enjoy the view as well as the surfers. Picture perfect! The hotel is a small boutique hotel with a friendly and helpful staff. It does not have a restaurant on site but there are many casual and more upscale dining within walking distance of the hotel. A short walk (1-2 blocks) on the boardwalk will take you to the surfer community of Pacific Beach with all the restaurants and shops. The hotel offers a free morning breakfast in the breakfast room. It was nice and everyone seemed to enjoy it. If you want a hot breakfast then you can order room service or walk to nearby breakfast restaurants as there are several options. The rooms are clean, well taken care of and the furniture, wall hangings, plantation shutters and other extras make your stay at The Pacific Terrace one to remember. Throughout the day the hotel staff sets out for the guests (without charge) iced tea, lemonade, cold water, hot water, teas, coffees, fruit and cookies. Also, a wine reception at 4:00 and on Friday cheese and crackers. There is a small gift shop, small gym, concierge service and each floor has a computer so that the guests may check e-mails or print boarding passes. For a fee you may park underground of the hotel, park free on the street or you can catch a bus (1 block) or take a bus to a Trolley station. The location is near downtown, Gaslight Distrist, Old Town and La Jolla. The twice daily maid service, nightly turn down service with chocolates, fresh towels waiting outside your door in a basket, terry white robes, pool towels, and other extras makes me want to return to this hotel when I am in the San Diego area again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Hotel! Great for Families.”
Reviews.Author: 2001elan
Reviews.Content: Just returned from a 2 night stay (1/1/08-1/3/08) at this great hotel. I traveled with my husband and 6 yr old son. The previous reviews are very accurate. There is just nothing negative to say about this place. I am a perpetual complainer and even I have to zip my lip on this one! The staff are great, the rooms are great. The continental breakfast is great, the pool is great. The location is outstanding. Other things to mention. They have a small work out room in the garage. It has a treadmill, elyptical and weights. All new with 3 flat screen TV's. Small but adequate. The hotel is situated on a bike path. Bring your bike, roller blades or jog. It is wonderful. Lots of bike rental places around. $10 for the day. Good restaurants to walk to (3-6 blocks). We loved Karinya Thai [-]. We sat on pillows on the floor. Great food and fun for the kid. Lots of options to eat on Garnet Ave. Sushi, Fatburger, Denny's, Japanese. Lots of Mexican food places on every corner. Parking off season is easy. There is plenty of free street parking. I assume during the Summer you will need to shell out $20 per day to park in the underground hotel lot. The 4-5pm wine and cookies are great. The heated pool is great even in the middle of the Winter. The beach location is the best in San Diego. The Jr Suite room has a fridge, coffee maker and microwave. Dishes, glasses and silverware too. Trader Joes is a few blocks away. Ralph's Supermarket is also a few blocks away. You can pick up tons of yummy frozen goodies and nuke them as needed. I booked directly through the hotel and obtained a $149 garden view per night rate. I showed them proof of a free oceanview upgrade from another website and they honored it. They have AAA and Gov't employee rates as well. You can't go wrong with this place.

Reviews.Title: “Back Every Year”
Reviews.Author: dominee
Reviews.Content: We have recently booked our fifth stay at this ocean front hotel. We had previously stayed at two other hotels along the beach front and found this to be by far superior. The rooms are large and comfortably furnished. The ocean front balconies are delightful. What has us returning year after year are the staff. They are professional, courteous and unfailingly pleasant and helpful. We also use the conference room for meetings and have found that while rather small it is fully furnished for our conference needs and comfortably fits the 10 - 15 persons who are part of our group. Parking is convenient, breakfasts are adequate, the pool area is very lovely as it overlooks the ocean. We also appreciate the hospitality hour each evening as we enjoy the wine served at the patio. We have not found a better location and therefore have quit looking!

Reviews.Title: “Fabulous”
Reviews.Author: Czarmomma
Reviews.Content: Booked the hotel room on short notice based on customer reviews and proximity to the ocean. Wanted to be able to walk to the beach with my kids. There is no way I could have been happier with my stay. The hotel looks like it was recently remodeled and everything is beautiful. The room was gorgeous and the balconey had a perfect unobstructed view of the ocean. My kids fell asleep to the sound of the waves. The staff was exceptional, even calling the room to make sure we were settled and everything was to our satisfaction. Turn-down service and chocolates. Huge fresh basket of towels by the door in the morning - without even having to ask for them. Wonderful breakfast selection. Pool right above the beach so you could see and hear the ocean while you swim. Free parking. GREAT GREAT GREAT Can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel romantic Location”
Reviews.Author: cynbyn
Reviews.Content: Lovely hotel in a great beachfront location. perfect for romantic getaways. Balcony was practically on the beach. lovely breakfast on the terrace early mornings overlooking the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel”
Reviews.Author: Venturagal
Reviews.Content: We really loved this hotel. This hotel is right on the beach in San Diego. You can literally walk out the hotel room and be steps away from the ocean. The rooms are all updated in a "tommy bahama" theme. They are tasteful, well decorated and have wonderful bed linens. I slept great. The nightly free wine and appetizers is a special treat and the contintential breakast is better than most. The service is wonderful and i did not meet one staff person that was rude or not helpful. We really enjoyed the location and there is many, many restaurants and shops within walking distance about 1-2 blocks away. We used the pool and jacuzzi, both of which were nicely heated. This hotel does not have a restaurant on site, but they have a deal with two local restaurants that will deliver food to your room. I ordered dinner one night and it was the same as hotel room service, except a bit limited. The patios are great and large and i highly recommend room 111 which is close to the front door and your patio is steps to the pool and beach. They really pay attention to small detail such as fresh coffee, tea and lemonade all by the pool for hotel guests to self serve. They also have fresh cookies ready at 4:00 prompt and fresh apples ready to eat at the front desk. I was very pleasantly surprised with this this lovely hotel and will be back of course.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel in a so so location”
Reviews.Author: finfam
Reviews.Content: The hotel itself is wonderful - service beyond excellent; so are the rooms. However, if you plan to stay here make sure you do not book a room on the south end over the garage - second floor - they call it a partial ocean view room, which it is, but you also get to listen to trucks and cars coming and going and staff doing same all day and all night, which made it seem a bit high at $200 a night in November. It's also right next to a public restroom on the beach which is frequented at all hours by skateboarders and the homeless. Pop the extra for a full-blown ocean view room - nicer, quieter, etc. Also, and this is really important, if daily viewing and sometimes walking over and around sleeping homeless people aren't your idea of a great family vacation, do not plan your vacation here - at least not in November. You cannot even find a bench along the boardwalk to sit on day or night - they are all claimed by homeless squatters usually sleeping there. Every 20 yards or so along the boardwalk you will come upon another homeless person, sadly, some of them obviously mentally ill. There are signs posted all along the boardwalk that read: no sleeping overnight, but that rule is obviously not enforced.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: dinko
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from San Diego and we love the Pacific Terrace Hotel. Everything was perfect and we will definitely stay there again!!

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed with Pacific terrace”
Reviews.Author: suziebUk
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for three nights in October with our two children aged 4 and 9. Whilst the saff were very friendly we found the standard of the accomodation disappointing.We paid a high rate for a family room and the first one on the ground floor was quite shabby, fridge on mini bar did not lock. To be fair we complained and were moved to a second floor executive room which was much better. Breakfast was disapponting. Small area to sit in(better to take to your room.) Communal areas in stairs needed refurbishing and according to the children smelt( altho I do not have good sense of smell). As I say staff friendly, location good, hotel expensive for level of accomodation offered in the experience of our trip (four differnet locations)

Reviews.Title: “Lived Up to Hype”
Reviews.Author: ChrisFromOz
Reviews.Content: Found this property through Trip Advisor and stayed 5 nights with wife, mother and three kids aged 9 months, 3 years and 4 years. Yes we all fit within a room which was on the ground floor right at the end with a beachside view but not pool side. The service from the hotel was exceptional. Friendly, helpful and likeable.. The rooms were very well appointed. The TVs were huge and included HBO movies. There was a kitchenette and even steps to help our kids reach the sinks - overall one of the best hotels for kids I've come across. Our kids loved the easy access to the beach, although stairs had to be taken, and adored the pool. Afternoon cookies and wine suited various members of our party. Breakfasts were included and this was well worth it. Free Internet access in the hallway, good laundry facilities - overall we could have stayed here a lot longer. i loved this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Had a wonderful experience at Pacific Terrace!”
Reviews.Author: shamrockcb
Reviews.Content: Stayed at the Pacific Terrace in a Jr. Suite Ocean Front with our 1 year old and it was phenomenal. We only wished that we stayed one more night! The view from the large balcony is gorgeous and we loved listening to the waves crash as we fell asleep on the comfy bed. We loved the personal touches such as the mp3 player alarm clock, flatscreen tv, small fridge, large spacious rooms. The staff was very friendly and helpful, and they even left us a cute little stuffed toy for our son in the pack and play. Would definitely come back during off season as it is worth the discounted rate. Highly recommend for families with kids, as well as parents who want a romantic getaway!

Reviews.Title: “Its Number One for a reason...........”
Reviews.Author: enk56
Reviews.Content: The reason its voted number one........... Great location - right on the beach, close to restaurants, bars etc but quiet at night. Rooms - Excellent furnishings, quality fittings & tv Pool - Great - plus jacuzzi - no bar service - doesnt exactly detract from the overall stay. Breakfast - adequate continental breakfast thrown in Staff - everyone is helpful & courteous; you are made to feel special. If possible - book a premium sea view room - expensive but worth it when youre sat on you're balcony overlooking the board walk and ocean as the sun sets - it don't get much better than that. Highly recommended - book it.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Hotel and Location”
Reviews.Author: jimmy_sportingstar
Reviews.Content: We booked this hotel from the reviews that we saw on Trip Advisor and we wern't disappointed. The hotel is in a brilliant location, seconds away from the beach. It is also in a very nice neighborhood, where people are very friendly. We did have one problem on the first night, but this was dealt with very fast and we were sorted out straight away. We also got a upgrade, whitch made it very good for us. The Hotel is near to bars and restaurants, whitch made it nice and easy to go out for food in the evenings. The breakfast in the mornings was very good too. The Swimming Pool and Spa were excellent along with the staff, we had a very good time there and will be going back.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Bum Location”
Reviews.Author: Wellsdesigned
Reviews.Content: My wife and I wanted a romantic weekend away from the kids. We had free airline tickets so we put the money we would have spent on airfare into getting a suite at the Pacific Terrace. It was well worth it. The hotel in general is nice, but the suites are awesome. You get a separate living room and bedroom, a real dining area and a decent kitchenette and two real balconies. The balconies were the most important since this hotel is as right on the beach as you can get in Pacific Beach. The sunset views over the ocean cannot be beat. From the 3rd floor balcony, we were able to just relax and watch the surfers, para-surfers, wind-surfers and all other beach activities. We were able to walk out onto the beach on a moment's whim and return to a warm outdoor shower on the hotel grounds afterwards. There is plenty of shopping and dining within walking distance. We never bothered to rent a car, we just taxied in from the airport and the Hotel sent us back to the airport in their own contract car. I would return again with the family and definitely want to go back for another romantic get away.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace-Pacific Beach-GREAT”
Reviews.Author: CASue_7
Reviews.Content: We have previously stayed at the Best Western in Pacific Beach and it is a fun place, but when I checked on the Pacific Terrace their usual $500 rates were cut in half and we decided to try it. While I would not pay a $500 rate, this hotel was a wonderful and beautiful place to stay. We had a Junior Suite with their "Premium" ocean front view. And, indeed it was ocean front. The staff was friendly and helpful. We will definitely check back for the "off season" rates next year.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: MisShelly
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel for 5 nights and plan to stay there again on our next visit. We traveled with our 4 yr.old and did not feel the least bit uncomfortable. There were many families with small children. I loved the hotel and its location. We paid to park our car in the underground parking and only used our car a couple of times. We could walk right out the door to the beach, the boardwalk, the pier, and many restaurants. The hotel staff was always friendly and accomodating but keep in mind this is not a "resort". I read other reviews where some were disappointed and perhaps they expected a resort. We were not disappointed about anything. It is a very unique hotel with a great location and great views. We felt it was worth the money and cant wait to go back!

Reviews.Title: “Got Small Kids....Read This”
Reviews.Author: max-sun
Reviews.Content: We stayed in the one bedroom Family suite with our two small children and it worked out perfectly. The beds are very large and cannot be moved against the wall so we did not let our toddler sleep on the bed however we were able to get an airbed for $15/day and a crib free (graco pack n play) from the front desk. There is plenty of room for both in the bedroom and allows you to stay up and watch tv on the huge hdtv in the living area. Beautiful hotel, awesome beach location, adequate breakfast of fruit, pastries, yogurt, juice, etc. and the most freindly and helpful staff. Once you stay you will be emailed a survey and they must take the results seriously because the staff are so happy to help. Fresh baked cookies every afternoon and lemonade and wine. The room service was fast and tasty. We had a great view of the ocean and the tiki torches surrounding the property from our first floor accomodation. The pool was warm and not over crowded. We would definately stay again and recommend for all travellers including families with small children.

Reviews.Title: “this is a beautiful hotel”
Reviews.Author: luvbug42
Reviews.Content: our room was gorgeous. the beds were very comfortable. the rooms were decorated beautifully with a patio that had a lovely view of the ocean. the staff was friendly and helpful. the hotel offered a continental breakfast to die for and wine tasting by the pool at night. never mind the chocolates on your pillows at night and the robes and slippers! stay here if you can!! you won't want to leave.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful Suite, Picture Postcard View”
Reviews.Author: WeLoveOurLife
Reviews.Content: We spent 3 nights at the Pacific Terrace - would have loved to have more time. We had a Presidential Suite right in the middle of the top floor. The suite was stunning and we loved the flat screen TV (also one by the tub) and the jacuzzi in the room. The view from the balcony was stunning. Afternoon wine is a nice plus and so is the breakfast - we simply got bagels and ate them in our room. Only down side was a large corporate function there - apparently the people go there the weekend after Labor Day every year and party till all hours of the night outside in the pool area. We don't know what they did in the inground whirlpool but the next day it looked gross and we wouldn't go in it. That aside, a really spectacular find and we'll return if we get the chance. For more info and photos see: http://www.weloveourlife.com/inns/sandiego.html

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Hotel”
Reviews.Author: ukTraveller54
Reviews.Content: Loved this hotel. All staff very pleasant and welcoming. Very clean and well maintained. Complimentary breakfast and wine hour was great with plenty of choice. Very good location on Pacific Beach, it is near to restaurants and bars.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace is terrific!!!”
Reviews.Author: Wandering_Poet
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace Hotel is a terrific place to stay. Located between Pacific Beach and Palisades Beach, the hotel is right on the ocean. Every morning the ocean is filled with wet suited surfers. Every evening the sunset was dazzling. The pool has is wonderfully situated with a view of the ocean and we spent many an evening in the hot tub, chatting with other guests from up the Pacific Coast. Breakfast is popular with a great selection of pastries, bagels, juices cereal and hot coffee. Everyone who worked at the hotel was extremely helpful and the front desk was extremely helpful making dinner reservations for us. The room was immaculate, spacious and luxurious. We'll definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “spectacular views”
Reviews.Author: taffy87
Reviews.Content: My mom, sister, and I came to San Diego for my sister's 40th birthday. I chose the Pacific Terrace specifically because of positive user reviews. We were not disappointed! The hotel was beautiful and everyone was helpful and friendly. Our room was upgraded at check-in, and the view we had from our balcony was unbelievable. We all loved the robes and slippers that were provided. The bathroom was exceptionally large and it was very easy for the 3 of us to get ready in the mornings. We asked for a taxi and we were provided with a driver that worked for the hotel. Carlos made our trip even more enjoyable and gave us first rate service with a smile! The Pacific Terrace is a very special place. We all plan to come back again.

Reviews.Title: “Clean with Great Customer Service; Maintenance needs some work”
Reviews.Author: AnitaBrett
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace Hotel has a lot to offer, and we would definitely stay there again, but it is a few strokes short of perfection and potential visitors should assess what is most important to them in a hotel before booking. On the positive side: 1. The customer service could not have been much nicer. Everyone was warm and friendly from the maids to the check in desk. VERY warm. Even the maintenance folks were very nice and went out of their way for us. 2. The pool is delightful. Small, but very warm. So easy to get into it. A good hot water shower is located poolside so if you are coming in from the beach you can rinse of thoroughly before going in the pool or into the hotel. There are nice fluffy chair covers and plenty of towels. The pool is basically oceanside although a wall is there to assure privacy. 3. The hotel is very clean. Maids come right away when you leave your room and do a very fine job of cleaning everything. Turndown service is nice with chocolates! 4. The location is great in that you are steps from the beach, close to many bars and restaurants - - all in walking distance. And you are ON the beach. The oceanfront room we stayed in had excellent views and a nice sized balcony with two chairs and a table. 5. Fantastic plasma television! Have never seen better in a hotel. On the negative side: 1. This particular area of San Diego could be described as having "local color". There's a good number of beach bums, BMX bikers, lots of body art and piercings, etc. We were asked by a few people to give them our doggie bags from the restaurants, but no one actually out and out begged for money. I never felt unsafe at any time. But I can see how this might bother some folks . . . 2. There were some maintenance issues during our stay. Our bathtub was leaking water into the room below. Unfortunately, they decided to fix this issue at the exact time we were returning from the beach and wanted to take showers. I was annoyed to be honest, but the chief engineer was very, very apologetic. He actually came down to get us at the pool when he was done with his work. They really could not have handled it any better than they did. We also had A/C issues. Everyday, the AC turned off on its own, and an engineer needed to come turn it on. A bit annoying, but it always ended up working. 3. The hotel doesn't have a restaurant or poolside bar service. Frankly, I think this was its biggest flaw. They provide room service through two local restaurants - - Chilis and a sort of sports bar. The sports bar does have good food, but I like to just be able to grab something spur of the moment and there's no way to do that. The hotel provides breakfast which I'd describe as very fair. If you just like cereal, milk, and a banana - - you are all set. They provide tons of pasteries that are totally nothing special. Their bagels are pretty much awful - - I'd give them a 3 on a 1 to 10 scale. The English Muffins are Thomas' and are fine. But the worst part is that the layout makes NO SENSE. The toasters are blocking access to the fruit bowls, and everyone is standing waiting for these very slow toasters to deliver the goods and meanwhile blocking others from getting their food. When you eat breakfast, I highly suggest bringing your food outside - - it's much more comfortable and pleasant there. There is also free wine from 4-5 which is a lovely touch, but it would be great to be able to buy a drink to have by the pool at other times of the day. 4. If you are going for the beach, the beach is good, but not fabulous. There's tons of seaweed actually on it (not in the water though). It's long and good for running. It has good waves for boogie boarding and surfing. The water (being the Pacific) was cold, but totally bearable. All in all, we liked it a did our kids. 5. The parking garage is a tight both in terms of space and the number of cars it can handle. We rented a GMC Acadia - - any bigger than that and you'd be seriously struggling to park. 6. The beds have great linens, but somehow weren't super comfortable. A bit too firm for my taste. If you like firm, you'd be very happy. The overall feeling is nice as the linens are high quality. All in all, we did like this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Disappointed”
Reviews.Author: Paul017
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a trip to the Pacific Terrace Hotel. I had booked the hotel as the reviews were positive and it described itself as luxury. We were disappointed as it is certainly not luxury. On the positive side the staff were friendly and helpful and the location in terms of access to a wonderful beach great. However, there were a number of factors that seriously detract from the experience. Probably the major one is the very poor ‘Continental’ breakfast. It is described in their in-room video as Gourmet; it certainly was not. A luxury hotel does not serve up a selection of pastries and packets of cereals in a school tuck-shop setting using cheap plastic cups and plates, surrounded by flies and expect to call that a luxurious experience. The lack of dining facilities, or indeed what appeared to be any form of cooking facilities, meant that we dined out each evening. The local area is really geared toward the younger generation, i.e. teens/early twenties and not forty-two with a wife and two children. Hence, the dining alternatives tended to be Grilles attached to Bars and were not really suitable for a family. Note that the area was not threatening, it’s just that the options were not really places you would take your family. The next aspect was the bathroom. In fact the shower (above a small bath) and toilet were in an en-suite that is best described as being close to a downstairs utility room. It was not a luxurious bathing experience. I have noticed in the photos posted by other reviewers that other bathrooms looked larger. We stayed in a Partial Ocean View room; maybe other types of rooms are better. We also had problems with our air conditioning, it worked very rarely and the room window could not be locked. Also, the in-room safe was small, so that you couldn’t fit in anything bigger than a mid-sized camera. Although the furniture was OK, the general appearance of the hotel was of being in need of a renovation, for example, the carpets were dated and the balcony floor covering was pealing. We didn’t use the pool, as we preferred the beach. However, it did not look particularly inviting and there was no pool-side bar, as far as I could gather. Would I stay there again. Probably not. The prices charged do not justify what is offered

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay midweek for the right price”
Reviews.Author: psdabj
Reviews.Content: We checked into the hotel on Wed. July 11th. I had reserved a garden view room that morning for $175.00 on their website and when we checked in, we were upgraded to a ocean view family suite. This is a good sized one bedroom with a outside area with table and chairs. We were on the first floor corner room that has obstructed views, I would not pay premium for 1st floor ocean front, I would want to be on one of the upper floors. However, for an upgrade, it was great for us!! The free wine reception is really nice and was great after a drive from Arizona. We also enjoyed the continental breakfast in the morning and the ice tea and lemonade all day. The staff was very friendly and helped with everything we needed. There was no noise, but we were there on a Wed. night and the hotel was not full. I don't think I would pay $400 or $500 for this hotel unless you absolutely have to be right on the water. I would prefer Coronado Island to this area for that price.

Reviews.Title: “Over-rated and not kid friendly for price”
Reviews.Author: chmaloduma
Reviews.Content: After reading several high recommendations, we decided to stay 4-nights @ Pacific Terrace in between LaCosta (Carlsbad) and Disneyland. We have two boys - 4 1/2 and almost 3 - and the hotel was not really kid friendly nor was the neighborhood desirable, especially in comparison to LaCosta. I'm under 40 so I'm in no way a prude, but the area consisted mostly of young surfers, people with multiple tattoos, etc. One set of washer/dryers were not in working order and the front desk didn't have quarters readily available for those wanting to do laundry (they did quickly run out and pick some up); room service (which is ordered from two local restaurants) left off one of our children's meals. The staff did offer to go back and get it, but 30-40 minutes with hungry child was not worth it so we just shared our meal with him. We also asked to checkout one day early but were told we'd be charged the full rate ($400+) anyway so we stayed. Parking under the hotel was also not fun but looking for street parking wasn't appealing either. On the positive side, each room did have a small refrigerator, microwave and hairdryer, and proximity to beach was nice. Continental breakfast in morning was nice and wait staff did stop by pool once to offer complimentary lemonade. We would definitely NOT stay there again mainly b/c of neighborhood and the need for more kid-friendly activities.

Reviews.Title: “Oceanfront location with great rooms”
Reviews.Author: PhotoTravels
Reviews.Content: This is a hotel that will appeal to families and even more so to couples. The large, well-appointed rooms offer comfort and either indirect or direct ocean views. The location is close to Sea World and sits along the Mission Blvd. strip of restaurants, shops, and bars. The strong point of this property is the rooms. They are spacious, comfortable, and well-maintained. Our room, number 317, was a “premium ocean view junior suite” that featured a wonderful ocean view. It is a one-room suite with dimensions of about 17x35 feet, excluding the dressing and bath area. We enjoyed leaving the balcony’s glass sliding door open at night, since the hotel is close enough to the beach to allow the sound of surf to lull us to sleep. We were able to close the screen door to exclude insects and adjust the wooden louver doors for privacy without losing the ocean’s soothing sound. The room was furnished in heavier, higher-quality furniture. The room was available with either two queens or a king with sofa bed. Accompanied by two children, we chose the two queens, which were massive; the mattresses were boxed in by a wide wooden frame, so that one would occasionally bump it when moving in or out of the bed. The beds faced a modular shelving unit that contained a 42” flat-screen HDTV, drawer space, and lighted shelves with inexpensive sculptures, etc. There was a two-chair seating group near the balcony door, a desk, and a table with four chairs. All were appointed with nice coverings in bold colors, and nothing seemed worn or dirty. At the table end of the room, there was a kitchenette with sink, microwave, undercounter refrigerator, and dinnerware. There was also a locked, second refrigerator stocked as a mini-bar. We never used the facilities to prepare meals, because of the abundance of restaurants within easy walking distance. Several restaurants allow your meal to be charged back to the hotel, and two restaurants will deliver to your room with a small service charge, again billed to your account. We tried that the first night we arrived, and the food was delivered by hotel staff, warm, within about 45 minutes. The bathroom area was more modest, although the hotel offers more bathroom features in an “executive suite” category that was sold out when we reserved. The sink in our room was in a separate dressing area with a closet and vanity with generous marble counter space. The toilet and shower were very average, located in a small room off the dressing area. The toiletries were “Gilcrest and Soams”, which I believe to be a European hotel supplier’s brand. The room rate includes a cold continental breakfast and late-afternoon happy hour. We did partake in breakfast every morning, with a selection of bagels, rolls, cereals, yoghurt, and fruit. There would also be two juices available. After a few days, the limited selection became somewhat tedious. The hotel has no restaurant other than the breakfast room. Breakfast could be eaten inside or out. The San Diego climate made breakfast by the pool very enjoyable. In late June, the mornings would be quite crisp, limiting ocean bathing, but enhancing lounging around the pool. The modest pool was heated and had an adjacent whirlpool tub. During our stay, it was never crowded. We never made it to the happy hour. It was held only from 4-5 p.m., and we would always be away from the hotel. Parking was available under the hotel for $18 per day. The garage is accessed through a gate controlled by the room key card, and there are elevators at each end that rise upward to the lobby and the rooms. There are a limited number of free spaces adjacent to the hotel, but they often were unavailable. Especially if you plan to be coming and going in your vehicle, the underground parking is a good investment, and can be decided upon at arrival. There is a tiny gift shop off the lobby, and the front desk can provide tickets to local attractions at a small (typically $2 per person) discount. The hotel straddles the beachfront promenade, which is itself atop a 20-foot cliff above the beach and the Pacific Ocean, both reached by nearby stairs. Although there is a comfortable expanse of sand, the beach experience was marred by tons of seaweed and dead marine life, at least during our visit. There were very few seashells along the beach, disappointing our 7 and 9 year old girls, but they enjoyed watching the surfers in the water next to the pier, just south of the hotel. By the time we left, the younger announced that she wanted surfing lessons. From the hotel, it is a ten-minute drive south to Sea World, and fifteen minutes to the Old Town area. The strip of restaurants and bars surrounding the hotel stays active until late, and drew some who seemed potentially problematic. Although not a major issue, there is a slight risk of encountering boisterous or confrontational conduct later in the evening. We stayed at a peak time, so the rates were high (over $500/night for our room, taxes and parking, even with an AAA discount) and the value was acceptable, but not great. We were not upgraded as others have reported, possibly because the property was busy. However, we recommend this hotel, primarily based its oceanfront location and the room features. It does not have elaborate public areas or a huge pool area, and the limited staff provided adequate, but not instant, service. Because the hotel is not large, there is no hustle-bustle, which we appreciated. We regretted not having planned more time to enjoy the room, beach and pool.

Reviews.Title: “Pricey but wonderful”
Reviews.Author: rubberducky
Reviews.Content: Well I don't know how you get a "deal" on this place but I couldn't manage it for the life of me... and I worked hard... lol We are a family of four - we are in the mid to late 30's and our children are 2 and 4. We have stayed in San Diego twice before, once at the Welk Estates in Escondito (love it, but only if you're staying for a week or so) and at the Bahia Resort Hotel at Mission Beach - before the reno's. I really wanted to stay here but the price US$450 scared the bejeezers out of me. This trip I was on business and could write off our hotel stay so I jumped at the opportunity. I read lots of reviews that complimented the hotel and since it's #1 in San Diego how could we go wrong. Just after I booked I read the latest review about the area being a dump and I got scared... however there was no going back... We arrived on July 6th at about 4pm... check in was quick and fast thanks to Humberto (Tito), they have parking underneath the hotel for $18 a night which was great because then it's a quick elevator ride to your hotel room. We stayed in a oceanview room on the second floor middle of the hotel. The room was huge, beautifully appointed and comfortable. The balcony was great with an amazing view. The beds are about four and a half feet high with a little step stool to climb up... There is a bar fridge and a mini bar. Never tried the internet but apparently there is wireless... We got changed quickly and ran for the pool (we had just driven up from Ensenada). There was free wine hour from 4 to 5 and lemonade for the kids. The wine was excellent, white, red and blush and the service was great. We had a quick glass on the patio and then changed over to plastic glasses and went for a dip. The pool isn't huge but is adequate for the most part, only occasionally crowded. The hot tub was great and the view of the surfers was fun to watch. The area around the hotel is funky and fun. We walked all over... ate at World Famous the first night and Gringo's the second night. I lost my nose ring and bought one around the corner at the tatoo parlour. We felt completely safe and happy in the area and after eating dinner at World Famous walked back along the beach skipping the surf with the kids at 11pm a night. There were a few homeless people sipping beers, etc. but no one was violent or scary. The beach is beautiful and clean and we met lots of the vendors along the way in their little shops who were so nice and helpful. We ate breakfast at The Broken Yolk on Garnet both mornings... mmm best omelets ever!! Dinner at World Famous was ok, the appy's were great but the main courses were hit and miss, the prime rib was good, the steak not all that interesting. Dinner at Gringo's was ok too.. the appy's were fabulous, however the traditional Mexican food we ordered was not our favorite and we wish we had ordered fajita's instead. At about 11pm on Saturday night there was a little yahoo going on in the pool, it lasted about 15 minutes before hotel staff cleared them out without incident, however it was very loud for a few minutes. We had a problem with dripping water over our vanity. I called the front desk and they sent the repair man, who looked at it and told me he would resolve it while we were out. When we came back it seemed to have be fixed, however overnight the drip came back and our whole vanity was flooded including all our bathroom stuff, it was a big mess. I complained when we checked out and they comp'd our parking so $36 credit, which was nice. So here's our list of pros: - amazing location, fun, hip and interesting - beautiful hotel - fabulous service - great pool area, fun to hang out at - wonderful sandy beach - entertaining watching the surfers - fun boardwalk to walk along - comfy beds/linens - tv was huge and lots of options - small bar fridge (good for leftovers and cold drinks, etc.) - lots of good restaurants/shopping near by (walking distance) List of cons: - very expensive - have to pay for parking - noisy - we didn't mind at all (in fact we like it) but if you're looking for peace and quiet you probably won't find it here between the surf crashing and the people around the pool We never even went into San Diego proper this trip, we loved the Pacific Beach area so much... we visited Sea World on Saturday and that was excellent, however it's a two day excursion with little people and we didn't get to see everything in one day... We would stay at this hotel again in a second as long as their prices don't get much higher!!

Reviews.Title: “Will never stay anywhere else in San Diego but here”
Reviews.Author: bg312
Reviews.Content: We spent a night in the Pacific Terrace Hotel in June and wish we had spent every night of our vacation there. Unfortunately we had booked several other nights and paid for them before we found out about this hotel. The Pacific Terrace is one of the few beachfront hotels on the California coast. The hotel rooms were beautiful and made us feel like we had stepped into a tropical paradise. The furniture was beautiful and classy and the rooms were exceptionally clean. The continental breakfast was wonderful with a larger variety of food than most hotels. The staff was amazing. We never saw a staff member that we weren't greeted with a smile and a question about our comfort and an offer of help if we needed it.
