The concierge was very helpful in assisting us in finding our way around Pacific Beach. The location was excellent - on the beach and right in the middle of all the activity, yet quiet and relaxing. The pool was beautiful and overlooked the ocean. We booked a partial oceanview room and were upgraded to a full ocean view without even asking and for no extra charge. From now on we will only stay in the Pacific Terrace Hotel when we visit San Diego. This hotel was only $185 a night including all taxes and fees. A great bargain for the quality. Also a much higher quality hotel than its stars indicate.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyable stay, but wouldn't stay again.”
Reviews.Author: Beachbabe31
Reviews.Content: We stayed here for 4 nights early June. Arrived early from Anaheim Doubletree (fantastic hotel) and were checked in straight away. Room was very spacious, full ocean view. Kids liked the pool although the pool area is quite small and they offer lemonade by the poolside which is very nice. Not sure how everybody seems to get such a good rate, but we booked through hotel website at $420 a night! This was our most expensive hotel during a 3 week stay, but certainly not the best. You are paying for the view. The hotel does not have a restaurant, so any room service is brought in from outside restaurants. The breakfast is served in a very small room downstairs. You can have cereals, small selection of fruit and toasted bagels, It's the same every day and there were never enough bowls etc, so you had to have polystyrene bowls which you are supposed to use if you want to take breakfast to your room. The most disappointing thing is the surrounding area, it's a dump!! The hotel said they had restaurants that you could sign a tab and they would bill the hotel, so that you did not have to carry your wallet around at night, this seems to me its because the area is so dreadful. We were recommended one restaurant by a local chap who got chatting to us outside the hotel, its called Nicks by the beach, very nice food and good service, its about a five block walk. All other nights we drove into the city and went to Seaport Village, about a 15 min drive. It's on the waterfront and has some good restaurants. We also went to La Jolla which is lovely. Wonderful area, great restaurants. Very easy to get to Seaworld and San Diego Zoo, both about 10 - 20mins drive. If we stayed here again, we would stay in La Jolla and certainly not Pacific Beach, the other reviews have said this is a dump, but I didn't quite believe it until I saw it. Unless you are really into surfing and under 25, stay elsewhere.

Reviews.Title: “Great accommodations, wonderful hospitality and beautiful views”
Reviews.Author: Rachel805
Reviews.Content: We stayed Monday and Tuesday, May 21 and 22 and were upgraded upon our arrival to a suite on the third floor with outstanding views from the two balconies off the bedroom and living room areas. The kingsize bed was so comfortable! The bathroom very spacious with a double sink, jacuzzi tub, separate shower and bathroom stalls, and a tv above the jacuzzi. The unit had two other flat screen tvs in each the bedroom and living room. It was very spacious. The staff were very pleasant and helpful and we enjoyed the afternoon wine hour at 4 p.m., hot tub and pool. A great walking/biking trail runs in front of the property and down the beach. Good restaurants, including Gringos Cantina, are a short to moderate walk away. Outstanding two days!

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!!!”
Reviews.Author: mom2three70
Reviews.Content: We stayed here last fall. My review is a bit late, but it was such a great hotel that I wanted to chime in. We stayed here in Sept. 06. We were there with 3 young kids 5 and under. We all had such a great time. The room was spacious, clean and beautiful. We had a 1st floor patio room, which was very nice with the kids to be able to access the pool so easily. Also, it was a great place to sit and drink free wine/lemonade while the sunset. Nice for eating breakfast and even dinner. One night we brought home a pizza from a joint just down the street and ate it on the patio. The staff was amazing. The free breakfast was really good. So good that we never even made it to Kona's for breakfast, and that is our favorite breakfast place in the world! It was very convenient to the beach, and great people watching. the kids loved the free cookies and chocolates. I can't begin to say how wonderful our experience was here! We walked down PB at night to go eat and we never felt the least bit unsafe, even with 3 small kids. Frankly, I'm dumbfounded about the few bad reviews about this hotel. I can't imagine what those people would like. My husband and I stayed at the Four Seasons Maui and Four Seasons on the Big Island just a couple of months before our SD trip, and it was on par with that experience. Mind you, no one is coming around spritzing you with Evian at the Pacific Terrace like they did at the Four Seasons Maui, but that's a bit much anyway, even for the Four Seasons. And, I'm not saying that the facilities and amenities are equal to the Four Seasons, but the experience was just as good, and it was a fraction of the cost. As for the complaints about the work out facility--who in their right mind would want to work out in a gym when you have miles of paths along the ocean (not to mention the ocean and the beach) literally right out the back door? I just don't get it, I guess. We will definitely stay here again. I can't wait to go back.

Reviews.Title: “A relaxing and friendly hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: ladymissk
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel in San Diego for 5 nights at the beginning of June 2007. We had a great time, would recommend the hotel to friends and hope to return soon. The rooms were comfortable, clean and tastefully decorated. An oceanview made our stay! It was great to watch surfers and the activity of the beach at any time of day. We were traveling with a three year old and felt comfortable letting our hair down while enjoying the upscale qualities of this hotel. We were pleasantly surprised to find a step stool for the little one already placed in the room. The swimming pool was warm. We enjoyed the complimentary wine bar from 4-5 every evening. Breakfast was very nice, too, with a variety to choose from. Turn down service includes lovely chocolates left on the pillow. Even the coffee packets for the pot in the room were good. We rented a car to get around San Diego, which was very helpful. The location of Pacific Terrace was perfect, on the beach and relatively close to all the cultural sites we wanted to visit. The hotel also has a car that can be hired out for a fee. This was a help getting to the airport and cost just a little less than taking a cab. If you enjoy museums, plan for a day or two at Balboa Park where there are so many museums and gardens to see, along with the Zoo. Stay at Pacific Terrace Hotel if you're looking for something on the beach, comfortable, upscale and friendly. P.S. Bring a sweater for breakfast, as the breakfast room is open to outside and is a little chilly in the morning.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, Views, Staff, Rooms, Everything”
Reviews.Author: County95
Reviews.Content: Beautiful Hotel on the beach. The views from our room were amazing. Watching people out there at 6 am surfing, that's the life. The rooms were nice and big with a nice kitchen area and great balconys. Very helpful staff and I love the free slippers we got.....Only thing I agree with some others is the neighborhood around the hotel, not much going on...I was there a few years ago, so maybe it has changed....But if you want a nice relaxing stay in San Diego, this is definetly the place.........

Reviews.Title: “Lovely room, nice beach, but the neighborhood. . .ugh”
Reviews.Author: JetSet1
Reviews.Content: My husband and I and 6 month old baby stayed here to celebrate our anniversary. We stayed 2 nights at Loew's Coronado Bay Resort (loved it!) then drove here for 2 nights because I wanted to have a room right on the beach to actually hear ocean waves crashing against the shoreline (you won't get this on any of the bays, artificial beaches or marinas in the area). What a culture shock leaving lovely, serene and secluded Coronado to drive through this overcrowded, busy, dumpy neighborhood lined filled with low rent apartments and 1 star motels. The only other decent hotels I noticed in the immediate area were Tower 23 and the Crystal Pier cottages which despite my dislike for the location I may try out someday just because they are so unique. THE ROOM: we got a premium ocean view suite on the 2nd floor. It was an outstanding, clean beautifully furnished room complete with sink, refrigerator, microwave oven, huge flat screen, dock for your MP3 player on the clock radio. The beds were cozy. But I don't like comforters and throw pillows (they are pretty but how sanitary are they?). My first morning of enjoying the ocean waves was interrupted too early in the morning by loud children playing near the pool area or one of the nearby balconies. THE HOTEL: staff was friendly but not extraordinary. I'd question their recommendations for dining. Two of the staff members highly recommended a place called The World Famous. What a dud recommendation. We drove to the place, could not find parking space anywhere within a few blocks so we drove up to the valet booth where we got ignored. I went inside to the hostess who told me there was a 45 minute wait. I scanned the place and it too looked like a dump. I guess the view is what attracts people to that dumpy restaurant. We drove off to Nick's around the corner and got immediate seating which was alright but not as good as the one in Maui. Our 2nd night I was much more clear with the concierge when I told her I wanted an elegant restaurant with a view in La Jolla. She recommended "Azul" which we LOVED and I highly recommend for amazing views, romantic and calm atmosphere and fantastic gourmet dinners and desserts. The continental breakfast was a plus even though our first day we walked to Hennessey's Pub for a good breakfast. The hotel staff had laid out a nice spread of pastries, bagels and cream cheese, yogurt, juices, etc. THE BEACH: fabulous! The walking path just beyond the pool area has nice views of the beach, there's a separate bike path too. THE LOCATION: on the plus side there are a lot of restaurants, cafe's and pubs/bars within walking distance which is great if you don't want to drive anywhere. But what a huge step down from Coronado and La Jolla this area of Pacific Beach is. I think it's because it's a very old neighborhood. If you're in your 20's or if you love to surf you'd probably love this area. The surfers are plentiful on this beach very early in the morning. Although it's a nice well maintained hotel with good staffpeople I probably would not stay anywhere in Pacific Beach again (except for maybe Crystal Pier cottages). It's nice to be on the beach but for the high rates they are charging at Pacific Terrace I'd rather stay at a full-service hotel or resort. I wish I had done more research about the surrounding area.

Reviews.Title: “The Best”
Reviews.Author: john1948
Reviews.Content: Stayed 4 nights in may 2007, There is a reason it's rated #1 ,the staff, it's clean, well kept, and a feeling of being taken care of, contribute to a great stay. Bethlehem ,Pa, USA

Reviews.Title: “Pure Heaven”
Reviews.Author: Live4DaysOff
Reviews.Content: This hotel was even better than the reviews I read on Tripadvisor. The hotel told us the checkin was at 4pm. We got there at 1130am from Anaheim (oops! wanted to get out of there alive- ha ha) and decided to at least advise the hotel were we there. The were WONDERFUL! They prechecked us in, gave us a garage key and told us we were welcome to use the pool and facilities all day. Then they advised us that they upgraded us to a premium ocean view from a partial ocean view! They then asked for my cell number and told me he would call me as soon as my room was ready and they did. When we got to our room, it was amazing! Plasma tv, fridge, nice bathroom, remote control fan, oversized comfy beds, IPOD docking station clock and a huge patio with table/chairs and a big seashell. The kids were so excited and my husband was surprised at how nice the hotel was for the price we paid ($199/night). The wine reception (4-5pm)was great and the staff was so helpful and got towels for the kids and offered to go get them fresh cookies in the lobby. They have apples and cookies at 4pm in the lobby and all day they have tea/lemonade and coffee in a room by the pool. While sitting by the warm pool we met several guests who have stayed there for years and called it a "secret gem". The ocean was so close and great for the kids. They had a warm shower to use before going back to the pool. The towels were fluffy and warm and they even offered poolside massages (not sure price). There were some women there for a girls weekend and they were lined up and ready to get a massage in the tent. A lot of people walk around in the white robes they provide in the room. The breakfast was great too and they even have highchairs. The staff was so helpful and nice. We ate outside and could see the ocean while eating. The only negative is the noise on the boardwalk if you sleep with your patio door open so we left it open half the night and then closed it when the surfers came at 5am. The AC worked great and drowned out the noise. They also have a computer for anyone to use in the hallway so we got to check our email daily which was nice. They offer a few restaurants for room service but it is pricey so we went down the boardwalk to the Green Flash and ate outside with an ocean view (it was delicious!). Also, the Ralphs grocery store is in walking distance so you can get some snacks/ beverages for your room. We DID NOT use our car the entire time we were there. Everything is close and easy to walk to! Our 4 yr old begged to go back to the hotel room because he liked it so much. We all loved it and ALL slept so well. The beds are great. The TV was great. My kids accidentally watched a pay per view movie for 3 minutes but the hotel removed that charge at checkout. The movies are only 9.99 though which is reasonable for a hotel. Our stay was so relaxing and positive. We will be back every year for now on!! We LOVE the Pacific Terrace and finally found a tradition for our little family. Thank you Pacific Terrace for a great stay and making us feel so welcome.

Reviews.Title: “Great Boutique Hotel, Loved Our Jr. Suite, Not So Good Neighborhood”
Reviews.Author: OCMommyof2
Reviews.Content: We loved everything about this small boutique hotel, except the location. If I could put this wonderful hotel in a better neighborhood, I would give it a perfect score. It is located next to a public restroom where homeless people hang out. The beach in front of the hotel is one of two beaches, that I know of, that allows alcohol on the beach, so that seems to attract more of a mixed crowd. The service at the hotel was outstanding and we loved our beautiful room. The moment we walked in, we felt as if we were in Hawaii as there were many Palms outside our window with a beautiful ocean view. The pool is in the center of the hotel, along the main boardwalk, but it is fully enclosed with glass fence and has a gate that can only be accessed with a room key. I felt very safe on the Hotel grounds and on the beach during the day. I do not think I would want to go out there at night, though. If I was still single, in my twenties, this town would be the place for me as it attracts the college crowds, as well. It has many casual restaurants and bars, but it would be nice to have some upscale shops and restaurants as well. I hope this helps you all trying to decide where to stay.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Hotel”
Reviews.Author: AZBeachmommy
Reviews.Content: We just recently stayed at this wonderful hotel. We actually reserved a Garden View room but we were upgraded to a Partial Ocean View Jr Suite. This room was beautiful and the view was spectacular. We really enjoyed the Plasma TV because they are rarely found in hotels. The room and bathroom were huge and very clean. The staff people were very respectful and polite. It was very nice having the ocean available within footsteps. There are many restaurants and stores within walking distance. . The hotel offers a continental breakfast, which consist of fruit, cereal, toast, bagels, pastries, muffins, coffee and milk. We really enjoyed the time we spent at this hotel and will return. Please keep in mind that if you would like a guaranteed parking space we advise to use the hotel garage, which is $18.00 for every 24 hours.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect!”
Reviews.Author: Justtina
Reviews.Content: We had to move out of our house for a quick remodel, and found this on Tripadvisor. We are a family of 5, got two rooms, and stayed two nights. Good value for the money! Great views of the ocean! The front desk people were very polite. The place is immaculate, and the decor is very relaxing and beautiful. The rooms are comfy, clean, and the TVs in the rooms are perfect! The parking garage, although it costs extra, is worth the price!

Reviews.Title: “Very Nice Hotel”
Reviews.Author: GreatTravelsLFH
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace Hotel is a great hotel with a wonderful staff! This hotel had very nice accommodations and amenities and is close to everything (La Jolla, San Diego etc). We traveled with our small children and the location actually worked out nice because we could get to everything quickly, yet we weren't in the middle of the city. We originally booked a partial ocean room and were upgraded to a family suite upon arrival, which was a great blessing as our 2 young children could go to bed at a normal hour and my husband and I could watch TV in the living area. Breakfast was wonderful and was included in the price. In addition, they served wine at the pool from 4-5 and the staff would walk around the pool offering cold drinks for the patrons. The pool area was on the small side but very clean and the water was nice and warm...a good thing seeing as it was only in the low 60's when we were there. Overall, I really liked this hotel and would recommend it. Everyone that was staying there had nice things to say and really seemed to be enjoying themselves. Thank you for a nice stay!

Reviews.Title: “Great as before, yet better with remodel”
Reviews.Author: noryglory71
Reviews.Content: This was our third stay at the Pacific Terrace. Last time was in '04 before their "Tahitian" remodel from their peachy and dated "Miami Vice" look. Although we loved the hotel before the upgrade, and it was the same hotel in all other regard, it really is classed up with the granite, flat panel HDTV, gorgeous beds and other decor. We ended up with a room on the first floor to the side of the pool, and although I was hesitant to take it (we've always had a second or third story room) it was FANTASTIC. I will request a pool-facing ground floor room in the future. You get a huge patio area, and lots of foliage provide ample privacy (frankly more private than the balconies IMO). Plus, the ocean view is better from the ground floor as you can actually see it from your room versus going out onto the balcony since you aren't above it only seeing sky. The bed was SO comfy. Really fantastic. The other guests that stay here are always so nice. We buddied up with another family and my kids went swimming every night with their new friends. I noticed this time the hotel was full of families. Last times we stayed here there were many, many, many more people on business. I am not sure why there was a change but it was better for us (more kids and racket at breakfast versus stuffed shirts reading the paper)... Breakfast was great as always and the staff is super friendly and accommodating. Don't miss Kono's down the boardwalk for breakfast one day though. The line is like an hour long at breakfast but if you go for lunch (can eat breakfast then too!) you will have a minimal wait and a great table overlooking the beach across the boardwalk.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: MatildeMayhem
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pacific Terrace for three days in March and we regretted having so many things planned to do in San Diego that we didn't have a lot of time to spend at the hotel. Even though the weather was spotty when we were there, we loved walking along the beach in the morning and spending the late afternoons sitting on the terrace just watching the ocean and the people walking/jogging/riding by on the sidewalk/boardwalk. The staff was absolutely wonderful and sweet. The bed was very comfortable. We are planning another trip back to San Diego soon just to relax at this wonderful hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!”
Reviews.Author: oceanpj
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace from 4/9 - 4/13. We booked a garden view room at a great rate through their website ($179!) and could not tell you how happy we were when we arrived and they had upgraded us to their premium ovean view room. What a wonderful surprise!! I had asked what prompts such an upgrade, and the staff said that if they have it available, then they upgrade! The room was beautiful. Very tropical feeling with a huge plasma t.v. and extremely comfortable beds. Chocolates left on our beds every night too. The view could not be beat. We were on the 2nd floor and had 180 degree view with only the bluff and the small boardwalk between us and the sand. To get down to the beach you take a stairs down, but we didn't mind that at all. One of the days was quite windy and the bluff actually helped block the wind. The complimentary breakfast was perfect for us with 2 small kids and we brought it to our room a few times. Coffee, lemonade and ice tea were almost always available through the day. The staff was so friendly and could not have said or done any more to make us feel welcome and cared for. The ONLY thing I would've changed was the shower doors in the bathroom. They did leak water pretty badly. The surrounding area is o.k. There is homeless around, but we never felt unsafe. I wish there were more restaurants available within walking distance, but we did have some choices. The Pita Pit was our favorite for a quick bite to eat. We had a great vacation and would return to this hotel in a second. We enjoy the smaller feel with the amazing views from the room. Once again, the staff were amazing. Housekeeping, front desk, maintenance (needed it one time for the tv), breakfast service....could not have been better!!

Reviews.Title: “Superbly by the Sea!”
Reviews.Author: russparks
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace Hotel provided us with a thoroughly wonderful two-week visit. We had a full-ocean-view room on the third (top) floor. The beds were amazingly comfortable, the decor was well-coordinated, and a big plus was the excellent quality 42-inch plasma TV (in all the rooms). We hugely enjoyed the generous-sized balcony, from which we watched surfers, kite-boarders, dolphins, sea birds, etc. As the saying goes, people can either make or break an experience, and the staff here most definitely "made" our exerience. They were extremely welcoming, helpful, professional and pleasant throughout our stay--notably the front desk and concierge personnel. Since parking in the Pacific Beach part of San Diego can be a challenge, especially during spring break, it was really great to be able to park in the underground garage (a daily fee was well worth every penny!). The hotel is located adjacent to the paved "Boardwalk," which extends a couple of miles to the south and on which we walked to convenient nearby restaurants, such as The Green Flash, World Famous, and Nick's. We definitely look forward to returning to this attractive, well-managed boutique-style hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent service”
Reviews.Author: ncmd
Reviews.Content: Great location for exploring the region and on the coast to boot. The staff are excellent in all respects. The rooms are well appointed. We will stay here again on our next visit.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel”
Reviews.Author: edelweiss1
Reviews.Content: We just returned from 5 days (4-7 to 4-12) at the Pacific Terrace Hotel and loved it. The staff was friendly and informative, our room was clean, fresh towels left daily and nightime chocolates were a nice touch. We had a "family suite" room, which consisted of 2 rooms. The main room had a microwave/mini fridge, sink, sofa bed, flat screen tv, and dining table. The bedroom had a door that closed off to the sitting area (very nice for sleeping kids), inside it had 2 queen size beds, flat screen TV, IPod docking station (nice surprise), balcony entrance, bathroom area with huge counter and 2 sinks. The toilet/shower area was separate. We were on the first floor, which gave us a larger patio area, however I would prefer to stay on a higher floor next time. Better view of the ocean, and no people walking right by you on the boardwalk (just a personal preference). We paid for the parking garage and it was absolutely worth it! Don't even bother trying to find parking on the street. I used the laundry facilities once (located on the garage level) and had no problems. The morning breakfast was great. There were bagels, danish, fresh strawberries/cantaloupe, bananas, yogurt, english muffins, boxed cereals, instant oatmeal, juices/milk/coffee/tea/hot chocolate. It was very helpful to not have to leave the hotel for breakfast, much less pay $20+ for a restaurant. In the afternoon/evening, there was iced tea and lemonade by the pool. Coffee, was available almost all day/night. From 4-5 wine was served by the pool (no cost), which was wonderful...cookies for the kids in the lobby, too. The only thing we encountered was a problem with the shower doors....they leak and badly. We ended up using a few extra towels, placed on the floor, to help with the water. Do not leave your clothes on the floor or you'll be using the dryer, too! :) We ate at 3 restaurants nearby, which were recommended by the hotel: Hennessey's Pub, Bella ____ Italian food (I don't recall the entire name), and Gringo's mexican food. All were great, and kid friendly. I will absolutely go back, fantastic hotel. If you have any questions, please feel free to email me. Paula

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful hotel!”
Reviews.Author: PZ
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace for 2 nights as part of our trip to LA and San Diego. Our only regret is that we did not stay there longer. The hotel was fantastic in every way. The service was excellent, every single employee was friendly and helpful and went out of their way to make our stay comfortable. Our partial ocean view room was upgraded to a fabulous suite, and even the partial view was excellent. The beach was really fun for our kids. The breakfast was really good, the afternoon wine by the pool was very nice. I would highly recommend this hotel to anyone, and if we return to the San Diego area, I would definitely stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: Nick_From_Manchester
Reviews.Content: This hotel is fantastic. On arrival we where greeted by friendly, efficient staff; including a very helpful concierge desk. The rooms were exceptionally clean and all had full or partial ocean views. Rooms were fully equipped with Ipod docking station (nice touch), large LCD TV, safe, separate sink from the bathroom to make dressing easier and clean comfortable beds. Large bathrooms, with an abundance of clean fluffy towels and toiletries made for a comfortable start to the day. Fresh fruit and water were left in the room each day and there was a fully loaded mini-bar, if needed. They offer free wine by the pool for one hour each day (mid-afternoon), which is a great opportunity to meet your fellow guests. The small pool is clean, with sun loungers available and the view overlooking the Pacific Ocean is gorgeous. Would not hesitate to return if in San Diego. Top tip: Take the tram (train) to the border for a day and visit Mexico. The journey is only 40 mins and the trains are very frequent.

Reviews.Title: “Great hotel”
Reviews.Author: bigelowfamily
Reviews.Content: After reading the reviews on this site, we changed our reservation from the Dell to the Pacific Terrace. The hotel was as wonderful as the reviews say, and we highly recommend staying there. The hotel is right on the beach with lots of good people watching opportunities on the jogging path right next to the property. The pool was the perfect temperature and the hot tub was hoooooot!! Go and stay there!

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: VolpeTravels
Reviews.Content: This may be the best located hotel in all of San Deigo- we had an Ocean Front room with a balcony and it was fantastic. Wine every afternoon was a nice touch. The room was very nice the decor high end- but the view and the pool are unbeatable. LCD TV was not working right- kepted turning itself on and off- but we did not really need to watch TV.

Reviews.Title: “Great Value for a King, Queen, and Princesses.”
Reviews.Author: thomrho
Reviews.Content: Great Value for a King, Queen, and Princesses. We stayed at the Pacific Terrace with our two daughters (3.5 and 8 months old) for five nights in early March. The hotel was beautiful, clean, and comfortable. It looked even better in person than on the hotel website. Everyone was friendly. We really enjoyed our patio and even the view was great from our "partial-oceanview." The room was roomy. I wish the beds weren't so high off the ground since I have two young children, but the rooms were beautiful. There was a big flat screen T.V. The sink and mirror were separate from the tub and toilet which made it easier for us to all get ready. There was always a fresh basket of linens outside the door the next morning in case we needed an extra towel. The included breakfast was very good with fresh fruit, cereal, pastries, juice, coffee, water, and yogurt. The afternoon wine reception was very relaxing. We sipped our wine by the pool. The pool area was beautiful and comfortable. Our 3.5 year old daughter loved the fresh baked cookies in the afternoon and adored the turn down service because she got chocolate on her bed at night! I enjoyed the free internet access in the lobby. We walked to dinner many nights. The hotel did a fantastic job of referring us to different dining spots. We really liked being able to push a stroller all along the beach on the sidewalk above. The area is difficult to pinpoint exactly. It is a 50s beach bungalow type location. There are alot of college kids that live in the area. As with any busy/large town, there were occassional homeless people along the Pacific Beach boardwalk. That being said, we were never uncomfortable. Right across from the hotel are condos that are starting at $750,000!!! The hotel was really convenient to La Jolla and to Seaworld. We loved that we stayed right on the beach and could hear the ocean. We paid $15 day to park in their garage under the hotel. They even had music playing in the garage that was relaxing. I found the convenience of the parking well worth the $15. This was such a great value. We would definitely go back in a heart beat.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: lvjen
Reviews.Content: Drove to San Diego from Vegas, stayed for 3 nights based on all the great reviews on this site. We did a lot of research to find a nice beach-front hotel & so glad we chose this one, we won't stay anywhere else in San Diego! Everything these other reviewers say were true for us too.. Helpful & friendly staff, great service, good location. Hotel decor was great, no complaints with the room at all. Loved coming back from dinner to find our beds turned down, chocolates on the nightstand & the radio playing some nice 'ambiance' music... Nice touches like that make this hotel unique. I couldn't get enough of the beautiful view from the room. Also the Continental Breakfast room opens up to the pool/patio area , so we ate breakfast outside looking out over the ocean every morning, it was a lovely way to start every day! Wasn't sure at first about paying extra for the parking garage, but glad we did. Parking seemed kind of limited & we were driving a larger-sized truck that was much easier to park in the garage, since it was never more than 2/3 full, and it felt very safe & secure.. Loved our visit, will definitely return!

Reviews.Title: “Can't go wrong here!”
Reviews.Author: JohnnySox
Reviews.Content: We chose the Pacific Terrace based upon the reviews and were not dissapointed. We stayed for a week and had a great experience. The room was ample size and clean with one of the most comfortable beds we have ever slept in. The room was "ocean view" and we could sit on the deck and watch the surfers and the sunsets. The 41" HDTV was an added bonus. Nice bathrobes were suppled, morning paper, nightly cleaning and turndown service, fresh towels at the door every morning, a nice breakfast included with bagels, pastries, fresh fruit, yogurt, juices, cereal and coffee. Every afternoon at 4pm there was a wine reception included, this was a great chance to meet others at the hotel. The pool was heated and the hot tub was clean. There were many restaurants we could walk to in a 10-15 minute walk. We could drive to most attractions in only 20 minutes, an excellent location. Pacific Beach is full of the boistrous twenty something crowd but that does create any problems. This is a great choice and great value for the quality of the facility.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay anywhere else!”
Reviews.Author: ajc57068
Reviews.Content: I am a travel agent and VERY picky when it comes to hotels. The Pacific Terrace is now on my list of the best! We completely enjoyed. Could not have asked for a better location or better service! An onsite restaurant would have been nice, but there were numerous places to chose from within walking distance to the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Very nice rooms and views”
Reviews.Author: susieq35
Reviews.Content: Went to the Pacific Terrace for the weekend before Valentine's day. The weather was terrible, cold and rainy (not the hotel's fault) We stayed in the Presedential suite and it was worth the extra $$. Beautifully appointed room, jacuzzi tub, Tommy Bahama like furnishings, flat screen T.V. ipod docking station. The only draw back is that this is supposed to be a non-smoking room/hotel but they allow smoking on the balcony and there were cigarette butts left there along with the aroma of cigarettes. This caused my husband's allergies to flare up making him sicker than a dog and as you can imagine ruining the romance of the weekend. We had to cancel our dinner reservation. We ordered room service and waited for well over 1 hour 30 minutes when the food arrived it was cold. This is probably due to the fact that there is not a restaurant at the facility and they order out from another restaurant.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderfully relaxing experience”
Reviews.Author: traveler304
Reviews.Content: As a frequent business traveler, I'd all but given up on a decent level of customer service provided by a hotel. The Pacific Terrace blew me away. We'd made use of the mini-bar fridge to store some personal items. On our 2nd day of four, we came back to our room to find that they'd brought us our own mini-fridge and placed our personal items in there. It was a very proactive, service-oriented action. On our last night, we tried to use the hotel computer to print boarding passes, but the printer wasn't working. The front desk person tried to fix the printer, with no luck. She immediately offered to check me in for my flight and print my boarding passess. I don't know about you, but there are times when I've run out of towels and called housekeeping to bring a few more the next morning. Every morning there was a basket of towels placed outside of our door just in case we needed some. We did have a problem with our AC functioning intermittenly. It wasn't a big deal because the outside temperature was mild. We came back to the room in the evening to find a cute hammer made of chocolate with a note from the maintenance person thank us for our patience while they fixed the AC. There will always be issues with rooms - but what matters most is how the hotel staff approaches it. In this case, they did a wonderful job. I personally loved the area that the hotel is located in. It's very low key and relaxing. Lots of local restaurants. The room was incredibly comfortable. A couple of nights we sank into the comfy bed with our down pillows and watched movies on the plasma TV, with the sliding door open so we could hear the ocean.

Reviews.Title: “Thank you trip advisors for the recommendation”
Reviews.Author: SuccessJoy
Reviews.Content: I just checked out this morning from a 3 day holiday weekend stay. I reserved 2 superior rooms with ocean view. They upgraded one to their top suite but both were great rooms with large balconies and great viewes - dead center over the pool and on their top floor of 3 floors (313 & 314). The rooms come with about a 40 inch HD LCD TV and a iHome radio alarm clock for my IPOD. They both have a refrigerator and more on the jacuzzi suite. Great looking, heavy furniture. The staff were ALL great. The cleaning crew to a person were so friendly and helpful. The front desk staff are young and hip, in keeping with the area. They almost pleaeded to me at check out if there was anything that could have made the hotel visit better. The hotel location is relatively quiet and has a great "boardwalk" just outside the property with fantastic views of the water. I really liked the small size of the place. Oh yeah, we listened to the roar of the ocean all night long. The breakfast is continental but was great. Again very friendly staff. There is a late afternoon happy hour with California wines. There are a number of good places to eat within a couple of blocks. Gringos was the best of the lot. We were always able to find a free parking spot but that may be becuase we parked the car around 5 PM for the night. Thank you trip advisor users for helping me find a great hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic Service, Location and Amenities”
Reviews.Author: KittenMama
Reviews.Content: I recently stayed for 2 nights while on business and plan to make this my new hotel in San Diego. The staff is extremely warm and intent on providing excellent service. The hotel itself is beautiful and is right on the beach with beautiful views. Continental breakfast is included. Wireless internet throughout. Pool, hot tub. Right on the boardwalk. What's not to love?

Reviews.Title: “We loved it !!”
Reviews.Author: thehudspeths
Reviews.Content: Pacific Terrace is just "perfect" the location is wonderful, waking distance from a lively part of town, shops and restaurantes. Right at the beach, fantastic views, the hotel is lovely. We will go back

Reviews.Title: “Quality Not Quantity”
Reviews.Author: sweetman47
Reviews.Content: A recent remodel of this hotel has made this a great botique property at an already great location. Pulaski furniture you'd want in your home, quiet rooms and friendly staff set this hotel apart. There are only 73 rooms but at least that many staff members to provide what ever you need. Yet, the atmosphere is tranquil. And when you step out onto your balcony and see the beauty of the ocean's crashing waves and the setting sun--breathtaking! VALUE: We booked through Expedia and got a great deal on a flight, hotel package. We didn't book a room with a view, but when we arrived they "upgraded" us to a Junior Suite with a view. We took a chance here because there are a few rooms that don't have views of the ocean. Our view was partial. But even what we could see of the ocean was gorgeous. Subtracting the price of our flights, we paid about $175 a night and it was worth it. The Junior Suite was a king sized bed, a sitting area and a kitchenette with a bar that seated four. LUXURY: Travertine tile, wood molding and granite was not just in the lobby but also in the kitchenette and bathroom of the Jr. Suite. The widescreen LCD TV was sharp. It was housed in an entertainment center with display cabinets. The waffle weave bathrobes were heavy. Each night, the turn down service left chocolates in a velvet bag or a small box like Godiva's. They cleaned the room morning and evening. Even the balcony was spotless. Each morning there was a basket outside your room with extra towels, if you needed them, and the local paper. The continental breakfast each morning (pastries, juices, coffee, milk, cereals, fresh fruit, yogurt, etc.) and the wine reception each evening were complementary. The bath soap was shaped like a sea shell. The shower head was a massager. The sink soap was large. The soaps and lotions were on a copper tray and were of high quality. The balcony had a cafe table and four chairs. LOCATION: Pacific Beach is a surfer community. But even the little bungalows blocks from the beach were over a million dollars or more. The hotel is on the boardwalk above the beach. To the north is a large condo building, then mansions. To the south, condos shops and restaurants. A grocery store and drug store were within walking distance at Grand and Mission Bay. We ate at Gringo's Mexican food and The Green Flash for breakfast served till 3 and fresh sea food. We also ate at Nick's but wouldn't recommend that restaurant. (See my reviews of those restaurants.) Fat Burgers was good too. You could enjoy the room, beach, boardwalk and neighborhood (some interesting shops up Garnet) for a day or two and not have to venture elsewhere, if you didn't want to. PARKING: We took at taxi from the airport (about $23, plus tip) instead of renting a car at first, because they charged for parking at the hotel. But our last day there I rented a car from Enterprise, who came to pick me up and allowed me to return it to a location near the airport when we left. Enterprise gave us a free shuttle ride to the airport. I got the car for less than $30 for a day and was again "upgraded" to a midsize car. I was able to park the rental car on the street within a block, sometimes two, of the hotel. The atmosphere of San Diego was very laid back (even the homeless people were more laid back!) In January it was comfortable to be outside near the beach with long sleeves during the day (60s) and a light jacket at night (50s). It was truly a relaxing experience. If I could afford the housing there, I would consider moving there.

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: gfdeb
Reviews.Content: Based on Trip Advisor reviews, we selected the Pacific Terrace for a recent short stay in San Diego out of hundreds of hotels. Were we ever happy that we did! We spent the front end of our trip at the Wyndham Downtown which was "ok" until we compared the value, location and amenities with the Pacific Terrace. The service was outstanding from the minute we arrived. Very solicitious, courteous, friendly, helpful but never too much. Our room was a delight as we booked a garden view but were rewarded with a partial ocean view and a room that looked just like the one featured on their hotel website (how often does THAT happen to anyone?) And, I know there is a time for downtown hotels- like the Wyndham- but it was expensive, the service was mediocre, the room was poor (and not what we had booked)....If you want to have an ocean beach at your door, with a small hotel feel/experience and still be near to what is happening, you will love the Pacific Terrace.

Reviews.Title: “Rave reviews were true!”
Reviews.Author: verogal
Reviews.Content: My husband and I met old friends at the Pacific Terrace for a week end get-a-way. Trip Advisor has worked well for me in the past, so I used it to research a beach hotel in the San Diego area. Most of the reviews I read about the Pacific Terrace before going there seemed too good to be true. I almost chose Trip Advisor's number two recommendation because I coud not believe so many positive reviews were possible. I am glad I did not choose number two, but stayed with number one! From our first encounter at the front desk until checking out of the hotel, everything was wonderful. All of the staff were extremely courteous and helpful. The decor was exceptional with attention to detail. Rooms were spotless and nice size with lot of extras like the Ipod docking station at the bedside. Beds were so comfy. Icing on the cake (or rather cookies) was the added touch of fresh cookies at the front desk and a complimentary wine hour from 4 to 5 pm. We were right on the ocean and the view was spectacular. We took long walks along the beach and enjoyed the local shops and restaurants. Our only regret is that we could not stay longer. We will definately go back to this first class establishment.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent”
Reviews.Author: ColoradoScootman
Reviews.Content: Great Hotel! After our 3 night stay here, we traveled to Las Vegas and stayed at the Bellagio - The Pacific Terrace was every bit as comfortable as the Bellagio. The staff was very friendly and helpful. Very clean. The rooms are spacious and very comfortable - flat screen tv's too. Cool location with easy access onto the beach or to decent restaurants.

Reviews.Title: “Nice beachside botique hotel”
Reviews.Author: bevanderson98
Reviews.Content: We only stayed for one night but it was lovely. Our room looked out over the pool and the ocean. The room decor was warm and inviting. The complimentary breakfast was nicer than you typically get. This place has a botique hotel feel to it. One thing to note is that parking might be hard to get on the street which means you have to pay for the garage.

Reviews.Title: “Great views and running by the beach”
Reviews.Author: Lynn_Lyon
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Pacific Terrace for a one week business trip based on the tripadvisor ratings when the hotel where my conference was scheduled was not available. I agree with the other posts and only wish that the conference had been held at this hotel. The differences between this and the one hosting the conference were very noticable. I was fortunate to have landed here. I was upgraded to an ocean-front suite and had a beautiful balcony overlooking the ocean. The room, amenities and overall experience were much better than expected for the price (Expedia had a better pre-pay rate than calling the hotel directly). My favorite perk was easy access to running on a well-lit sidewalk that runs parallel to the ocean (so much better than running on the sand). I was able to have a quick run every morning, enjoy the sunrise and see the surfers starting their day. The run gave me a chance for people-watching (there were some characters singing, playing instruments, hanging out) as well as the diverse group of homes on the water (everything from $6M custom homes to quaint little beach homes). The breakfast was very nice and convenient on my way out every morning. The only challenge (which appears to be everywhere in this area) wa the lack of quick cab service. There are not cabs lined up in front of the hotel and it can take up to 20 minutes to have a cab show up. When I could walk I did because the weather was so nice but it was challenging to get anywhere in a hurry. I wish I had more time at the hotel and in San Diego to enjoy it more. I look forward to returning and bringing the family.

Reviews.Title: “Great Little Hotel”
Reviews.Author: akh2oguy
Reviews.Content: We stayed here 12/13-12/16 in an "oceanview room". It was as indicated, however, you had to be on the balcony, which was a large, comfortable balcony, to see the ocean. What I liked about the hotel best, is that it is at the far end of a line of beach hotels and restaurants. Consequently, you get the best of both worlds; a quieter place to relax and enjoy your outdoor balcony or just a short walk down the water front to fine restaurants and party spots. I'd recommend this hotel to anyone staying in the San Diego area. Reviewed by the h2oguy from Anchorage, AK

Reviews.Title: “Best Hotel Stay Ever”
Reviews.Author: TravlinGuy
Reviews.Content: Awesome view; clean, nicely decorated rooms; balcony overlooking the Pacific Ocean; the sound of the surf at night; a staff who genuinely seems to care about making your stay enjoyable (Claire at the front desk is a real gem); a good continental breakfast; excellent location with lots of good, reasonably priced restaurants within walking distance (try Taco Surf across Mission Blvd). I was there for a conference, and my conference hotel was full, so I happened across the Pacific Terrace. I had a much nicer stay here than I would have at the larger conference hotel nearby. I will definitely be back here again. One minor beef: I checked the price through an online reservation service and called the hotel direct to see if they would match it. The reservation clerk said no. When I arrived, a different desk clerk informed me that not only do they match online rates, but they beat them by 10%.

Reviews.Title: “Great Everything”
Reviews.Author: mashdm
Reviews.Content: We loved this hotel. The location is great, the rooms are spacious and the service was prompt. The breakfast in the morning was so nice, especially having two kids with us. We loved this hotel and would go back in a second.

Reviews.Title: “A Thanksgiving to remember”
Reviews.Author: Spirerock
Reviews.Content: We (my wife and I and our daughter and son-in-law) just returned from a great getaway over Thanksgiving at the Pacific Terrace. Our experience parallels the reviews of many of the prior guests. it is a great place to stay!! Let's get this one out of the way right off ... Yes, our shower leaked a bit, but only if we weren't observant. The doors swing from the walls, meeting in the middle of the tub opening. It is great for getting in and out of the tub, but can leak if you don't get the doors closed in the correct sequence over the side of the tub. This did not ruin our stay. The staff is indeed friendly. We arrived early and were given access to the pool area and general facilities while we waited. Being a holiday week, we did not get an upgrade, but were pleasantly surprised by the view from our 'partial ocean view' room. (see photos) It may be that since we arrived early, we may have gotten the two prime POV rooms that were available. Our room was larger than the room that our kids had because theirs lost some of the footprint to the stairwell. This is something you may want to watch for even in the second floor Ocean View rooms. The breakfast was sufficient and ample, but lacked any form of protein other than yogurt. The selection of scones, muffins, pastries, cereal and fresh fruit should keep most appetites at bay for the morning. It was very nice to not have to get up, get dressed and go find breakfast. There is an interesting, reasonalby priced breakfast stand just down the walkway from the hotel that had people lined up out the door each day. The grounds are very well kept and groomed. The pool and spa are very well maintained and their are plenty of towels by the pool and in baskets by the rooms that can be used from until the rooms are serviced. Our only complaints regard a few details in the room ... a noisy AC system fan that was irritating, plantation shutters that were not properly installed and didn't slide well and a few needed paint touch ups. It appeared that the room had recently had some rennovations that just weren't well finished. It was obvious that new carpet had just been installed in the stairway, so upgrades are in process. Also, the bell on the elevator door is really annoying! The 42" plasma TV was so good that even my wife enjoyed watching it. You do get a bit of price break on tickets to major attractions by booking through the concierge. When we go back, and we will go back, we will upgrade to an Ocean View room. This is a great facility in a prime ocean front location.

Reviews.Title: “Very People Oriented”
Reviews.Author: teacher34
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a trip to San Diego/Pacific Beach. This time I wanted to try out the Pacific Terrace Hotel as I wanted to do some comparisons of another hotel in this area we also enjoyed. The Pacific Terrace Hotel (PTH) has wonderfully appointed rooms. Our room was on the second floor and had a partial ocean view. I would have preferred full ocean view, but at least we got a little bit of the ocean and the surfers. Our room was reallly very beautiful as well as very spacious. Floral patterns and dark woods, small refrig, coffee maker, toaster, etc. The room includes breakfast in their Carribean Room, choices of ceral, fruits, juices, bagels, etc. They also turn down the bed in the evening, and leave a little bag of chocolate on the pillow. From 4-5PM they have wine. The view and location cannot be beat. Parking is $15 per day, however, they do have a few free slot and there is parking on the street. We were able to park on the street during our stay, so no fee. Very friendly staff, a great place to stay. We love this area. A perfect vacation!

Reviews.Title: “Coastal Gem”
Reviews.Author: MariMouse
Reviews.Content: This is a beautiful hotel that exceeded my high expectations. It is the type of place I would return year after year. Pros: Helpful staff, immaculately clean and updated, nice sized balconies (worth the $$ for ocean view; you will regret not having it), excellent beds and linens, robes provided, clean, beautiful pool area. Turn down service is nice, if you like that. Beautiful sunset view. Nice warm outdoor shower for those returning from the beach. Good spa services available. Fun to watch surfers from balcony. Cons: Surrounding neighborhood is rundown and sketchy for walking at night -- safe, but not nice (ex. young men sharing a joint on the sidewalk, many vagrants). Very urban. Not a lot of familes walking around at night. (Boardwalk area OK during the day. Lots of joggers. ) Housekeeping was pleasant but not thorough; did not remove our trash every day even when full. Parking is $15/day billed automatically. Your responsibility to ask them to remove the charges if you don't use garage. We used the free parking in the alley. My strongest dislike was having to go to the garage to use guest laundry. Very isolated area. Neutral: Breakfast is OK, all carbs (cereals, pastries, fruit). Wine hour is nice but wine is low end (you get what you pay for when it's free). No snacks available; bring your own. Jr suites are significantly larger than 2 bedded rooms. Beach chairs available for $5/day. They are extremely heavy and awkward. Supply own lightweight chair, if possible. Beach can be very windy. Some good restaurants but not a large number of family oriented places. Definitely the surfer bar part of town. Try Kafe' Zen for great Thai food. Many restaurants deliver to hotel. This hotel could use its own restaurant. Overall, I just loved it and would love to return. I know I listed some cons, but I wanted to be thorough. It's a great destination hotel if you want to hang out and enjoy the amenties. It's beautifully maintained. I just wish it was in a more upscale neighborhood.

Reviews.Title: “A breathtaking view......Denver, CO”
Reviews.Author: Travelnurse6156
Reviews.Content: As a travel nurse finishing an assignment in San Diego, my husband and I decided to spend 3 nights enjoying this lovely city. We both love the water and I wanted to choose a location that would give us a nice view. I could not have imagined what lay in store for us. The hotel was a mere 13 minutes from the apartment where I had been staying and it was very easy to find. We were thrilled as we pulled up to the hotel. Checking in was a breeze and the entire staff from the front desk to housekeeping was pleasant and very accommodating. Upon walking into the room, we immediately walked onto the ocean front balcony and could not take our eyes off of the beautiful view. We had a premium ocean view junior suite, which was not cheap, but well worth every penny. The room itself was very large and spotlessly clean. Wonderful amenities, a great large screen TV and the most comfortable linens we ever slept on! Not to mention the turndown service, chocolates and superb robe and slippers! We immediately decided that we would forego some of the activites we had planned, and instead, just enjoy the beauty and romance of this ocean front jewel.....and we did just that. We walked on the beach during the day and at night, with some of the most gorgeous sunsets. This hotel is right up the boardwalk from Mission Beach, but much quieter with an interesting array of people, as we both love to people watch. As another reviewer wrote, do not let the surrounding buildings make you hesitate. This is a very sweet community that is peaceful, relaxed and ultra convenient. A real taste of the beach/surfer life. We were able to walk to restaurants (we ate twice at Hennessey's....try the Shepherds Pie!). The afternoon wine by the pool was a nice treat. Lovely landscaping compliments this tropical oasis. We never imagined ourselves being able to fall asleep with a patio door open listening to the crashing of the waves. What a great ending to my short assignment in San Diego. We are already looking to return!

Reviews.Title: “Special view”
Reviews.Author: John&Jennifer
Reviews.Content: Right on the front overlooking the beach and sea, top quality hotel, superb staff, very clean and well maintained. Stayed 3 nights late October and apart from a little noise from the room above and an early checkout in an adjoining room, which disrupted our last nights sleep, this hotel was exellent. After exploring, La Jolla just up the coast was a better area, but as this is only a few minutes by car, the hotel is still an ideal base. San Diego, Seaworld ect are 10-15 minutes by car also, but make sure you get a local area map before setting off so as not to get lost. If visiting San Diego use the public parking down the side of the USS Medway aircraft carrier, $10 for all day.

Reviews.Title: “You won't be disappointed.......”
Reviews.Author: 41off
Reviews.Content: What a great Hotel and in an amazing position overlooking the beach. What you need to know... It is clearly run by people that CARE.. Wine hour from 4-5pm, complimentary quality breakfast, free parking and a complimentary Computer for guests to use together with friendly warm staff. These are things that any Hotel could offer, but don't. This Hotel deserves all the credit and resulting business such innovation brings. The pool area is great and spotlessly clean our only regret was that we didn't spend more time here....

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Stay!”
Reviews.Author: guacomole
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pacific Terrace with my two teenage daughters for three nights in October. We'd booked a partial ocean view, but our room wasn't ready when we arrived, so the hotel upgraded us to a suite. It was lovely! A beautiful view from our balcony, soft beds, lots of room, quite clean, fresh cookies every afternoon at the front desk. The continental breakfast was nothing memorable, but it was fine. The service was excellent. Everyone from the front desk to the housekeeping staff was friendly and polite. I'd definitely stay here again.

Reviews.Title: “Exceptional view, nice breakfast, gorgeous pool, professional staff”
Reviews.Author: PickyPacker
Reviews.Content: I'd never been to San Diego and really wanted to be where we could see the ocean. Not only was the view breathtaking, but the sound of the crashing surf lulled us to sleep each night. It's hard to imagine a finer location in all of California. On check-in we were generously upgraded from a partial ocean view to a full ocean view room. (#214, located nearly in the center of the hotel facing the ocean). The room was lavishly decorated and spotlessly clean. Throughout our 4 night stay (Oct 17-20, 2006) the maid service was fantastic and the evening turn-down and chocolates left on the pillows were such a nice touch. The beds were incredibly comfy. The giant flat screen TV had my husband in awe as he watched a baseball game. Now he wants one at home! The continental breakfast was quite generous and very good: about a dozen dry cereals to choose from, milk, assorted juices, tea and fresh brewed coffee, better-quality pastries, a variety of fresh fruit including cut melons, bagels, muffins, bread, and even peanut butter and cream cheese to use as spreads. The pool and hot tub were cleaned and serviced every morning and just the right temperature. There were always clean towels, including long lounge chair towels, right beside the pool. It was such fun to sit in the hot tub and watch the skaters on the path and the surfers on the beach. The staff was very attentive about keeping the pool area clean and tidy. During the 4-5pm wine reception you could even take a glass of wine (served in a special plastic glass) with you to the pool or hot tub. Don't be alarmed by the older apartment complexes sandwiched between the hotel and the main drag of Mission Blvd. They look a little seedy compared to the sparkling Pacific Terrace Hotel, but seem to be inhabited by mostly laid-back surfer types. I thought the Pacific Beach area would be more upscale, but it is a colorful mixture of old and funky with new and trendy. Our stay at Pacific Terrace was fantastic and I can't wait to return. My only regret is that we had so many plans for our time in San Diego, but the Pacific Terrace was so delightful that we hated to leave and ended up spending hours each day just relaxing by the pool, enjoying the complimentary breakfast and wine, and watching the sunset. I'd highly recommend this hotel to anyone who appreciates the natural beauty of the ocean, clean rooms, comfortable beds, a good breakfast, and cheerful, professional staff. Also I have to mention that we ate at Gringo's mexican restaurant 3 out of the 4 nights we were at the Pacific Terrace. It's a short stroll down the path from the hotel, located on the corner of Garnet and Mission Blvd. The food was very fresh and tasty. My daughters loved watching the tortillas being hand made as they have a window between the dining area and the kitchen.

Reviews.Title: “The Review were true”
Reviews.Author: Burn1911
Reviews.Content: We were on a road trip down the coast and didn't book until a few days before and so with limited internet acess were relying on the reviews on Trip Advisor being correct and OMG they were spot on with this one, it was FANTASTIC...... We were blown away when we walked in the room and felt we had been transported somewhere remote and tropical, what a treat and such a shame we were only there for 1 night. It was expensive, and it is a shame they charge for parking when you really have very few other choices, but the price was worth it for the room and the view and the facilities, they let us use the pool for the full day the day we checked out, which in my mind is a big PRO for them!!! The staff were lovely all around, the breakfast ladies were really nice!! Very friendly! And the chocolates left on our bed after the turndown (which we weren't expecting!) were YUMMY!!! none of that cheap rubbish!! So yep we loved it, big thumbs up from us, Well Done!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the hotel, room, view, and location!”
Reviews.Author: salsamia
Reviews.Content: This is the best hotel on Pacific Beach which is situated perfectly for all San Diego sight seeing vacations - close to everything. The hotel staff is friendly and helpful in every way. The room is perfect, clean, completely remodeled with the best of everything from new furniture, the best bed with a feather bed on top and views that overlook the pool with flaming torches and a jacuzzi as well as the ocean and the beach just on the other side of the glass wall. Nice robes in the bathroom, a kitchen, and a wide screen LCD TV with all of the comforts of home and more. Your own private balcony where you will leave the windows open all night and listen to the waves come in. We barely had time to stay in the room, but we didn't want to leave it and go home.

Reviews.Title: “Breathtaking”
Reviews.Author: USANorway
Reviews.Content: My husband and I took our first trip to CA and despite the gloomy weather this hotel was wonderful. The staff were very helpful and efficient. The hotel is located a block from the main drag so the noise level is reduced. The breakfast was delicious, always fresh fruit. We had an oceanview room and were able to eat our breakfast on the balcony and take in the beautiful view. If we are to return to CA again in the future we would definitely stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. Even our Californian friends were impressed with the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: MDJ77
Reviews.Content: Have been to “The Terrace” many times over the last six years and each time is just as exciting as the first time we were there. We were there in march of this year ‘06 and saw some of the new furnishings being moved into some of the rooms. Just returned from yet another wonderful stay and the new furnishings including the 40” TV’s really put this already wonderful place over the top. (the price is getting to be almost over the top to but worth it to a point. The pool area is always clean and like new and the continental breakfast is a real meal (not just bagels and coffee) with plenty of room to sit by the pool to enjoy while you read the SD union paper provided every morning and a great view of the ocean from the pool area. The surrounding locations provide a real variety of food and attractions. (You have to eat at the Green Flash, the food is great and affordable). All in all the best hotel in San Diego.

Reviews.Title: “Wow!! The reviews were right.”
Reviews.Author: 2_x_Travellers
Reviews.Content: You always wonder when the reviews for a hotel are this good, whether you are going to be disappointed. Well, we weren't. It lived up to everything we expected, and more. The staff are very friendly, and went out of their way to ensure we enjoyed our stay. We were upgraded to a junior suite - HOT TIP for anyone booking one - the cabinet lights are turned off by touching the hinges!! We kid you not. You feel as if you are somewhere tropical, but near to everything. There are some free parking spaces outside the hotel, but it is first come first served. Breakfast well worth a try, and the pool is a welcome treat after a day out & about. Free internet access available for guests. Hotel recommended a restaurant called Green Flash - a 9 block walk south down the broadwalk, which was well worth the walk. We loved this hotel, and will be back again.

Reviews.Title: “This is the "Real Deal"!”
Reviews.Author: raider74
Reviews.Content: This place is just like most previous reviewers have stated. It is truely a Diamond in the rough! Vacationers to the Oregon Coast should compare this to a Shilo Inn x 10. Friendly staff, ( really), helpful conciere (really) and a front desk staff that is interested in making your stay as enjoyable as possible (really). We stayed for three days in a premium Junior Suite on the third floor in late September. Slight noise of the ocean could be heard at night. Wonderful King bed and flat screen TV. $15 daily parking under the hotel is well worth it. Parking in the neighborhood is sketchy. Boardwalk along the ocean makes for wonderful mornining walks. Guys, check out Konos a couple blocks south for takeout breakfast/coffee. Big Breakfast #1 for $5.50 was great! We brought this back and my wife enjoyed the continental breakfast at the hotel by the pool. Complementary wine hour from 4-5 daily was enjoyable. We got back from downtown at 5:30 one evening and the conciere graciously brought two full glasses to our room within 10 minutes when politely asked if it would be possible this once. This was our first visit to San Diego, but will not be the last. Too many things to do and see. We will definitely stay here again next time. No doubt about it!!

Reviews.Title: “This Place Really is The Best!!”
Reviews.Author: HogsBreath_01
Reviews.Content: Well what can I say? My new wife and I spent the final 3 days of our honeymoon from 18th - 21st September at Pacific Terrace and it exceeded all our expectations. We picked the PT after reading all the good things written about it on Trip Advisor and to be honest because of all the ravings I had a sneaky feeling it would be a bit of a disappointment. You know what I mean.......when you expect something to be so good, it's always a let down. After a horrible overnight flight from a fantastic week in Hawaii and an extremely irritating 4 hour drive from LAX, we pulled up at Pacific Terrace. We had not slept for over 24 hours and must have looked like the living dead..........we certainly felt like it! However from the moment we stepped inside, we were made to feel so comfortable and welcome, we knew this place was different from most hotels. Our room was to die for - it was huge. We had paid for a Deluxe Ocean View Room, but randomly got upgraded to a Deluxe Ocean View Suite. It was fantastic. The bed was so comfortable, the massive HD ready Plasma TV unbelievable, the bar and kitchen area (which we were not expecting at all) were great and the balcony and view were spectacular. The pool area, although small, was more than adequate for the size of the hotel and was so well looked after. If you're around the pool area at 4.00pm each afternoon, a trolley gets wheeled out with a complimentary selection of wine for guests. I thought what a nice touch to be given something for nothing; a glass of wine would be lovely. Four glasses later, I thought it was an even nicer touch!! However, all these things said, the thing that really puts this hotel in a league of its own is the staff. I've stayed in a lot of different accommodations in my time and I can without hesitation say these guys were the best. Not only were they so very helpful and efficient, but their general manor and friendliness was really heart warming. I cannot put it into words, but I'm sure everyone else who's stayed here will back me up, they are just really genuinely lovely people. From the maids, to the room service, to the reception staff - absolutely everyone was fantastic. I 've always fancied going to San Diego and had lots of things planned to end off our 3 week honeymoon. However, we were so comfortable in the Pacific Terrace, we did nothing..........and didn't feel bad about doing nothing! This place was so awesome, it just seemed appropriate to chill out and enjoy our last few days in peace. Trust me, for all you people considering staying here........go for it.......you will not be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Experience”
Reviews.Author: doke
Reviews.Content: The staff is amazing. We checked in early and they upgraded us to a junior suite. Every single member of the staff was so pleasant and accomodating, and the best part was that it was all genuine. The afternoon wine hour and continental breakfast, both out by the pool, was top notch. The room itself was amazing. Great, classy decor with a bar and a large, flat screen HD television. A great, king sized bed. A superb balcony that overlooks the pool and the Pacific Ocean, complete with dozens of surfers, was equally staggering. There is a walking and biking trail between the pool and the beach, and everybody that walks by does a double take to look at the beautiful property. It looks like an oasis with all of the palm trees making the great three story structure look even more amazing. It does cost an extra $15 a day to park in their garage but it's a small price to pay for all of the greatness. My girlfriend and I have been lucky enough to go to many beautiful places and stay in many beautiful hotels but we both think this was the best overall experience we ever had in our travels. We are already making plans to fly across the country again just to stay here.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent!”
Reviews.Author: BALovToTravel
Reviews.Content: We chose to stay here because of prior TripAdvisor reviews. The Pacific Terrace Hotel lived up to all expectations. The location was excellent - right on the beach in a nice beach community. The staff was both friendly and helpful. The pool area faces the beach, yet is glassed in for privacy. In the evening, we walked to restaurants nearby on staff suggestions. The room itself was wonderful - we chose a non-beach front room, however, we could sit on the patio, and see the ocean and the beach walk from our patio. Our room was beautifully decorated. The sitting area had a large, flat-screen TV. We both loved the king-size bed - it was one of the most comfortable beds I've ever slept in! Everything about the hotel was first-class -- US Today delivered to the room, great continental breakfast with fresh fruit, and wine at the pool every day at 4-5. In addition to the normal room amenities you expect from this type of hotel, the room included terry robes, lighted makeup mirror, q-tips and cotton balls, and a full-size hair dryer. Will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “More wine? Yes, please.”
Reviews.Author: SquireDanaher
Reviews.Content: Location The Pacific Terrace Hotel is located on the beach in the heart of the San Diego surfer community, surrounded by a bevy of bars, burger joints and beach-wear bargains. You won't find any swank dining options within walking distance, but there are plenty of restaurants to choose from. I recommend Gringos. It's two blocks from the hotel and serves a great margarita. As for its beach locale, it couldn't be better. The hotel sits atop a 50-foot cliff with nothing between it and the ocean but a boardwalk, a few palm trees and about 100 feet of sand. Service Everyone we encountered at the Pacific Beach Hotel was extremely friendly and went out of their way to ensure we were having a pleasant stay. There seems to be a bit of pride in not being a big-box hotel, i.e. Hyatt, Marriott, etc., and it shows in their personal attention. It was nice to recognize the faces at the front desk and have them do the same with you. Amenities A heated pool. Hot tub. Balconies overlooking the ocean. Fresh cookies daily. Free wine. Does a hotel stay get much better? Additional nice touches: refridgerator in every room and games such as chess and Yahtzee! set out on tables by the pool. Very nice indeed.

Reviews.Title: “simply the best PB experience”
Reviews.Author: Vinny'sDad
Reviews.Content: Have been to Pacific Beach numerous times and stayed in numerous hotels there. This trip, we wanted a nice place to stay with our 7mo old son. First trip with him.. The room was HUGE!!! Had a suite on the 2nd floor. Bathroom was rediculously huge as well. All the furnishings were beyond top notch. Super clean everywhere. Balcony was perfect for viewing the ocean and some of the street life.. The pool and surrounding areas are fantastic. Loads of plants, clean walks, and a very clean and warm pool. The staff was VERY friendly and polite no matter what the situation. Breakfast was perfect every day. Pastry, bagels etc. You can walk to sooo many restaurants, bars, shops, you name it in just a few min. They even have locked surfboard lockers in the garage which was great so I did not have to lug my board to the room every day. The surfing scene is very laid back and super friendly right in front of the hotel. It was worth every penny. I have to say, it is the first time a website, brochure pic, has been accurate or even less spectacular then the location itself. The Pacific Terrace far exceeded our expectations (which were pretty high!)

Reviews.Title: “Loved Our Stay!!!”
Reviews.Author: perezk27
Reviews.Content: We have just returned from a 3 night stay at Pacific Terrace Hotel. This place is just amazing. We had a premium ocean view room with 2 queen beds. The room was very spacious and well decorated (the wood shutters and big screen tv added a nice touch!) They offered a free continental breakfast, wine hour by the pool from 4-5 pm., and freshly baked cookies at 4 pm. Very friendly and knowledgeable staff. If you want to utilize the use of their parking garage there is a $15/day charge (it's not a lot if you want a secure place to park your car at night). We didn't have to do a lot of driving since there are eating places and grocery stores within walking distance. My kids (ages 4 & 2) loved the fact that we didn't have to walk far to go to the beach - it's right outside the pool area. We will definitely stay here again!

Reviews.Title: “Pleasure!”
Reviews.Author: Lenasu11
Reviews.Content: My friend and I discovered the Pacific Terrace Hotel while looking for a well priced place to stay in PB. The rooms were decorated to make you feel like you were in the tropics. The beds were huge and so comfy! The bathroom was marble and spacious. The pool overlooks the beach and they even serve free wine from 4-5pm. The staff was extremely pleasant. It was a pleasurable experience all in all. I will definately go back!

Reviews.Title: “It's true! This hotel is a "diamond" in the rough!!! We absolutely loved it!”
Reviews.Author: Carolyn66
Reviews.Content: When we heard our son decided to join the U.S. Marine Corps and that he would be graduating bootcamp in early September of this year, we decided to plan a one week trip to California. We really wanted to treat ourselves and stay somewhere near the ocean with a nice view, but were unsure of which hotel we should select. When we stumbled upon the Pacific Terrace Hotel and read all of the reviews about this "diamond in the rough", we decided to give it a try. I have to be honest...we thought the reviews might be a little too good to be true. However, let me tell you...WE LOVED EVERY MINUTE of our stay. When we checked in, the staff was very friendly and truly went out of their way to ensure our stay was as wonderful as possible. Upon entering our suite...and I know my mouth dropped wide open...the bellman said, "Enjoy your stay with us". Our room was just BEAUTIFUL! We loved the turn-down service and chocolates at night and the 4-5 p.m. wine at the pool. The continental breakfast each morning was very nice with a plentiful selection and great coffee. We talked about planning our next vacation around our stay at this WONDERFUL hotel. I can't wait!!! Thank you so much Pacific Terrace...you are a 5 star in our book!

Reviews.Title: “Absolutely Wonderful!!!”
Reviews.Author: SLKSABR
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a 4 night stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel...WE HAD A GREAT TIME!!! First of all, my wife and I were vacationing with our two children ages 4.5 and 6. A 'Welcome' email from the hotel was received a day prior to our arrival, suggesting we prepare for relaxation…a nice way to begin. Our 5 pm check-in was smooth, especially for the busy holiday weekend. The staff at the front desk was courteous, professional and efficient. The bellman, Rich, was particularly helpful in pointing out all of the features of the property (pool, breakfast/wine hour, parking, etc.) and our stunning room. We booked an executive suite as it was the only way to GUARANTEE that we receive a room with two queen beds. Premium ocean view and Jr. suites are offered with both King/sofa bed or 2 queen configurations and while the hotel tries to accommodate all requests there are no guarantees. The room exceeded our expectations. Out third floor suite was very spacious and nicely appointed.
