Notable amenities: 42” plasma TV, large double sliding doors w/ plantation shutters, ocean view patio w/ seating for four, wet bar w/ microwave. The bathroom was exceptionally large and had a jetted tub. The room was clean and well cared for. Our room was located on the north side of the hotel facing the Capri and the ocean. Rooms on the south side look out toward Crystal Pier. There was enough noise at street level that we chose to close the sliders at night. I’m not sure if the rooms that directly face the ocean would be quieter as they are adjacent to the pool, beach and beach walk. The pool facility was appropriately sized for the hotel. Pool and hot tub were heated to 85 and 104 deg. respectively. There were no age restrictions for the hot tub. I believe the hours were 7-10 a.m. Seating was adequate and towels plentiful. Additional shade seating would be nice. This is NOT the ‘send your nanny down in the morning to reserve a lounge chair’ pool scene. Very relaxed and laid back. Deluxe continental breakfast is served from 7-10am and is well stocked and plentiful. Pastries, bagels, cereals, fresh fruits, yogurts, juice, coffee, tea and milk are offered. Seating is cozy inside or one can dine outside near the pool. It seemed that most guests took advantage of the complimentary breakfast. Iced tea and lemonade are available throughout the day as are an assortment of board games. Complementary wine hour is from 4-5 p.m. by the pool. The hotel DOES NOT have a restaurant or pool side bar service, however, there is fare from two local restaurants to choose from for room service or pool side delivery. Guests are also able to charge back to their room at several other nearby restaurants. Location is ideal. The hotel is located in Pacific Beach just north of Crystal Pier and shares an oceanfront location next to the Capri By The Sea condominiums. Beach access is just out the secured gates. Activities are plentiful. There are several restaurants nearby and worthy of mentioning: The Fishery, PB at Cass and Opal (.8 mile from hotel), an inland neighborhood eatery (no ocean view) delicious, FRESH seafood. Station Sushi, Solana Beach, if you’re up north (and returning to the hotel from Legoland) it’s well worth the stop. Great hotel staff recommendation! Taco Surf, PB, Mission Boulevard between Felspar and Emerald, GREAT taco eatery just a block away. Take-out for pool-side dining. I would not recommend Taylor’s. Service was slow, food mediocre and ambiance just so-so. The fitness room was under construction and was going to be ‘very small’ according to staff. We did not utilize any offsite fitness facility. Parking located beneath the hotel was adequate and secure; I believe it was $17 a night. The hotel also provided 10 first-come first-serve spaces in the alley behind the hotel at no charge. Surface/street parking is difficult due to the desirable beach location. Hotel checkout is 11 a.m. I had inquired about a late checkout when I booked our room two months prior to our stay and was told it would not be a problem, so I booked a late returning flight to Reno to maximize our stay. However, this request was denied the night before our departure due to the ‘unusually high amount of room turnover’. In the end, we were extended until noon and were able to use all the hotel facilities (less the room) until 3 p.m. So what cold be done better? Tough question. There were a few noticeable exterior ‘wear and tear’ marine environment issues (peeling paint, rusty metal) that could be repaired. A small pool side bar might be nice to aid in relaxation. One or two of the staff seemed overwhelmed by the demands and volume of guests and were neither helpful nor responsive to guest requests…find replacements ASAP that are truly dedicated to guest service. Overall, a wonderful long weekend and we’ll be back again in the spring for more enjoyment and relaxation!

Reviews.Title: “Awesome!”
Reviews.Author: Klee1
Reviews.Content: My family (2 children under 10 and husband) and I really enjoyed our recent stay. The room was spacious and newly redecorated with a great view of the ocean. We booked a partial oceanview and were very pleased watching the surfers in the morning. There was a small kitchenette (refrigerator, sink, stove) in our room. The continental breakfast was good, although we did venture down to Kono's two mornings and loved it - great coffee!! My children enjoyed the free cookies and lemonade and the complimentary wine hour was a very nice touch. Our room was kept very clean by the room attendant. The hotel is not directly on the beach but on a bluff above it. There are stairs and a ramp fairly nearby. We only had to park in their lot one evening and used the street parking whenever possible. There is also a computer on the first floor for internet access with a printer where you can print out tickets to local sights (many offer discounts). There is a public restroom to the south of the hotel building which does attract the homeless, however, we were never harassed or bothered at any time. The area is well used by surfers and fitness buffs (runners, walkers, and bikers). Overall, a great hotel. We will definitely stay there again!

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel”
Reviews.Author: alastairp
Reviews.Content: We recently spent 6 nights at this hotel. The location, adjacent to Pacific Beach is superb. Our room, a junior suite, was very large and spotlessly clean. Earlier comments regarding the evening service are all accurate; the chocolates, radio, turn down all add an extra touch. We too had the shower screen situation and regularly flooded the bathroom floor! The breakfast could be taken back to your room if desired and the staff were always eager to assist in any way possible. Just one thing re location; the streets near the hotel are full of young adults clubbing and pubbing and so, in the evening we drove to restaurants a little further afield. Having booked through expedia I would do so directly with the hotel and yes, I would LOVE to return again!

Reviews.Title: “Not impressed”
Reviews.Author: WallyJones
Reviews.Content: After being told that hotel guests had access to fitness facilities nearby, we find out after checking in that these "nearby" facitlities are 6+ blocks away. When I am traveling on vacation with my young kids, it's tough to fit in some time to exercise so I try to keep the time I am away doing that as short as possible. So now I have to spend nearly 25 minutes walking back and forth to a local club that costs me $11 to use each time. I travel several dozen times a year -- mostly for business and a few times for pleasure -- and to me nearby fitness facilities mean an elevator ride away or at most across the street. So today I barely had time to try to fit this in and trek off to the local club only to be told that I cannot use their facilities because I don't have ID with me -- of which the hotel made no mention that it would be required. So I end up out walking around for nearly half an hour and don't get time to get in some exercise because that would mean me being gone another hour and a half from my wife and kids. Hardly what they expect from me on a family vacation. Other comments: - it was -physically impossible to take a shower in our bathroom without flooding the floor with water because a large gap between the shower stall and the wall. It was a pain in the neck to have to mop up after every single shower which required us calling to ask for more towels and bath mats. - Their coffee is terrible. It tasted like it was made with grounds used for the second time. The location is very nice if you want to be right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: doescott
Reviews.Content: we just returned from a week at the pacific terrace,and i have never enjoyed a hotel so much.i am a tripadvisor member from massachusetts,no affiliation with this hotel in any way.having said this,the terrace was everything we hoped for and more.from the staff,to the free large continental breakfast,to the room everthing was awesome.breakfast was large and varied.the room was new and spotless.a 42" plasma was the perfect way to relax in the room.the pool was spotless and towels were always replenished.cold drinks were available all day,along with free cookies in the afternoon.wine tasting at 4pm,and chocalates at night made our stay truly enjoyable.if we ever go back to san diego,i would not hesitate to stay there again .well worth spending the extra money for a good place,as it makes a vacation so much more enjoyable.

Reviews.Title: “PAcific Terrace, a winner!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Dito! Just read the other reviews, nothing else to add other than I agree. Spent three days with my familly incliding two small kids. Great staff, great location, great rooms. Breakfast was plentifull in a fun environment. Check out at 11AM, but we were given keys to parking and hotel bathroom as well as towel tokens, so we stayed till sunset! Pacific Beach is a hippy/surfer zone, plenty of local shops and eateries. This hotel is a diamon in the rough!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay”
Reviews.Author: KellieCNh
Reviews.Content: My husband and I just returned from San Diego and stayed at the Pacific Terrace for two nights. Upon arrival, around 3pm, our room was not ready, we understood check in was 4pm, but had just driven 2.5 hours from Cabazon CA (where we vacationed for 5 days) and really just wanted to get into our room and relax! We left our luggage in the car and hung out at the beach until 4:15pm, went back and our room still wasn't ready, so they immediately upgraded us from the Junior Suite ($450.00 a night) to the Kingston Suite and showed us to our room. WOW.. What an awesome room!! The attendant at the desk told us that the Kingston Suite goes for $850.00 a night! It showed!! We had two balconies overlooking the ocean, one in the living room and one in the bedroom. Granite everywhere, great soaking tub, separate shower, large flat screen TV’s in both living room and bedroom. Turn down service at night was great. They left a box of chocolates on each of our pillows and slippers at the end of the bed. They dimmed the lights, turned on the ceiling fans and played really nice soft music on the radio in the bedroom. We really did not take advantage of the continental breakfast, but it did look great, very crowded though. We did order room service from one of the three restaurants that serviced them (no restaurant on site) and it took about 1.5 hours for delivery and by then the food was cold. Parking was $14.00 a day if you couldn't find an open space in their tiny parking lot. Staff was wonderful. Can't really say one bad thing about the Pacific Terrace Hotel! We met people staying at Pacific Terrace without an ocean view and their only complaint was the homeless people. One side of the hotel faces a public restroom and the homeless people tend to hang around there at all hours. They also sleep on the beach at night, but never once did it bother us or our great time we had.

Reviews.Title: “A Great Surprise”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific Terrace while on vacation in California from Florida. We had no specific plans or reservations and just drove down PCH from LA ending up in Mission Beach. Happened upon this wonderful hotel and could not have been happier. The rooms are beautiful. Beds are very comfortable. Huge bathrooms with a jaquzi tub (which my son loved!). Got a great rate and the customer service was awesome. Very accomodating. Free internet service. Nice pool area and free continental breakfast. Lots of shopping, restaunts and bars all within walking distance. Fun place for couples and families. I would definitely go back to Mission Beach and the Pacific Terrace the next time I'm in California.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace, 3rd year in a row”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We love the Pacific Terrace and have come back to it every December for the last three years. The location is wonderful, the beach is great, the staff is friendly & accommodating, our rooms are always nice even though we pay for them using our American Airline points. Last year we upgraded to a small suite which gave all 4 of us plenty of room. My kids loved the staff and their free nightly cookies in the front lobby. The breakfast in the morning was crowded in the small dining room, but still nice and we could have eated outside by the pool. We'll be back!

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic!!!!”
Reviews.Author: cap
Reviews.Content: We recently stayed at the Pacific Terrace for the 2nd time and I can say once again it was fantastic!!! The rooms are newly remodeled since our last visit and quite beautiful. They have an excellent continental breakfast in the a.m. and a wonderful wine hour in the afternoon but my favorite are the warm cookies at the front desk at 4:00 everyday. Our room had an exceptional view of the ocean and we left our patio door open to hear the waves all night. The best thing about our stay was the service, all attention was given to us by the employees, I felt like a queen. Can't wait to return next year.

Reviews.Title: “UNBELIEVABLE”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: All I can say is....UNBELIEVABLE! What a great place. We were staying at another place down the beach that was a total disappointment. We walked on the beach and saw the PT and took a chance at a vacancy. They gave us a Jr suite for $30 a night less than the place we were staying at. We moved into the PT and the room was AMAZING. The staff was extremely friendly and helpful. If you want the "perfect" spot on the beach and a beautiful room for a terrific price, book the Pacific Terrace. Believe me, you will NOT be disappointed.

Reviews.Title: “Great family place and location!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Excellent hotel! I can't say enough about it! My husband and 2 year old daughter stayed here and had a great time. Great location, great service. Easy to access beach and restaurants. Perfect for kids! Only one complaint...the carpet in our room was really dirty! ewww, like make your socks black dirty. Besideds that it I would definately go back! Rooms are very nice!

Reviews.Title: “Excellent for the Cost!”
Reviews.Author: OKC Traveller
Reviews.Content: My family of four (one teen and one child) had an excellent experience at PT. We chose an oceanview room online and got Rm. 308. Plenty of room for four, so no need to upgrade to a suite (unless they are going to give it you of course!). Wide screen HDTV, queen beds, upgraded decor, but the selling point is the view! Get oceanview for the few dollars more per night and you won't regret it. No need to pay for the underground parking, though. Wide variety for the FREE continental breakfast, and if you've ever paid for a meal in SD, then you can appreciate this perk. The staff was great, not intrusive or overly friendly, just there when you need them. That's perfect service in my opinion. No hotel dining is not a problem. Just walk a few short blocks to any kind of food you want. Pacific Beach is a fun place to stay and the PT is BY FAR the best hotel in the area. Don't expect Four Seasons cause you're not paying for that, but do expect an excellent hotel experience for the price you are going to pay. (Check out the view in the pic!)

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at Pacific Terrace!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family had a great stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel! Initially we had booked into a hotel down the street (on the other side of the Pier) and were very unhappy. We called the Pacific Terrace and thankfully they booked us into their hotel. Upon arrival they had upgraded us into one of their family suites insisting we have a positive visit while in San Diego. The staff were phenomenal and very customer service oriented. The free morning continental breakfasts were fantastic and the afternoon wine by the pool a bonus. The family suite was very comfortable, clean and best of all was oceanview overlooking the surfers. The suite was also easy access to the pool and hot tub, also oceanview by the way!! Many restaurants and shops are within walking distance. I would definitely recommend this hotel to families who love the beach, surf and ocean views.

Reviews.Title: “If only the weather had cooperated. . . . .”
Reviews.Author: Weaver1952
Reviews.Content: My wife and I spent a week at the Pacific Terrace in early May. We were looking forward to a week of sun and warm weather. We did not see much sun or 70 degrees. Luckily, the hotel was great. We had a second floor suite which looked over the pool. We could step out on our balcony any time of the day and see at least a hundred surfers. The staff was outstanding, always helpful with directions and recommendations. The continental breakfast was very good as was the afternoon wine reception. The chocolates on the pillow each night were a nice touch. We will definitely stay there again if we return to San Diego, but it won't be in May.

Reviews.Title: “Good and Bad”
Reviews.Author: playhard01
Reviews.Content: We recently went to San Diego with some friends for spring break. My husband and I are used to staying in La Jolla. Since our friends were staying at Pacific Terrace we decided to do the same. I had read a review before we went that said "don't stay on the left hand side of the hote"l. When offered an upgraded room on the left hand side we took it thinking, well the review was probably exaggerated. No way! We were up all night one night to the sounds of a screaming bum. Right out to the left of the hotel is a public beach restroom, and small parking area for beach goers. The rest room is active all night long. After that being said the hotel it self is very nice. It was recently remodeled. We had an awesome tv, bed, bathroom. The pool was great. You can order food from local restaurants at the pool. The free breakfast in the morning was great. I think the hotel experience would have been excellent had we not have stayed on the left side and had gone for a middle room.

Reviews.Title: “loved this hotel”
Reviews.Author: irene-england
Reviews.Content: We (2 couples) stayed here 9th-10th of March at the end of our holiday.The hotel rooms were a good size,nicely decorated,the complementary breakfast was good as was the complementary wine.The staff were helpful,pleasant and friendly,they gave advice on where to find good food locally.We ate twice at the 23 restaurant down the road from the hotel.The food was great. We enjoyed our visit to San Diego and intend to return soon. Irene

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Sights, Wonderful Room, Wonderful Vaction”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My family and I just loved it there. Our room (107) was perfect. It was right near the patio, close proximity to the beach. We were treated very well. The entire hotel experience was a delight. A very highly recomended hotel for everyone.

Reviews.Title: “Exceeded our expectations!”
Reviews.Author: digger
Reviews.Content: Even though we had high expectations after reading previous reviews, we were still amazed at how wonderful this hotel is. Of course it didn't hurt that we were surprised at check in with an upgrade to a full ocean view room. We had teenagers and seniors in our group; all were thrilled with this place. It is in a fun area with plenty of restaurant/bar choices within walking distance. The staff were always so friendly and helpful. They even loaned us umbrellas one day when it was raining. When we were there the weather was a bit cool, but the pool area was well protected and comfortable despite the breeze coming off the Pacific. The hotel is nearly done with a major face lift; the furniture and decor are beautiful. This place is a class act in a great location. So much nicer than the large hotel chains, mostly due to the personalized service. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Excellent Hotel”
Reviews.Author: potato
Reviews.Content: Location-right on Pacific beach Rooms-extra large Views-beautiful--even with the "non ocean" view, we were still facing the pool and ocean, only semi-blocked since we were on the ground floor Staff-genuinely friendly and helpful Parking-free parking on the streets was available the whole time we were there Breakfast-nice selection I highly recommend this hotel, like many others who have written reviews.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel”
Reviews.Author: mike1318
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace is a great hotel but you need to understand what it is. It is in a great location, right on a small bluff over the Pacific Ocean, just north of the Crystal Pier. The view from the ocean view balcony is spectacular with the surfers and sunsets. The rooms are very nice and upscale. Staff is very friendly and helpful and create a very laid back atmosphere. They offer a small complimentary continental breakfast every morning which is nice. It is not a trendy hotel. So, if you are looking at a place to be seen this is not it. Yes, there are sufers, college kids, and bums that hang out on the beach. I've never had a problem with any of them but if they bother you then go out to Coronado or La Jolla. This hotel has been great for our kids as the small pool is warm and not very crowded. It is does not have an onsite restaurant or bar. So, if you want 4 star service while sitting by the pool then this is not the place. If you don't mind walking down the beach to dinner or bars then this is not a problem as there are many. Also, we have 3 small kids and there are many walk up fast food places very close if you don't feel like a formal dinner. I would also say the entire Pacific/Mission Beach area is pretty laid back. There aren't any 5 star restaurants within walking distance. There are many decent places to eat but you have to go to Gaslamp or downtown for the trendy places. The area is definitely on the upswing with real estate booming. It is also much more exciting than La Jolla or Coronado, which are good for shopping, but pretty boring IMHO other than that. The beach at the hotel is great. There is some seaweed around whereas Coronado keeps the beach pretty clean. There is also a 2-4 foot break for body surfing. Overall, without a doubt, one of my favorite hotels anywhere and easily my favorite in Southern Cal. Much more relaxing and enjoyable than LA, Laguna Niguel, La Jolla, or Coronado.

Reviews.Title: “A wonderful place to Stay”
Reviews.Author: mtsuz
Reviews.Content: We just got back from a family reunion style vacation and wanted to express our pleasure with the Pacific Terrace Hotel. Our rooms (and we had 4 of them), were all beautiful. Clean, comfortable, with beautiful views and lots of room. Very comfortable beds. The people were very helpful and friendly. We all agreed this was the place to stay!

Reviews.Title: “Hideous Service- must read”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: The hotel is certainly in the right location, however the service was hideous. No returned phone calls from management, the walls are paper thin and it's not in the best neighborhood (if you're going for spring break, then cross that thought out). Breakfast was horrible (toast was not toasted- literally right out of the bread bag, no jelly, butter, salt or pepper and they actually charged $2 each for tap water??? Unbelievable. I was very excited to finally arrive here after reading the reviews, but if you are looking for service, stay at the Hyatt LaJolla or W downown.

Reviews.Title: “Great Small Hotel!”
Reviews.Author: biosdh
Reviews.Content: We just returned from three nights at this hotel. My only bad comment would be that the hotel isn't located in the best neighborhood - small surfer cottages around that like to party! Our first night we were on the side of the hotel and were paying 385.00 so we asked to be moved and they happily did so the next day. Now we were overlooking the pool which was much better. The rooms were clean and the beds comfortable. The breakfast layout was nice. Very family friendly place with a great location for biking and beach walking. The drive to LaJolla was about 20 minutes and it was charming. The staff was incredibly nice. I called the Concierge for dinner reservations and everyone was very helpful. I would recommend this hotel very much.

Reviews.Title: “Nice!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We just returned from a 2 night stay. It was our first time staying at this hotel and the first time in this area of San Diego. The staff were friendly and very attentive. Our 1st night we were upgraded to a suite---it was very nice and the view was great! The second night we had a room on the second floor and the view was even better!!! We enjoyed our stay and do plan to return in a few months.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing Place to Stay in San Diego”
Reviews.Author: steg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at the Pacific Terrace for two nights on a business trip. It is an amazing hotel which I would love to return to. I almost felt like I was on vacation. The hotel is located directly on the beach. I had a great view of the ocean from my patio. The breakfast was lovely with lots of fresh fruit and pastries. The hotel staff was very helpful and professional. The room was large and clean. The beds were very comfortable. I wouldn't change a thing.

Reviews.Title: “A Delightful Place”
Reviews.Author: billrose2
Reviews.Content: Husband and I reserved for three nights from the internet. We had a wonderful view of the ocean from second floor. There were several amenities that we didn't expect. Bountiful free breakfasts, bath robes furnished, wonderful bedding, free wine hour each afternoon, turn down service, free cookies and super friendly staff. Glass doors over the tub did leak onto bath floor, but we learned to put a towel down to absorb it before showering and it worked fine. Underground parking was $15 per day, but was worth not having to hunt street parking. Also their underground garage was decorated with potted plants/trees and fresh flowers in garage elevator foyer. Would certainly recommend it and would stay there again. After leaving there we attended a conference at the Manchester Hyatt down on the Bay and their rooms and service weren't nearly as nice.

Reviews.Title: “Awesome Views of Surfers and Sunsets”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a 3-night stay. There were three of us (myself, my husband, and our 13-year-old daughter). We booked a premium oceanview room for $195/night. We had an awesome view from the second floor balcony of the pool, ocean, sunsets, and surfers. Everyone at the hotel was very friendly and helpful. We enjoyed the deluxe continental breakfast each morning on our balcony. It included standard continental breakfast fare, plus fresh strawberries and melons, and 8 different kinds of fabulous breakfast pastries (yummy). My husband had complimentary wine each afternoon. Our room was very spacious and had incredibly comfortable beds. The furnishings were so-so. The marble bathrooms were great. For some reason, our room was always quite hot so we had to leave the sliding door open to cool it off. When I turned on the A/C, the vent squeaked terribly. The kitchenette faucet leaked which kept me awake at night. The location of the hotel is great if you like being close to the beach. Pacific Beach is a very laid back area. On the beachfront promenade, you will see all types of people from young to old. The hotel was being painted even though their web site said that the renovations had been completed earlier in the month. Our room had a very strong smell of paint the first two nights. The hallway carpets were dirty. Perhaps they will be cleaned or replaced after the renovations are complete. I thought the pool and spa areas were lovely. There was also abundant landscaping. Parking under the hotel was very convenient and secure. Despite a few deficiencies that I mentioned in this review, I would highly recommend this hotel at the discounted winter rate of $195. I understand that they charge almost twice as much during the peak season. I don't think I would pay that much to stay here, but I wouldn't pay $400 to stay in a Ritz Carlton either.

Reviews.Title: “Lovely hotel in a lovely location”
Reviews.Author: MJDunne
Reviews.Content: Stayed here for 2 nights in Jan. was upgraded to a suite which was lovely. Nice sitting area with tv and stereo, small kitchen then onto bedroom with 2 queen beds, wash area and separate bathroom. My only complaint was the lack of bar and restaurant with this hotel, the breakfast room was just ok however the location was fantastic, right on the pacific. Be aware though, I was on business and this is a very young area. I walked to Moondoggies for dinner and was acosted by loud young college kids who had drank an awful lot !

Reviews.Title: “Loved every minute”
Reviews.Author: FindoFace
Reviews.Content: Our family of four, including boys ages 10 and 12, just returned from a one week stay at the Pacific Terrace. We stayed at this hotel solely based on the other Trip Advisor favorable reviews and were not disappointed! We booked a "standard room" through our travel agent and were more than pleased with the partial ocean view we had from 2nd floor... it was spectacular! The room was very spacious; tastefully decorated; nice balcony; had a kitchenette with microwave, stove and frig; beautiful bathroom area was separate from the rest and was very roomy; the glass shower doors looked pretty but water leaked onto the floor every time we showered! Very comfy queen beds; in fact, this had been a concern of my husband's when we were hotel searching because his back can't handle uncomfortable beds. No problem here! The continental breakfast was invaluable to us... fresh fruit, a dozen cereals, fresh pastries, bagels, yogurt, juices, coffee, etc. What a great way to start the day without having to leave the hotel or pay extra. A few of the days we were able to enjoy the complimentary wine hour from 4-5. Lots of eating places within walking distance. Loved the pool and whirlpool, especially being right next to the ocean. Very friendly, helpful hotel staff. For convenience, we usually bought our "touristy" tickets at the front desk for $2 off per ticket (SeaWorld, Zoo, Wild Animal Park, LegoLand). We always found parking on the street nearby so avoided the $15 parking garage cost. Various parts of the hotel were undergoing remodeling (which was never a bother to us); when it's all done, I would say that ALL areas of this hotel will be a "WOW"!

Reviews.Title: “We Love the PT on PB”
Reviews.Author: adkbakerhiker
Reviews.Content: We stayed in San Diego for the first time at the Pacific Terrace Hotel and loved it. The rooms are very clean and spacious. The bath and beds were the best, and the location and layout could not be beat. The fresh cool January air in the open hallways was a far cry from the suffy closed in hallways of even the most posh hotels. After all "your on the beach". The staff was very friendly and the continental breakfast was superb. We truly hope to return again someday.

Reviews.Title: “still great but needs a facelift!”
Reviews.Author: mountaingirl914
Reviews.Content: First, it is the best hotel on Pacific Beach and the water front location can't be beat. We have stayed here many times over the years and it's always consistant. We noticed during this stay that the rooms are looking a little shabby...torn wallpaper, holes in the walls (poor patch job) and carpet coming up int the corners. Hopefully, it will get a well deserved makeover soon. The kids loved the food variety at the free breakfast.

Reviews.Title: “Nice locatiuon and hotel”
Reviews.Author: albeeee
Reviews.Content: can't go wrong here, Max at the front desk was very helpful, ocean was actually too loud, imsgine that!

Reviews.Title: “Newly renovated and looks great!”
Reviews.Author: jeniroli28
Reviews.Content: Our deluxe Ocean view was just that. Deluxe. The view was worth every dollar I spent for that room. The room was spacious and the tiled bathroom with glass doors was a nice touch. They served a great breakfast outside by the pool which had a selection that seemed to go on forever. After breakfast we took a walk on the beach which is only a stones throw away. Over all a wonderful experience, and can't wait to stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Loved Pacific Terrace and Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: Bosman
Reviews.Content: Me, my wife and two sons (11 and 13) stayed at Pacific Terrace just after the high season was over in August. The hotel was well run, the rooms were big, the free breakfast was good, and the location was spectacular. Pacific Beach is a very busy urban beach, a nice mixture of funky beach bum and fancy tourist. Lots of good restaurants at a variety of price points and beach-oriented stores nearby. Easy drive to downtown SD and you can even get public transportation fairly easily and cheaply. The surf is good but not threatening. We were able to find free parking on the street. Definitely hope to go again.

Reviews.Title: “Enjoyed our stay, will return”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Based on the reviews posted on TripAdvisor, we decided to book a weekend at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. Yes, parts of the hotel are under construction as they remodel, and the hotel made it a point to notify us about the construction prior to confirming our trip, which was nice. Since we stayed Saturday and Sunday night, the sights and sounds of construction were not present, so it was actually a quiet weekend. When we arrived, I was immediately told that we had been upgraded to a junior suite, which was a spacious and clean room, with an excellent view of the ocean. You are so close, that all you hear all day and all night are the crashing waves, so if you truly enjoy hearing the ocean, this is a perfect place to stay. Hotel staff were very pleasant and helpful, and the continental breakfast was sufficient for my family. Nothing elaborate, but plenty to eat. The other nice feature, was that the hotel is within walking distance to many restaurants and bars. Overall, we enjoyed our stay and would definitely return, but once the remodel is complete, I am sure prices will increase significantly. So, if you want to stay at a great place for a great rate, go during the remodel phase. We were able to stay in a room for less than half the usual rate.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay at the Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: tanglesfoot
Reviews.Content: My Daughter and I stayed at the Pacific Terrace in San Diego this past October. We were upgraded to a junior suite when we checked in. It was perfect. Lots of extra room. beautiful view, excellent staff from the front desk to the housekeeping group. I would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “San Diego Family Getaway”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We read some reviews before booking our stay at the Pacific Terrace and found that it was probably one of our better choices. It was one of the BEST Hotels that my family has ever stayed at...really, the BEST! The staff was very friendly, professional and always ready with a smile. The room was clean and most comfortable to sleep in. The breakfast buffet had a variety of everything you need to fill a hungry tummy. Having the Hotel on the beach was wonderful for our kids who loved going down to the water everyday. Thanks to the staff and we look forward to coming back again.

Reviews.Title: “Great for families”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked at the Pacific Terrace after reading the reviews on TripAdvisor. We booked directly on the hotel's website and got a great last minute rate on a family suite. The room was very big with a kitchenette (microwave, stove, refrigerator) - perfect for preparing bottles of milk for our 8 month old, there was a dining area and a sofa bed. It was very clean, plenty of piping hot water and the beds were sooo comfy. We thought the breakfast provided was way above average - plenty of cereals to choose from, fresh fruit and fresh croissants/bagels danish etc. There were also plenty of highchairs - clean ones with working harnesses!! If you choose to get breakfast out there is an abumdance of eateries along the boardwalk (and it's only a 5 min walk to Starbucks!). There's also a great supermarket there where you can pick up supplies to store in your refrigerator. At 4pm-5pm there was complimentary wine tasting which was a lovely touch, there was hot water and coffee provided all day (just help yourself) and cookies at the front desk. Unlike others, we found the $15 a day parking convenient. We could load the kids up easily in the underground parking and did not have to fight for street parking. The key card worked every time so no problems there. The pool area was spotless - even though the weather was unusually cool when we were there, we could still swim and even take the baby in. The beach was a bit grubby and there was a lot of seaweed but we didn't really want to go down there anyway; the view however is beautiful - a lovely sunset most evenings and we even saw dolphins playing off the end of the pier. Yes, there are a few down and outs who "live" along the boardwalk, but all were friendly and non-threatening and it did not put us off wandering along the boardwalk each evening for a stroll with the kids. If you enjoy running, this is a great place to exercise and join the many other runners who seemed to be out all day. This is a wonderful accommodation - we think it's one of the nicest hotels we've ever stayed in (and we've stayed in some pretty swanky hotels). It's small, quiet, the staff are incredibly helpful and efficient and it's very well positioned. We went out every day and the longest we were in the car was on the journey up to Legoland (40 mins). By the way, the hotel has a brilliant sheet with detailed directions to all the major sights. We didn't need a map or even a guidebook - it was all provided for us. Most of the sights are easily within a 20 minute radius, probably less. We bought our tickets at the front desk which saved a few bucks and beat the lines at the entrances. We will definitely be returning to San Diego and this hotel. We've wanted to go for a while but could never settle on a suitable hotel. Thanks to TripAdvisor we found a real gem.

Reviews.Title: “One of my favorites”
Reviews.Author: Mugsydogg
Reviews.Content: One of the nicest hotels in San Diego. Yeah, its expensive but worth every dime for the view, service and quality of staying there. Make sure you get a room with a view. The hotel is still worth staying at without one, but it will be worth it having one. Parking is right below you, which is rare for the Pacific Beach area of San Diego. Boardwalk is right out front. This hotel is my favorite place to stay, anywhere on the west coast.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Location and Service”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked one of the Presidential suites for our stay and enjoyed it immensely. Room was spacious with an excellent view of the ocean and pool, and a nice jacuzzi. My only complaint is that the shower area chould have been brighter. The staff was very helpful, especially the concierge and the front desk personnel. They provided suggestions for activities, directions, and discount tickets. We used the hotel business center to print out our airline boarding passes, and found it very convenient. As noted by other reviewers, the free continental breakfast is somewhat limited, but better than that offered at some other places we've stayed. During our stay in San Diego, we stayed in two other locations (La Jolla and Balboa Park), and enjoyed Pacific Beach the most. A very casual atmosphere and convenient to everywhere.

Reviews.Title: “wonderful stay”
Reviews.Author: fabi*from*belgium
Reviews.Content: thank-you to you for upgrade, your hotel is wonderful. want us to return also quickly as possible

Reviews.Title: “Fantastic”
Reviews.Author: BunionMan
Reviews.Content: Location: perfect - off the main road, directly overlooking the great beach, About 20 min drive to SD Staff:- great, really friendly and helpful - and free wine and cookies everyday at 4pm Rooms: decor "interesting", but clean - we got upgraded twice, each room was really nice & spacious Activities:- small pool overlooking beach, plenty of cyclists, runners & surfers about Nightlife - great - close to several bars and fantastic restaurants - but far enough away so not to be bothered by the noise Price - a tad expensive, especially when you factor in parking, but no complaints 9 out of 10

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Stay!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family just returned from a visit to San Diego. We started out in another hotel that was less than what we had hoped. After a late night hotel search on our laptop and many positive recommendations from this site we found the Pacific Terrace hotel. It turned out to be wonderful! It's a great location right on the ocean. The staff was very pleasant, courteous, and accomodating. We've got 2 young kids and they were very family friendly as well. The rooms and facilities were great. The only thing that could have been better was that they were doing some remodeling and at times we heard some of the workers sawing and banging during the day. I'm sure this is only temporary and will result in an even better experience for guests in the near future. We met many other guests who swear by this hotel and have stayed many times. We will certainly stay again and again when we return to San Diego. One hint - book early because, according to the staff, they fill up 6 months to a year in advance for prime ocean view rooms during the summer months. Otherwise 3-6 months advance booking is usually ok. Guess we lucked out with out last minute booking...

Reviews.Title: “very nice stay”
Reviews.Author: piuli
Reviews.Content: we had a great time in Pacific Terrace. We were on honeymoon and they upgraded our room to an amazing junior suite with a partial ocean and pier view. Great service with on demand afternoon maid service (and chocolat offered in room every day in the afternoon). Convenient possibility of dining in room ordering food with affiliated restaurants (good if you don't feel like going out one night) offering a wide range of food choices. They gave us also the chance to keep a surfboard in a secure lot in the garage, although the hotel should pay more attention to surfers' needs especially for the fact that getting in the garage again with a longboard can be sometimes difficult if you find the door closed and have to walk up to the lounge all wet... Very good complimentary breakfast and a nice swimming pool.

Reviews.Title: “Great Hotel, great rooms”
Reviews.Author: Cornbree
Reviews.Content: After some of the reviews on Trip Advisor we booked the Pacific Terrace Hotel via Expedia and got a fantastic deal. We paid only £94 for a Premium Ocean View Room (which is app. $200) per night. When we contacted the hotel directly before our trip we checked if we could get a better deal than that, but they offered us $405 per night for the same room, which is double. The hotel is fantastic. The Premium Ocean View rooms very spacious and nicely decorated. Althought the hotel seemed quite booked, it felt very quiet and except for the waves on the beach couldn't really hear anything. The pool area is very small, but we spent there only little time, as we wanted to explore the area. The complimentary breakfast is not really the best in the world, but at least it is complimentary and if you are not a big breafast eater you get the things you want (cereal, fruit, bagels, jam, juice, tea, coffee). The breakfast room however is VERY small and can't accommodate all guests staying in the hotel. We took our breakfast to our room and sat on the balcony, which was very nice. The free wine tasting in the afternoon (also free lemonade) was a nice add on to our stay. There are a few complimentary parking spaces next to the hotel. Alternatively they offer underground parking for $15 per day, but we always found some parking on the street. Personally we were not so keen on the near by area of the hotel. There are lots of bars and restaurants, but most of them not really to our taste. But we went to downtown San Diego (Gaslamp district), which is only about 20 minutes away and found fantastic restaurants and bars. We also went one evening for a meal in La Jolla, but it was very quiet there. Maybe because it was off season (after the school holidays). A nice bar/restaurant near the hotel is "Jrdans" (5 minutes). We liked the hotel so much, that we actually wanted to extend our stay over the weekend, but they were fully booked. We then booked the "Hilton Hotel" in San Diego (Mission Bay), which was overlooking the bay. I will leave a seperate review for this one as well on Trip Advisor. Anyway, we can really recommend this hotel to anybody.

Reviews.Title: “The best spot on the beach”
Reviews.Author: beach6dream42
Reviews.Content: I love this hotel. I stayed for the first time in 1997 and have come back every year. It has gotten a little bit more expenseive but it is worth it. It is very clean and nicely updated. I love the ocean view rooms in the front of the hotel and have only stayed in those and the ocean view suites. The rooms surround the pool area and it has the feel of being in a condo or as if you live there. They offer a free continental breakfast the is much more that you would expect and is very good. They also offer complimentary wine in the evening which is very classy. I love to sit in the evening by the pool looking at the ocean and sipping a glass of wine enjoying the sunset. What a setting! The pool is nice and you can eat your breakfast by the pool in the morning and read your free copy of the paper. I love the feel of this hotel and it is truly oceanfront. Not a lot of hotels are that close to the water. The last time I stayed which was for an anniversary, there was a large group of people that monopolized the faciility and I was dissapointed because of the noise and small children runnning around. The adults stayed up very late and were very noisy underneath our balcony outside and in the halls. I STILL LOVE THIS HOTEL. I would love it even more if they restricted too large of groups and even more appealing would be an adults only (nothing weird) romantic kind of hideaway for romance and relaxation. I have kids and I enjoy really getting away and have gone to adults only resorts in Mexico and the Carribean. These resorts are in demand and this is a very special hotel. It would be the perfect hotel for this type of romantic getaway.

Reviews.Title: “Great stay at the Pacific”
Reviews.Author: zuberry
Reviews.Content: My husband and I plus our teenage daughter spent 3 nights at the Pacific Terrace and had a great time. We had premium ocean view room with two queen beds and the room was extremely comfortable. Balcony was very roomy and the view was great. Continental breakfast ok but choice was rather limited and did not appear to vary. Pool pleasant but rather stingy with towels. Front desk staff very helpful and purchased discount tickets to Seaworld (this was a fantastic day!). Overall, a great stay and would stay again.

Reviews.Title: “We loved it”
Reviews.Author: KatfromLQ
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our stay at this hotel. After reading some of the reviews I was nervous about staying there and almost canceled our reservation. What a mistake that would have been. Our two children, 8 & 7, had the best time at the beach and pool. Our room was wonderful and we left the door open at night so that we could hear the surf. The staff was very friendly and helpful. They kept the hotel immaculate. This is an old beach town with a lot of surfers and yes even homeless people. Since I grew up near a beach town similar to this, I loved it. You do have to walk down stairs to the beach but that was no big deal. It was close to Sea World and there were great restaurants within walking distance which we did every night of our stay. We decided to park in the garage so we didn't have to try to find parking everyday. We had a premium view Jr. Suite on the 3rd floor and our view was wonderful. We also got a great price. I would not consider this a "resort" hotel because of the area but I would stay here over any of the resort hotels nearby. We will definately be returning very soon for a week-end stay.

Reviews.Title: “the best hotel on the beach”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Our family (2 kids 7 and 9) just came back from San Diego. We were looking for an hotel on the beach and close to the San Diego Zoo and Sea World. We found exactly what we were looking for and more. The rooms were big enough, the beds were really comfortable, we could sleep with the patio door open and enjoy the breeze of the ocean, the kids had a lot of fun in the pool and whirpool, the kids could circulate in the hotel alone and feel secure, the breakfast was included and the pregnant lady who prepared the breakfast was very lovely. The only bad side to my opinion was the decoration of the room, if they could use lighter colors it would be much nicer.

Reviews.Title: “My family LOVED hotel, beach, town, etc.”
Reviews.Author: Single48
Reviews.Content: It's funny. For all of the reasons one family hates Pacific Beach, another loves it. We loved the whole ambiance of the beach and town, including the dilapadated shops and funky eateries, bums and bikers. We spent a week in August, and would go back in a heartbeat. In fact we are going to try to get our extended family to go next summer. The staff was incredibly nice. I started out all silicon-valley-tense, and ended up getting a hug from one of the staff on our departure. No one ever hugs me! No problems parking on the street, although a couple of times 4-5 blocks away. Great continental breakfast, replenished constantly. We could take pool towels to the beach, and replace every time they were wet or dirty. We probably had one of the worst rooms, next to ice machine, elevator and noisy boiler-like thing outside. I hate noise (and am very tense in case I forgot to mention), but I rarely noticed. I was way too relaxed! You are paying for the beach location, definitely. The bathroom was one of the nicest I've ever seen though, and I thought the room was pretty, big, and clean. It was well worth the $$$.

Reviews.Title: “Where's the ocean?”
Reviews.Author: 356LavaGirl
Reviews.Content: We couldn't really see the ocean from our rooms unless we craned our necks, we obviously were on the wrong side, the room was noisy due to hotel's general a/c unit that was on continuously. The pool was small and in the shade my kids were cold. The location is good, but For the price we paid, I expected a bigger RESORT-style pool and preferably a separate pool for the children, and a quiet one for the adults-so I don't have to worry about my noisy children disturbing those adults trying to read by the pool . The plexi-glass/glass separating the pool area from the boardwalk was DIRTY so we could hear the surf and not really see it. On the otherhand, people walking the boardwalk stop and look in to the pool area I felt like I was on exhibit at the zoo. We reserved by phone and the young woman who helped us was not helpful at all, she did not know how much the extra charges, taxes, amenities, parking, resort fees, etc. would be, and didn't know who would know, all rooms had ocean views so they were the same, and I couldn't request a room on the top floor since I don't like noise, and generally very impatient with me even though she knw I was calling long-distance. I wanted to veryify what I was paying for before I entered a contract, you know! The college age front desk people were inexperienced, and had trouble finding our reservation which was made a month in advance. When you call in a reservation you don't have any written proof that you have made it. They fortunately found rooms available, can't imagine what would've happened if they didn't. Parking cost 15$, and we couldn't cancel it the second day, even though we had found a cheaper spot in the neighborhood. We enjoyed the breakfasts, and the beach. There is a brown tide(lots of seaweed/kelp floating right past the surf, and lots of surfing going on so I didn't let my kids play in the water at the beach, and had them play in the pool. The beach was also fishy smelly probably from all the fishing going on at the pier nearby or the kelp. Don't waste your money. For the same amount you can stay at a REAL RESORT with real resort amenities and veteran staff who know what they are doing.

Reviews.Title: “Ask real ocean view or surprise!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: Families beware! Family suites that cost 485$ + tax per night are sold ocean view. There are four family suites: two are 1/4 ocean view and 3/4 beach bathrooms view or tall building view. "Private patio" actually seats you in the street with beach bums and parked cars. I was so excited about this hotel I booked 6 nights, money wasn't a problem. When I saw the accommodation I asked for alternative that was unfortunately unavailable. I left the same night and the front desk didn’t seem to care less. I had to pay the cancellation fee of one night but my family including small children wasn't allowed to stay although it was 11 pm. So, don't go there unless you are sure to have a real view of the ocean, you don't have kids, and you don't happen to talk to the right person at the front desk.

Reviews.Title: “Great Beach Location”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: My husband, two children (ages 10 & 11) and I stayed at the Pacific Terrace Hotel for 3 nights over spring break. We made our decision largely due to the positive reviews the hotel received. I was disappointed. I thought the hotel itself was average and pricey. Room was small and nothing special. Beds were comfortable. We stayed on the 3rd floor, corner room. Our balcony overlooked the ocean and street also which was very noisy. There are several small inns, etc.. next to the hotel along with early morning trash pick-up, etc.. Request to stay on other side of hotel. We did but hotel was full, therefore, they could not change our room. Pool was small. Service and food were above average. Location is convenient to walk to various restaurants for lunch/ dinner. Also, it's a great beach location. We would only stay again if we got a great rate based on the terrific beach location and only if we were on the quiet side of the hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Terrific Beachfront Spot”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I was in southern California for a business trip but decided to fly down one night early and treat myself to a beach front hotel for one night. I read the reviews on here before I booked my room and I totally agree with the raves! When I arrived on a Sunday evening, I was upgraded to a junior suite which totally surprised me. The front desk staff was very, very helpful and cheery. My check-in was quick and my room was impressive. The absolute best thing about this hotel is that the balcony was spacious and positioned in such a way to get a great view of the ocean. There is a beach walkway (sort of a boardwalk) right in front of the balconies so you are definitely in the middle of the beach activity, but not to the point that it's too much. It was just me staying there that night but a lot of families were staying there and seem to be having fun at the pool, which really isn't needed since you are literally steps from the ocean. Although the rates are kind of high, you do get the value you pay for. I highly recommend this hotel for a full beach excursion!

Reviews.Title: “Great location”
Reviews.Author: littlee876
Reviews.Content: We were pleasantly surprised at the location of the hotel. Never having been to San Diego we had no idea what to expect. I found the people I spoke to on the phone great. I called a couple of times for different reasons and both calls were handled professionally and without any issues. When we tried to check in I was a little disappointed though. We got there about noon and were told check in isn't until 4pm. I hadn't read that on my confirmation. We were allowed to use the facilities but unfortunately the key cards they gave us didn't work most of the day. Actually there seemed to be issues with electronics throughout our stay. Elevator was out of service for the most part all the time. The gates to the facility from the boardwalk rarely worked meaning we were stuck inside or outside the gate having to walk around to the front door. Not a big deal but for $350/night... The breakfast was lovely. Those ladies are the best. They work harder than anyone I've ever seen. Note to manager - give them a raise or a pat on the back sometime. Our room was fine. The balcony was the best. There were some small issues in our room that again for the price should have been seen to. ie: clock radio wouldn't stay plugged in, vent system very loud, peeling wallpaper in bathroom. It sounds like a lot of complaints but they are really picky things. This place was gorgeous. I think for the money they charge though none of these things should be listed.

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay at the Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: johnaseymour
Reviews.Content: My Wife and I spend 4 days at the Pacific Terrace on June 14 - 18th. We had a Jr. Executive Suite with a Premium Ocean View (Suite #206). The room was very nice and the view was great. We looked out over the boardwalk and directly on to the ocean. On our last night the weather broke and allowed us to see a beautiful sunset. The staff was very friendly and I was impressed that everyone said "hello" from Housekeeping to the maintenance people. Our beds were turned down and candy left on our pillow (Godiva Chocolate) along with a pair of slippers and the next day's weather and surf forecast each night. There was a microwave, refrigerator, sink, and stove on our room. There was ample parking in the underground secured garage ($15 daily) as well as several spots along the back alley. It was a short walk to many local area restaurants (they have automatic billing to your room at several different restaurants). Nearby Crystal Pier was a short walk and you could watch surfers all day and evening. While the hotel is a little pricey compared to some hotels, it is a perfect getwaway for romance or for families wishing to be right on the beach.

Reviews.Title: “Perfect Place”
Reviews.Author: jacqvm
Reviews.Content: We just returned from our San Diego vacation and a 5 day stay at the Pacific Terrace. This hotel was wonderful! The staff is incredibly helpful and everyone is very friendly and accommodating. We had a nice room the first night, but requested an ocean view upgrade if it became available. The next day they moved our room for us into not only an upgraded ocean view, but a huge suite with a kitchenette and private balcony. They did this at NO EXTRA CHARGE. This room was incredible. The breakfasts included in the hotel were fabulous. Every morning the fresh fruit, coffee, juices, yogurt and any kind of danish, bagel, cereal and muffin you could want was available until 10:00 a.m. The afternoon wine happy hour was a nice touch too- it was supposed to close at 6:00 pm, but the staff was happy to keep pouring wine even at 6:45 pm. Wireless service was available for a fee, but in our suite our laptop got internet service and we were not charged for it even though we told them we were getting it. Every night our beds were turned down and chocolates were left on the pillows. There is not a better value for a 5 star hotel on the ocean in San Diego. We loved it and would stay again without even pricing another place.

Reviews.Title: “Amazing view!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We booked a jacuzzi suite with an ocean view. The view was so amazing that we rarely left our balcony! The only thing the hotel could use is some redecorating. The room had a very late 70's feel to it. The room was much larger than I expected. Always a place to park.

Reviews.Title: “Won't stay here”
Reviews.Author: jen85268
Reviews.Content: I really wanted to stay at this hotel but when I called to reserve a room, I was shocked by the lack of knowledge and professionalism of the reservationist. First of all, you are put on hold for about 5 minites before they connect you with the person who takes the reservations. Secondly, the person who takes your information can barley speak english and is unfamilair with the specials or even what rooms are available and when. Essentially, it is obvious that the staff is untrained. Too bad because I would have spent alot of money at this hotel and now I'm looking somewhere else. Hopefully, I will find a hotel where the staff speaks english and is somewhat educated in the hotel business.

Reviews.Title: “Beautiful ocean view rooms”
Reviews.Author: antcel25
Reviews.Content: The Pacific Terrace Hotel is wonderful....I had a deluxe ocean view room with a private balcony...I got to watch the sun set in the evening..I loved hearing the waves crashing...At night while I lay in bed I would have the curtanis open and just look out towards the ocean..The staff is also friendly and helpful...Would definitely stay again..

Reviews.Title: “Awesome hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: A great location for a great hotel! We stayed for 5 nights in the beginning of May and we wished we could stay longer! All the good reviews for this hotel are true. We have 2 small children, and I am always concerned about the "family friendliness" of a hotel. This was a great hotel for the whole family. We got a great rate on Expedia, so we upgraded to a premium ocean view room. That took us off the first floor. You certainly cannot see too much from the 1st floor. The staff was great too!!

Reviews.Title: “Waves lull you to sleep”
Reviews.Author: PTVT
Reviews.Content: My husband and I stayed at the Pacific Terrace May 8 -12th. We had an ocean front third floor room with a beautiful view. Loved falling asleep to the sound of the waves every night. Pacific Beach is a young crowd so I would reccommend going off season and during the week. We would stay there again.

Reviews.Title: “Wonderful Experience!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I stayed at Pacific Terrace May 5-8th with my best friend for a girls weekend. The location could not have been better! Our room was amazing, the service excellent and we were steps to the beach. I would highly recommend Pacific Terrace to anyone planning on coming to San Diego!

Reviews.Title: “Best and only hotel at Pacific Beach”
Reviews.Author: pjparty
Reviews.Content: Stayed in room 202 April 11-13, 2005. This hotel is on a bluff and you walk down several stairs to hit the beach. The hotel, its' employees and the view far exceeded all expectations! Room 202 is very spacious and included a balcony, robes, hair dryer, iron and board, mini-bar, king bed, dining table and chairs, along with granite- countered kitchenette, bar and bathroom. Balcony had an absolutely gorgeous Pacific Beach coastline and Crystal pier view. This room is on the side of the hotel, so the view isn't directly over the ocean and we couldn't see the pool. A public parking lot was next to our room, but we didn't have any bothersome noise. (And we're really picky about excessive noise. If we're on vacation, we want peace and quiet!) Rooms directly overlooking the pool and ocean are located in the center of the hotel. Outstanding service from employees. Everyone smiling, polite and helpful at every turn. Special touches include: (all complimentary) beverage/coffee bar, wine hour continental breakfast and morning newspaper. Beautiful hotel grounds made the views from the warm pool and jacuzzi even more enjoyable. Attentive drink service at the pool. After seeing the other hotel choices in Pacific Beach, there is absolutely no other choice than Pacific Terrace Hotel. Underground parking is $15/day, with unlimited usage. We were lucky enough to find public parking next to the hotel. We were close enough that we walked to every restaurant. Just a few short blocks to everything. Loved this hotel and we're already drooling to return!

Reviews.Title: “Great!!!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: What a find!!! We were looking for a place to stay along pacific and mission beach and first stopped by the Best Western which wanted $180 for an ocean view. We had driven by the Pacific Terrace, but to be honest, looked sooo nice from the outside I thought for sure it would be over priced. My "new" wife convinced me to go check prices and see if they had any rooms available. When I got in, I asked if they gave a AAA discount. The nice lady at the desk crossed out a room rate of $385 and wrote in $195 for an ocean view. Right away I knew this was the place to complete our honeymoon. Turns out the room she was going to put us in was not ready so we were upgraded to a premier ocean view room right above the boardwalk overlooking the ocean. This was honestly one of the best places we could have ever found we had to stay an additional night. If you are headed to San Diego and want to stay on the ocean and walk to anywhere, This Is The Place!!!

Reviews.Title: “Loved the Pacific Terrace”
Reviews.Author: JBM
Reviews.Content: My 12 year old daughter and I stayed at the Pacific Terrace, Feb.20 till Feb.25 and loved every minute of it. The staff was wonderful, the service was great. I would stay there again, in a flash. It is pricey though. It was Feb.2005

Reviews.Title: “Walked in to bliss”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I don't know if I can speak highly enough of this place. We were walking up the beach looking at a hotel to stay at for the night and we walked in on this one. The friendly service was impeccable. They even went to the trouble of showing us the room we would have. We had the room for $178 for the night instead of the $355 rack rate. We had to get to UCSD that day and found the conceirge was out to lunch but the other staff just jumped in and sorted us out, we were going by bus so they got a timetable and a map for us. We headed out for lunch down Garnett St which is packed full of shopping, eating and bars (although most play hip hop) WE went back to the hotel and were surprised at the friendliness when we walked in, was an event that puts a smile on your dial. We left for UCSD and went out that night until quite late at night (1am) we walked back to the hotel and whilst they lock the doors at night, someone was there to let us in, we asked about a late checkout and were told we needed to contact housekeeping in the morning. Arriving back in our room our jaws dropped. We found a letter under the door wishing us a lovely stay, the beds turned down, a mint on the pillows and the radio turned on for us to enjoy. This made our night, we paid $220+ a night for hotel rooms in vegas and didn't get this kind of service. WE had a great nights sleep and the beds were fantastic. Woke up and gave housekeeping a call, they allowed us until 12:30 to chekcout so we went back to sleep. The attention to detail at this hotel is amazing and the staff really deserve a pat on the back for it. We didn't get a chance to use the pool or spa but they sure looked inviting. If we got back to San Diego, this place is definetly on the top of our list.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!”
Reviews.Author: AutumninSeattle
Reviews.Content: My friend and I stayed at the Pacific Terrace the 3rd thru the 5th of March. It was wonderful. We were upgraded without even asking to an ocean view room. The hotel staff were friendly, helpful and professional. The room was clean and pretty. The hotel location was right on the beach. It was also near every type of store one could possibly need. One staff member helped us with driving directions and recomended Gringos restaurant, which was fabulous. The weather was less than perfect but the staff was perfect! I will come back with my husband, 15 yr old and 10yr old. Nice heated pool and jacuzzi.

Reviews.Title: “PERFECT!”
Reviews.Author: tweakes
Reviews.Content: This is absolutely the best hotel overall that I have ever stayed in. The facilities are nice -- they are the most spectacular by any means -- but it's a beach hotel -- it's expected. What makes this hotel so special is the staff. Before arriving to San Diego for Valentine's weekend, I spoke with the concierge many, many times about wanting champagne in the room, Sea World tickets, a tour to Tijuana ... she was always happy to talk to me and recognized my voice immediately and called me by name. I talked to her A LOT and she not once seemed impatient or frustrated with me -- she truly wanted to help me. Upon checking in, I found that the great service did not end there. While clearly waiting for the concierge, a front desk staff member came up to me and asked if there were something she could help me with -- clearly going out of her way so that I didn't have to wait any longer (...and she could help me). I asked an employee where we could great breakfast upon check-out (4:30a.m. -- long before the continental breakfast opened) and she took our "order" made us each a separate "breakfast bag" with fruit, muffins, cereal, and juice and had it ready for us upon check-out. Each time I entered the hotel I was greeted by name and was asked how my dinner was or how my trip to Tijuana was ... they really seemed to KNOW me and were interested in my day's activities. They followed up with everything - suggested things before I asked them - they seemed to know what I wanted and did it without me having to ask them. This truly is a special hotel. I make a point of mentioning the staff because it is the staff that makes it truly unique. The facilities are beautiful -- the pool and hot tub are great -- the rooms are HUGE -- but I've stayed at nice hotels before -- I have never had service like this though. My stay at the Pacific Terrace Hotel will truly be remembered by me forever ... I felt ... special!

Reviews.Title: “Great Stay!”
Reviews.Author: tlusk
Reviews.Content: Went with the family (wife and 2 kids) for a trip to Sea World and San Diego Zoo November 4-6. Booked the standard "Garden View" room and were upgraded to a an ocean view Family Suite on the first floor. The staff was wonderful, and my only possible gripe would be that the ocean view from the patio was obstructed by a clear partition that separated the patio from the public areas. Kids had a blast running on the beach and playing in the water, would highly recommend this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Happily Surprised”
Reviews.Author: frugalguy
Reviews.Content: My wife and I stayed here for 2 nights in February. Pacific Beach is kind of an older beach community. Pacific Terrace has to be the nicest hotel in the area. Right on the beach, if you can get it pay for it because it is worth it. Smaller hotel so everything is very accessible. Parking is great. Being so close to the ocean parking could be a nightmare, but their parking garage is great, pay the extra $15 I think it was well worth it. Great restaurants within walking distance. Boardwalk to stroll on right outside the hotel. Unless you are a very hard person to please you won't be dissapointed at this hotel. I didnt mention though we didnt pay anything near the rack rate of $355 for our room. We paid $116 a night.

Reviews.Title: “Pacific Terrace Is The Place!”
Reviews.Author: Vacation043
Reviews.Content: My husband and I spent 4 nights Jan 11-14 at the Pacific Terrace Hotel. From the moment we walked in to the time we checked we had nothing but the best service (from all staff in all departments). Always smiling, addressing us by Mr, Mrs.... Lovely, Spacious Rooms, Very Clean. Excellent room service. Requested a late checkout (was no problem). Restaurants/Shopping Suggestions Excellent. Love Pacific Beach Area (La Jolla would be second choice) Breakfast was unlimited choices (eat in garden or on balcony in room) Wine between 4-5, cookies at front desk, also tea, coffee, lemonade all day. Pool and Hot Tub awesome. No complaints at all. Love to go back on day! Location is the best (within walking distance of shops, food, drug stores, car rentals, mission bay/beach) Overall very tourist friendly and very safe at night. Please check it out (room on 2nd or 3rd floor nice 1st floor easy access to pool and carribean room) Hope this helps! I will be back.

Reviews.Title: “such a relief!”
Reviews.Author: KarineSF
Reviews.Content: I am the wary type, and I got really worried indeed after reading some of the reviews on this site. We booked an 'ocean view' room on Expedia which still cost us a lot of money (over Christmas). We were all looking forward to this vacation, the 1st one for a long time, my husband and I and my 2 small children, for 7 nights. When we checked in and I found out we were staying on the ground floor, I knew straight away that we would only get a partial view of the ocean - but decided to swallow my pride and see the room first. And what a surprise - it was great! just in front of the swimming pool, facing directly the ocean, far enough from the breakfast room (which gets busy), with a nice little patio. We stayed and made the most of a beautiful holiday. The best thing for us, was that we could open the French doors into the patio and let the kids play (quietly!). The swimming pool is fenced so we didn't have to worry about them getting close to it. We really enjoyed the staff, the breakfast, the wine reception, the location, and the room - which came with a small kitchen. We also realized that there aren't many rooms at all which don't have an ocean view as all the rooms are facing south, north or west - None of them face east. The only thing I would get a bit worried about is with the ones facing north, as they didn't seem to get any sunshine what so ever. Tough choice to make sometimes, I really value sites such as this one - Thank you, and have a great time if you chose this hotel.

Reviews.Title: “Loved it”
Reviews.Author: 1127sg
Reviews.Content: I stayed at this hotel last February with a friend of mine. We splurged and got an ocean view room. I don't know how many times I called the hotel to verify that the room was definitely facing the ocean. We weren't disappointed, as the room was awesome and had a full front view of the ocean and boardwalk. We were on the 3rd floor and the pool was directly below our room. The rooms all have bathrobes and slippers, which is a cute touch. You can buy the bathrobes for a price, which my friend did. The free breakfast is good--lots to choose from and you can take it outside on the patio with tables/umbrellas. As two women traveling alone we never felt scared or nervous walking the boardwalk at night. The boardwalk takes you right to some good restaurants. I will have to say parking is a problem. There are only a few 'reserved' spots for guests (without paying). A few times we had to park down the block when returning at night. But that's a small thing to deal with when you wake up to the ocean outside your balcony door! If you're thinking about staying here and question some of the reviews on here--yeah, maybe sometimes things don't go perfectly well for people, but if you want a small hotel, beautiful setting and friendly staff, this is the place. (Just re-verify where your room is!)

Reviews.Title: “Be Warned...'Ocean View' is a Joke at this Hotel”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at this hotel for two nights in the first week of December 2004. Be forewarned...if booking an "Ocean View" room from Travelocity, Expedia, TraipAdvisor, etc., don't expect to get what most people consider an "Ocean View" room once you get to this hotel. You are better off booking only the "Garden View" room if you want an Internet discount because I could just barely catch a glimpse of the ocean from my "Ocean View" room. It was a real disappointment and downer. The only way to get an Ocean View Room is by booking directly with the hotel....as I leaned after I checked-in....and paying the 'premium' rate that isn't found on the discount internet services. I was really looking forward to our stay at this hotel after researching it on this internet sight. I could picture looking out at the ocean and watching the sunset from our room. I had the choice of booking the Garden View or Ocean View and opted for the latter. Boy...was I in for a surprise! Problem #1 - When I got to my room, it had only a king-sized bed for myself and 3 other people! The receptionist claims that Expedia didn't inform them that we had 2 kids staying with us. I showed her a hardcopy of my booking and confirmation # - which showed 2 adult and 2 kids as per the booking procedure - and she said they don't get that information from Expedia...they get different information. Say what??? So this is now my problem?? Oh well, can you please help me out and get me a room with 2 queens. Sorry sir, we're full tonight...perhaps tomorrow...you have a fold-out bed in your room that you can use. Problem #2 - They placed us on the ground-level. Looking out our patio, you needed to be 6' or taller - and standing up - to catch a glimpse of the ocean. Everything else in front of you is overgrown shrubs, flowerbeds, palms, brick privacy dividers and a 7' barred fence on the property-line. When I told the Manager that I am extremely dissappointed they consider my room as "Ocean-View", she said that all their ground-floor rooms are considered Ocean View as per AAA ratings or some other fancy-named agency. Can we get and "Ocean View" room on the 2nd or 3rd floor - even if it's for only tomorrow night?? Although you booked "Ocean View" over the Internet, we cannot give you an ocean-view room on the 2nd or 3rd floor because they are classified as...."Deluxe" Ocean View rooms and therefore cost much more money. What?? Oh yes....and they are not available over the Internet. And Sir, your current room also has a kitchenette (that I didn't need!) so we actually consider your room as an upgrade from your confirmed rate! Boy...do I feel better!! Problem #3 - You can complain all you want, but the Manager is used to these Ocean-View complaints, and does not budge on the interpretation. She offered to move me the next day to another "ocean-view" room, facing north, on the north side of their building. The room looked directly into the Capri hotel and had a better glimpse of the ocean, but I passed on the offer, and decided to air my complaints on TripAdvisor...hoping that someone else doesn't run into the disappointment that I did....two nights of sleeping on an old cot-type pullout bed...and enjoying the ocean view from my room for as long as I could stand on my tip-toes! I don't know why people seem to rate this place so high and give it rave reviews. If I was to return to San Diego, I would probably stay next-door at the Capri. Do your own due diligence. Good luck in your search.

Reviews.Title: “very pleased!”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: I chose this hotel for a romantic weekend away from the kids with my hubby based upon the tripadvisor reviews, and was not disappointed! The room was lovely, and just as described, the staff was delightful! They cheerfully gave recommendations for restaurants (and it was great advice) and they have a little business center that I used for free, so I could checkin for our flight home online - that alone saved an hour or more wait at the airport! Every person we dealt with was pleasant, from the cleaning staff to the people who set out the breakfast - and the balconies/patios, views, and pool area are all lovely! It's also in a nice location right on the boardwalk, and the beach. I don't know that I would stay there with very small children (under 5), but it was perfect for the two of us. We also got a good rate on a site called ------------.

Reviews.Title: “Really, really enjoyed our stay !”
Reviews.Author: A TripAdvisor Member
Reviews.Content: We stayed at the Pacific from 12/10 to 15/10 at the end of two weeks touring. I had booked an ocean view suite and wow, what a view ! I've noticed the last review re some issues with a room, however, I could not fault ours. It was clean, furnished well, very quiet and we felt comfortable with the whole place. We considered changing our flights just to stay longer ! The staff were all excellent and we loved the location in Pacific Beach. The place has a young vibe to it, but certainly at the time we stayed was not in any way rowdy. Of the hotels we stayed at on this trip, this was the best and I would certainly return. Not sure if restuarant recommendations are the done thing on here, but on the last night we went to Cafe Bella Italia and had a great meal - its on Garnet Blvd and was listed in the hotels recommendations. San Diego was brilliant in every way - will be back !

Reviews.Title: “Loved it!!!!”
Reviews.Author: temtravel
Reviews.Content: Stayed at Pacific Terrace Oct 10-13. The small intimate feel of the hotel is a huge welcome from many of the mega-resorts I've stayed at. You dont have to walk 2 miles back to your room if you've forgotten your sunscreen, etc back at your room. Stayed on the 1st floor and pool and breakfast room was literally 10 steps from my patio. The Pacific Beach area of San Diego is not ritzy but it has alot of character. Within walking distance to local sights and restaurants..While my room showed some ware, I expect that is with most beach hotels. I am a travel agent and have stayed at super deluxe to downright dumps...I would stay here again,, cant wait to go back.

HotelInfo.Name: Pacific Terrace Hotel
HotelInfo.Address: 610 Diamond Street, San Diego, CA 92109
